Last week, when the Secretary was confelting in Peking for the first time in a year, that official kept insisting that the Chinese had not been pushing for full diplomatic relations or American disengagement from Taiwan.

title: BELLA S. ALTSHULER
description: Bella Slepian Altshuler, a member of the New York City Community Planning Board 4 for Chelsea, died Saturday at her home, 418 West 17th Street, She was 84 years old.

title: Processors of Food Show Rising Profits
description: Most of the food industry's 12 largest processing compavies continued to enjoy high profit gains in the third quarter of this year as the nation's consumers experienced a 15 per cent squeeze on the cost of their household food budgets.

title: U.S. AIDE BACKS PARENTS ON BOOKS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 (UPI) In a potentially controversial departure from earlier policy, Dr. Terrel H. Bell, the United States Education Commissioner, says he will ask schoolbook publishers tomorrow to print only materials that do not insult the values of most parents.

title: Soup and Tart at the Kitchen Is a Supper With AvantGarde
description: Jean Dupuy's avantgarde dinner party event Saturday night at the Kitchen called Soup and Tart could certainly be complained about, but there were enough nice things to make one almost forget the discomfort and the longueurs.

title: Two Pioneers Trace Bursts of HighEnergy Radiation to Jupiter
description: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif., Dec. 1 Like two bloodhounds sniffing across the solar system, Pioneer 10 and Pioneer 11 have traced to Jupiter bursts of highenergy radiation whose occurrence near the earth has long puzzled space scientists.

title: Mills Does a Walkon With Stripper
description: BOSTON, Dec. 1 (AP)Representative Wilbur D. Mills, Democrat of Arkansas, who appeared on stage last night with a stripper, Annabel Battistella, said today he had written a film for her called It's Not Burlesque. He thinks it will make her a star.

title: Ford News Conference On Networks Tonight
description: Ford News Conference On Networks Tonight

title: Golda Meir's Influence Is Still Strong in Israel
description: RAMAT AVIV, Israel  A security guard As posted on the sidewalk and a sturdy fence surrounds the yard, but otherwise the twostory beige bungalow looks like any other in his comfortable suburb a few minutes north of Tel Aviv. A ring of the doorbell brings a familiar face, a firm handshake and that same slightly skeptical smile that appeared in news photographs from Israel for two generations.

title: CBS Plans 2Hour Special,On Poll of Popular Taste
description: The People's Choice Awards, a twohour television special, will present the results of a national poll. to select the public's favorite television shows, motion pictures, actors, entertainers, musical groups and sports figures. The special will be shown March 4 on CBSTV.

title: Hartwick Advances In Soccer
description: Adelphi won ?? II and Brockport State near Buffalo took Division III of the National Colleglate Athletic Association soccer tournaments last Saturday, and now Hartwick College of Oneonta can make it a sweep for the State of New York by winning Division I.

title: OUTLOOK IS BLEAK IN WEST BENGAL
description: CALCUTTA, India  In a feeding kitchen in Calcutta, 80yearold Aizaz Bux stands barefoot with a tin pot and waits for a dole of overcooked gruel.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: With 1,510 Civil Service and provisional city employes scheduled to be dismissed in an economy move, Mayor Beame said that those with Civil Service status will get top priority in reassignment to provisional positions that are available and to which they are eligible.

title: British Football
description: RUGBY LEAGUE

title: Dispute on Investigative Reporting Leads Press to Study Its
description: There is a growing controversy in journalism over the nature of investigative reporting, a controversy that has left much of the American press selfconscious and sometimes defensive about the subject.

title: Yankees Obtain Oliver From Orioles for Cash
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 1 (UPI)The winter baseball meetings officially get underway tomorrow but there was a little gunjumping today when the New York Yankees purchased Bob Oliver from the Baltimore Orioles in a straight cash transaction.

title: Emmett Holt Jr. Dies; Led Pediatrics at N.Y.U.
description: Dr. L. Emmett Holt Jr., the Internationally acclaimed pediatrician Who expanded the pediatrics department of the New York University School of Medicine into a major research center, died Saturday in Myrtle Beach, S. C. He was 79 years old.

title: Bomb Damages Office of I.T.T. And Other Points in Puerto Rico
description: SAN JUAN, Puerto Rico, Dec. 1A series of bomb blasts in scattered parts of Puerto Rico early today severely damaged an International Telephone And Telegraph Corporation ofnye, a Burger King restaurant and several United States Army Reserve vehicles.

title: New 911 System Speeds Suffolk Police
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. I., Dec. 1 At 1:53 A.M. on a recent day, the telephone rang in the room where James Wichrowski works. The woman on the line was hysterical. My children have been stabbed, she cried.

title: REVENUE SHARING CALLED PRIORITY
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 1Mayor Thomas Bradley of Los Angeles urged delegates to the 50th annual conference of the National League of Cities today to make the reenactment of general revenue sharing our No. 1, legislative priority for 1975.

title: Layoffs Grow in Europe as Auto Sales Slump
description: PARIS, Dec. 1Europe's automobile industry, on which roughly one in 10 jobs depends, is accelerating layoffs in the face of a slump in sales as deep as in the United States.

title: Gas Kills 6 Men in Texas As They Repair a Pipeline
description: ABILENE, Tex., Dec. 1 (AP) Six men died tonight when poisonous methane gas and oil poured from a ruptured pipeline they were repairing near this West Texas city, the authorities said.

title: Algiers Bustles Toward Industrial Gains
description: ALGIERS, Nov. 30Ships and goods jam the port of this North African capital. Cars, and trucks jam the streets, and visiting businessmen and diplomats fill the hotels.

title: Tennessee Freshman Scores 42 in Confidence Game
Soccer Results
description: Soccer Results

title: Hawaii Tops Rutgers, 2816
description: HONOLULU, Dec. 1 (UPI) Regis Grice scored on thirdquarter touchdown runs of 26 and 1 yard and the University of Hawaii rushed for 296 yards in a 2816 victory over Rutgers last night in a football game marred by a fight that sent a player to the hospital.

title: 6 Hurt in Subway at 1918 Disaster Site
description: Six persons were slightly injured yesterday when a Franklin Avenue subway train derailed at the site of the Malbone Street wreck in Brooklyn, where 97 people were killed in the city's worst subway disaster 56 years ago.

title: AGENCY ATTACKED OVER SOVIET TOURS
description: RIVER EDGE, Dec. 1 (AP)A window was broken in the office of the Liberty Travel Service here today, apparently as a protest against the concern's dealings with trips to the Soviet Union. A man who refused to identify himself called The Associated Press in Newark and said:

title: Dispute on Investigative Reporting Leads Press to Study Its Role
description: There is a growing controversary in journalism over the nature of investigative reporting, a controversy that has left much of the American press selfconscious and sometimes defensive about the subject.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The cost of electricity from Consolidated Edison went up yesterday by $3 a month for the average customer. The 9.7 per cent increase, the latest major increase granted the utility this year, was approved by a 32 vote of the state Public Service Commission on Nov. 12. It is expected to raise Con Ed's revenues by $164million a year.

title: Davis Wins, U.S. Boxers Tie
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 1 (AP)Laszio Pakozdi of Hungary, a heavyweight, decisoned Marvin Stinson of Philadelphia to give the Hungarian Olympic team a 5.5 tie with the United States National Amateur Athletic Union team last night. The crowd of 3,800 booed the decision in the final match. Stinson went down for the 8 count in the second round.

title: Bridge: Caravelli and Mrs. Utegaard  Capture Mixed Pairs Laurels
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Dec. 1The first major championship of the American Contract Bridge League's Fall Nationals was decided here in the early hours today. The mixed pair title went to Gerald Caravelli of Des Moines, Ill., a financial analyst for an insurance company, and Helen Utegaard of Bethesda, Md.

title: Professor Marries Susan Jane Wachtel
description: Susan Jane Wachtel, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Sydney Wachtel of Lawrence, L. I., was married here yesterday afternoon to Dr. Richard Frank Levine, an assistant professor in hematologiv research at Rockefeller University. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Irving Levine of Philadelphia. Rabbi David M. Posner performed the ceremony at Temple EmanuEl.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
JAMES K. RYAN
description: James K, Ryan, former president of the Great Neck (L. I.) Trust Company, which was merged in 1954 with the Franklin National Bank, of which he was a former vice president and director, died Saturday at his home, 203 East 72d Street. His age was 79.

title: Golda Meir's Influence Is Still Strong in Israel
description: RAMAT AVIV, Israel  A security guard is posted on the sidewalk and a sturdy fence surrounds the yard, but otherwise the twostory beige bungalow looks like any other in this comfortable suburb a few minutes north of Tel Aviv. A ring of the doorbell brings a familiar face, a firm handshake and that same slightly skeptical smile that appeared in news photographs from Israel for two generations.

title: America: Abused and Fed Up
description: NASHVILLEThe World Food Conference in Rome, like many other United Nations gatherings, turned into a hateAmerica session. Delegates from Communist and socalled nonaligned nations charged that imperialists were responsible for the food shortages in the Southern Hemisphere. They demanded that Americans eat less and give away more.

title: Iran Offers to Fully Back Rusumed Output of C5A's
description: Highlevel IranianAmerican talks were held in Washington last week on a recently sweetened offer by the Shah of Iran to pay for reopening the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation's C5A production line and to buy 10 of the $55million military cargo planes, industry sources said yesterday.

title: BUTZ SAYS HE PLANS TO STAY IN JOB IN '75
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 1 (UPI) Agriculture Secretary Earl L. Butz said today that he, intended to remain in his job next year despite recent demands for his resignation.

title: Wyszynski Criticizes Demolition of a Church
description: WARSAW, Dec, 1 (AP)In a statement read today in churches throughout Warsaw, the Roman Catholic primate of Poland, Stefan Cardinal Wyszynski, criticized the Government for having demolished a church in what he called an act unprecedented since the war.

title: Toronto Debates a Curb on Construction
description: TORONTO  This rapidly growing city has put the brakes on development while its people try to decide what they want their streets to look like.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing Paisenger and Mail Ships

title: Daley to Seek Reelection In Chicago, Press Reports
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 1 (UPI)Mayor Richard J. Daley, who is also the head of Chicago's Democratic Party organization, is expected to announce this week that he will seek an unprecedented sixth term of office, it was reported today by both of Chicago's Sunday newspapers, The Tribune and the SunTimes.

title: An ExCahill Aide to Go on Trial For 3d Time in TaxFraud Case
description: Joseph M. McCrane, the for mer New Jersey State Treasurer, faces a new setting but some old charges today when he goes on trial for the third timethis time in Scranton, Pa. He wil be answering a Federal indictment charging him with masterminding a taxfraud conspiracy during William T. Cahill's 1989 gubernatorial campaign.

title: Mrs. Papadopoulos Jailed
description: ATHENS, Dec. 1 (Reuters)Despina Papadopoulos, wife of former President George Papadopoulos, was remanded to jail today pending her trial on charges of fraud against the state, judicial authorities said tonight.

title: Davis Performance Recalls Heisman Years Garrett, Simpson
description: Anthony Davis may not win the Heisman Trophy this, his final season at the University of Southern California.

title: Ariane Sylva Diamond Bride Of Steven J. Grossman Here
description: Ariane Sylva Diamond and Steven J. Grossman were married here yesterday afternoon at the home of the bride's stepfather and mother, Mr. and Mrs. Stanley H. Weintraub of the Lombardy. The bridegroom is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Nicholas Grossman of Waterbury, Conn.

title: Riggins Scores 3 Times in Rout of Chargers
description: It might be a little late for this season, but the Jet juggernaut continued trampling the opposition yesterday, defeating the San Diego Chargers 2714, for its fourth straight victory.

title: Ford Hears a Sermon Critical of U.S. Policy
description: WASHINGTON; Dec. 1 (UNPresident and Mrs. Ford went to church today and heard a sermon questioning United States policies on spending for military defense and food for the world's hungry people.

title: On Crying Wolf!
description: WASHINGTON When President Ford sported a wolfskin parka in Vladivostok and promised an admiring Leonid Brezhnev to send another wolfskin along as a gift, a New York Times editorial excoriated him for aiding and abetting the extinction of an endangered species.

title: Red Smith
description: Tom Landry is familiar to America's television public the tall figure wearing a hat one size too small whom they see pacing the sideline with the measured gait of a pallbearer when the Dallas Cowboys play football. As the only coach the Cowboys ever had, Landry has watched his team win 123 games, lose 81 and tie 5 and has yet to show jubilation or disappointment. He doesn't talk much, either, but when he does speak he can be profound. Football, he said on Thanksgiving Day, is an incredible game. This is what makes it so unbelievable at times. You can't get profounder than that. He was talking about the performance of a 22yearold quarterback of towering obscurity named Clint Longley, a performance so incredible it was practically unbelievable. Flung into a championship game for the first time in his life when Roger Staubach got the wobbles, young Longley put backbone into a team that was groveling at the feet of the Washington Redskins.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Greek and Greek Cypriote leaders said that they had agreed to take a common line in negotiations with the Turks over the future of Cyprus, but a communique issued in Athens after two days of talks did not explain what that line would be. As a result of the meeting, the Greek side now seems prepared to enter substantive negotiations for the first time since talks collapsed in Geneva last August, but in view of the political uncertainty in Turkey it is not clear whether the Turks are ready to talk. [Page 1, Column 5.]

title: A Case for Cultural Plurality
description: POPULAR CULTURE AND HIGH CULTURE. An Analysis and Evaluation of Taste. By Herbert J. Gans. 179 pages. Basic. Books. $10.

title: Dangerous Water
description: A recent study of the water supply of New Orleans reveals that it contains traces of several known cancercausing agents. This research, conducted by the Environmental Protection Agency, has prompted. E.P.A. to begin an immediate, nationwide study of drinking Water.

title: Lincoln Blockbuster
description: In what some members of the City Planning Commission have called a carefully orchestrated shell game, the developers Paul and Seymour Milstein have bounced plans for a building for the Lincoln Square area back and forth between the commission and the Board of Standards and Appeals. The builders' purpose is quite clear: they are after a variance that will give them a structure 33 per cent larger than anything legally permitted in the Lincoln Square Special Zoning District. That kind of blockbuster means appalling density. It is also quite clear that the whole city loses if the Milsteins win.

title: Venezuela Ponders Course Suited to TakeOver of Oil
description: CARACAS, VenezuelaVenezuelan Government officials are expressing hopes that a working formula reached with two United States companies in an iron ore expropriation will provide a model for taking over the far more important oil industry, which produces the bulk of Venezuela's foreign exchange and government revenues.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: MOVIES AND MAKERS Two programs of interesting films, both including discusatonal appearances by contributors, start here today. The New York Public Library, which screens free short films at various branches throughout the year, tonight will open a series of eight features and programs titled The Filmmaker Speaks: An Open Forum at the Donnell Library Center, 20 West 53d Street.

title: Legislator Knifed
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 1 (UPI)The Chicago police have charged a man who has a long prison record with armed violence, aggravated battery and unlawful restraint in the stabbing of State Representative Peggy Smith Martin, a Chicago Democrat last night. The police said today they arrested Hubert Locke, 42 yesterday, after MrsMartin was able to identify him. The 43yearold legislator was reported in good condition today in St. Bernard's Hospital.

title: Siting Unpopular Plants
description: The current friction between coastal states and Federal officials over offshort oil development is one more symptom of a far bigger governmental and constitutional problem that seems likely to crystalize soon. That is the fair share issue: the question of where many indispensible, if objectionable, national activities and, fixtures should be located, which areas should bear the burdens, and above all how these matters should be decided.

title: FREDERICK MERRILL, DIPLOMAT, 69, DEAD
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 Frederick T. Merrill, who was the State Department's Director of EastWest Contacts from 1956 to 1960 and deputy chief of mission in Rumania from 1960 to 1962, died yesterday of a heart attack in Arlington, Va. He was 69 years old and had lived in Villierstown, County Waterford, Ireland, and Wainscott, L.I., since his retirement in 1965.

title: 6 Hurt in Subway at 1918 Disaster Site
description: Six persons were slightly injured yesterday when a Franklin Avenue subway train derailed at the site of the Malbone Street wreck in Brooklyn, where 97 people were killed in the city's worst subway disaster 56 years ago.

title: Riggins Scores 3 Times in Rout of Chargers
description: It might be a little late for this season, but the Jet juggernaut continued trampling the opposition yesterday, defeating the San Diego Chargers, 2714, for its fourth straight victory.

title: British Football
description: RUGBY LEAGUE

title: LEGISLATORS MEET TO DISCUSS REFORM
description: TARRYTOWN, N.Y., Dec. 1A buoyant Stanley Steingut, treated much as if he were already Speaker of the Democraticcontrolled State Assembly, pronounced himself an advocate of open government today, pledging to restructure the archaic processes of the Legislature and open its deliberations to public scrutiny.

title: Hong Kong Again Returns Illegal Immigrants to China
description: HONG KONG, Dec. 1 (Reuters)A second group of illegal immigrants from China was handed back across the border to Chinese authorities today, a spokesman for the Hong Kong Government said.

title: Jersey Consumer Notes
description: A spate of consumer legislation popped up in the Legislature last week, with a bill aimed at requiring food stores to convert their shelves to unitpricing getting fug Senate approval by a vote of 26 to 1.

title: Advertising
description: The secret agent for the Continental Can Corpordion in its recent search for an ad agency to help it with, a worldwide communications effort has blown his cover.

title: District of Columbia Bill Permits Bounty for Guns
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 (UPI)  Mayor Walter Washington signed a bill today that authorizes the District of Columbia's government to set up a gun bounty program similar to one that has almost been phased out in Baltimore.

title: SHOP TALK Safety Pin's Dressy Role
description: The safety pin, somebody once said, is one of the bestdesigned objects around. Of course, they're handy to pin up a broken shoulder strap or diapers, but who really looks at one?

title: Poll Shows Increasing Discontent With Ford
description: New Jerseyans' discontent with the way Gerald Ford has conducted the Presidency, particularly his handling of the economy, has risen sharply since September, according to the latest New Jersey Poll, conducted by the Eagleton Institute.

title: Trial Set in Judge's Death
description: SPOKANE, Wash., Dec. 1 (UPI)  The trial of Ricky Young, 22 years old, accused of blowing up a Superior Court judge with a bomb mailed to his chambers, was scheduled to begin tomorrow. The defendant, who is from Prosser, Wash., was accused of pending a lethal package that exploded in the face of Judge James Lawless on June 3.

title: Nancy Stern Is Bride of S. R. Karetsky
description: Nancy Ann Stern, a lawyer with Hardee Barovick Konecky & Braun, was married here yesterday afternoon to Samuel R. Karetsky, a member of the equity department at Morgan Stanley & Co., investment banking concern.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Dec. 1 (AP)Blacks may excel in sports, but it's not because they're superior to white athletes, says Jesse Owens, who won four gold medals in track for the United States at the 1936 Olympics in Berlin. There is no difference in ability between the races, said Owens, who addressed the American Medical Association's National Conference on the Medical Aspects of Sports. It, all boils down to how badly you want something, he said.

title: New Mexico Starts Project to Contain Space Hall of Fame
description: ALAMOGORDO, N.M., Dec. 1 Ground was broken today for a $10million International Space Hall of Fame complex in what Gov. Bruce King described as the birthplace of the first atomic space age as he turned over the first spadeful of earth.

title: Parcel Service to Resume
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 1 (UPI) Package deliveries by the United Parcel Service are scheduled to resume tomorrow in California, Arizona and Nevada after a twoandahalfweek strike by drivers and packagers. The striking, workers, members of 10 local teamstar unions, ratified a twoyear contract this weekend, raising their hourly wages from $6.41 to $7.92, with an additional $2.34 in fringe benefit.

title: Queens Looks Back at Good Old Days
description: The youngsters pointed with excitement to the toy fire truck, the fathers argued over whether they indeed remembered the 5cent, handcranked movie shows, and oldtimers such as James Jackson reminisced about the days of getting dressed in patent leather shoes, spats and straw hats, so that all the girls were after you.

title: ERIK N. OLSEN
description: Erik N. Olsen, vice president and manager of the international banking office here of the Bank of America, died Thursday at his home, 45 East 85th Street. He was 57 years old.

title: Soviet Military Hints at Dissent on Arms Issue
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 1The Soviet armed forces newspaper Krasnaya Zvezda hinted today at military dissatisfaction over one aspect of the tentative strategic arms accord reached a week ago at Vladivostok by President Ford and Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet leader. In a commentary, the paper attacked foreign military bases as a source of war danger.

title: GREEK CYPRIOTES AND ATHENS AGREE ON STAND IN TALKS
description: ATHENS, Dec. 1Greek and Greek Cypriote leaders said today that they had agreed to take a common line in negotiations with the Turkish side over the future of Cyprus. But a communiqu, issued here after two days of talks, did not explain what that line would be.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Passenger and Crew List
description: Following is a list of the passengers and crew of the plane that crashed at Upperville, Va., as released by Trans World Airlines:

title: Horse Show Results AT MELVILLE, L. I.
description: Small Pony Hunter ChampionshipChampion, Mr. and Mrs. Chester Broman's The Patriot, 13 Points' reserve, Lisa Scardino's Bachelor Button, 11.

title: Roder Puts Bears on Top, 1613
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 1In what has become painful repetition, this time before a nearrecord number of noshows, the New York Giants dropped a 1613 decision to the Chicago Bears today on a 24yard field goal by Mirro Roder with 36 seconds left.

title: Jews Urged to Teach Young About Nazi Crimes
description: BOCA RATON, Fla., Dec. 1Deploring the lack of knowledge and understanding among Jewish youth about the Nazi holocaust, leaders of American Orthodox Judaism called today for intensive study of the subject.

title: Maxine Cromwell Is Married To Dale Hopkins at St. James'
description: St. James' Episcopal Church was the setting here yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Maxine Hope Cromwell, daughter of James H. R. Cromwell of New York and the late Maxine MacFetridge Cromwell, to Dale Edgar Hopkins, son of Mr. and Mrs. George E. Hopkins of Long Meadow, Mass.

title: RATES REVERSING DOWNWARD TREND
description: The rush to lower interest rates that fed a fantastic rally in fixedincome markets this autumn suddenly has reached its consolidation stage. With this stage one of digestion, rather than indigestion, Wall Street hopeshas come the realization that rates moved down too far and too fast, as swings often happen in the bond market.

title: LAWYERS IN FAVOR OF COURT REVISION
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 Lawyers are not as stubbornly opposed to streamlining some procedures of the appellate courts as a number of reformminded professional authorities had expected.

title: Diane Inselburg Married to Julian Spirer
description: Diane Nancy Inselburg, a psychologist with the child developmental clinic of the. Brooklyn Jewish Hospital, was married last evening to Julian Henry Spirer, an associate with the law firm of Paul, Weiss, Rifkind, Wharton & Garrison here.

title: CRIME RATE DOWN IN PERILOUS AREAS, UP IN REST OF CITY
MOYNIHAN EXPECTED TO LEAVE INDIA SOON
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1State Department officials said today that they expected Daniel P. Moynihan to resign as Ambassador to India in time to return to the Harvard faculty in the spring semester when his leave of absence expires.

title: The Spirit of the 12th . . .
description: When the 12th Congress convened in 1811, the House of Representatives elected a freshman member, Henry Clay, as Speaker. Clay had resigned from the Senate to serve in the House, then regarded as the more important branch.

title: PittsburghToronto Flights
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 1 (AP) Eastern Airlines will initiate nonstop service between Pittsburgh and Toronto on Tuesday. the first United States airline to schedule through service between here and another country. The airline will fly four round trips daily from Greater Pittsburgh International Airport.

title: Police Seek a HeavySet Man In HitandRun Death of Rabbi
description: LAKEWOOD, Dec. 1 (UPI)The police are seeking a heavyset man about 45 years of age in the hitandrun death of Rabbi Jacob Katz of Lakewood.

title: Holiday Traffic Is Slowed As Storm. Strikes the East
description: A huge storm shrouded the eastern half of the nation in a patchwork of snow, sleet and rain yesterday, an intimation of winter that brought the long Thanksgiving weekend, to a close with hazardous driving and other headaches for homebound travelers.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
British Laborite Calls German Leader Han
description: LONDON, Dec. 1 (Reuters) A British Labor party member of Parliament today described Chancellor Helmut Schmidt of West Germany as a patronizing Hun because of his speech to a Labor party conference yesterday.

title: WATERGATE FOCUS 15 ON HUSH MONEY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1For 29 days the prosecution at the Watergate coverup trial preseated witnesses, documents and tape recordings in an effort to prove that the five defendants had conspired to obstruct justice through such means as payments of hush money to the seven Watergate burglars.

title: America: In a Schizophrenic Way
description: WASHINGTON What can be said about America's outlook and spirit today? A recent national opinion survey by Potomac Associates shows a markedly schizophrenic public mood. It is a mood we first recorded three years ago, and its persistence contrasts sharply with findings a decade and more ago. Its very existence raises the specter of social and political instability.

title: Old Is Out and New Is In For Businessmen's Desks
description: Nicholas Brady transacts his business as board chairman of Dillon Read &, Co., Inc. over a dining room table, an 18th century English relic that he calls a desk.

title: Dance: A Day in the Life of City Ballet
description: George Balanchine is forever, in interviews, calling himself a chef, a carpenter, a cabinetmaker, a dentist, etc. But he happens to be only one thing. He is a choreographer. Possibly his carpentry is splendid, his cooking is certainly fine, and he mixes vodka as only perhaps a Georgian can. But his genius is for choreography.

title: Women and Minority Groups Increase Againin TV, Study Shows
description: Employment of women and ethnic minorities by television stations in the United States increased again in 1974, as it has every year since 1971, and the gains were strikingly noticeable in the upper job levels, according to an annual employment study of the industry by the Office of Communication of the United Church of Christ.

title: 3 Children Killed as Fire Strikes Newark Tenement
description: NEWARK, Dec. 1, (UPI)A threealarm fire raced through a frame tenament early today and killed three children, equalling the worst death toll this year in a Newark fire.

title: RABBI IS WOUNDED RESISTING A HOLDUP
description: A 25yearold rabbi was shot and slightly wounded by one of two young men who attempted to rob him near his home in the Crown, Heights section of Brooklyn last night, the police reported.

title: Chinese Exposed to Eclipse, Told It's Perfectly Natural
description: PEKING, Dec. 1 (Agence FrancePresse)  China had a total eclipse of the moon Friday night and the press was careful to explain that, contrary to traditional superstitions, it did not herald catastrophes.

title: BYRNE IS IN FAVOR OF TAX PACKAGE
description: Governor Byrne said yesterday he would favor a modest increase in New Jersey's sales tax if it was part of a revenueraising package designed to meet the state's anticipated budget deficit and educationfinancing problem.

title: Holiday Traffic Is Slowed As Storm Strikes the East
description: A huge storm shrouded the eastern half of the nation in a patchwork of snow, sleet, and rain yesterday, an intimation of winter that brought the long Thanksgiving weekend to a close with hazardous driving and other headaches for homebound travelers.It was a glowering and rainy day in the city and even colder and more sullen in the suburbs, where afternoon sleet turned to snow last night. Overnight accumulations were expected to be washed away by more rain today.

title: Kirkman Withdraws
description: LONDON, Dec. 1 (UPI) Boone Kirkman of Seattle has a broken nose and will be unable to fight Britain's European heavyweight champion, Joe Bugner, Tuesday. Alberto Lovell of Argentina will fill in for Kirkman.

title: Game Kept Legislator From Taking Fatal Jet
description: MARTINSVILLE, Ind., Dec. 1 (UPI)Representative William G. Bray, Republican of Indiana, decided to see the ArmyNayy football game at Philadelphia on the weekend instead of returning to Indiana and the decision may have saved his life.

title: Israeli Says Base of 2 Raiders Will Be Attacked
description: TEL AVIV, Dec: 1Defense Minister Shimon Peres said today that Israel knew the site in Lebanon where two Palestinians Who killed an Israeli citizen yesterday had received their guerrila training.

title: News Summary and Index MONDAY, DECEMBER 2, 1974
description: Greek and Greek Cypriote leaders said that they had agreed to take a common line in negotiations with to Turks over the future of Cyprus; but a communiqu issued in Athens after two days of talks did not explain what that line would be. As a result of the meeting, the Greek side now seems prepared to enter substantive negotiations for the first time since talks collapsed in Geneva last August, but in view of the political uncertainty in Turkey it is not clear whether the Turks are ready to talk. [Page 1, Column 5.]

title: BIG PROFITS SHOWN IN NURSING HOMES
description: A study of reports by 92 nursing homes in New York City discloses that operators paid themselves $3,225,000 last year in salaries for undefined services. About onethird did not claim to have done any work at all, while the rest said they served from three to 80 hours a week.

title: Miss Werner Has Nuptials
description: Barbara Stephanie Werner, daughter of Mrs. Sigmund Werner of East Orange, N.J., and the late Mr. Werner, was married yesterday afternoon to Michael Peter Canno, son of Mr. and Mrs. Leonard Canno of New York, at the bridegroom's home in Rye, N. Y.

title: Rubber Trading To Start Jan. 22 on Cocoa Exchange
description: Beginning Jan 22, trading in natural rubber futures will begin at the New York Cocoa exchange, T. P. Aitkin, president of the board of managers of the exchange, announced yesterday.

title: Soccer Results
description: EXHIBITION GAME

title: New Jersey Sports
description: ROBBINSVILLE, Dec. 1The pairing for eight high school football playoff games, the first held by the New Jersey State Interscholastic Athletic Association, were announced today. The association also named 13 sectional champions where playoffs will not be required.

title: Watergate Aftermath: 2
description: WASHINGTON  The Watergate coverup trial has dramatized the fact that, when President Nixon published his tape transcripts last April, crucial passages were left out. But it is not yet generally realized that the new tapes played at the trial could lead to further prosecutionsof those involved in cutting incriminating material from the transcripts.

title: Robberies and Burglaries Drop in South Bronx and Harlem, Study Reports
Supplementary OverCounter Listings.
description: The following is a supple mentary weekly list of mutual funds prepared by the National Association of Securities Dealers. The range shown reflects prices at which securities could have been sold (bid) or bought (asked) last Friday.

title: SUBWAY HOLDUPS LAID TO 11 YOUTHS
description: Eleven teenaged members of a Bronx gang were arrested yesterday and charged with robbing at least 60 subway change booths of approximately $60,000 in tokens and cash over the last two months, averaging about $1,000 a day since Oct. 1.

title: ALL 92 ON BOARD KILLED WHEN JETLINER CRASHES IN RAIN NEAR WASHINGTON
description: UPPERVILLE, Va., Dec. 1A Trans World Airlines 727, battling a driving rainstorm, slammed into a wooded slope near a secret government installation today, killing all 92 persons aboard. It was the worst air disaster of the year in the United States.

title: Roder Puts Bears on Top, 1613
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 1In what has become painful repetition, this time before a nearrecord number of noshows, the New York Giants dropped a 1613 decision to the Chicago Bears today on a 24yard field goal by Mirro Roder with 36 seconds left.

title: GREEK CYPRIOTES AND ATHENS AGREE ON STAND IN TALKS
description: ATHENS, Dec. 1Greek and Greek Cypriote leaders said today that they had agreed to take a common line in negotiations with the Turkish side over the future of Cyprus. But a communiqu, issued here after two days of talks, did not explain what that line would be.

title: Dance: Sanasardo's Amazing Graces
description: Humor came surprisingly to the fore in Paul Sanasardo's program Saturday evening at the American Theater Laboratory. Most often Mr. Senasardo has presented a saturnine creative profile, so that the bittersweet tone of The Amazing Graces was welcome.

title: U.S. Golfers Win From Japanese
description: WAKAYAMA, Japan, Dec. 1 (Reuters)  The United States won the fourth United StatesJapan golf tournament today by nine strokes but Teruo Sugihara of Japan edged Hubert Green of Birmingham, Ala., for the individual title.

title: Importance of U.S. Munitions to Israel Assayed
description: Military studies in the United States, Israel and Western Europe emphasize that the pace and scale of American munitions support during combat could be vital to Israel's ability to fight a successful war against Egypt and Syria.

title: Weicker Backs Rockefeller
description: Senator Lowell P. Weicker Jr., Republican of Connecticut, said yesterday that he would vote for confirmation of Vice Presidentdesignate Nelson A. Rockefeller, The Associated Press reported. Senator Weicker's comments were made in an interview broadcast by WNBC here.

title: COAL PACT LEADS IN EARLY RETURNS
description: WASHINGTON,' Dee. 1The first scattered voting today by Striking coal miners, balloting early on a tentative agreement with the mine owners that is strongly backed by Arnold R. Miller, president of the United Mine Workers, gave only the narrowest margin of approval to the proposed settlement.

title: GiantsBears Scoring
Crash Was Worst One in the U.S. This Year
description: The crash of the Trans World Airlines jetliner in Virginia yesterday was the second major disaster this year among domestic commercial airlines in the United States, the Associated Press reported.

title: Udall Calls Conservation Key to Energy Shortage
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 (AP) Conservation should be a major tool in the battle to overcome the energy shortage, Representative Morris K. Udall said today.

title: GiantsBears Scoring
Wedding for Judith A. Rothenberg
description: Judith A. Rothenberg, daughter of Mrs. Irving Rothenberg of New York and the late Mr. Rothenberg, was married yesterday afternoon to Peter V. Tishman of New York and Harrison, N. Y. Rabbi Maurice Davis performed the ceremony in Mamaroneck, N. Y. at the home of the bridegroom's mother, Mrs. Norman Tishman.

title: Secret Facility Is Near Site of Crash
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 (UPI)  The crash today, of Trans World Airlines Flight 514 on a Blue Ridge mountaintop jolted the government's classified Mount Weather installation only a mile and half away.

title: Welfare Plan Would Link Fund to Jobs
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 (UPI) Cutbacks in Federal welfare funds are planned for states with the poorest record of placing welfare recipients in steady jobs, the Department of Health, Education and Welfare said today.

title: Amy Lewinger Wed To a Tax Specialist
description: The marriage or Amy Lewinger, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Julius B. Lewinger of New Rochelle, N. Y., to Henry Bubel, son of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur Bubel of Greenwich, Conn., took place yesterday afternoon.

title: Attica Hearings Are Under Way
description: BUFFALOFor the last do weeks in the Erie County Courthouse here, pretrial hearings have been ping on in the first major case to stem from the Attica prison rebellion of September, 1971, which resulted in the loss of 43 lives.

title: ChemicalGroup Profits Surge in West Germany
description: BERLIN, Dec. 1At a time of worldwide economic gloom, West Germany's chemistry giants last week reported exceptional gains in 1974 and forecast a further, though somewhat slower, expansion on foreign markets next year.

title: G. GOULD LINCOLN, 94, POLITICAL REPORTER
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 1 (UPI) G. Gould Lincoln, the dean of Washington political reporters, died today at his home here. He was 94 years old.

title: Rommel's Son Wins Election As the Mayor of Stuttgart
description: STUTTGART, West Germany, Dec. 1 (UFI)Manfred Rommel, son of Field Marshal Erwin Rommel, the Desert Fox, won election today as Mayor of Stuttgart.

title: Physician Dragged To Death on L.LR.R. As Doors Trap Him
description: A 44yearold physician was killed yesterday morning when the doors of a Long Island Rail Road train closed on his right leg and he was dragged some 175 feet as the train left the Huntington station, Suffolk County police said.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A 13yearold girl who had been missing for two days after she fell while horseback riding was found yesterday afternoon, tired and wet but in high spirits. The police said the girl, Diana Lynn Hicks, was found at 4 P.M. by employes of a stable in Wall Township.

title: YoYo Ma, Cellist, Performs Not Plays
description: The difference between playing a piece of music and performing it is vast, and probably cannot be taught. One of the performers, and already a major one at age 19, is the cellist YoYo Ma, who gave an extraordinary recital yesterday at the 92d Street Y.M.Y.W.H.A., stoutly supported at the piano by Peter Schaaf.

title: Ruling on Mexican Aliens Stirs Chicanos' Job Fears
description: SAN YSIDRO, Calif., Dec. 1 The Supreme Court ruling last week affirming the unrestricted right, of Mexican green card aliens to live and work in the United States has stirred new fears among MexicanAmericans already hard hit by rising unemployment.

title: Cookbooks: The Books Publishers Love Best
description: It's rarely discussed on the Johnny CarsonMerv Griffin??day show circuit, it's never ??ought by Hollywood for multimilliondollar movie adaptations, and it almost never cracks the influential bestseller lists. But to its publisher, a cookbook can be a gold mine that never runs out of gold.

title: Beame Seeks to Reassure Employes Facing Layoffs
description: With 1,510 Civil Service and provisional city employes scheduled to be dismissed in an economy move, Mayor Beame said yesterday that those with Civil Service status will get top priority in reassignment to provisional positions that are available and to which they are, eligible.

title: Explosion In Ethiopia Stirs Reports of Guerrilla Drive
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Dec. 1 (AP)Rumors of a guerrilla campaign against the threemonthold military Government spread through Addis Ababa today after an explosion at a fuel depot at the airport.

title: New Energy Head Gets Mixed Reception
description: Frank G. Zarb, a 39yearold former investment banker who was named last week by President Ford to head the Federal Energy Administration, has left both admirers and critics behind him during his meteoric rise on Wall Street.

title: Paris Postal Workers Back
description: PARIS, Dec. 1 (UPI)Nightshift postal and telecommunications employes went back to their jobs here tonight, starting a general return to work after 43 days of a paralyizing mail strike.

title: She Tells Why She Married a Tribal Chief
description: Wyn Sargent, one of the better known brides of 1973, came to town the other day, One reason, she said, was to tell her side about her much publicized marriage to the chief of a cannibal tribe in West Irian, formerly Netherlands New Guinea.

title: British Labor Party Gathered at Annual Meeting, Displays Deep Divisions
description: LONDON, Dec. 1They sometimes say that the Labor party is an argument.

title: Hartwick Advances In Soccer
description: Adelphi won Division II and Brockport State near Buffalo took Division III of the National Collegiate AthIetic Association soccer tournaments last Saturday, and now Hartwick College of Oneonta can make it a sweep for the State of New York by winning Division I.

title: New 911 System Speeds Suffolk Police
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. I., Dec. 1 At 1:53 A.M. on a recent day, the telephone rang in the room where James Wichrowski works. The woman on the line was hysterical. My children have been stabbed, she credit.

title: TV Review
description: The Public Broadcasting Service, tonight at 8 o'clock, once again taps the work of an independent videotape group for some unusually fresh documentary material. The group is the Downtown Community TV Center, near Chinatown. The hourlong program culled from 45 hours of tape recorded over two months last spring, is called Cuba: The People.

title: Flyers Crush Scouts, 10 to 0
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 1 (AP)Bobby Clarke scored one goal and assisted on four others tonight, leading the Philadelphia Flyers to a 100 rout of the Kansas City Scouts in a National Hockey League game.

title: Ulster Imperatives
description: The killing of twenty persons and wounding of nearly 200 in terror bombings of Birmingham pubs has finally brought home the dimensions of the Northern Ireland catastrophe to the people of Britain. Though violence in Ulster has claimed some 1,200 lives in five years, including more than 200 British soldiers, Britons generally and at times even the British Government have treated the situation as a nasty nuisance, rather than a problem menacing the whole United Kingdom.

title: Sports Today BASKETBALL
description: St. John's at Vanderbilt. (Radio WOBB, 8:30 P.M.)

title: Hawaii Tops Rutgers, 2816
description: HONOLULU, Dec. 1 (UPI) Regis Grice scored on thirdquarter touchdown runs of 26 and 1 yard and the University of Hawaii rushed for 296 yards in a 2816 victory over Rutgers last night in a football game marred by a fight that sent a player to the hospital.

title: CAMBODIA SEARCH FOR 23 CONTINUES
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Dec. 1  Twenty three foreign journalists are still missing and unaccounted for in Cambodia. As the war here nears the end of its fifth year, no conclusive evidence has yet emerged of their whereabouts or their fatealthough men in captivity described as journalists have several times been reported seen.

title: Bucks Pin Loss On 76ers
description: MADISON, Wis., Dec. 1 (AP)Kareem Abdu Jabbar scored 29 of his 35 points in the second half tonight as the revived Milwaukee Bucks gained a 117112 victory over the Philadelphia 76ers in a National Basketball Association game.

title: 2 Men Slain in Muggings at Same Hour Four Blocks Apart on Lower East Side Arguments Noted Very Quiet People
description: Two elderly Chinese men were stabbed to death in apparent robberies Saturday night in tenement entrances four blocks apart on the Lower East Side.

title: Sucheta Kripalani, Indian Aide And Independence Fighter, Dies
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 1 (Reuters) Sucheta Kripalani, a leading fighter in the struggle for Indian independence, died here today of a heart attack, She was 67 years old.

title: About New York There Are Muggersand Muggers
description: There is an infinite number of ways to get mugged in New York, some of them more surprising than others. The other day, shortly before 9 A.M., Jack Orr left his apartment on the West Side and walked up to Broadway to buy a newspaper. When he returned to the apartment, he found two boys in the lobby. The older boy was perhaps 14 years old, and the younger one perhaps 6. Together they were looking at the doorbells.

title: Panamanian Horse Wins At San Juan
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., Dec. 1Horses from Panama won all three international races held yesterday and today at El Commandante race track here.

title: Miss Stoll Upset in Tennis
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., Dec. 1  Tracy Austin of Rollings Hills, Calif., upset Caroline Stoll of Livingston, N. J., 62, 60, in the final of the United States Lawn, Tennis Association's girls 14yearold championship today at the Port Washington Tennis Academy. In the 12yearold bracket, Shelly Solomon, of Fort Lauderdale, Fla., defeated Susan Mascarin of Grosse Point, Mich., 64, 62.

title: Democratic Support Growing For $700Million Jersey Tax
description: TRENTON, Dec. 2Senate Democratic leaders announced tonight growing support for a $700million state tax program to fill an impending budget deficit and to comply with the State Supreme Court order to refinance New Jersey's system of funding public schools.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: The Arizona Public Service Company has filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission a registration statement for the proposed sale of 1.5 million shares of its common stock. Proceeds will be used to reduce the company's shortterm debt. The offering is being made through First Boston, Blyth Eastman Dillon and Dean Witter.

title: COAST CITY PLANS TO RAZE THE STUB
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 2San Francisco has its Golden Gate Bridge, its Coit Tower and Its famous Bay, It also has the Stub.

title: Saks Gives Library $25,000
description: In celebration of its 50th Christmas, Saks Fifth Avenue will give $25,000 to the New York Public Library. Allan R. Johnson, chairman of the store, said he hoped the gift would be an inspiration to others in the industry to help this superb New York institution, which so badly needs financial assistance.

title: Rangers Flounder With Key Men Out
description: It's almost as if the fragrave of operatingroom antiseptic can be projected over a telephone line. Some New York Ranger employes are answering, the phone with: Lenox Hill annex. Understandably. With four of their best men on the injured list, the Ranger's are floundering, tied for third place. (with the New York Islanders) in a fourteam division.

title: Miss Krupsak Calls for an End To Rule by Few Chiefs in Albany
description: TARRYTOWN, N. Y., Dec. 2  Lieutenant Governorelect Mary Anne Krupsak said today that the Legislature had to reform itself through institutional change that would free Assemblymen and Senators from domination by a few legislative leaders.

title: F.E.A. RULES SET ON COST OF CRUDE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 (AP) The Federal Energy Administration issued regulations today to equalize the cost of crude oil among refiners and the cost of fuel oils among distributors.

title: MILITARISM OUT IN GREEK SCHOOLS
description: ATHENS, Dec. 2When Greek schoolchildren were given textbooks this fall, many of the books still contained the emblem of the fallen military dictatorshipa phoenix rising from its ashes. The Ministry of Education instructed the pupils to remove the offending page. That was not really necessary

title: Tactical Nuclear Cutback In Europe Urged by Study
description: A defensepolicy specialist of the Brookings Institution has recommended that the United States reduce the number of tactical nuclear warheads it deploys in Western Europe from the present total of 7,000 to 2,000.

title: Books of The Times
description: NAKED NOMADS. By George Gilder. 180 pages. Quadrangle. $7.95.

title: Gambler Testifies To Bribing Police In Mount Vernon
description: WHITE PLAINS, Dec. 2 (UPI) A confessed gambler testified inWestchester County Court today that he had paid bribes amounting to $800 or $900 month to Mount Vernon police officers, including a captain.

title: Arkansas Paper Asks Mills To Alter Behavior or Quit
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., Dec. 2 (UPI) The Arkansas Gazette, the largest newspaper in the state, called on Representative Wilbur D. Mills, Democrat of Arkansas, in an editorial today to either forgo his public indiscretions with Annabel Battistella, a stripper, or resign.

title: KUWAIT IS BUYER OF DAKERSTOCK
description: BONN, Dec. 2The tiny oilproducing Arab sheikdom of Kuwait was the mystery buyer that acquired about 14 per cent of DaimlerBenz, maker of Mercedes automobiles, last week, the Dresdner Bank disclosed today.

title: Chess: Asia, Out of It Until Recently, Is Trying Hard to Catch Up
description: The Far East, until recently an uncultivated area of the game, is currently making great progress. Last summer at the Nice Olympiad, Australia, New Zealand, Singapore, Indonesia, Hong Kong, Japan, Malaysia and the Philippines entered teams and the Philippines sextet qualified for the championship finals, finishing 12th out of 16.

title: Refiners Cut Sugar by 5c, First Drop in 20 Months
description: The first price reduction in sugar in 20 months was announced yesterday by three of the nation's largest refiners. The price action shaved the price of sugar, which has been the most volatile food product this year, by about 5 cents a pound.

title: Saudi Entrepreneur's NonOil Success
description: LONDON, Dec. 2When Adnan M. Khashoggi was a student at Chico State College in northern California 20 years ago, his father sent him $10,000 to buy a new car like the ones driven by other Arab students. Instead, young Mr. Khashoggi put the money in the bank.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: CRETE REVISITED: After its dandy 110 in the Shade, Octagon has done it again with a revival of Zorba. And Where, pray, in all the midtown area can, you see a good musical, even a small one, for $2.50? The answer is at the Dixie Hotel, 250 West 43d Street, the groundfloor showcase of the enterprising Octagon youngsters, most of them in their twenties and pluckily restaging Broadway musicals that did not quite make it, artistically, or ??inancially.

title: SPAIN TO PERMIT POLITICAL GROUPS
description: MADRID, Dec. 2The Spanish Government tonight announced limited freedom for Spaniards to form political associations for the first time since the end of the Civil War 35 years ago.

title: Howard Had Coronary
description: NEPTUNE, Dec. 2 (AP) Doctors for Congressman James J. Howard, a Democrat, hospitalized since Nov. 23, said today that a heart attack had been diagnosed as the reason for his illness. The sixterm Congressman, listed in satisfactory condition at the Jersey Shore Medical Center here, had complained of dizzy spells and stomach cramps.

title: RALPH E. FLIEDNER
description: Ralph E. Fliedner, who founded the Fliedner funeral establishment in Great Neck, L.I., in 1933, died yesterday at his home, 190 Middle Neck Road, Great Neck. He was 68 year old.

title: Hostages Held 7 Hours on Coast By Gunman in a Supermarket
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 2 (UPI)Two gunmen, cornered in a supermarket during a holdup attempt today, seized seven store employes as hostages. One gunman was captured quickly but the other bargained for nearly seven hours with the police before he released the last hostage and surrendered.

title: LINDSAY F. JOHNSON
description: Lindsay F. Johnson, who retired in 1970 as president of the New Jersey Zinc Company and a director of Gulf & Western Industries, Inc., which acquired it in 1965, died Saturday in Southern Pines, N.C. He was 67 years old.

title: High Winds and Tides Batter State in Wake of Rain
description: High winds in the wake of heavy rain walloped the soggy metropolitan area yesterday during the morning rush hour, flooding highways, uprooting trees, disrupting rail lines and fraying the nerves of commu ters returning to work for the first time in five days.

title: Miki Chosen to Succeed Tanaka in Japan
description: TOKYO, Dec. 2A senion member of Japan's Parliament Takeo Miki, was selected today to become ??emier. He will succeed the inc??bent, Kakue Tanaka, in about 10 days.

title: SWISS SEEK TO HALT AN INFLUX OF MONEY
description: ZURICH, Switzerland, Dec. 2 (Reuters)The Swiss National Bank took a further move today aimed at stemming the flow of foreign funds into Switzerland.

title: Soviet Astronauts Orbited in Test for Project With U.S.
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 2The Soviet Union launched today an improved Soyuz spacecraft with two veteran astronauts aboard into orbit around the earth in a major systems test for the SovietAmerican space rendezvous scheduled for next July.

title: HOUSE DEMOCRATS END MILLS'S RULE OVER COMMITTEES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2The Democrats in the House, of Representatives voted today to divest the Democrats on the Ways and Means Committee and the panel's chairman, Representative Wilbur D. Mills of Arkansas, of the authority to make committee assignments for other Democrats.

title: Needed Army Reform
description: Defense Secretary Schlesinger's effort to get sixteen combat divisions instead of thirteen out of the Army's 785,000 men200,000 fewer men than the sixteendivision Army of preVietnam 1964is an ambitious, longoverdue and muchneeded reform.

title: Hijacker Gets 60 Years
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec, 2 (AP) Luiseged Tesfa, 24 years old, of Ethiopia, was sentenced in Federal court today to a 60year prison term for his role in the 1972 hijacking of a jet from Philadelphia. International Airport. Michael S. Green, 35, of Washington, was also convicted for taking part in the hijacking. He was sentenced in August to a 50year Federal prison term.

title: LAG IN ARTS FUNDS SEEN LABOR PERIL
description: One of the key problems facing both management and labor in their continuing relationships in the performing arts, particularly at the nonprofit institutions, is the question of dwindling financial support, Alan Olson, assistant to the executive secretary of the American Guild of Musical Artists, said yesterday.

title: The Proceedings in the U.N. Today
A Tax Where It's Needed
description: Winfield Dunn of Tennessee, the chairman of the Republican Governors Conference, is the latest public official to bring pressure on President Ford at least to consider a higher gasoline tax. Despite his professed wish to see gasoline consumption reduced, as a first step toward coping with the energy crisis and the high price of oil, Mr. Ford has insisted that he is not even thinking about raising the gasoline tax.

title: JOHN POTESKY
description: John Potesky, who retired in 1972 as advertising director of The Journal of Commerce, died Sunday in West Palm Beach. He was 77 years old and formerly lived in East Orange, N.J.

title: SAUL SLOMIAK
description: Saul Slomiak, chief counsel since 1972 of the United States Customs Service, died yesterday of cancer in Holy Cross Hospital, Silver Spring, Md. He was 45 years old and lived in Rockville, Md.

title: Canadiens Win, 20; Larocque in Goal
description: MONTREAL, Dec. 2 (UPI) Larry Robinson scored both goals and Bunny Larocque earned his first shutout of the season tonight as the Montreal Canadiens beat the Atlanta Flames, 20.

title: A Leveling of Rates and Glut Factors Municipals Off
description: Corporate bond, prices broke drastically yesterday as a glut of merchandise and the suddenleveling off in shortterm interest rates produced the biggest selloff since the huge rally began in midSeptember. The market went right down the tube, declared one bond trader. A similar turbulence hit the municipal bond market, which became unhinged after New York City was forced to pay record interest costs of 9,4 per cent and 95 per citit for both sevenmonth notes, And oneyear notes, respectively.

title: Jury Chosen at New Trial For McCrane in Scranton
description: SCRANTON, Pa., Dec. 2The Federal Government again opened its campaignfraud case against Joseph M. McCrane, the former NeW Jersey State Treasurer, as a jury of seven women and five men was selected today, from several Lackawanna Valley communities, an area Considered remote enough from New Jersey politics to insure, a fair trial.

title: Dominica on Alert After Black Group Is Told to Disband
description: ROSEAU, Dominica, Dec. 2 (UPI)  All 160 soldiers and policemen on this Eastern Caribbean island went on full alert this week to enforce an order to disband made to a black guerrilla group blamed for the murder of several whites. The 300member group, called the Dreads and hiding in the mountainous jungles of the island's interior, was ordered by Prime Minister Patrick John to disband by Wednesday. Government sources said Mr. John would consider declaring a state of emergency if the guerrillas did not obey the order.

title: Vladivostok Pact: How It Was Reached
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2The latest SovietAmerican nuclear arms deal was worked out only after the Russians agreed to exempt American nuclear bombers stationed in and around Europe and to limit the total level of missiles, bombers and multiple warheads permitted on each side, according to authoritative Administration officials.

title: Park Parcels Transferred
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 (UPI) President Ford announced today the transfer of an additional 21 parcels of land in 16 states and Puerto Rico for recreational use under the Legaey of Parks Program. The properties total nearly 2,735.66 acres and are valued at $11,017,000. The latest transfer brings to 482 the number of Legacy of Parks properties in all 50 states, the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico, Guam and the Virgin Islands.

title: 22 G.I.'S IN BERLIN PENALIZED IN STRIKE
description: BERLIN, Dec. 2The United States Army is disciplining 22 soldiers who went on strike at their unit here last week in a dispute over haircut regulations.

title: INQUIRY STARTED ON UPSTATE CRASH
description: HAVERSTRAW, N. Y., Dec. 2 Investigators began today to unravel the cause of the nearvertical plunge last night of a Northwest Airlines 727 charter jet into a wooded area of Harriman State Park.

title: 2 ExJudges to Investigate School Aides' Outside Ties
description: School Chancellor Irving Anker announced yesterday that at his request, two former city judges would conduct a comprehensive independent inquiry into relationships between Board of Education staff members and two companies whose business dealings with the school systems were being investigated by the city and state.

title: Building Trades Wages Rise
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 (UPI) The average union wage rate of building trades workers rose 2.4 per cent in urban areas in the third quarter, the largest thirdquarter gain recorded by the Department of Labor.

title: Roger Turcotte, Off Slowly, Waits to Hit Brothers' Form
description: Roger Turcotte, the fourth of the riding Turcottes, still is seeking his first victory. The 19yearold, 107pound jockey finished fifth at Agueduct in this only start yesterday.

title: Jersey Democrats Draft Tax Proposal To Net $700Million
description: TRENTON, Dec. 2Senate Democratic leaders announced tonight growing support for a $700million state tax program to fill an impending budget deficit and to comply with the State Supreme Court order to refinance New Jersey's system of funding public schools.

title: Advertising
description: When the House of Herms, the French leather and perfume company, decided that the time had come to advertise Caleche, its women's fragrance, and Equipage, its men's fragrance, on American television it wanted to make a splash.

title: Labor Against Europe
description: Britain's Labor party has managed to embarrass its own Government and widen an already bitter division in its ranks over the issue of membership in the European Common Market. In a vote dominated, as always, by the bloc votes of the big trade unions, the party's annual conference has demanded a virtually complete restructuring of the European Community as the price of continued British participation.

title: Paris: The Privacy of the Impressionists' Engravings
description: PARIS, Dec. 2 The impressionist lexhibition just ended at the Grand Petalsit is soon, to open in New York at the Metropolitan Museura of Artwas visited by a record crowd of more than 500,000 people in two and a half months. When, as was the case here, believing is seeing, you know that you are dealing with idolatry, not art. The Sailboats of Argenteuil have become the fetishes of a new cargo cult. An antidote against it, as efficient as it was unexpected, has fortunately, been provided by Impressionist Engraving, an exhibition organized by the Bibliotheque liatitmale, comprising some 350 works leadung up to, and by, the group.

title: Ford Says Accord Gives A Basis for Cut in Arms
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2President Ford made public tonight the details of a tentative agreement on arms control that he and Leonid I. Brezhnev had reached in Vladivostok. He said the accord put a firm ceiling on the arms race and created a solid basis for future arms reductions. [Opening statement, page 28.]

title: Bulletin Strike in 2d Day
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 2 (UPI) Delivery, of the Philadelphia Bulletin was halted today for the second day by a strike of 150 Mailroom employes who were protesting the suspension of 10 their members. The newspaper was being published as usual but sales were limited to the lobby of the building.

title: Vladivostok Pact: How It Was Reached
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2The latest SovietAmerican nuclear arms deal was worked out only after the Russians agreed to exempt American nuclear bombers stationed in and around Europe and to limit the total level of missiles, bombers and multiple warheads permitted on each side, according to authoritative Administration officials.

title: Stage: Rhythm of Sun, From Poland
description: TO THE RHYTHM OF THE SUN, based on Urszula Koziol's poetry, adopted for the stage and directed by Boguslaw Litwiniec; music and Instrumentation by Zbigniew Piotrowski; choreography by Waldemar Fogiel; setting by Piotr Wieczorek. Performed by the company. Presented by WPA Theater, 333 Bowery.

title: Pioneer Closes In for Loop Around Jupiter
description: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif., Dec. 2Plunging toward Jupiter for its perilous loop around that planet tonight, Pioneer 11 has cast its electronic eye on Callisto, second largest of the Jovian moons, and revealed what seems to be a small polar cap like that on Mars.

title: A.M.A. GROUP WEIGHS DEFINITION OF DEATH
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Dec, 2 (UPI)Committees of the American Medical Association's House of Delegates met today to thresh out recommendations on 65 resolutions, including a controversial definition of death.

title: Earnings for Year Climb at Tesoro Petroleum
Chick Corea Puts Energy Into Jazz In Carnegte Concert
description: When Chick Corea performed at the Newport Jazz Festival last summer, his guitarist, Albert DiMeola, had only been with the quartet a few days, and understandably played a rather retiring role. But Sunday night, when Mr. Corea and his cohorts returned to Carnegie Hill, Mr. DiMeola had plearly settled in, and the performance as a whole wae more typical of what Mr. Corea has been up to recently than last summer's was.

title: Pioneer Photographs Jupiter and Flies On
description: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif., Dec. 2Pioneer It transmitted the first pictures of Jupiter's south polar region tonight and then, after a perilous journey through what is believed to be the most intense part of that planet's radiation belt, soared into a trajectory that will carry it across the solar system in five years to Saturn.

title: SIRICA HINTS JURY VON'T HEAR NIXON
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 Judge John J. Sirica strongly suggested today that he intended to let the Watergate coverup case go to the jury without waiting to get testimony from former President Richard M. Nixon.

title: Davis's Bid for Heisman Appears to Be Too Late
description: Anthony Davis drew nationwide attention Saturday with his electrifying 234yard, fourtouchdown performance against Notre Dame. But it was probably too little, too late for the Southern California back to pass Archie Griffin of Ohio State, in the Heisman trophy balloting.

title: Contract Awards
description: The General Electric Company announced yesterday that it had received an order for 195 diesel electric locomotives costing more than $100million from the Federal Railway System of Brazil. The order is the largest overseas award for rail power ever received by G.E., according to Hoyt P. Steel, vice president and general manager of G.E.'s International sales division. The equipment, to be built largely in G.E.'s plant in Campinas, Brazil, will be delivered to the railroad in 1975 and 1976.

title: I.M.F. Bonds Tied to Gold A re Urged in Italian's Plan
description: PARIS, Dec. 2  Italy has now followed the United States in offering a proposal for mobilizing the International Monetary Fund's gold resources to provide temporary relief for countries hardest hit by the sharp increase of oil prices.

title: Why the Prisoners Are Looking to Federal Courts
description: In the nineteensixties, the United States Supreme Court set the tone for a revolution in criminal law procedure. In a series of landmark decisions, the court required state and tocal governments to furnish counsel to indigent persons accused of crimes. In the last few years, a marked shift in this procedural revolution has taken place. The lower Federal courts, instead of the Supreme Court, have taken the lead in carving out new law. And rather than focusing on the legal rights of the cused, these courts have taken an increasingly active role in supervising state and local institutions which house those who have not:been convicted of a crime. By and large, state courts, which have shown less interest in such suits, have been, bypaised. Also, Federal law has become more highly developed in this area.

title: Airline Strike Grows
description: DALLAS, Dec, 2 (UPI)Airline mechanics joined 1,100 members of the Air Line Employes Union today in a strike against Texas International Airlines. The line's flights have been cut 10 per cent, but airline spokesmen said that flights were on schedule and no significant problems had arisen from the walkout.

title: Dolphins Beat Bengals With Old Style, 24 to 3
description: MIAMI, Dec. 2The game was important, so the Miami Dolphins, accustomed to success in such quantity that they need challenges to start the adrenalin moving, responded. They trounced the Cincinnati Bengals, 243, tonight in the Orange Bowl for their ninth victory in 12 games and remained tied with the Buffalo Bills for first place in the East Division of the American Conference.

title: JANET R. LAUREN, 54, A CONCERT MANAGER
description: Janet R. Lauren, former concert manager and radio producer, died here yesterday at the age of 54. She lived at 450 East 85th Street.

title: Vivian Dixon Wanamaker Dies; A Prominent Society Figure, 57
description: Vivian Dixon Wanamaker, who had been prominent sociaily here and in Palm Beach, died Sunday in Westminster Hospital, London, after a brief illness. She was 57 years old and lived in Rome.

title: UNESCO Worried by Reaction on Israel
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 2UNESCO, worried by unfavorable reaction to measures taken against Israel in a recent meeting of the organization said today it hoped that Israell scientists, educators and scholars would continue contributing to its work.

title: NICHOLAS PALIHNICH SR.
description: Nicholas J. Paiihnich Sr., who retired in 1968 as executive vice president of the International Terminal Operating Company, a marinecargo handling organization, died Saturday at his home in. West Orange, N.J. He was 74 years old.

title: Tax Evasion in Trenton
description: All across the country these days public officials are wrestling with excruciatingly difficult dilemmas caused by rising costs and shrinking revenuesexcept in New Jersey. It's not that New Jersey doesn't have problems. It does, in spades. It's just that the Legislature in Trenton so far hasn't had the courage to grapple with them.

title: In OF QUORUM STALLS RIVER BILL
description: WASHNIGTON, Dec. 2A bill to put 70 miles of the Net River in the Wild and Scenio Rivers Systems was jeopardized today when Representatives James A. Haley and Roy A. Taylor, the chairman and ranking Democrat of the House Intenor Committee, were once again unable to assemble a quorum to act on environmental bills.

title: S.E.C. WEIGHS EASING FOREIGN FUND RULES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 (Reuters)The Securities and Exchange Commission invited today public comment on whether it should ease its registration eequirements to permit more foreign investment companies, notably mutual funds to operate in the United States.

title: Champagne Toast For Fight Referee
description: LONDON, Dec. 2 (Reuters) Dinnerjacketed boxing fans hurled champagne glasses, empty bottles and ice cubes into the ring at the Hilton Hotel tonight in protest against a referee's decision.

title: Labor Party Sued by U.A.W. Over Name of Newspaper
description: DETROIT, Dec. 2 (AP)The United Auto Workers union has filed a $14million lawsuit against the United States Labor party alleging that the group illegally uses the name of the U.A.W. newspaper for a paper of its own.

title: News Summary and Index
description: TUESDAY, DECEMBER 3, 1974

title: BROOKLYN MAN HELD IN EXWIFE'S SLAYING
description: A Brooklyn man was arrested yesterday and charged with strangling his former wife whose body was found Sunday night in a vacant lot in Rockaway, Queens.

title: OilShale Investment Estimated for Colorado
description: DENVER, Dec. 2 (UPI)The United States Bureau of Mines said today it would take an Initial capital investment or more than $522million to build an oilshale mining and retorting plant capable of producing 100,000 barrels of oil a day in Colorado.

title: Refiners Cut Sugar by 5c, First Drop in 20 Months
description: The first price reduction in sugar, 41.20 months was announced yeterday by the of the nation's largest refiners. The price action shaved the price of sugar, which has been the most volatile food product this year, by about 5 cents a pound.

title: W. L. Gulick Is Appointed Dean of Hamilton College
description: CLINTON, N.Y., Dec. 2 (AP) Hamilton College announced today that W. Lawrence Gulick, chairman of the Dartmouth College Psychology Department, had been named dean of the New York school.

title: GANG MEMBERON BAIL IN SUBWAY ROBBERY
description: One of the 11 teenage gang members accused of staging a twomonth robbery spree of city subway token booths had been free on bail awalting trial on charges of robbing a booth that he was accused on Sunday of holding up again.

title: ANITA BRENNER, WROTE ON EXICO
description: MEXICO CITY, Dec. 2 (AP) Anita Brenner, a journalist and author of several books on Mexico, was killed yesterday in an auto accident about 300 miles north of here. She was 69 years old.

title: Sonics Turn Back Kings by 110106
description: OMAHA, Dec. 2 (UPI) Fred Brown scored 5 of his 23 points in the last three minutes tonight to help the Seattle Supersonics outlast the Kansas CityOmaha Kings in a 110106 National Basketball Association triumph.

title: Mills Derided in Congress Over Link to Stripper
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2Representative Wilbur D. Mills, who had been widely regarded as the most powerful single member of Congress, today was the object of derision and scorn among his colleagues because of his relations with a striptease dancer.

title: Woman Ousted by Amin Reportedly Under Guard
description: LONDON, Dec. 2 (Reuters)Elizabeth Bagaaya, the former Uganda Foreign Winker, has been questioned by the police in Uganda where she is under house arrest but no charges have been brought against her, according to reports reaching London from Kampala.

title: Vocational Schools Attack Regulatory Proposal
description: Representatives of the State Education Department and of the private vocational iodustry joined yesterday in attacking the Federal Trade Commission's proposal to regulate the industry.

title: TEXAS CITY FACES RELOCATION PLAN
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Dec. 2Under an Army Corps of Engineers proposal, 1,550 residents of Baytown, Tex., would be relocated from a flood plain in the Houston suburb.

title: New Knicks, Old Knack, Same Coach
description: Dave DeBusschere, Willis Reed, Jerry Ludas and Dean Meminger are gone, but the Knicks have a better record now than at this time a year ago. They have surprised the fads who have stayed away and those preseason prognosticators who said the team's chances. for a National Basketball Association playoff berth were slim.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Jersey Bell Seeks Rate Increase

title: Ford Adviser Favors Tax Cuts If Economy Needs a Stimulus
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 Alan Greenspan, chairman of President Ford's Council of Economic Advisers, said tonight that if stimulus for the economy became necessary to head off rising unemployment, the stimulus should take the form of tax cuts rather than larger Government spending.

title: ARMY HEAD WARNS PRANCE OF UNREST
description: PARIS, Dec. 2  The Chief of Staff of the French Army has warned the Minister of Defense that if he does not improve morale and living conditions among the military, a revolt may be provoked.

title: Japan's Top Party Selects Takeo Miki To Succeed Tanaka
description: TOKYO, Dec. 2A senior member of Japan's Parliament, Takeo Miki, was selected today to become Premier. He will succeed the incumbent; Kakuel Tanaka, in about 10 days.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The police searched the Vineland area for one of two youths who escaped from the State Correctional Institution at Annandale last Friday.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: KENNEDY ASKS FUNDS TO PORTUGAL, AFRICA
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 (Reuters)  Senator Edward M. Kennedy said tonight that he would propose creation of a $50million United States loan fund to he divided equally between. Portugal and her African territories that are gaining independence.

title: South Koreans Fish Off U.S.
description: COOS BAY, Ore., Dec. 2 (AP)  The South Koreans have joined the nations fishing off the coast of the Pacific Northwest. The first known fishing boat from that nation to fish there, the Soo Cong 31, was boarded recently by the Coast Guard and the National Marine Fisheries Service 20 miles offshore from Coos Bay.

title: Ford Says Accord Gives A Basis for Cut in Arms
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2President Ford made public tonight the details of a tentative agreement on arms control that he and Leonid I. Brezhnev had reached in Vladivostok. He said the accord put a firm ceiting on the arm race and created a solid basis for future arms reductions. [Opening statement, page 28.]

title: Inmates and Guards Lament the Imminent End of the Tombs
description: At the Tombs, through whose gates at least a halfmillion accused men have passed since 1941, inmates and guards are already talking of the venerable prison in the past tense.

title: West Side Highwar
description: New York's disorderly but democratic planning processes, marked equally by vision and paranoia, sometimes produce surprisingly good results. The latest issue that has struggled to a notably improved solution is the controversial rebuilding of the West Side Highway.

title: Mates an Guards Lament the Imminent End of the Wombs
description: At the Tombs, through whose gates at least a halfmillion accused, men have passed since 1941, inmates and guards are already talking Of the venerable prison in the past tense.

title: Benefit Tennis Scheduled
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 2 (AP)The 1975 World Cup tennis competition between the United States and Australia will be held March 6 to 9 at the new Hartford Civic Center. Proceeds will benefit the Cystic Fibrosis Foundation, the charity adopted by the Association of Tennis Professionals.

title: Baltimore Hospitals Struck
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 2 (UPI)About 2,500 nonprofessional employes of three major hospitals went on strike today after a weekend of negotiations failed to produce agreement on, a new contract. Maintenance and service workers set up, picket lines outside the Johns Hopkins Hospital, Maryland General Hospital and the Center before the start of the 7 A.M. shift.

title: City Turns Down Move to Arbitrate Issue of Police Pay
