description: The city has rejected a recommendation by Arvid. Anderson, chairman of the Office of Collective Bargaining, that an impasse panel be created to make a binding decision in the city's pay parity dispute with the Patrolmen's Benevolent Association.

title: USE OF MARIJUANA DECRIED BY SAXBE
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Dec. 2 (UPI)  Attorney General William B. Saxbe said today there was growing evidence that marijuana is no harmless lollipop, and that legalizing its use would pose a health problem as well as a law enforcement problem.

title: Mortgage Rate Is Cut to 8.25% Under U.S. Conventional Plan
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 (UPI) James T. Lynn, the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development, reduced today interest rates from 8.5 per cent to 8,25 per cent in the Federal plan for conventional home mortgages.

title: Bubba Smith Suit For Injury Still On
description: TAMPA, Fla., Dec. 2 (AP) A Federal judge refused today to dismiss a $2.5million personal injury suit filed by the Oakland Raiders defensive end, Bubba Smith, against the Tampa Sports Authority and the National Football Lenge.

title: HOUSE DEMOCRATS END MILLS'S RULE OVER COMMITTEES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2The Democrats in the House of Representatives voted today to divest the Democrats on the Ways and Means Committee and the panel's chairman, Representative Wilbur. D. Mills of Arkansas, of the authority to make committee assignments for other Democrats.

title: L. I. Holdup Nets $5,000
description: CARLE PLACE, LI, Dec. 2 (UPI)Two masked holdup men escaped with $5,000 late tills morning from the Dover House Restaurant al 440 Old Country Road.

title: COAL PACT VOTING EXTENDED 2 DAYS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2The winter's first heavy snowstorm in the Appalachian coal fields forced the United. Mine Workers of America today to add two extra days far Membership balloting and to extend through Wednesday today's scheduled rankandfile voting on the coal industry's proposed contract.

title: '75 World Cup Slated
description: The 1975 World Cup golf matches will be played at the navatanee course in Bangkok, Thailand, Dec. 3 to 7, the International Golf Association announced yesterday.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: EDISON, Dec. 2With a lifetime batting average of .214, with only eight home runs in 10 years and with a major league total of 101 runs batted in, it seems surprising that Jeff Torborg, a former Westfield High and Rutgers University star, lasted seven seasons with the Los Angeles Dodgers and three more with the California Angels. He never hit more than .233 and hit only three triples in 10 years. But Torborg's strength never showed in the statistics columns. He could handle pitchers.

title: The Dance: Eliot Feld Back for a 5Week Season
description: The Eliot Feld Ballet is back for a fiveweek New York season, care of Joseph Papp and his Public Theater on Lafayette Street. On Sundday night the Feld opened shop at the Newman Theater with a program that, while not containing, anything new, seemed carefully calculated to show the company off at its best.

title: 450 Layoffs Are Planned By Offshore Power Systems
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 2 (Reuters)The Westinghouse Electric Corporation said today that Offshore Power Systems, its joint venture with Tenneco, Inc., would reduce operations at Jacksonville, Fla., and cut the work force to 250 from 700 by yearend.

title: Poland to Meet Only Half Of Sugar Export Contracts
description: WARSAW, Dec. 2 (Reuters) Poland has told Western countries that it meet only half of its sugar export contracts for 1974, diplomats said here today.

title: Planning Commission Finishing Proposal for South Richmond
description: The City Planning Commission is nearing completion of a proposal for the development of the South Richmond area of Staten Island, desived to preserve the rustic chartiller of the existing small towns and surrounding landscape in what has come to be called the city's last frontier.

title: Divorce Is Out, but Brazilians Break Up Anyway
description: RIO DE JANEIRODivorce Brazilian style  or legal separationis spreading and the reason generally given is the new economic independence of women.

title: LAJOS ZILAHY DEAD; WRITER OF NOVELS, 83
description: Lajos Zilahy, a novelist and playright, died Sunday night near Novi Sad, Yugoslavia, where he had been working on the filming of one of his stories. He was 83 years old and lived in Woonsocket, R. I.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: TRENTON, Dec. 2 (UPI)The New Jersey Racing Commission approved winter and spring thoroughbred meets at Garden State Park today, continuing the track's competition with. Pennsylvania's new Keystone Park in suburban Philadelphia. The commission chairman, Tom Connery, said Keystone should consider changing its schedule, which calls for thoroughbred racing through next Memorial Day. The competition has become known as the racing war since Garden State started winter racing for the first time this year and Keystone opened last month. The war has reduced attendance and revenues at both tracks.

title: PRESIDENT WARNS OF UNDUE ALARMS ABOUT ECONOMY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2President Ford said tonight that the nation now faced the triple challenges of inflation, recession and an energy crisis, but warned that our greatest danger today is to fall victim to the more exaggerated alarms that are being generated about the underlying health and strength of our economy.

title: Treasury Bills Rise At the Weekly Auction
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2Yields rose on Treasury bills auctioned today in both the 91day and 180day maturities.

title: New Knicks, Old Knack, Same Coach
description: Dave DeBusschere, Willis Reed, Jerry Lucas and Dean Meminger are gone, but the Knicks have a better record now than at this time a year ago. They have surprised the fads who have stayed away and those preseason prognosticators who said the team's chances for a National Basketball Association playoff berth were slim.

title: Seasoned Japanese Politician Takeo Miki
description: TOKYO, Dec. 2Takeo Miki, long a LiberalDemocratic leader and high Government official has frequently been a candidate for the Premiership but wasnever really taken seriously. Today, in a turnabout that he appears not to have expected, Mr. Miki found Man in the Newshimself designated as the next Premier.

title: Mills Derided in Congress Over Link to Stripper

title: Concert: Panufnik Work
description: We don't hear much of the music of Andrzej Panufnik in this country. He was born in Poland in 1914, established a reputation as a conductor and avantgarde composer, and then moved to Britain in 1954. He remained there. Last night in Avery Fisher Hall, the Philadelphia Orchestra played the Sinfonia Sacra by Panufnik, and there was a good deal to admire about the 22minute long work.

title: O'Dwyer Accuses Tunnel Contractors
description: City Council President Paul O'Dwyer accused contractors on the troubled Third Water Tunnel project yesterday of unfairly tarnishing the city's reputation for dealing with private companies in publicworks contracts.

title: North Sea Oil Cost Put at $15Billion
description: Some $15billion will have to be spent to lift production of oil from the North Sea to 3 million barrels a day by 1980, Cazenove & Co., the Britishbased investment banking house, said here yesterday.

title: Kuwait Daimler Buyer
description: The oilproducing Arab sheikdom of Kuwait was the mystery buyer that acquired last week about 14 per cent of DaimlerBenz, the West German maker of Mercedes automobiles, the Dresdner Bank disclosed. Page 57.

title: Bishop Spottswood Of N.A.A.C.P. Dies
description: Bishop Stephen Gill Spottswood, board chairman of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People and a retired spiritual leader of the African Methodist Episcopal Zion Church, died Sunday night of cancer at his home in Washington. He was 77 years old.

title: EUROPEANS AGREE ON REGIONAL FUND
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 2The last obstacle to the convening of a Common Market meeting in Paris next week fell today as the nine member countries agreed on the principles of a common fund to help economically backward regions in Europe.

description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 (Reuters)Roy L. Ash, Director of the Office of Management and Budget, said today it was likely that the jobless rate for November would act as a trigger for the Administration's $2.7billion public service employment program.

description: DENVER, Dec. 2 (UPI) The Great Western Corporation said today that it had appealed United States District Court Judge William Taylor Jr.'s denial of a preliminary injunction against the tender offer made by the sons of the late Texas billionaire H. L. Hunt.

description: The Red Badge of Courage, Stephen Crane's short novel about an 1863 battle in Civil War, has been fitted out for a television adaptation that, although it runs less than 90 minutes, seems interminable. It can be seen, or endured, tonight at 8:30 as part of something called an NBC Celebrates America series.

title: Colombia Is Facing Worst Economic Crisis in Years
description: BOGOTA, ColombiaWith sugar priced at 9 cents a pound, gasoline selling at 11 cents a gallon and minimum wages just raised 25 per cent, this country should by all current economic yardsticks be in an enviable position.

title: G.O.P. Governors Divided On Solutiong to Troubles
description: ST. LOUIS, Dec. 2The nation's Republican governors agreed today that they had fallen on hard times, but they could not agree on what to do about it.

description: NEWINGTON, Conn., Dec. 2 Post Office officials sifted through more than three tons of undelivered, charred, waterlogged mail today after firemen found it in the burning home of a young substitute mailman.

description: HELSINKI, Dec. 2 (AP)Mrs. Urho Kekkonen, wife of Finland's President, died of a heart attack today at the Helsinki University Hospital. She was 74 years old.

title: 2 Bombings Rock Ethiopia's Tense Capital
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Dec. 2Bombs exploded in Addis Ababa today, damaging the City Hall and a downtown hotel and reportedly injuring 13 persons. Later, gunfire and at least two handgrenade blasts were heard on a road in the eastern part of the city.

title: Democrats Face Disputes on Three Issues at Parley This Week
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2More than 2,000 Democrats Congressional figures, party officers and a great majority of untitled local party activistsw gather in Kansas City, Mo., this week in their first national convention without a Presidential nomination at stake.

title: SOVIET WILL SUPPLY A REACTOR TO EGYPT
description: LONDON, Dec. 2 (UPI)The Soviet Union has agreed to supply Egypt with a nuclear reactor, a Soviet publication said today. It is viewed as a step toward restoring close relations at the expense of the United States.

title: HIGH WINDS BUFFET AREA AFTER RAINS
description: High winds in the make of heavy rain walloped the soggy metropolitan area yesterday during the morning rush ho flooding highways, uprooting trees, disrupting rail lines and fraying the nerves of commuters returning to work for the first time in five days.

description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 2  The United States warned today that, until suitable alternatives were devised, the arrangements that have preserved peace on the Korean peninsula for more than 20 years should not be abandoned.

WORLD FUTURES IN SUGAR DECLINE

description: The Pan American Phoenix, known for years as an impeccable source for the finest in Mexican handcrafts, has moved from Lexington Avenue to elegant new quarters at 927 Madison Avenue between 73d and 74th Streets.

description: Texaco, Inc., announced yesterday a 1centagallon increase nationwide in its price for all grades, of tractor and diesel fuel, No. 1 and No. 2 heating, oils and kerosene to all classes of trade, effective last Friday.

description: NEWARK, Dec. 2About 2,000 striking faculty members at eight state colleges returned to their classrooms today as an impartial mediator, appointed last Thursday to help settle the labor dispute, set up a meeting for resumption of negotiations between the teachers and the state's Office of Employee Relations.

description: TOKYO, Dec. 2Takeo Miki, long a LiberalDemocratic leader and high Government official has frequently been a candidate for the Premiership but was never really taken seriously. Today, in a turnabout that he appears not to have expected, Mr. Miki found himself designated as the next Premier.

The Consul General of Spain, Alberto LopezHerce, presided over the official inaugural reception.

description: Paul Hellman, honorary chairman of B. Blumenthal & Co., Inc., button manufacturer, of which he was president from 1938 to 1968, died Sunday in Palm Beach, Fla., where he had a winter home. He was 81 years old and lived at 480 Park Avenue.

description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 President Ford, who has been experimenting with the format and location of White House news conferences, offered another variation tonight.

description: Louis L. Levine, State Industrial Commissioner, said yesterday that he had asked a Federal court for permission to continue financing until May 1 the controversial New York Plan, which expired over the weekend, to protect the 800 trainees currently enrolled.

title: G.M. WOULD BACK GASOLINE TAX RISE
description: Thomas A. Murphy, the new chairman of the General Motors Corporation, said yesterday that G.M. would support higher Federal gasoline taxes if the Ford Administration should decide they were necessary to reduce petroleum imports.

description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 Judge John J. Sirica strongly suggested today that he intended to let the Watergate coverup case go to the jury without waiting to get testimony, from former President Richard M. Nixon.

description: The partly decomposed body of a man about 20 years old was found floating in the Harlem River near the Henry Hudson Bridge yesterday morning.

title: Newcombe Mocking Connors For Dropping Out of Tourney
description: The Jimmy ConnorsJohn Newcombe controversy heated up yesterday, with the Australian accusing the American of ducking him by pulling out of the Commercial Union GrandPrik Masters tournament starting next Tuesday in Melbourne. Newcombe mocked Connor's excuse that he had a tooth problem. He's made other alibis, like a bellyache and a virus, at previous times, said the 30yearold Aussie, who, on comparative records, was supplanted this year by the 22yearold Connors as the world's No. 1 player.

title: Recording Devices. Found In Wreckage of T.W.A. Jet
description: Two recording devices that investigators hope will disclose the cause of the Trans World Airlines crash in which 92 persons died Sunday were recovered yesterday from the wreckage on a mountain: slope 23 miles west of Washington's Danes International Airport.

title: Weekly Truck Tonnage Up
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2The American Trucking Associations, Inc., reported intercity truck tonnage in the latest week ended Nov. 23 was 16.1 per cent above the corresponding week a year ago which included the Thanksgiving Day holiday. Based on a weekly survey of 35 metropolitan areas increased tonnage from a year ago was reported at 30 localities.

title: Projection of Budget Gap Defended by Goldin Aides
description: Aides to Controller Harrison J. Goldin who helped him draw up his estimate of a $650mil lion gap in the city's expense budget defended their procedures yesterday and said that they had erred at all, it was on the side of conservatism.

description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2The House Judiciary Committee has developed evidence contradicting Nelson A. Rockefeller's assertions that he was not privately told of the White House wiretapping and the secret operations in Chile before their newspaper disclosure, wellinformed sources said today.

description: MINEOLA, L.I., Dec. 2A Nassau County grand jury refused today to indict members of the County Police Department who searched the home of a Roosevelt pharmacist without a search warrant.

description: As the First major Amercan performing artists to appear onstage Havana since the United States and Cuba broke off relations in 1961, Cynthia Gregory and Ted Kivitt of American Ballet Theater, found themselves continuoualy followed by Cuban ballet fans.

description: MEXICO CITY, Dec. 2 (AP) The Government said Monday that Lucio Cabanas, Mexico's best known guerrilla leader, was killed in a mountain gun battle with Mexican soldiers.

title: No, Blacks Don't Have It Made
description: The national debate on the roles of race, ethnic heritage and sex in employment, academic admissions and job promotion is continuing without a letup. Whether or not we blacks have benefited from improper preferential treatment, many whites are convinced that we now have it made because of our color. The truth is that despite goals, quotas and affirmative action, we do not have it made.

description: The city's welfare rolls have taken the largest month's jump in nearly three yearsan increase of 12,750 persons in September over Augustand the first quarter of the fiscal year has shown a monthly rise ayeraging 2,136 persons.

description: LIMA, Peru, Dec. 2 (AP)Peru's Premier and two other men prominent in the military Government escaped assassination last night, the Interior Ministry announced today.

S. Kresge in staging preChristmas price promotions, Frank M. Tarman, chairman of Genesco, Inc., said at the annual meeting yesterday in Nashville.

description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 (UPI) In a significant retreat from earlier optimism, Transportation Secretary Claude S. Brinegar said today he was not sure a sevenpoint Government program could save Pan American World Airways from financial failure.

title: Why the Prisoners Are Looking to Federal Courts
description: In the nineteensixties, the United States Supreme Court set the tone for a revolution in criminal law procedure. In a series of landmark decisions, the court required state and local governments to furnish counsel to indigent persons accused of crimes. In the last few years, a marked, shift in this procedural revolution has taken place. The lower Federal courts, instead of the Supreme Court, have taken the lead in carving out new law. And rather than focusing on the legal rights of the accused, these courts have taken an increasingly active role in supervising state and local institutions Which house those who have not been convicted of a crime. By and large, state courts, which have shown less interest in such suits, have been bypassed. Also, Federal law has become more highly developed in this area.

title: U.S. RANKS EIGHTH IN FOOD INFLATION
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 (UPI) Food inflation in the United States this year has been worse than seven major nations surveyed recently but not so bad as seven others, the Agriculture Department said today.

title: Notes on People
description: The exodus of Nixon Administration holdovers from the Ford White House staff continued yesterday with the resignation of Dean Burch, counselor to the President on political affairs. Mr. Burch, who was chairman of the Federal Communications Commission before his appointment as counselor by Richard M. Nixon last March, will join the Washington firm of Pierson, Ball & Dowd, which specializes in communications law.

title: Judge Waives Jury Trial In L. I. Corruption Case
description: MINEOLA, L. I. Dec. 2 Family Court Judge Martin Ginsberg waived a jury trial today as his trial opened in County Court here. The 43yearold judge is charged with grand larceny by extortion, perjury and receiving a bribe, all allegedly committed while he was an Assemblyman in 1970 and 1971.

description: With Governor elect Hugh.L. Carey relaking quietly outside the city, the State Democratic Committee yesterday confirmed Its choice of Patrick J. Cunningham of the Bronx as the new state chairman.

title: Shuttle Service Bank
description: The Franklin Avenue rapidtransit shuttleon Which train derailed on. Sunday, causing injuries tO six personWent back into service on both tracks in Brouklyn at 3:45 A. M. yesterday.

title: Prisoner Found Hanged In Cell at Police Station
description: A 31yearold man arrested for allegedly creating a disturbance in a Harlem subway station Sunday night was found hanged early yesterday in a cell in a police station at 120 East 119th Street.

description: ROME, Dec. 2Premier Aldo Moro tonight outlined a broad economic program for his new Government aimed at fighting inflation and bolstering the nation's sagging economy.

description: A small New jersey Stockholder, relying largely on a general warning issued by a conmissioner of the Securities and Exchange Commission, filed suit here yesterday to block an offer by Carnwall Equities, Ltd., to buy back own stock at $4 a share.

description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2President Ford said tonight that the nation now faced the triple challenges of inflation, recession and an energy crisis, but warned that our greatest danger today is to fall victim to the more exaggerated alarms that are being generated about the underlying health and strength of our economy.

description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2A grim outlook for both unemployment and wage inflation emerged today from new economic studies published by the Brookings Institution.

description: TRENTON, Dec. 2 (AP)The State Supreme Court indicated today that a dispute over outofstate dumping of garbage in New Jersey might eventually have to be resolved by the Federal courts.

title: Second Thoughts
description: Specialists in the world of finance, in and out of Wall Street, were jolted last week when the House Rules Committee abruptly blocked final action on farreaching legislation to restructure the nation's stock exchanges along less monopolistic and anachronistic lines. It, seemed an inglorious end to three years of bipartisan effort, doubly galling when Rules Committee members argued that hasty action was inappropriate on a matter of such importance to business and investors.

description: WASHINGTONIt isn't easy to get rid of a used war.

title: Dave Anderson
description: The possibility, if not the probability, exists that Joe Namath will be on stage at Shea Stadium for the last time as a member of the New York Jets in Sunday's game with the Buffalo Bills. He is exercising the option clause in his $250,000 contract this season, meaning that on May 1 he can be a free agent. He could auction himself to another National Football League team, with the Jets demanding players and/or draft choices in compensation. He could auction himself to the World Football League, with the Jets getting zilch; He could enter the Monday night football TV booth. He could concentrate on being a motionpicture actor. He also could sign a new Jets' contract but he apparently is not inclined to return, at least not now. Asked if he had give much thought to the possibility of Sunday's game being his last here, he nodded.

title: Burlington Northern Outlay
description: Directors of Burlington North; ern, Inc., authorized yesterday a $243million capital expenditure program for, 1975. Louis W. Menk, chairman, said $235milion of the total would he for rail operations, with $7.9million earmarked for the company's Natural Resources division. Included in the overall program, is the start of work on a 116mile rail line to serve coal mines in the Wyoming Powder River Basin, and the completion of a new freight yard near the Twin Cities.

description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 2 (Reuters)A Federal safety panel said today that bad weather was increasingly to blame for fatal crashes of small planes.

title: Hunger vs. Responsibility
description: Another meeting in Rome last week on the world's shortterm hunger crisis has wound up in disappointment. Despite extended discussion of the issue at two previous meetings, all that seems to have come out the latest session was general agreement on the size the food gap and a fuzzier consensus that enough grain is available to feed the hungry nations. What has yet to be ascertained is who Is going to pay for the grain and for transporting it.

description: Former Representative Paul B. Dague, it Republican who represented Pennsylvania's Lancaster and Chester Counties from 1947 to 1967, died Monday in Downingtown (Pa) Hospital. He was 76 years old.

title: STOCKS DECLINE IN BRISK TRADING
description: The stock market turned in its third consecutive decline yesterday in accelerated trading, although a mild, midafternoon recovery recouped some of the earlier losses.

title: Vidata Program Recruited SchoolSystem Employes
description: A manpowertraining program headed by the Vidata International Corporation recruited employes of the Board of Education as paid staff members, according to a board supervisor who was paid about $3,500 by the program.

title: Congress Overrides Veto Of Veterans' Benefits Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3The House and the Senate, by overwhelming margins, voted today to override President Ford's veto of a bill providing for the largest increase since World War II in educational benefits for veterans.

title: CONFEREES FAVOR STRIP MINE CURBS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3  A SenateHouse conference committee cleared tonight, for probable final passage by Congress next week, a strong Federal law to curb the environmental abuses of strip or surface mining for coal.

title: PENN CENTRAL CITES LARGE OCTOBER LOSS
description: Trustees of the Penn Central Railroad reported yesterday that the huge bankrupt system had operated at a net loss in October of $5.4million and that its deficit in the first 10 months of this year reached $130.2million. In the 1973 month the net loss was $3.7million and for the first 10 months of 1973, a deficit of $135million was reported, after an extraordinary credit of $16.5million.

title: High School Drug Pushers Arrested in Los Angeles
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 3 (UPI) More than 100 youthful drug pushers were rounded up today by police officers after a twomonth investigation of narcotics sales in the city's high schools.

title: Criticism of Mills Grows Among His Constituents
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., Dec. 3 A new political storm has erupted in his home state in the wake of Representative Wilbur D. Mills's latest escapade with his nightclub strippen friend.

title: Senator Is Sought As Chief of A.B.A.
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Dec. 3 (AP)A Louisville businessman John Y. Brown Jr., said that several American franchises were interested in having Senator Marlow Cook, Republican of Kentucky, become the next commissioner of the league.

title: Questions and Answers: Owning Gold
description: Question: When will I be able to buy gold?

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
People and Business
description: With preliminary data pointing to a decline of 4 to 5 per cent in the real gross national product in the current quarter, James L. Pate, Assistant Secretary of Commerce for Economic Affairs, said yesterday that the present United States recession may be the longest since World War II.

title: YOUNGER MEN GAIN IN JAPANESE PARTY
description: TOKYO, Dec. 3The restless young lions of Japan's governing LiberalDemocratic party have mounted their first open challenge to The party elders and have emerged with enhanced influence.

title: Buckley and Pell Move to Revise Law on Right to School Records
description: Senators James L. Buckley and Claiborne Pell announced yesterday that they would jointly propose next week legislation to amend controversial sections of a new law giving parents and students the right to examine school records. Among other things, the proposed changes would guarantee the confidentiality of existing letters of recommendation, permit students to waive the right to see selected documents and restrict the right of students to see parents' financial statements.

title: Music Society, Composers Unit Play at Carnegie
description: The United League of Composers and the International Society for Contemporary Music, United States section, opened this season's series of five concerts at Carnegie Recital Hall Monday night with a rather less hardline program than one might have anticipated.

title: Spurring the Arms Race
description: President Ford now has confirmed that the Vladivostok agreement on strategic offensive nuclear arms legitimizes a further buildup, quantitative and qualitative, by both sides.

title: Arabs Back French Plan for Oil Parley
description: KUWAIT, Dec. 3France has now obtained the support of Middle Eastern oilproducing countries for her plans for an international conference of oilexporting and oilconsuming nations, according to French officials here.

title: Laver Still Going After One Title
description: Just when it seemed as if Rod Laver had exhausted his goals in bigtime tennis, he suddenly. is finding fresh challenges lobbed teasingly toward him.

title: Griffin Wins Heisman Poll
description: Archie Griffin of Ohio State, currently the most famous of seven footballplaying brothers from Columbus, Ohio, became the 40th winner the annual Heisman Trophy yesterday as the outstanding college football player in the nation.

title: Harold Ross, Sea Expert, Surgeon and Researcher, 91
description: HAWTHORNE, N.J., Dec. 3 (AP)Dr. Harold L. Ross of Hawthorne, an expert on marine biology who helped make the undersea movie 20,000 Leagues Under The Sea in 1915, died today in Fort Lauderdale, Fla. He was 91 years old.

title: DR. MELISSA RICHTER, EDUCATOR, DIES AT 54
description: Dr. Melissa Lewiss Richter, a specialist in adult and continuing education, died Thursday of cancer at her home in Providence, R.I. she was 54 years old.

title: Coalition Sues to Prevent New L.I. Sewage Plants
description: The Environmental Defense Fund, a national coalition of lawyers and scientists, filed suit in Federal District Court in Brooklyn yesterday in an attempt to block the building of new sewage plants on Long Island on the ground that such plants could have disastrous effects on the island's freshwater supply.

title: Spain's Political Reforms Given a Chilly Reception
description: MADRID, Dec. 3The Government's announcement last night of limited freedom of political association dropped like a dud today on the Spanish political world in one of the most notable anticlimaxes in this country's recent history.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: As a chemist, I applaud your Nov. 17 editorial urging President Ford to reestablish the lines of communication with the scientific community that were cut by the Nixon Administration for political reasons.

title: People in Sports
description: Joe Caldwell, a 10year vetteran of professional basketball, was suspended indefinitely yesterday by the spirits of St. Louis for activities deterimental to the best interest of professional sports.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Vasa K. Bracher, 92, Dies; Retired Real Estate Broker
description: Vasa K. Bracher, a retired real estate broker and longtime resident of Dongan Hills, S.I., died Monday in Carolton House, a nursing home in Fairfield, Conn. He was 92 years old.

title: CAREY KILLS HOPE FOR MORE CITY AID
description: Governorelect Hugh L. Carey said yesterday that the city should be on notice that there isn't any new source of state aid in prospect to help ease the budget problems Mayor Beame has been emphasizing.

title: WIDE APPEAL URGED BY G.O.P. GOVERNOR
description: ST. LOUIS, Dec. 3Gov. Christopher S. Bond of Missouri, the incoming chairman of the Republican Governors Association, warned his colleagues today that the cure for their party's ills did not lie in binding ourselves to some narrow ideology that denies the constructive role of government in our society.

title: FENCING Collegos
description: GYMNASTICS Collegos

title: Prices of World Sugar Futures And Silver Contracts Decline
description: Sharp price declines in world sugar futures contracts and silver contracts mirrored news events yesterday. In Paris the sugar exchange closed because of a lack of buyers. In Washington Secretary of the Treasury William E. Simon disclosed plan to auction gold, a development that discouraged both gold and silver traders.

title: CONFEREES FAVOR STRIP MINE CURBS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3  A SenateHouse conference committee cleared tonight, for probable final passage by Congress next week, a strong Federal law to curb the environmental abuses of strip or surface mining for coal.

title: FED EASES CREDIT A LITTLE FURTHER
description: Against a background of turbulence in the, money and capital markets yesterday, the Federal Reserve apparently began the delicate process of easing credit another notch. The central bank permitted Fed funds to trade below 9 per centthe low end of its recent intervention band for this critical shortterm ratewithout taking any action for its own account.

title: Inventory Buildup Slowed in October
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3The buildup of manufacturers' inventories slowed in October from the rapid pace of the preceding six months, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: But Fiscal Year Hits Peak
Boom Comes to Bolivian Area Where Che Guevara Died
description: SANTA CRUZ, Bolivia, Nov. 27  The clanging of rising metal shutters on the store fronts signaled the end of the leisurely lunch break. Businessmen and ranchers filled the treeshaded street cafes. Indians reopened their small sidewalk stands under a bright, subtropical sun. And the usual procession of trucks heavily laden with sugar cane churned the dust around the central plaza.

title: CIVILIAN INDICTED IN FT. DIX DEATH
description: NEWARK, Dec. 3A Federal grand jury today indicted a 26 yearold civilian for involuntary manslaughter in the death of his companion following an incident involving them and a group of Army trainees at Fort Dix last July 8.

title: Solzhenitsyn Puts Back Parts of SelfCensored Works
description: ZURICH, Switzerland, Dec. 1Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn came downstairs from his writing room in a faded, blue plaid lumberjack shirt, its tails hanging over loosefitting slacks, his hair flying, s his beard full. He was taking a break from writing, and he exuded energy and activity.

title: WESTCHESTER FIGHT ON BUDGET TRIMS
description: WHITE PLAINS, Dec. 3The Westchester County budget became the focus of angry charges today after Republican leaders on the Board of Legislators moved to restore a sexcrime squad and county extension services, including 4H Clubs, to the budget.

title: ROCKEFELLER STOCK IS SPREAD WIDELY
description: The stock holdings of the Rockefellers as disclosed yesterday give support to the Vice Presidentdesignate's repeated insistence that his family does not exercise control over major American companies or industries.

title: Cy Twombly, ExCoach For Washington and Lee
description: LEXINGTON, Va., Dec, 3 (AP) E. Parker (Cy) Twombly, former athletic director and golf and swimming coach at Washington and Lee University, died. today at a Savannah, Ga., hospital. He was 77 years old.

title: Bucks Beat Braves for 4th in Row
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 3 (UPI) Buffalo's Bob McAdoo outdueled Kareem AbdulJabbar, 3736, but the Milwaukee Bucks blunted the Braves' fourthquarter challenge to stop the Atlantic Division leaders, 110101, tonight for their fourth straight National Basketball Association victory.

title: The Ford Program
description: President Ford is trying to buck up business and public confidence on the state of the economy. Times are nowhere near desperate enough, he said at his news conference this week, to paraphrase President F. D. Roosevelt's great rallying cry that the only thing we have to fear is fear itself. Still, it is a good thing to remember.

title: Morristown Crafts Sale Proves Brisk
description: MORRISTOWN, Dec. 3Business was brisk today at the 40th Annual Woman's National Farm and Garden Association's Friendship Market and Craft Sale in the Governor Morris Inn here.

title: Lawsuit Weighed By Steinbrenner
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec, 3A lawsuit that could test or topple the legal structure of baseball was being considered today by the attorneys for George Steinbrenner, the principal owner of the New York Yankees.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: Sunday horse racing, apopular new method of increasing parimutuel tax revenue, is expected to be introduced next year at Belmont Park and Saratoga.

title: Oil From the Wells of China
description: PARISThe only great country that gains factually, not just relatively, from the international oil crisis is China. The superpowers, America and Russia, are sufficiently supplied with resources to survive the energy shortage intact if careful; but other major countries such as Japan, India and the European Community have all been severely hit.

title: Sabres Win, 4 for Martin; Blues Trounce Seals, 51
description: LANDOVER, Md., Dec. 3 (UPI)Dick Martin pumped in four goals tonight, pacing the Buffalo Sabres to a 5.3 victory over the Washington Capitals in the National Hockey League.

title: Article 6  No Title
description: Frank (Pancho) Martin, the 48yearold Cubanborn trainer, who only last Thursday set a New York record for saddling throughbred winners in one year, was suspended for 60 days by Aqueduct's stewards yesterday.

title: Vermont Calls for Studies On Canadian Dam's Impact
description: BURLINGTON, Vt., Dec. 3 (AP)The State of Vermont joined New York today in calling for more environmental studies before a decision was made on construction of a flood control dam on the Richelieu River near St. Jean, Quebec.

title: PARIS IN IRAQ DEAL; DENIES LOAN REPORT
description: PARIS, Dec. 3The French Government announced today that France and Iraq had agreed on a series of business deals worth $1billion, but it denied reports published yesterday that Iraq had granted France a $1billion loan.

title: Fellner Wants Tax Cut Applied To Business and Capital Gains
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3Any tax reduction to stimulate the economy should apply to corporation taxes and capital gains taxes as well as to the regular individual income tax, a member of President Ford's Council of Economic Advisers said today.

title: Beame Bars Proposal On Scofflaw Amnesty
description: Mayor Beame rejected yesterday a recent proposal by City, Councilman Matthew J. Troy Jr. for a scofflaw amnesty period, contending that the program would be counterproductive and encourage motorists to break the law.

title: Wedding Held for Jody Johnson
description: Jody Johnson was married here last evening to Morton Alan Rutherfurd, a descendant of Peter Stuyvesant and a greatgrandson of Levi P. Morton, Vice President under President Benjamin Harrison and later Governor of New York.

title: Business RecordsBANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGSSOUTHERN DISTRICT
description: Tuesday, Dec, 3, 1974

title: A FIGHT IS LOOMING AT HCA MARTIN, INC.
description: A fight for control of HCA Martin, Inc., is shaping up according to information filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission and the New York Stock Exchange. S. H. Scheuer, a private investor who has acquired almost 400,000 shares of the company, has notified management that he and Julius Hermes, executive vice president of the company, will seek a special stockholders meeting for the purpose of removing Bernard Klebanow as president and chief executive officer, and Jesse Ratner as vice president of administration and finance and treasurer.

title: Bridge:
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Dec. 3The second stage of a most unusual double was completed in the early hours of this morning here at the American Contract Bridge League's Fall National Championships.

title: ROCKEFELLER AIDE LISTS $1BILLION AS FAMILY WORTH
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3The 84 members of the Rockefeller family are worth more than $1billion in securities owned outright and in trusts from which they benefit, the House Judiciary Committee was told today by the family's senior financial adviser.

title: Slalom Stars Facing Uphill Ski Cup Battle
description: VAL D'ISERE, France, Dec. 3  The World Cup skiing season opens tomorrow in this Alpine resort village. Although most of last season's major winners are still racing, a change in the scoring rules has given an advantage to the allround skier, one who competes in the downhill as well as the slalom and giant slalom events.

title: Four Found Dead in Car
description: BEAVER FALLS, Pa., Dec. 3 (UPI)A mother and her three young children were found dead yesterday in the charred wreckage of their automobile stranded in deep snow along State Highway 251. The victims were Mrs. Sharon Cook, 24 years old? of Beaver Falls, and her children, Carl Jr., 6, Fred, 4, and Silvia, 2. ed to stabilize the fare.

title: Notes on People
description: John Sherman Cooper, the former Senator from Kentucky, arrived in East Berlin yesterday to take up his duties as the first United States Ambassador to East Germany. He was thus the last envoy from the Big Four powers of World War 11 to assume his duties in the Communistcontrolled German state. Last Sept. 4 the United States became the 111th country to recognize East Germany, which has been a state for a quarter of a century.

title: Spending on Food in Nation Rises to 16.9% of Income
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 (AP)Government statistics show that Americans are spending a greater percentage of their income on food than they did in recent years.

title: BALLOT AIDE SCORED ON ROLE IN RECOUNT
description: CONCORD, N. H., Dec. 3 (UPI)  Senatorelect John A. Durkin, Democrat of New Hampshire, accused a member of the Ballot Law Commission hearing an appeal of his victory with a conflict of interest.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Dec. 3 (UPI)Delmonica Hanover, a 5yearold mare owned during the racing season Delvin Miller of Meadow Lands, Pa., and Arnold Hanger of Lexington, Ky., has been voted the 1974 harness horse of the year. The selection was made in balloting conducted by the United States Trotting Association in conjunction with the United States Harness Writers Association. Delmonica Hanover received 48 votes. Armbro Nesbit was second with 32, followed by Handle With Care with 30, Armbro Omaha with 22 and Dream of Glory with 20.

title: Brewers Get Farmer
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 3 (AP)The Philadelphia Phillies sent Ed Farmer, a pitche who was on their Toledo roster, to the Milwaukee Brewers today for a minor league infielder  outfielder, Steve McCartney. Farmer had a 21 wonlost record with an 8.42 earned run average for the Phils last season. McCartney hit .266 with 32 homers for Sacramento of the Pacific, Coast League.

title: AllMale As You Like It Opens Drably
description: What went wrong with Clifford Williams's allmale production of Shakespeare's As You Like It, which opened somewhat drably last night at the Mark Hellinger Theater, following a sixmonth crosscountry tour? It is a good question. When Mr. Williams first staged his production seven years ago for Britain's National Theater it was a resounding success. But the company at the Mark Hellinger is not Britain's National Theater; indeed, so far as I know only one actor, playing a minor role, has ever appeared with the National Theater. That could be the first mistake.

title: Haldeman Rebuts Prosecution on Meaning of the Tapes
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3  In the face of a long and openly skeptical crossexamination by the Watergate prosecution, H. R. Haldeman sought repeatedly today to rebut the inferences that the prosecution has drawn from the White House tape recordings.

title: An Actress Goes on Tour To Raise Women's Sights
description: Mario Thomas, who looks like a sprite and talks like a waterfall, has taken on a new activity, all in the cause of feminism.

title: Realities of Cyprus Cloud Talks Outlook
description: ATHENS, Dec. 3After two clays of talks, Greek and Greek Cypriote leaders announced on Sunday that they had agreed to follow a common line toward Cyprus. In public, the leaders have stressed their satisfaction with the meeting and their unity in any future negotiations with the Turkish side. But in private, participants in the talks acknowledge that the common line covers only broad policy areas and leaves many important questions unresolved.

title: Occidental Files a Lawsuit to Prevent Acquisition by Standard Oil of Indiana
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 (UPI) The Occidental Petroleum Corporation filed suit today to prevent its acquisition by the Standard Oil Company of Indiana. It was also disclosed in Congressional testimony here by Armand Hammer, Occidental chairman, that Arab interests had bought several million shares of Occidental stock two weeks before Indiana Standard tried to acquire Occidental on Nov. 15.

title: ROCKEFLLER AIDE LISTS $1BILLION AS FAIRY WORTH
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3The 84 members of the Rockefeller family are worth mere than $1bilion in securities owned outright and in trusts from which they benefit, the House Judiciary Committee was told today by the family's senior financial adviser.

title: Arkansan Once Held Vast Power in House
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3On Jan. 7, 1958, Wilbur Daigh Mills became chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee and one of the most powerful men in Congress. Today he was in Bethesda Naval Medical Center, his health uncertain, his personal life the subject of rude jokes and his power slipping from his hands.

title: City Cuts Financial Assistance For Encounter, Inc., Drug Unit
description: Jerome Homblass, Commis sinner of the city's Addiction Services Agency, has notified Encounter, Inc., a controversia rehabilitation organization for drug users and other troubled teenagers, that he has adopted a recommendation to cut off its funds.

title: Guide GOING OUT
description: SHARP BURR a new Off Off Broadway play by Charles Hallett, a teacher at Pordham University, titled Aaron Burr is splendid theater. With Burr as an independent, uncompromising dependent, the playwright has arranged a series of tight, interlocking scenes evoking the political deadlock that brought Jefferson the Presidency and kindled Burr's pride into a murderous ?age at Hamilton. As the play fades on raised dueling pistols, Nathaniel Pendleton, a stanch Federalist, speaks the last line: We'll see that history remembers Burr only as he murderer of Hamilton. This is not a pretty play but it rings true grippingly and, yes, historically. Richard Harden has beautifully directed the firstrate cast, including Charles Herrick as Burr, Edward Seamon as Hamilton, John Wylie as Jefferon, Edwin Byrd as Pendieton, Edward W. Powell Jr. as William Van Ness and Vanderlyn, the painter.

title: NEWCONSTRUCTION VIRTUALLY BARRED IN CAPITAL BUDGET
description: What is called the most stringent capital construction budget in New York City's history was proposed yesterday, and although the $1.79billion total is the city's third highest, only $5.1million is proposed for new major construction.

title: 2 Arraigned in Kidnapping
description: PRESQUE ISLE, Me., Dec. 3 (AP)  Two persons were arraigned today in District Court on charges of kidnapping a 62yearold Massachusetts businessman as he was driving to his mother's home on Thanksgiving Day. Ronald G. Valente, 25 years old, of Haverhill, Mass., and an unidentified juvenile were arraigned.

title: NiceGuy Leadership
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3President Ford's latest press conference is an almost perfect illustration of his struggle with himself in his new job. Confronted by devilish economic problems, he tried to say the American people should take the inflation, the recession and the energy crisis seriously, but not too seriously. It was hard time, he suggested, and they shouldn't go fishing or go crazy. They should be sensible. They should sacrifice, but a big tax on gas, now supported by Henry Ford and General Motors, was probably too much.

title: For Children, It's Nutcracker Time in New York
A NEW RED DRIVE IN VIETNAM SEEN
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 3  Documents that have come into the hands of South Vietnamese military intelligence indicate that the North Vietnamese and their Vietcong allies are planning to step up their attacks significantly in the imminent dry season.

title: SOVIET SAID TO GIVE ARABS ATOM PLEDGE
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 4Four Arab countries have received assurances from the Soviet Union that it will provide them with nuclear devices if it is proved that Israel possesses atomic weapons, according to Arab diplomatic sources hare.

title: Israeli Says Egypt Agreed to Permit Her Cargo in Canal
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 3 (AP)Israel's Foreign Minister said today that Egypt had given a secret commitment to let cargo bound for Israel pass through the Suez Canal once the waterway is reopened.

title: Nine City Workers Cited for Outstanding Service
description: Every army has its decoration dayan occasion for recognition, when officers and rank 'n file soldiers are summoned forward to be cited for extraordinary acts that may serve as inspiration for others.

title: Ford Criticized on FoodStamp Plan
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3Two leading Senate proponents of Federal food aid programs assailed today a proposal by President Ford to reduce the benefits of food stamps by raising their costs to poor recipients.

title: Debate on Investing Grows
description: Banks and brokerage houses across the country are gearing up for the sale of gold bars to their customers, even as a growing controversy swirls around the advisability of such purchases by private investors.

title: Swiss Move to Cut Their Contribution To UNESCO 10%
description: GENEVA, Dec. 3The Swiss Senate voted today to cut by 10 per cent the country's annual contribution to the budget of the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization as a protest against the agency's treatment of Israel.

title: Planes Fly Despite Strike
description: DALLAS, Dec. 3 (UPI)Texas International Airlines managed today to keep about half its scheduled flights going despite a threedayold walkout by the Airline Employes Union. The union members, who include ticket agents, reservation clerks, secretaries and other clerical workers, struck Sunday when contract talks broke down.

title: RABBI M. J. GOLINKIN
description: WORCESTER, Mass., Dec. (AP) Mordecai J. Golinkin, senior rabbi of the Orthodox community in Worcester, died today at the age of 90.

title: Cards Sell Scheinblum
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 3 (AP)The St. Louis Cardinals sold an outfielder, Richie Scheinblum, to Hiroshima Carp of the Japanese Central League tonight.

title: C.A.B. Grants KLM a Stay In Dispute Over Flights
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 (AP) The United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia granted KLM Royal Dutch Airlines today a sevenday stay in its dispute with the Civil Aeronautics Board despite the C.A.B.'s argument that no such stay was needed.

title: Mrs. Hamilton Fish Sr. Is Dead; Wile of Former Representative
description: Mrs. Hamilton Fish, wife of Hamilton Fish Sr., former Republican Representative from Orange County, N. Y., died yesterday at New York Hospital. She was in her sixties and lived at 655 Park Avenue.

title: Cards Retain Ken Boyer
description: ST. LOUIS, Dec. 3 (UPI)The St. Louis Cardinals anflounced today a reshuffling of their farm system maagers, but Ken Boyer, a forer major league third baseman, was retained as head of their AAA farm club at Tulsa.

title: STATE AUSTERM EVOKES CONCERN
description: TRENTON, Dec. 3  More than 1,200 New Jerseya turned out for a mass meeting here today to express their co cern over possible reductions state aid for human service as a result of the projected budget austerity faced by the State Department of Institutions and Agencies.

title: GAMBLER ADMITS HE BRIBED POLICE
description: WHITE PLAINS, Dec. 3Carmine Tripodi, a convicted gambler, testified in County Court today that he had been bribing Mount Vernon police officers for years to protect his illegal activities.

title: ARTHUR VORWALD, PATHOLOGIST, DIES
description: Dr. Arthur I Vorwald, a specialist in occupational medicine and respiratory diseases, died Friday in Green Bay, Wis. He was 70 years old.

title: A Major House Reform
description: The new Democratic caucus in the House of Ripresentatives has a major achievement to its credit a month before the 94th Congress is even to convene. The party that will be overwhelmingly in control of the House has voted to break the power of the Ways and Means Committeea bastion almost as formidable as the old Rules Committee in the days of Howard W. Smith.

title: NEW CONSTRUCTION VIRTUALLY BARRED IN CAPITAL BUDGET
description: What is called the most stringent capital construction budget in New York City's history was proposed yesterday, and although the $1.79billion total is the city's third highest, only $5.1million is proposed for new major construction.

title: A Disenchanted Reformer Backs Return to the Pols
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Dec. 3Representative James G. O'Hara of Michigan, a disenchanted founder of the charter movement in the Democratic party, said today that the power to nominate Presidential candidates should be returned to the pols.

title: SLAIN GUERRILLA BURIED IN MEXICO
description: ATOYAC, Mexico, Dec.3 (AP) Lucio Cabaas, Mexico's slain guerrilla leader, was buried without ceremony in the Atoyac municipal cemetery, Gov. Israel Nogueda Otera of Guerrero state said today.

title: Sidney M. Jourard, 48, Psychologist and Author
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla., Dec. 3 (AP)Dr. Sidney M. Jourard, humanistic psychologist and author of The Transparent Self, was killed yesterday when his car fell on him as he was working on it at his home. He was 48 years old.

title: About New York
description: Fanne Foxe tripped and hurt her knee, and last night she canceled her engagement in New York. Miss Foxe said she was canceling because her knee hurt, although a friend said it was because of Wilbur Mills. The chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee went into a hospital yesterday, and this, the friend said, upset Miss Foxe.

title: Dolphins Back to Super Style
description: MIAMI, Dec. 3The record goal of three Super Bowl victories in a row now seems plausible for the Miami team. The Dolphins, who by their own admission respond only to challenges, indicated last night they were ready for the playoff route to Super Bowl IX, to be played in New Orleans on Jan. 12, when they crushed an allegedly good Cincinnati team, 243, In the Orange Bowl. It was less a contest than an exhibition of how to play the game in the Shula style.

title: Big Deals: McGraw to Phils, Allen to Braves, Lee May to Orioles
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 3Baseball's trading market began to boom today when some of the fanciest salaries in the game changed sides. Tug McGraw; the sloganeering relief pitcher of the New York Mets, went to the Philadelphia Phillies; Dick Allen, the highestpaid man in major league history, to the Atlanta Braves, and Lee May, one of the home run heroes of the National League, to the Baltimore Orioles.

title: Chicago Mayoral Bid Barred
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 3 (AP)Representative Ralph H. Metcalfe, Democrat of Illinois, spiked reports today that he might accede to appeals by black community leaders that he run for Mayor next year. Mr. Metcalfe, who has had ties with Mayor Richard J. Daley, who is expected to seek a ninth term, said that he had considered campaigning for the post, but that necessary financial backing did not materialize.

title: Exhibit Spotlights Stage Women
description: Curtain Call, an exhibition of paintings, posters, sculptures Ind costumes focusing on the great women of the New York stage, opened yesterday at the Museum of the City of New York to the delight of the old and the curiosity of the young.

title: News. Summary and Index WEDNESDAY, DECEMBER 4, 1974 The Major Events of the Day
description: Britain's Defense Secretary announced plans in Parliament yesterday to cut defense spending by reducing manpower, ending new programs, closing bases and bringing troops home from Southeast Asia. Forces on Cyprus would be reduced as well as most of those in Singapore and some in Hong Kong. The agreement with South Africa on using the Simonstown naval base would be ended. The proposals would leave intact the 55,000man force assigned to West Germany under the North Atlantic Treaty Organization. The Secretary, Roy Mason, estimated that the cuts would save about $700million next year. Britain's present defense spending is about $8.6billion a year. [Page 1, Cols. 23.]

title: MERGER COMBINES PEUGEOT, CITROEN
description: PARIS, Dec. 3A major reorganization of the French automobile industry involving two mergers of major companies was announced here today by the Government.

title: 2 HARLEM WOMEN SLAIN IN BUILDING
description: A 55yearold Harlem woman and her 19yearold niece were stabbed to death in the hallway outside their apartment after the younger woman opened their door to an earlymorning caller yesterday.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: FRANKLIN LAKES, Dec. 3The lyrics of an old song proclaim that It's a long, long time from May to December. For the members of the undefeated Ramapo Regional girls tennis team it seems even longer from December May to wait for a championship.

title: PRICEFIXING DANGER IS NOTED BY SAXBE
description: COLUMBUS, Dec. 3 (UPI)Attorney General William B. Saxbe said today that terrorist bombings and illegal pricefixing were crimes that a democratic society must eliminate to survive.

title: New Lottery Applicable To Clover Club Tickets
description: TRENTON, Dec. 3With the state's new weekly lottery scheduled to have its first drawing on Thursday, Charles C. Carrella, executive director of the lottery, has announced that the 243,000 members of the New Jersey Lottery Clover Club, who hold individual subscription numbers for either six weeks, 12 weeks, or one year, are eligible to play the new weekly game without obtaining new membership cards.

title: Restatement Is Due
description: A 21 per cent increase in thirdquarter sales and sharp gains in thirdquarter and ninemonth earnings were reported yesterday by the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation.

title: GOLD PRICES DROP ON U.S. SALE PLAN
description: LONDON, Dec. 3  The disclosure that the United States Government plans to sell 2 million ounces of gold in January, prompted a sharp decline in the metal today on the European bullion markets.

title: A Greenhouse for Growing Your Vegetables for a Year
description: One day recently anyone looking for the Roast Beef Room at the Hotel Roosevelt might have felt lost. That's because the name was changed to the Vegetable Factory while a home greenhouse being marketed under that name was introduced at a luncheon featuring eggplant parmigiana, spinachandmushroom salad and glazed carrots.

title: Britain Will Cut Forces; Pullbacks in Asia Planned
description: LONDON, Dec. 3The British Government announced plans today to cut defense spending by reducing military manpower, ending new programs, dosing bases and bringing forces home from Singapore and Hong Kong.

title: Earnings at British Petroleum Climb in Quarter and 9 Months
description: The British Petroleum Company, smallest of the world's seven major international oil companies, announced yesterday a 22 per cent increase in profits, to $221million, or 67 cents a share, for the third quarter of 1974, up from $181million, or 49 cents a share, for the 1973 period.

title: Stock Bill Blocked In House Unit Again
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3The House Rules Committee refused again today to permit consideration during the current session of Congress of an omnibus bill to restructure the securities industry, end price fixing by stock exchanges and strengthen the regulatory powers of the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: CITY AIDE DENIES ERROR ON TUNNEL
description: The chairman of the city's board of Water Supply yesterday denied charges by contractors digging the Third Water Tunnel that the board had given misleading information on suosurrace rock conditions and therefore was responsible for cost overruns that have threatened to halt work on the project.

title: P.S.C. Aide Urges New System For Con Edison Electric Rates
description: A state examiner yesterday recommended changes in the electricrate structure for the Consolidated Edison Company that would increase bills for residential customers and ease charges on commercial and industrial users.

title: Wilson Flies to Paris and Meets Giscard
description: PARIS, Dec. 3Prime Minister Wilson of Britain flew here tonight to confer with President Valry Giscard d'Estaing in an attempt to smooth prospects for the meeting next week of leaders of European Common Market countries.

title: Talking Chimpanzee Asks For Names of Things Now
description: ATLANTALana, a chimpanzee who has learned enough of a modified English to converse with people through a computerized keyboard, has made significant progress toward a more sophisticated use of language since her earlier achievements were reported on this page six months ago.

title: Thornburg Rides 2,000th Winner at 42
description: CHERRY HILL, N.J., Dec. 3 (AP)Buck Thornburg rode the 2,000th winner of his career by sending a long shot, Marybelle York, to the winner's circle in the fifth race at Garden State Park and then notched No. 2,001 in the sixth with Umiga's Worth.

title: Debate on Investing Grows
description: Banks and brokerage houses across the country are gearing up for the sale of gold bars to their customers, even as a growing controversy swirls around:the advisability of such purchases by private investors.

title: Lebanese Oust Abie Nathan
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec. 3 (AP)Abie S. Nathan, the Israeli selfstyled peace seeker, arrived today in Beirut from Paris, was arrested several hours later and deported. Mr. Nathan told the police he came to Lebanon as part of his eightyear campaign for ArabIsraeli reconciliation.

title: Building Contracts Fall 18% From October of 73
description: Contracts in October for future construction totaling $7.2billion dropped 18 per cent below the level of October, 1973, the F. W. Dodge division of the McGrawHill Information Systems Company reported yesterday. The seasonally adjusted Dodge index, with 1967 as 100, fell to 148 in October from 187 in September and 191 in October of 1973.

title: Capital Loss
description: The city's broadening fiscal crisis took on a shocking although not altogether surprising new dimension yesterday when the Planning Commission unveiled a $1.79billion proposed new capital budget which contains only $5.1 million for new construction. That compares with $104 million in the current year and $405 million three years ago.

title: PALESTINIAN AID INCREASED BY US
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 3The United States today announced an increase in its contribution to the United Nations agency that takes care of, Palestinian refugees.

title: Excerpts From Dilworth's Testimony Before Panel
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 Following are excerpts from the testimony today of J. Richardson Dilworth, general manager of Rockefeller Family & Associates. Mr. Dilworth testified before the House Judiciary Committee about how finances of the 84 members of the Rockefeller family are handled.

title: DENMARK'S PREMIER ASKS AUSTERITY PLAN
description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark, Dec. 3 (AP)Premier Pout Harding's minority Government asked Parliament today to approve an austerity plan that would ban all wage increases next year and freeze all dividends and profits.

title: New Jersey G.I. Facing Trial in Beard Protest
description: BERLIN, Dec. 3 (AP)The United States Army today made public the names of two Berlin Brigade soldiers facing a courtmartial in connection with a protest involving a fellow soldier who refused to shave off his beard.

title: Suspect in $4Million Theft Freed on $25,000 Bond
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 3 (UPI)The alleged mastermind of the $4.3million Armored Express Company vault burglarythe largest United States cash theft in historywas released today on $25,000 bond.

title: Arkansan Once Held Vast Power in House
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3On Jan. 7, 1958, Wilbur Daigh Mills became chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee and one of the most powerful men in Congress. Today he was in Bethesda Naval Medical Center, his health uncertain, his personal life the subject of rude jokes and his power slipping from his hands.

title: DILLARDS, EDWARDS SHARE MUSICAL BILL
description: The Dillards, a group of long standing, are an example of folkies who have adopted and adapted to the challenge of electricity. An amplified banjo may not be a thing of esthetic beauty but it does the job, cutting through the front line at the Dillards' opening at the Bottom Line on Monday.

title: Business Briefs
description: PORTAUPRINCE, Haiti, Dec. 3 (Reuters)The Reynolds Mining Corporation has agreed, after three months of negotiations, to pay increased levies on its operations in Haiti. The Government would receive more than $11million a year as a result of the readjustment of royalties and taxes paid by the subsidiary of the Reynolds Metals Company, compared with an average revenue of $1.8million up to now, President JeanClaude Duvalier announced yesterday.

title: Soviet Astronauts Feel Well; Adjust LifeSupport Equipment
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 3Two Soviet astronauts orbiting the earth for the second day adjusted the life support system of their Soyuz 16 spacecraft today to rehearse for the joint SovietAmerican space rendezvous planned next July.

title: Lambs Mark Birthday With Cala to Save Club
description: More than 300 club members, celebrities and other friends of The Lambs turned out for a fundraising gala last night to help celebrate the theatrical club's 100th birthday and to prevent it from sinking under a $350,000 mortgage.

title: COMMODORE HERSEY
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Dec. 3Commodore Mark Leslie Hersey, U.S.N., retired, who graduated from the United States Naval Academy in 1909, died at his home here today. He was 86 years old.

title: Jet Lands at Wrong Field
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Dec. 3 (UPI)A Frontier Airlines 737 jetliner with 102 persons aboard accidentally landed last night at a small landing field used mainly by private planes. The flight landed safely at Salt Lake Airport No. 2, which has a runway of only 5,600 feet, compared with one of 10,000 feet at Salt Lake International, where it was supposed to land. The Federal Aviation Administration said the main runways at both airports were numbered 34.

title: REPLY IS AWAITED ON NURSING HOMES
description: Bernard Bergman, the centre figure in a spreading investigation of the nursinghome industry, is believed to have left the city without telling the Temporary State Commission on Living Costs whether he will testify voluntarily at its hear ings later this month.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: Underwrters headed by Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith, Inc., offered yesterday 4 million common shares of the Union Electric company at $9.375 a share. The utility said it would use proceeds to retire in part shortterm debt incurred in connection with its construction program.

title: New Guinea Cult Chief Disappoints the Faithful
description: PORT MORESBY, New Guinea, Wednesday, Dec. 4 (Reuters)Hundreds of disappointed PapuaNew Guinea tribesmen began returning home toddy after a threeday expedition to see the announced crucifixion of their cult leader.

title: Cards Retain Ken Boyer
description: ST. LOUIS, Dec. 3 (UPI) The St. Louis Cardinals announced today a reshuffling, of their farm system managers, but Ken Boyer, a forer major league third baseman, was retained as head of their AAA farm club at Tulsa.

title: U.S. ASKED TO EASE ROADWORK RULES
description: NEWARK, Dec. 3Officials of the State Department of Transportation and the construction trades unions met in Washington today with the New Jersey Congressional delegation to lobby for changes in environmental rules governing highway construction  rules that the union leaders contend are key contributors to high unemployment rates among their members.

title: Advertising
description: A marketer can figure he has got a pretty hot new product entry when the competition starts to copy it.

title: Prices Drop in Europe
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3Secretary of the Treasury William E. Simon announced today that the Treasury would sell at auction two million ounces of its goldworth about $360million at current world market priceson Jan. 6, a few days after Americans are legally permitted to own gold bullion beginning Dec. 31.

title: W.F.L. Bowl: They'll Play For Pride
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Dec. 3 (AP)Players for the Birmingham Americans said today they were disenchanted and dissatisfied, but that they would relent and play in World Bowl I against the Florida Blazers on Thursday night.

title: Texas Instruments, Inc. Is Sued by Bowmar
description: The Bowmar Instrument Corporation said yesterday that it had begun legal proceedings in the Federal Court for the Northern District of Indiana in Fort Wayne, alleging violations of the Sherman and Clayton antitrust acts by Texas Instruments, Inc.

title: DEMOCRATS ACT
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3Representative Wilbur D. Mills entered a hospital today soon after House Democrats voted to redlice further his vast power and began steps to remove him as chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee.

title: Civilian Indicted in Death Of Companion at Fort Dix
description: NEWARK, Dec. 3A Federal grand jury today indicted a 26yearold civilian for involuntary manslaughter in the death of his companion following an incident involving them and a group of Army trainees at Fort Dix last July 8.

title: Miki Formally Named Head of Japan Party
description: TOKYO, Wednesday, Dec. 4 (AP)The ruling Liberal Democratic party this morning formally elected Takeo Miki party president and, in effect, Japan's new Premier.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: The Theater Development Fund, has acquired a wideranging collection of costumes that are being made available to; educational and nonprofit performingarts groups at nominal rates. The 48,000 theatrical costumes are for rent on a slidingprice scale that is geared to the groups' number of performances and to the seating capacity of their auditoriums.

title: PRICES OFF AGAIN ON AMEX AND OTC
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market dropped again yesterday as traders were discouraged by a prolonging of the coal strike, the recent upturn in shortterm interest rates and other factors.

title: Relief Rolls Held Steady Upstate As Those in City Rose by 11,000
description: Upstate welfare rolls have been holding steady while New York City's have started moving up again, the State Department of Social Services reported yesterday.

title: F.D.A. CITES CONCERN ON ANTIPERSPIRANTS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 (UPI) Aerosol antiperspirant sprays containing zirconium may cause lung disease and probably are not much better at fighting odor than sprays without the chemical, according to a government report.

title: Five Tables on Investments by Family
Whalers Defeated 3d Time in Row
description: DETROIT, Dec. 3 (AP)Jerry Zrymiak's first goal of the season, on a rinklong dash in the third period, enabled the Michigan Stags to send the Eastern Divisionleading New England Whalers to their third straight World Hockey Association loss last night, 21.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The City Council approved a bill yesterday that would give the city more effective powers to recover $17.5million owed by landlords for emergency repairs to their buildings repairs that were paid for by the city. The Council, acting on a message of necessity from Mayor Beame, passed the bill 38 to 0. The Mayor will sign the bill within 10 days.

title: McAuliffe to Manage
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 3 (AP)Dick McAuliffe, an infielder who retired at the end of last season, was named today manager of Bristol, the Boston Red Sox farm club in the Eastern League. McAuliffe, 35 years old, spent, last season with the Red Sox after 13 years with Detroit.

title: Getting the Biggest Bang for the Buck...
description: Following is a list of some civilian and military tradeoffs adapted from the book The Permanent War Economy. The author is professor of industrial engineering at Columbia University and national cochairman of SANE.

title: New Books
description: Fiction

title: White House Frustration With Congress Reported
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3The White House, reacting to accusations that President Ford was not adequately dealing with economic problems, intensified its attack on Congress today for not having acted on Mr. Ford's economic proposals.

title: Rockefeller Says State Checked Against Bugging at 1968 Parley
description: A spokesman for former Governor Nelson A. Rockefeller confirmed yesterday that the state police had used electronic devices to protect Mr. Rockefeller from being bugged at the 1968 Republican National Convention in Miami Beach.

title: British Football
description: ENGLISH LEAGUE CUP

title: AT GARDEN, 7:35 P.M.
description: RADIO WNEW, 7:30 P.M.

title: Britain Will Cut Forces; Pullbacks in Asia Planned
description: LONDON, Dec. 3The British Government announced plans today to cut defense spending by reducing military manpower, ending new programs, closing bases and bringing forces home from Singa pore and Hong Kong.

title: Starrett in $500Million Condominium Deal in Iran
description: A leading New York building company disclosed here yesterday that it had signed a contract with Iranian banking interests to acquire land in Iran for the construction of an estimated $500million of highrise condominiums.

title: Fed Is Seeking Tighter Controls Over Foreign Banks in the U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 (AP)  The Federal Reserve Board asked Congress today to require licensing for foreign hanks operating in the United States and also to place them under the same federal regulations that apply to United States banks.

title: Romantic Works Dazzlingly Done By Abbey Simon
description: Abbey Simon returned to Carnegie Hall on Monday night with a characteristic program of largescale Romantic pieces: Franck's Prelude, Chorale and Fugue; Brahms's F minor Sonata and the 12 Etudes in Chopin's Opus 10. His extraordinary virtuosity undiminished and his interpretative powers deepened, the pianist seems to be, at 53 years old, at the height of his career.

title: Bugner Winner In Second Round
description: LONDON, Dec. 3 (UPI)With Muhammad Ali at ringside looking him over as possible opponent, Joe Bugner, the European heavyweight champion, stopped Alberto Santiago Lovell of Argentina tonight in the second round of a scheduled 10round bout.

title: Pioneer Leaves Jupiter's Dragon, Next Stop Is Saturn
description: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif., Dec. 3Pioneer 11, having flown into the jaws of the fiery dragon, as one of space agency official put it, licked its wounds this morning and made new closein observations as it soared over, Jupiter's northern hemisphere and headed for Saturn.

title: QUEENS LANDLORD KILLED IN HOLDUP
description: A Queens landlord was shot to death and his brother was wounded shortly before noon yesterday in an attempted holdup of the renting office in the Dexter Apartments, 14725 88th Avenue, Jamaica. The slain man, 56yearold Samuel Janowitz, was shot in the head during a struggle with a man in his late twenties who, with a woman of about the same age, had entered the building ostensibly to look at apartments. During the struggle, Mr. Janow itz's older brother, Solomon 60, was shot in the chest before the couple, frightened by the screams of a woman secretary, fled emptyhanded in a waiting auto.

title: Contractor Is Fined $1,000 For Gift to Nixon Campaign
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3The former president of an electrical contracting company pleaded guilty today to making an illegal corporate contribution of $5,000 to President Nixon's 1972 reelection campaign and was fined $1,000.

title: Ethical Society Seeks to Abandon Landmark Status
description: The Society for Ethical Culture moved in State Supreme Court yesterday to end the landmark designation of its 65yearold meetinghouse here by the Landmarks Preservation Commission.

title: Municipal Group Seeks Policy of Urban Conservation to Save American Cities
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 3Members of the National League of Cities are preparing to adopt, and lobby for, a new national urban policy based on the theme that survival for America's cities depends on a sweeping Federal and local commitment to make better use of existing urban resources.

title: PAUL COZE
description: Paul Coze, Frenchborn painter and writer, died in Phoenix, Ariz., Monday, at the age of 71.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given In Eastern Standard Time

title: CONDITION IS SET ON RAIL MERGER
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3The Interstate Commerce Commission said today it would condition its approval of the Union Pacific Railroad's acquisiton of the Chicago, Rock Island & Pacific Railroad on a requirement that Brown Brothers Harriman & Co. of New York become a party to the merger application.

title: McAuliffe to Manage
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 3 (AP)Dick McAuliffe, an infielder who retired at the end of last season, was named today manager of Bristol, the Boston Red Sox farm club in the Eastern League. McAuliffe, 35 years old, spent last season with the Red Sox after 13 years with Detroit.

title: HE IS EXHAUSTED
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3Representative Wilbur D. Mills entered a hospital today soon after House Democrats voted to reduce further his vast power and began steps to remove him as chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: Frank (Pancho) Martin, the 48yearold Cubanborn trainer, who only last Thursday set a New York record for saddling throughbred winners in one year, was suspended for 60 days by Aqueduct's stewards yesterday.

title: Prices Drop in Europe
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3Secretary of the Treasury William E. Simon announced today that the Treasury would sell at auction two million ounces of its goldworth about $360million at current world market priceson Jan. 6, a few days after Americans are legally permitted to own gold bullion beginning Dec. 31.

title: Sunrise in Concrete
description: To his credit, Governorelect Carey has dealt a potentially lethal blow to the illconceived project of extending Long Island's Sunrise Highway from Shinnecock Hills Amagansett. Mr. Carey has declared himself dead set against the planned addition to the expressway, a throwback to the days of highway mania.

title: Oil Prices Reduced By Amerada Hess; Newsprint Is Raised
description: The Amerada Hess Corporation said yesterday that it was cutting prices of its petroleum products in varying amounts, effective immediately. The company said the price cuts depended on grade and would average about 50 cents a barrel, or 1 cents a gallon. The greatest reductions will apply to low sulphur home heating oils and industrial and utility fuels that are used widely in the Northwest.

title: Possible Data Bank Peril
