description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 (UPI) The Government admitted today that there could be leaks from a planned national data bank on child abusers unless states imposed standards on privacy and confidentiality. The Federal system will gather only statistics and not names or other identifying characteristics, said Frank Ferro, acting head of the Children's Bureau.

title: A New Jazz Room Is Setting for Rudd And His Trombone
description: For a dozen years or more Roswell Rudd has been an anomaly among the jazz avantgardists with whom he has usually played his trombone. Although he could contribute lustily to the tumult customarily stirred up by his avantgarde associates, he managed to do it while making use of the full range of jazz trombone developments, including basic New Orleans tailgate and the rich heritage of Jack Teagarden.

title: Amid More Freedom, Italian Women Also Turn to Monastic Life
description: ROMEJust when life outside the home is finally becoming accessible to Italian women, a surprising number appear to be turning their backs on hardwon jobs and professions to enter cloisters.

title: AIR QUALITY IS ISSUE AT CENTER
description: The city Environmental Protection Administration said yesterday that it had been unable to determine the potential effects on air quality of the convention center proposed for the West Side but that it would decide by the end of the month whether to issue a construction permit.

title: News Summary and Index WEDNESDAY, DECEMBER 4, 1974
description: Britain's Defense Secretary announced plans in Parliament yesterday to cut defense spending by reducing manpower, ending new programs, closing bases and bringing troops home from Southeast Asia. Forces On Cyprus would be reduced as well as most of those in Singapore and some in Hong Kong. The agreement with South Africa on using the Simonstown naval base would be ended. The proposals would leave intact the 55,000man force assigned to West Germany under the North Atlantic Treaty Organization. The Secretary, Roy Mason, estimated that the cuts would save about $700million next year. Britain's present defense spending is about $8.6billion a year. [Page 1, Cols. 23.]

title: Aides to Beame and Goldin Disagree at Budget Deficit Parley
description: Aides to the Mayor and to the Controller argued over their differing estimates of the size of the city's expense budget deficit yesterday, and after a twohour meeting agreed to disagree.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: Nine City Workers Cited for Outstanding Service
description: Every army has its decoration dayan occasion for recognition, when officers and rank 'n file soldiers are summoned forward to be cited for extraordinary acts that may serve as inspiration for others.

title: Laurence Wilson Displays A Warm Tone in Brahms
description: Laurence Wilson took on an allBrahms program in Alice Tully Hall on Monday night. The pianist, a faculty member at Manhattan Community College, seemed to have a definite affinity for at least one aspect of the composer's keyboard style in that his tone remained consistently warm, sonorous, musical and completely free of rhetorical bombast.

title: HOUSE ACTS TO KILL NIXON TAPES DEAL
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 (UPI) The House passed by voice vote today a measure that would nullify an agreement former President Richard M. Nixon made with a government agency giving him poss Nssion of his tares.

title: CON ED WOULD END GAS APPLICATIONS
description: The Consolidated Edison Company asked yesterday for state permission to stop taking new applications for naturalgas service after Jan. 15 because of severe cutbacks in supplies.

title: SAFETY UNIT ORDERS SEAT BELT REMINDER
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3The National Highway Traffic Safety Agency imposed today standards for a new seat belt reminder system to replace the unpopular interlock feature on new cars.

title: Theater: Drums at Yale
description: As is commonly known, at the age of 21 Nathan Hale was hanged as a spy by the British. With his supposed death words, I only regret that I have but one life to lose for my country, this potential footnote became a famous martyr.

title: Knicks Triumph, 100 to 95
description: Lakers was spelled out across the front of their uniforms, but there was an unfamiliar look to the Los Angeles Lakers, beaten last night by the Knicks, 10095, at Madison Square Garden.

title: Scouts Rescued in Tennessee
description: GATLINBURG, Tenn., Dec. 3 (UPI)Two explorer scouts missing since Sunday in the stormswept Great Smoky Mountains were lifted out by helicopter this afternoon and taken to the University of Tennessee Hospital at Knoxville for treatment of exposure.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The State Education Commissioner, Fred G. Burke, ordered a homosexual teacher to comply with an order the Paramus Board of Education and submit to a psychiatric evaluation.

title: Talking Chimpanzee Asps For Names of Things Now
description: ATLANTALana, a chimpanzee who has learned enough of a modified English to converse with people through a computerized keyboard, has made significant progress toward a more sophisticated use of language Since her earlier achievements were reported on this page six months ago.

title: Congress Approves Bill on Safely Water, With Hint of Veto
description: WASHINGTON,Dec. 3 (AP)Congress finished action today on a $156million bill designed to safeguard drinking water. The measure provides for establishing national minitnum water standards for the first time.

title: OFFICER KILLS MAN WIELDING TOY GUN
description: A 20yearold suspect in a car theft was fatally shot by a plainclothes police, officer last night after he allegedly pulled a toy gun when he was confronted by the officer in a stolen car.

title: Witness Links McCrane To Cahill Election Fraud
description: SCRANTON, Pa., Dec. 3Richard Smith, the former president of a New Jersey public relations company, testified in Federal Court today that in 1969 he sent out a number of false business invoices used to disguise thousands of dollars in campaign contributions as taxdeductible business expenses.

title: ...And the Dollar Value of Human Life
description: I asked my students whether or not a human life was worth at least $5. One student replied that the question was improper since no monetary value could be put on the priceless gift of life. Another student asked me to be more specific.

title: White House Tree Is Due
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 (AP) The White House Christmas tree is due to arrive Friday and be decorated over the weekend for the holiday season. It is 19foot tall fir that comes from Michigan.

title: IRT, BMT DELAYED BY POWER FAILURE
description: Tens of thousands of rushhour subway riders were delayed up to an hour yesterday afternoon when an explosion in a power substation crippled subway signal systems on some lines in downtown Manhattan.

title: DEFINING DEATH HELD DOCTOR ROLE
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Dec. (UPI)  The American Medical Association adopted a resolution today urging that physiciansnot legislatorsdecide when death occurs.

title: Red Smith
description: Jess Thompson, scout for the New York Jets, was clocking college football players in 40yard sprints when a slight youth looking on spoke up softly: Sir, I can beat any of them. Thompson was amused. You can, eh? Who are you? A player? Roscoe Word, the young man said. I am in high school. For the hell of it, Thompson timed him. He beat everybody. I tell people I'm cocky, Roscoe Word said yesterday, just cocky enough to believe in myself. In the National Football League nobody is afraid of anybody but you respect people. I respect the pass receivers. But if I set up right and read my keys right, I don't believe any receiver can beat me. He sat chatting softly in one of the meeting rooms in the Jets' training complex at Hofstra University, 163 pounds of polite confidence. He has grown in the five years since Thompson encountered him in Pine Bluff, Ark., but not much. Nevertheless, the rookie is a regular at cornerback, and on the rare occasions when a receiver beats him he wants to know why.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: Sunday horse racing, a popular new method of increasing parimutuel tax revenue, is expected to be introduced next year at Belmont Park and Saratoga.

title: Penn Six Beats Yale
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 3Penn broke out for four secondperiod goals and added three in the final period for an 8.2 hockey victory over Yale tonight.

title: CURBS ARE TIGHT FOR ADDIS ABABA
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, 3 (AP)Addis Ababa went into a virtual state of siege today as the military Government arrested eight more persons in the continuing hunt for terrorists setting off bombs in public buildings.

title: Dance: Portrait of Billy
description: The Alvin Ailey City Center Dance Theater is back with us again for another threeweek season, and last night at the City Center it presented a rather interesting company premiere.

title: Football Coach Resigns
DEMOCRATS SPLIT ON JERSEY TAXES
description: TRENTON, Dec. 3Efforts to forge a tax proposal to resolve New Jersey's fiscal crisis foundered again today when none of the proposed revenue components could gain conclusive support among the Democratic majority in the State Senate.

title: Barzilauskas Becoming Jumbo Jet on Defense
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Dec. 3 It was early in the Jets' game against Miami two weeks ago, and Bob Griese, the Dolphin quarterback, backpedaled as if to set up for a pass. But Joe Schmiesing, the Jets' right tackle, read the play correctly, and when Griese handed off to Larry Csonka, Schmiesing was ready to pounce.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: DEAN BACKS CURB ON TRADE SCHOOLS
description: Dr. James Hall, dean of adult and continuing education at York College in Queens, testified yesterday that the Federal Trade Commission's proposals for regulating private vocational schools were necessary to prevent the schools from taking advantage of unsophisticated students lured to the schools by misleading advertisements.

title: Fairleigh Beats Buffalo, 81 to 57
description: RUTHERFORD, N. J., Dec. 3 Rich Conrad, a 6foot2inch guard, scored 28 points tonight to lead Fairleigh Dickinson University to a 8157 triumph over the University of Buffalo. Steve Solop, a 68 sophomore center, scored 21 points and grabbed 16 rebounds for the Knights, who led, 4330, at the half.

title: DOMINICA IS FACING REBEL SHOWDOWN
description: ROSEAU, Dominica, Dec. 3 (UPI)  The tiny white community on this Caribbean island was given special protection today by policemen preparing for a showdown tomorrow with a black guerrilla organization called the Dreads.

title: Ford and Kissinger Press Trade Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3President Ford and Secretary of State Kissinger issued separate warnings today that a failure by Congress to adopt the Administration's trade bill could have disastrous consequences for the world economy.

title: Police Officer Kills a Bystander in Chinatown Melee
description: A policeman shot and killed one customer and wounded another in a Chinatown restaurant yesterday as, the police said, he tried to subdue eight alleged members of a youth gang.

title: Books of The Times In Love With Marvin Gardens
description: THE MONOPOLY BOOK. Strategy and Tactics of the World's Moat Popular Gains. 144 es. Illustrated. By Maxine Brady. McKay. $5.95.

title: LEON DENNEN
description: Leon Dennen, a special correspondent for the Newspaper Enterprise Association, and a specialist, on European affairs who Spoke 15 languages, died yesterday of acute leukemia at Mount Sinai Hospital. He was 66 years old and lived at 134 West Fourth Street.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: TENANTS GET PLAN ON NOHEAT POLICY
description: A group of state and local officeholders and tenants' organizations announced a program yesterday under which lawyers or legal advice would be provided free if necessary to tenants who withhold a day's rent this winter for each day their landlord does not provide heat or hot water.

title: FORMER CAHILL AIDE IS APPARENT SUICIDE
description: WASHINGTON CROSSING, Dec. 3 (UPI)Ira Grayson, top aide to former Gov. William T. Cahill, was found shot to death in his home today in what the state police said was an apparent suicide. Mr. Grayson was 47 years old.

title: Publisher Named Upstate
description: ROCHESTER, Dec. 3 (AP)Thomas P. Dolan has been promoted to chairman and publisher of the Westchester Rockland Newspapers, and Louis A. Weil 3d named president and general manager of the group. The promotions were announced today by Allen H. Neuharth, president and chief executive of the Gannett Company at corporate headquarters here.

title: WILLIAM N. ORMSBY
description: OSTERVILLE, Mass., Dec. (UPI)William N. Ormsby, member of the Brown University team that played Washington State in the first official Rose Bowl, died yesterday. He was 82 years old.

title: 21 Bus Strike Leaders Get Jail Terms in San Antonio
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex:, Dec. 4 (UPI)A state judge fined 21 nion leaders of a city bus strike $50 each today and sentenced them to jail terms for ig noring court orders to go back to work.

title: Israeli Paper Says Eban Met Twice With Hussein
description: It was the first firm indication in Israel that meetings had been held with King Hussein by Israeli officials.

title: Towers Charged Medicaid For Liquor, Car and Gifts
description: Liquor bills, parking fines, a college tuition fee, a new Chrysler and donations to political and religious organizations all have been entered in the books of the Towers Nursing Home and billed to Medisaid.

title: Artists in Soviet Rebuff Offer for a Show
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 9A group of Soviet artists who work outside officially approved styles has turned down an offer by the Moscow City Council to let them hold an indoor exhibition of their nonconformist works later this month, one of its organizers said today.

title: Theater: Rabe Revised
description: Joseph Papp as a producer lies many qualities, but the two most unusual are loyalty find grit. When he commits himself to a playwright it appears to be a total commitAnent. It is much the same with actors. Mr. Papp has a sense of company, a sense of a continuing institution. This is the vital, living aspect of the New York Shakespeare Festival, wherever that festiyal turns up, at the Public Theater on Lafayette Street, In Central Park or at Lincoln Center.

title: MiniEssays
description: Midterm Exam

title: Breaking the Nuclear Habit
description: WASHINGTONThe Atomic Energy Commission was abolished recently, and for good reason. We are are now nearly thirty years into the nuclear age, but still not near the point where we can safely harness the peaceful atom as a major substitute for oil.

title: ExpenseBudget Hearings Start Today
description: The long and painful process by which the city will arrive at an expense budget that could approach $13billion for the fiscal year 197576 will begin this morning, when officials of the New York Botanical Garden will appear before Budget Director Melvin N. Lechner to ask for more money to maintain its flower beds.

title: HOUSE DEMOCRATS VOTE TO WEAKEN SENIORITY SYSTEM
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4House Democrats further undercut today the conservativeoriented seniority system, bolstered the power of the Speaker and added to the sweeping reforms whose effect will be felt at the White House as well as on Capitol Hill.

title: Mail Ban to France Lifted But Delays Are Expected
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (AP) The Postal Service today lifted an embargo on mail to France that had been imposed as a result of a strike by French postal workers. The strike was settled last week.

title: ROCKEFELLER AIDE HELPED HOSPITAL
description: A top aide to Nelson A. Rockefeller when he was Governor intervened with the State Health Commissioner in 1972 to keep open a blackrun Queens hospital in the face of inspection reports detailing deteriorating health conditions, according to documents turned over to the House Judiciary Committee.

title: Christmas Tree Theft
description: NEVADA CITY, Calif., Dec. 4 (AP)A stack of 2,500 Christmas trees, baled for shipment to United States servicemen overseas, has been stolen. The trees were among 5,100 being readied for servicemen abroad through Operation Christmas, begun in 1967 by Douglas Alian, a Vietnam war veteran. He estimated their value at $17,500.

title: Walter E. Kelley, 88, Dies; Wrote Roar, Lion, Roar
description: Walter E. Kelley, who wrote the Columbia College football fight song, Roar, Lion, Roar, and built the Fleetwood Acres garden apartments in Yonkers, died of a heart attack yesterday morning at his home, 5251 Sycamore Avenue, in the Riverdale section of the Bronx. He was 88 years old.

title: MILLS PANEL TOLD TO BOW TO REFORM
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4With Representative Wilbur D. Mills hospitalized and effectively removed as chairman, the other Democrats on the House Ways and Means Committee discussed this morning what appeased on its face to be a plan to counter reform and lock themselves into influential positions.

title: A Quirky Quartet Confidently Played By Purcell Group
description: The Purcell String Quartet is oddly named, when you consider that the stringquartet littrature as we know it did not come Into existence until the 18th century, about a century after Henry Purcell flourished. Never mind that; the Purcell Quartet turns out to be solidly capable ensemble and its concert at Carnegie Recital Hall on Tuesday night upheld the honor of the name.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE TRIUMPH OF ART NOUVEAU: PARIS EXHIBITION 1900. By Philippe Jullian. Translated from the French by Stephen Hardman. 216 pages. Illustrated. Larousse. $19.95 until Dec. 25, 1974; $25 thereafter.

title: ALDO TRIPPINI
description: MADRID, Dec. 4 (UPI)Aldo Trippini, former bureau manager and regional executive for United Press International in Spain, died at his home here last night. He was 51 years old.

title: MOYERS STARTING PUBLICTV SERIES
description: Bill D. Moyers, who gave up his threeyearold public television series. Bill Moyers' Journal, last May after it had won three Emmy awards, is mounting a new series for the Public Broadcasting Service that will deal entirely with international affairs. Originating at WNET/13 here, the series will be scheduled Thursday nights at 8, beginning Jan. 16.

title: Dave Anderson
description: During the major league baseball meetings, the trades that are consummated are seldom as fascinating as those that aren't. The announcements are seldom as fascinating as the whispers. The most fascinating whisper for New York consumption today is that the Mets preferred to retain Jon Matlack, their almost lethal lefthanded pitcher, rather than swap him to the Oakland A's for Reggie Jackson, the proven slugger and storm center. In some corners, that whisper has an asteriskthe A's also demanded second baseman. But on an evenup basis, Matlack would be an appropriate ransom. Jackson would provide the Mets with a thunderclap hitter, a species they have never possessed. He would make the summer more pleasant and more productive for all the pitchers, including the one who moved into Matlack's turn in the rotation. But the mystique of the Mets often involves the blind devotion of their zealots. They deem it a sacrilege to trade any of the idols, even the tarnished idols. At the time of the whispers involving Matlack and Jackson, a zealot was asked if he approved.

title: Top Ford Advisers Concede Recession Has Accelerated
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4President Ford's chief economic advisers said today that the nation's slide into recession had accelerated recently but insisted that Administration policies would be able to restore stability over the long run.

title: BRITISH OUTLOOK IS FOUND GLOOMY
description: LONDON, Dec. 4Two of Britain's most respected ecomonde advisory organizations issued gloomy assessments of the national outlook today, suggesting that unemployment and inflation would continue to worsen in the months ahead.

title: Fordham Five Halts Yale, 7257
description: Darryl Brown scored 16 points in the first 10 minutes of the second half last night to help break open a close game as Fordham defeated Yale, 72 57, at the winner's Rose Hill gymnasium.

title: F.C.C. Refunds CATV Fees
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4The Federal Communications Commission said yesterday it was refunding $4million in fees collected from cable television concerns rather than try to recompute their bills under a Supreme Court order. In 1970, the F.C.C. adopted a fee schedule of 13 cents a subscriber, to be paid by cable systems by April 1 of each year as part of the commission's aim to be selfsupporting, but last March 4, the Supreme Court said the fee was a tax that could be imposed only by Congress.

title: Another Official From R.I.
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., Dec. 4 (UPI)New Jersey has lured away another top Rhode Island education official. He is Dr. Ralph H, Lataile, deputy assistant commissioner of education. He Will go to work for his former chief, Dr. Fred G. Burke, who is now New Jersey's Education Commissioner.

title: The. Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Consumer Notes Why Nutritional Labeling Is Delayed to Next June
description: In midNovember, the Food and Drug Administration put off until June 30, 1975, the effective date for the introduction of nutritional labeling on all food products for which nutritional claims are made. The delay was ordered primarily on the ground that the inflationary impact of the regulations had not been studied.

title: Personal Finance: Safeguards for Debtors Who Don't Pay Up
description: What happens when a debtor stops making payments for a purchase financed through a retailer, bank or finance company?

title: Seized Lobster Tails Are Sold for $453,300
description: BOSTON, Dec. 4 (AP)When the United States Custims Service seized 333,045 pounds of lobster tails more than two years ago, the shipment was worth $1.5million.

title: Two Ministers Threaten Suit Over Boys' Cooking Classes
description: The New Milford, Conn., school board scoffed yesterday at complaints that its policy of requiring sixthgrade boys to study home economics is leading to homosexuality and moral decay.

title: Heavy Rains in Los Angeles
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 4 (Reuters)  An overnight storm dropped up to two inches of rain in the Los Angeles area, causing mudslides, the evacuation of 75 homes and the collapse of roofs on five factories. No casualties were reported.

title: Eagle Has Surgery
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 4 (AP)The Philadelphia Eagles said today that a reserve running back, Tom Bailey, had undergone corrective knee surgery. He was placed on the injured reserve list and a tackle, Herb Dobbins, was added to the roster.

title: P.S.C. Bids Phone Company End FlatFee Intrastate WATS Plan
description: The State Public Service Commission yesterday ordered the New York Telephone Company to stop providing a flatrate intrastate Wide Area Telephone Servicethe WATS lines that let a customer make unlimited longdistance calls inside the state for a single charge.

title: Malaysia Protest Continues
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia, Dec. 4 (Reuters) The police lobbed tear gas today at 200 students protesting against inflation. A tight cordon was placed around the University of Malaya and policemen manned key points around the city to avert a repetition of yesterday's daylong clashes with about 5,000 student demonstrators, in which at least four riot policemen were injured and 1,135 youths were arrested.

title: Last of the Klamath Indians Collect $49Million for Tribal Lands
description: KLAMATH FALLS, Ore., Dec. 4Donald Schonchin, wearing a black cowboy hat, a quilted jacket and dark tinted glasses, was one of the first through the back door of the bank this morning, and he put his $103,000 into an account that he plans to use to buy cattle and land.

title: SOVIET ASTRONAUTS END DOCKING TESTS
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 4, (UPI)Two Soviet astronauts complated a series of docking tests aboard their Soyuz 16 spacecraft today and prepared for a fullscale dress rehearsal of next July's Soviet  American rendezvous in Space.

title: Clash Over Import Scandal Blocks Indian Upper House
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 4  The upper house of Parliament was abruptly adjourned today when Opposition leaders blocked the proceedings after they had tried unsuccessfully to get the Government to publish a report on what is known the importlicense scandal.

title: VINCENT J. BROSNAHAN
description: Vincent Joseph Brosnahan, who retired in 1970 as advertising sales manager of Sports Illustrated magazine, died yesterday in Baltimore. He was 62 years old and lived in Darien, Conn.

title: HELEN READ, CRITIC AND ART HISTORIAN
description: Helen Appleton Read, art critic and art historian, died Tuesday at her home. She was 87 years old and lived at 146 Hicks Street, Brooklyn.

title: Advertising
description: When Karen M. Kopsa, a 23yearold media coordinator at Peitscher, Janda Assoociates, Inc., a Chicago advertising agency, learned that she had won Esquire magazine's Christmas Gift Contest, she not only got the right to choose $2,500 worth of gifts but she also became an instant celebrity.

title: Laos Advisory Council Asks Recognition of Insurgents
description: LUANG PRABANG, Laos, Dec. 4 (AP)The National Political Council, the advisory arm of the coalition Government, met for the first time today and unanimously adopted a political program calling for recognition of the Vietcong in South Viet nam and the insurgents in cambodia.

title: Veto Record of Ford: 4 of 15 Are Overridden
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 President Ford, in office less than four months, now has the worst batting average in veto confrontations with Congress of any President in this century.

title: Notes on People
description: A small storm is brewing in Key Biscayne, Fla., over attempts by Richard M. Nixon and two of his millionaire friends to have the street on which they have bonles be made a private road. The former President, in a petition also signed by Charles G. Rebozo the banker, and Roped Abplanalp, the industrialist, maintain that unless the county makes Bay Lane a private road it will become glutted with tourists and the curious.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: BERGEN, Dec. 4Hours after the capacity crowd had filtered out of Bergenfield's stadium on Thanksgiving Day, coach Bob Taglieri sat in the quiet solitude of the hometeam dressing room in a state of soulsearching, attempting to discover where he had failed.

title: Altitude of 727 Worried Crewman Before Crash
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4A reconstruction of the events in the Sunday airliner crash in which 92 persons were killed shows that, just a few minutes before the plane hit, a crewman may have questioned whether the plane was flying too low.

title: Jet Carrying 191 Down
description: A charter plane carrying 182 Indonesian Moslems on a pilgrimage to Mecca and vine crew members crashed and burned near Colombo, Sri Lanka. Details on Page 15.

title: Unionism as Usual
description: Instead of proferring suggestions of their own for the city's fiscal survival, unions in the civil service seem to be vying with one another in devising ways to push this metropolis over the brink.

title: F.P.C. RAISES COST FOR NATURAL GAS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4In an effort to lift future production, the Federal Power Commission today fixed the uniform price of natural gas at 50 cents a thousand cubic feet, an increase of 8 cents.

title: Bernard Schmickrath, 61, Dies; Developer of Aircraft Engines
description: Bernard A. Schmickrath, former executive in the aviation engine industry, died Tuesday at Tucson Ariz., apparently of a heart attack. He was 61 years old.

title: Fordham Five Halts Yale, 7257
description: Darryl Brown scored 16 points in the first 10 minutes of the second half last night to help break open close game as Fordham defeated Yale, 7257, at the winner's Rose Hill gymnasium.

title: Chile Buys Railway Coaches
description: SANTIAGO, Chile (UPI)Chile has signed a contract with the FiatConcord firm of Argentina for purchase of 15 new railway coaches at a total price of $2million, The purchase is being made with part of a $100million credit extended to Chile by the Argentine Central Bank.

title: Film: Death and Devil
description: Occasionally, there's a movie that almost bestows a lifelong allergy to closeups. After watching the huge faces awash with repressed emotions or the great meaningless grins and mild scowls in Stephen Dwoskins's Death and Devil, you may never again want to see a mug that's larger than your own. The movie, which opened yesterday at the Whitney Museum of American Art and will run through Tuesday, is based on the play by Frank Wedekind (18641918). Aside from butchering the text, the director has achieved a style of camerawork that results in a riot of dullness.

title: Miss Drexel First In World Cup Ski
description: VAL D'ISERE, France, Dec. 4Wiltrud Drexel said she had an absolutely faultless race and Annemarie Proell Moser admitted she had made one mistake. As a result, Miss Drexel won the women's downhill race today as the World Cup skiing season opened and Miss Proell, the defending champion, finished seventh.

title: CONVERTER LINKED TO SUBWAY BLAST
description: The Transit Authority said yesterday that an explosion in a power substation that delayed thousands of homebound commuters Tuesday evening was caused by a failure in the insulation of a 59yearold rotary converter.

title: Mrs. Kuykendall Withdraws Nomination
description: TRENTON, Dec. 4 (AP)Penelope L. Kuykendall withdrew today as the Byrne administration's nominee to head the State Division on Women, ending an impasse that followed disclosures that she had written three bad checks.

title: Monitor to End on NBC Radio; Restyled Network Service Set
description: Monitor, the 20yearold weekend potpourri of news, entertainment and features, will be terminated in February for a new radio network service devoted primarily to news, information and sports, NBC Radio announced yesterday.

title: Making It in the World of Dogs
description: An allrounder in dogshow terminology is a judge eligible to rule on ali 120 breeds registered with the American Kennel Club. More profounaly, an all  roundermight be defined as one involved in brebling, exhibiting, judging and clubwork. Such a person isMrs. Muriel Freeman. For 17 years she been active with the Rottweiler breed in the United States. Three years ago she was invited to judge Rottweilers in Germany, the only American to have been afforded the honor.

title: Contract Talks to Resume With City Fire Dispatchers
description: John T. Burnell, the city's Director of Labor Relations, yesterday said that negotiators for the city and the Fire Alarm Dispatchers Division of Local 3 of the International Brotherhood A Electrical Workers were scheduled to continue their contract talks at 9:30 A. M. to morrow at his offices, 250 Broadway.

title: Jet Carrying 191 Down
description: A plane carrying 182 Indonesian Moslems to Mecca and nine crew members crashed and burned near Colombo, Sri Lanka. All aboard were presumed dead. Page 15.

title: 5th Ave. to Be Closed For Festival on Sunday
description: Fifth Avenue will be closed to vehicular traffic on Sun day from 34th to 57th Street for the annual Fifth Avenue holiday festival, which will bring roller skating, puppet shows, choral groups, ethnic dancers and music groups to the avenue.

title: The Special Delights of Vietnamese Cooking
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam If any dish was ultimately responsible for a visit that entailed several thousand miles of travel to South Vietnam, it was cha gio, considered by many to be the national dish of the country. It is pronounced zhahzhaw, and we first sampled it several years ago in a few of the flourishing Vietnamese restaurants of Paris.

title: MINERS' LEADERS CERTAIN OF VOTE APPROVING PACT
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4Leaders of the United Mine Workers will announce tomorrow that the coal miners' strike will end on Friday as a result of ratification of the industry's contract offer. About 55 per cent of the union members voting are expected to have approved the offer.

title: MELNIKOV IS DEAD; SOVIET ARCHITECT
description: Konstantin Melnikov, one of Russia's leading avantgarde architects, died in Moscow a week ago at the age of 84. Word of his death was received here yesterday.

title: Leafs Give Old Rookie A New Life in Hockey
description: Life has dealt a strange hand to Claire Alexander of the Toronto Maple Leafs, who last Monday became the oldest rookie In the National Hockey League. The 29yearold defenseman, who two years ago was a milkman playing senior hockey in Ontario, scored a goal in the premier game of his N.H.L. career against Washington. Tonight's contest against the New York Islanders at Nassau Coliseum, Uniondale, L.I., will be his third major league game.

title: SAIGON CONVOY LOST TO AMBUSH IN DELTA
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, Dec. 5 (AP)Communistled forces ambushed a South Vietnam Government military convoy in the Mekong Delta southwest of Saigon, killing 15 militiamen and wounding 45, military headquarters here reported today.

title: Mills Puzzles the Folks Back Home
description: KENSETT, Ark., Dec. 4This has been a hard year in White County.

title: Washington Dodge, Adviser On Investments, Dies at 67
description: Washington Dodge, an investment adviser who survived the Titanic sinking in 1912, died here Tuesday of a heart attack. His age was 67.

title: Music: A Serious Evening of Serkin
description: They used to say of Hans von Billow's recitals, last century, that everything about them was serious. The pianist was serious. The audience was serious. The instrument itself looked serious. In those respects, Rudolf Serkin, who played last night Carnegie Hall, evokes the quality of a Blowand, much later, a Schnabelrecital. He is a serious artist who plays serious programs, and if you don't like it, stay away. Enough, fortunately, like it to fill Carnegie Hall.

title: Hearings About Union's Funds End, but U.S. Plans an Inquiry
description: Hearings into questionable investments of pension and welfare funds of Amalgamated Union Local 355, allegedly involving persons with underworld ties, were closed yesterday by the State Commission of Investigation. But the union faces further investigation by the State Insurance Department and Federal authorities.

title: 1975 EASING SEEN IN BUSINESS SWINE
description: While purchasing executives throughout the country are predieting a further deterioration in business conditions, they expect the worst will be over by the middle of 1975. This was the consensus of a majority of executives surveyed last month by the National Association of Purchasing Management, Inc.

title: Gold Swindle Laid to Nevada Company
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4Court action to recover millions of dollars invested in an alleged Ponzitype gold coin and silver contract swindle was announced today by the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: Meadowlands Contractor Tells of a McCrane Offer
description: SCRANTON, Pa., Dec. 4 (AP) The chief contractor of the sports complex being built on the Hackensack Meadowlands testified today that his company had deducted from its corporate taxes $6,000 in contributions to William T. Cahill's 1969 gubernatorial campaign.

title: Business Briefs
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 4 (Reuters)The Belgian Government and the Belgian Banking Commission have approved a proposal to merge the Banque Lambert and the Banque de Bruxelles, S.A., sources close to the two banks said today. The sources said the merger would be announced officially tomorrow, with action to put it into effect starting Friday. Neither bank would confirm the merger but spokesmen for both said a joint press conference would held tomorrow afternoon.

title: Kelley Vows to Restrict Counterintelligence Acts
description: DURHAM, N. C. Dec. 4 (UPI) The director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, Clarence M. Kelley, says he will not direct the agency to conduct counterintelligence operations in domestic cases without consultation with Attorney General William B. Saxbe and President Ford.

title: Cabbie Offers Tip to Put Giants on the Right Road
description: Jack Miller has been listening to New York Giant fans grumble in the back of his caxi all season, searching for answers to the club's woes.

title: Licensing Is Studied
description: Attorney General Louis Lefkowitz is expected to announce today that he has prepared legislation to require licensing of most gold dealers doing business in New York State.

title: Garrett Is Still Firm on May Deadline
description: BOCA RATION, Fla., Dec. 4The Securities and Exchange Commission gave in slightly to the New York Stock Exchange here today on the future of the industry's pricing policy. But the commission reaffirmed that there was little likelihood it would back away from its firm position that stockbrokers must do away with fixed minimum commission fees by next May)

title: School Board in the Bronx Suspended in Fund Inquiry
description: Acting on evidence of fiscal mismanagement and payroll padding, School Chancellor Irving Anker yesterday suspended the elected community school board of District 9, in the Bronx, and placed the district under a centralboard trustee pending a complete investigation of the district's books and personnel records.

title: Leonard Bernstein Denies He Evaluated Henderson Library
description: Leonard Bernstein, the conductor and composer, testified yesterday that he had never evaluated a music library do. nated to the University of Wisconsin by Skitch Henderson, the musician charged with incometax evasion.

title: Advance in South Asia
description: With the decision to resume trade relations that was announced in New Delhi last week, India and Pakistan have taken a major stride along the path toward conciliation which they charted at Simla two and a half years ago. Although progress toward the normalization of relations between the two subcontinental rivals has been agonizingly slow, the trade pact offers convincing evidence that pragmatic leaders in New Delhi and Islamabad remain committed to ending nearly three decades of conflict between their two countries, climaxed by the bloody war over Bangladesh in late 1971.

title: News Summary and Index
description: THURSDAY, DECEMBER 5, 1974

title: Delaware, Penn State Are Feasting on Lambert Awards Luncheons
description: The annual DelawarePenn State football awards luncheon, known to some as the Lambert Awards luncheon, will be held today at the Roosevelt Hotel. Delaware will receive the, Lambert Cup for the 10th time as the best team in the East's Division II and Penn State will receive the Lambert Trophy for the 11th time as the best team in Division I.

title: Kansas City Jaycees Win An Injunction on Convention
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Dec. (AP)A Federal judge says the United States Jaycees entered into a private conspiracy with the Palm Springs, Calif., chapter to deprive the chapter here of the Ten Outstanding Young Men convention next month.

title: Wallace Posts Reward
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Dec. 4 (AP)Gov. George C. Wallace has posted a $1,000 reward for information leading to the arrest and conviction of the killer of a United Mine Workers official, Sam Littlefield of Bessemer, Ala. The official was killed on Nov. 15 in an apparent robbery attempt at a motel in Washington, D.C.

title: Kissinger, After Senate Briefing, Calls Criticism of Arms Accord Surprising
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4Secretary of State Kissinger said today that he was surprised by the criticism voiced in Washington of the tentative agreement on arms control recently reached in Vladivostok.

title: About 500 Production Workers Are Laid Off at G.T.E.Sylvania
description: SENECA FALLS, N. Y., Dec. 4 (UPI)About 500 production workers at the G.T.E.Sylvania plant here will be laid off indefinitely, starting Dec. 13, company officials have announced.

title: Latest Fad for Thieves Is the Stealing of Plants
description: SAN FRANCISCO (AP)San Francisco has produced a new type of criminalplantnappers.

title: Mills's Power: Why the Others Wanted Him to Have It
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4  In assessing the importance and the consequences of Wilbur D. Mines fall from power, the crucial point that was to be remembered is why he had the power In the first place. That he plainly wanted power and worked intelligently and hard (until just lately) to keep it, is only half or less than half the story.

title: H.L. Hunt Will Says Challengers Will Forfeit Rights to Benefits
description: DALLAS, Dec. 4 (AP)The will of H. L. Hunt, the Dallas oil billionaire, has been filed for probate, and one of its stipulations is that anyone who challenges it will forfeit all rights to benefits and property listed in the will.

title: 4 Die in Quebec Crash
description: SHERBROOKE, Que., Dec. 4 (AP)A bus and a truck collided headon today, killing tour persons and injuring 16, the police said.

title: Rangers Beat Wings, 42; Villemure Excels in Goal
description: For the benefit of those diehards who believe the only good hockey available in the National Hockey League is played by the original six establishment teams, forget it  those days are gone forever.

title: School Board in the Bronx Suspended in Fund Inquiry
description: Acting on evidence of fiscal mismanagement and payroll padding, School Chancellor Irving Anker yesterday suspended the elected community school board of District 9, in the Bronx, and placed the district under a centralboard trustee pending a complete investigation of the district's books and personnel records.

title: Korff Accuses White House Of Holding Letters to Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (AP)Former President Richard M. Nixon has been unable to obtain thousands of lettersr se to him at the White House in response to a public appeal from a committee backing him, Rabbi Baruch Korff, chairman of the group, charged today.

title: MRS. JULIUS LEMPERT
description: Florence Kennedy Lempert, the widow of Dr. Julius Lempert, an ear specialist, died Tuesday at her apartment in the Troy Towers, Union City, N. J. Her age was 74. She is survived by a brother.

title: Muskie Introduces a Bill To Help Poor Heat Homes
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (AP) A bill to authorize a $75million Federal program to help poor families heat their homes was introduced today by Senator Edmund S. Muskie, Democrat of Maine.

title: ANNA MOFFO SINGS NEON IN PAGLIACCI
description: Anna Motto took the part of Nedda for the first time at the Metropolitan Opera in Leoneitvallo's Pagliacel on Tuesday night. She joined a cast headed by Richard Tucker that had appeared earlier this season.

title: 191 ASSUMED DEAD MET IN SRILANKA
description: COLOMBO, Sri Lanka, Thursday, Dec. 5 (Reuters)All 191 people aboard a chartered jet taking Moslem pilgrims to Mecca were presumed to have been killed last night when the plane crashed in the central highlands of Sri Lanka  formerly Ceylonand burst into flames, an air force spokesman said today.

title: Yonkers Skater Captures Lead
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L.I., Dec. 4The North Atlantic figureskating championships began today with competition in school figures at the Twin Rinks Arena.

title: Court Here Reinstates Yule Vacation
description: Jurors won't sit, lawyers take vacations and witnesses are hard to ocate. So this year the traditional twoweek Christmas holiday has been reinstituted for most of the State Supreme Court justices in the five boroughts.

title: F.P.C. RAISES COST FOR NATURAL GAS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4In an effort to lift future production, the Federal Power Commission today fixed the uniform price of, natural gas at 50 cents a thousand cubic feet, an increase of 8 cents.

title: Big Ten Eliminates Rose Bowl Vote
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 4 (AP)The Big Ten revised its controversial Rose Bowl selection procedure today by approving a new method that virtually eliminates a conference vote.

title: Wallace, With 19%, Leads in Poll Of Democratic Candidates in '76
description: A Gallup survey of rankandfile preferences for Democratic Presidential candidates in 1976 indicates that no Democrat can yet claim as much as 20 per yet claim as much as 20 per cent of the field. Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama is the leading choice with 19 per cent.

title: PORTUGUESE WIN ACCOLADE IN U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 4Portugal won an accolade today for the way she is helping her former possessions to attain independence.

title: DISPLAY FOCUSES ON WORDS OF '76
description: Whereas the hofitle incurfions this country is expofed to make it neceffary that the good people of this colony be on their guard, therefore Resolved that it be and hereby is recommended that the militia in all parts of this colony hold themfelves in readinefs to march at a minutes warning.

title: Kentucky Carolers Limited
description: DAYTON, Ky., Dec. 4 (AP)Strolling Christmas carolers on local streets must have a license from the city, according to a requirement approved last night. Councilman John Wiseman said, Some carolers are lingering in front of houses after their songs and requesting donations.

title: Algeria Pushes Farm Reform, but Progress Is Slow
description: RAS BOUIRA, Algeria, Nov. 30  For Abdelaziz Ameur, a 48yearold agricultural worker with seven children, Algeria's Agrarian revolution means living in a solid house with a floor, electricity and running water and sharing in the proceeds of 1,200 acres.

title: New Year Closing Extended
description: The city's Consumer Affairs Commissioner, Elinor C. Guggenheimer, yesterday extended the mandatory New Year's Eve closing time for cabarets, catering establishments and public dance halls licensed by her department from 4 A.M. to 8 A.M. New Year's Day.

title: FERNANDO GERASSI
description: Fernando Gerassi, a painter and resident artist at the Putney School in Vermont, died Tuesday in University Hospital, Philadelphia. He was 75 years old and lived in Putney.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Nine children were treated for minor injuries after school bus and a car collided in South Ozone Park, Queens. Those injured were among 30 on the bus, owned by the Muhammad Temple of Islam, 10501 Northern Boulevard, corona, en route to the Muhammad University of Islam, 102 West 116th Street, in Manhattan.

title: Ten Women Are Honored For Civic Achievements
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (UPI) President Ford met yesterday at the White House with 10 women honored for achievements in their communities.

title: British Soccer
description: FOOTBALL LEAGUE CUP

title: 3,000 Dairy Workers Strike, Cutting Oil Milk to City and L.I.
description: Three thousand employes of 115 milk processing and distributing plants that supply nearly all milk consumed in New York City and on Long Island went on strike last night.

title: Military Tribunal In Ethiopia Begins Trials of Officials
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Dec. 4 (Reuters)A special threeman military tribunal began trying former Government officials today on charges of corruption and maladministration, a spokesman for the military Government said.

title: Paul Shyre to Star in Play, On Mencken Next Month
description: Paul Shyre, who is a specialist in character anthologies, will star in his own adaption of Blasts and Bravos, an Evening With H. L. Mencken, which will open on Jan. 6 at. the Cherry Lane Theater. As adapter, director or producer, Mr. Shyre has devised such shows as Will Rogers' U.S.A. and Sean O'Casey's Pictures in the Hallway.

title: Regulators Warned Of Utility Profit Need
description: SAN DIEGO, Calif., Dec. 4 Three investment bankers and two spokesmen for public utilities told state regulators yesterday that they must be more responsive to the asserted needs of utilities for greater profits or risk deterioration of service to the public.

title: If the Board Quits, Hunts to Raise Bid
description: The Great Western United Corporation said yesterday that the Hunt brothers had offered to increase their tender offer for the company if the board of directors agreed to resign.

title: Dalton School Picks Headmaster Following a SevenMonth Search
description: The Dalton School's board of trustees announced yesterday the appointment of a new headmasterDr. Gardner P. Dunnan, who has been district principal in Briarcliff Manor, N.Y., since 1969. Dr. Dunnan will take over his new post at the private school on Jan. 2.

title: House Backs Bill That Could Curb Busing Programs
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 (UPI)The House voted today, 212 176, to accept a compromise with the Senate that could effectivelyy ban the busing of hoolchildren to achieve racial desegregation.

title: Treasury Is Watching Flow of Petrodollars
description: BOCA RATON, Fla., Dec. 4 A top Treasury official declared today that the Government agency was taking a clese look at the impact. Arab and Iranian petrodollar investments in the United States.

title: Frances Nelkin Dead at 65; Leading Millinery Designer
description: Frances Kleinfeld Nelkin, for nearly 40 years a leading millinery designer, died Tuesday in Pompano Beach, Fla. Mrs. Nelkin, formerly a resident at 880 Fifth Avenue, was 65 years old.

title: 4 Circus Aides Die In Fire On Ringling Brothers Train
description: KINGSTREE, S. C., Dec. (UPI)Four persons died yesterday, in a fire that swept through a Pullman car on a Ringling Brothers and Barnum and Bailey Circus train.

title: MINERS' LEADERS CERTAIN OF VOTE APPROVING PACE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4Leaders of the United Mine Workers will announce tomorrow that the coal miners' strike will end on.. Friday as a result of ratification of the industry's contract offer. About 55 per cent of the union members voting are expected to have approved the offer.

title: Light Device and a Drug Used to Clear Psoriasis
description: BOSTON, Dec. 4Skin doctors at the Massachusetts General Hospital, reported today that they had achieved complete clearing of psoriasis in 50 patients with an experimental technique that combines a newly developed ultraviolet light device and a naturally occurring drug that Egyptians and Indians have used since ancient times.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: New Head of Tornado
description: DALLAS, Dec. 4 (UPI)Robert Power, who was among those chiefly responsible for the building of Texas Stadium in suburban Irving, was named today president and general manager of the Dallas Tornado of the North American Soccer League.

title: DEVELOPERS TEIL OF JERSEY PAYOFF
description: TRENTON, Dec. 4Two land developers testified today that they had made payoffs of nearly $200,000 to officials of the Borough of Lindenwold and to a Camden County tax officer to obtain zoning changes and other favorable land concessions in the Camden suburb from 1968 through 1973.

title: Cortina Mayor Launches Olympic Bid
description: Mayor Renzo Menardi of Cortina d'Ampezzo arrived in New York yesterday to start a campaign to bring the Winter Olympic Games back to his colorful, high Italian Dolomite resort region. His target of date is 1984. Meardi, the guest of honor at a luncheon given by Alitalia Airlines officials, said he was encouraged in his goal by the recent award to Lake Placid of the 1980 edition of the winter sports classic.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The Department of State is not without responsibility in the shocking massacres in Ethiopia on Nov. 24. The savagery and extent of the executions reveal a frantic resolve by Aminlike majors to achieve a complete break of all internal and external ties.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: QUEENS TENANTS CALL RENT STRIKE
description: Tenants of the Forest Hills South Apartments gathered yesterday Morning in front of the neatly landscaped gardens of their sevenbuilding complex to announce the beginning of rent strike over security provisions in the buildings.

title: S.E.C. Said to Scrutinize Cornwall Equities Offer
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission is investigating a tender offer of Cornwall Equities, Ltd., to buy back 250,000 shares of its own stock at $4 each and then to go private, sources close to the Government agency disclosed yesterday.

title: Bruins Tie Canadiens On Two Late Goals, 44
description: MONTREAL, Dec. 4 (UPI)  Johnny Bucyk and Carol Vadnais scored goals 18 secands apart in the final two minutes of play tonight, enabling the Boston Bruins to gain a 44 tie against the Montreal Canadiens in a National Hockey League game.

title: Camden County Developers Tell Of $200,000 Payoffs to Officials
description: TRENTON, Dec. 4Two land developers testified today that they had made payoffs of nearly $200,000 to officials of the Borough of Lindenwold and to a Camden County tax officer to obtain zoning changes and other favorable land concessions in the Camden suburb from 1968 through 1973.

title: Democrats Chart Sweeping Economic Policy Stand
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Dec. 4Democratic leaders changed the rules of their charter conference today to let the party write a sweeping resolution an the nation's troubled economy at the conference next weekend.

title: News Summary and Index
description: France has signed a contract to sell $800million in arms to Saudi Arabia. The Saudi Defense Minister, Prince Sultan ibn Abdel Aziz, was quoted in Lebanese newspapers as having said that France would provide antiaircraft missiles and antitank weapons and would strengthen his country's tank force. The Defense Minister was further quoted as having said his Government was confident of purchasing additional weapons from the United States with no strings attached. [Page 1, Columns 56.]

title: ZELLERBACH SET TO RAISE PRICES
description: The Crown Zellerbach Corporation announced yesterday that it was raising the price of its 30pound newsprint to $280 from $245 a ton in the western regional market. The company said the increase was necessitated by the rapid escalation of costs relating to manufacture and delivery of newsprint. It added that there were no changes in other terms and conditions of sale and delivery. The company had previously increased the price on Aug. 1 from $213.50 a ton.

title: HENRY J. HARKAVY
description: Henry J. Harkavy, a lawyer here more than 40 years, died Sunday at Mount Sinai Hospital. His age was 80, and he made his home in Miami Beach.

title: Orioles Send McNally to Expos; Allen Balks at Trade to Braves
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 4Dick Allen, the missing man of baseball, surfaced long enough today to say no thanks to Atlanta, but nobody took him too seriously as the major leagues' winter trading market kept booming along.

title: 1,000 Underprivileged Children Treated to a Toyful Shopping Spree
description: Nineyearold Kevin Johnson sat on Santa Claus's lap at Macy's yesterday morning and asked for a bicycle. He said he would put it on order at the North Pole and that would get it, Kevin reported solemnly. Angel Vale, also 9, was not as positive as his friend. I don't know what am going to ask for, he said. I'll have to think about it.

title: E.P.A DOM'S DATA ON ATOMIC MISHAP
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4The Environmental Protection Agency praised today the methods o fan Atomic Energy Cornmission study on the chances of a serious reactor accident, but the agency concluded that deaths and injuries resulting from such an accident could be 10 times higher than suggested by the commission study.

title: Fill the Deepest Gorge?
description: The river was overhung by dark and stupendous rocks, rising like gigantic walls and battlements; these would be rent by wide chasms that seem to speak of past convulsions of nature. Sometimes the river was of a glassy smoothness and placidity, at other times it roared along in impetuous rapids and foaming cascades. Here the rocks were piled in the most fantastic crags and precipices; and in another place they were succeeded by delightful valleys carpeted with greenwoods.

title: KICKBACKS LINKED TO COMPUTER LIST
description: Officials of Hempstead, L. I., maintained a computerized record as part of a kickback scheme under which empleyes of the Long Island town paid per cent of their annual salaries to the Republican party, according to court, papers filed by prosecutors in United States District Court in Brooklyn.

title: Bridge: Caravelli Seeks to Collect Second. Title at San Antonio
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Dec. 4 Three players made strong bids to collect a second national title at the American Contract Bridge League's Fall Nationals today.

title: Pro Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: STOCKS ADVANCE, THEN DIP ON AMEX
description: After earlier gains, stock prices turned lower yesterday in moderate trading on the American Stock Exchange and in the OvertheCounter market.

title: A NoStrike Deal Offered By Players
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 4The Major League Baseball Players Association has offered the club owners what amounts to a nostrike pledge in return for early bargaining and binding arbitration of unresolved issues after a cutoff date.

title: BISHOP WATERS, LED DIOCESE OF RALEIGH
description: RALEIGH, N.C., Dec, 4 (AP) The Most Rev. Vincent S. Waters, Roman Catholic Bishop of the Diocese of Raleigh, died yesterday, apparently of a heart attack, at his home. He was 70 years old.

title: Swiss Foreign Minister Named President for 1975
description: GENEVA, Dec. 4The two houses of Parliament today elected Foreign Minister Pierre Graber to serve as President of Switzerland for 1975.

title: RABIN SOFTENING DEMAND ON EGYPT
description: TEL AVIV, Dec. 4Premier Yitzhak Rabin has suggested that Israel may soften her demand for a formal Egyptian renunciation of belligerency as a condition for a further Israeli pullback in occupied Sinai.

title: Miss Ching Blends Chinese Traditions In Dance Program
description: Chiang Ching's dance company credibly performs works in a variety of styles but shows special sensitivity to traditional Chinese dance. A selection of these pieces was given Tuesday evening at Hunter College along with some newer works, two of which, Soliloquy of Bhiksuni and Pien, were premieres.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Three men, including a father and son, were charged with murder in the death of a man whose remains were found in a wooded area of Jackson Township last Friday. The father was sought as a fugitive; the two othersAlbert V. Compolattaro, 20 years old of Toms River and Jerald E. James, 22, of Jackson Townshipwere arrested and arraigned on the charge.

title: November Store Sales Off
description: Many New York stores and their suburban branches turned in their worst decline last month in more than four years.

title: World Bowl Kicks Off Tonight
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Dec. 4 First there was the Rose Bowl, 1902. Then there were other bowls culminating in the Super Bowl, anno 1967. Tomorrow night there is the World Bowl. The better frame of reference would be the Earth Bowl as in the Whole Earth Catalogue, the volume that suggests a search for Inner Resources other than straight cash.

title: CITIES ARE CHIDED ON U.S. FUNDS USE
description: HOUSTON, Tex., Dec. 4Vernon E. Jordan Jr., executive director of the National Urban League, told a gathering of city officials today that they were neglecting the needs of the poorest constituents in spending Federal revenuesharing funds.

title: A British Bridgehead on Broadway
description: Less than two years before the nation observes the ofcentennial of the American Revolution, the British are once again occupying New York, at least the part of it that is called Broadway theater.

title: 50 BEGIN A PROTEST AT SEOUL ASSEMBLY
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Thursday, Dec. 5 (Reuters)  More than 50 opposition party members of the National Assembly broke into the Assembly hall today and began a sitin to back demands for changes in South Korea's stringent Constitution.

title: I.M.F. Cites Oil Drawings
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4The International Monetary Fund announced today additional drawings by 12 countries under its oil facility totaling about $750million. The largest drawing was about $495million by Italy, bringing that country's total since the facility was established earlier this year to about $800million.

title: Protest Spares Frogs
description: AMSTERDAM (AP)A proest by a Dutch animal protection society has forced cancellation of a frogs' legs party planned by a student grouprat Leiden University. A Parisian chef had been engaged to prepare the delicacy for celebrations of the 160th anniversary of the University's Minerva Society.

title: The Man Behind the Woman Governs Argentina
description: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 4Before he departed, When he with quite lucid, General Peron asked me to take care of Isabel, said Jose Lopez Rega, the Minister of Social Welfare In my way, I have done as he wished.

title: Cooke Leads Special Mass For U Thant This Morning
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 4Cardinal Cooke will officiate at a special mass tomorrow for U Thant, former Secretary General of the United Nations, who died last week.

title: MITSUI ISSUE IS SET FOR AMEX TRADING
description: The American Stock Exchange will admit to listing and dealings tomorrow $20million in Mitsui & Co., Ltd., 8 per cent sinking fund convertible debentures due Sept. 30, 1989. This was said by the Amex to be the first foreign security to be listed on an American securities exchange since the interest equalization tax was phased out earlier this year and will make Mitsui the only Japanese issue now traded on the Amex.

title: TERRORISTS SEIZED BY DOMINICA FORCES
description: ROSEAU, Dominica, Dec. (UPI)Security forces today moved against a black terrorist movement called the Dreads, arresting several members.

title: Room At the Top
description: BOSTON, Dec. 4All day long, on the news bulletins, the big news was that President Ford was going to hold a press conference. The President will answer questions tonight, the announcers breathlessly told us. He will have two statements. His spokesman, Ron Nelsen, refuses to say how major they will be.

title: Pistons Defeat Rockets, 8669, Setting Team Mark for Defense
description: DETROIT, Dec. 4 (AP)the Detroit Pistons jumped tb a 2816 firstquarter lead, Bob Lanier scoring 10 points, and then coasted to an 8669 National Basketball Association victory tonight over the Houston Rockets.

title: People in Sports
description: Paul (Bear) Bryant, head coach of Alabama, the college football team ranked No. I by United Press International, was named Southeastern Conference coach of the year for the fifth time yesterday. He was selected in a poll of fellow coaches in the S.E.C.

title: Jewelry Salesman Robbed
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 4 (UPI) Two gunmen knocked down :a New York jewelry salesman here yesterday and snatched his attach case containing more than $100,000 worth of jewel The police said the victim wart Leopole Levkovits, a represent, ative of L&L Import and Export Company, New York.

title: Capital Investment Lag Seen in First Half of '75
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4 The first official estimates for the key sector of business investment in plant and equipment in 1975, covering the first half of the year, indicated today a weakening in this key prop under the economy.

title: People and Business Lag in Inflation Fight Charged
description: John E. Sheehan, who was named to the Federal Reserve Board in 1971 by President Richard M. Nixon, yesterday accused the Ford Administration and Congress of failing to take the lead in fighting inflation.

title: CITY PAYROLL ROSE 12,950 IN 4 MONTHS
description: The number of fulltime employes on the payroll of the City of New York increased by 12,950 in the first four months of the current fiscal year, a new set of figures from the Controller's Office showed yesterday.

title: Jury Told Nixon Offered $200,000 Cash to 2 Aides
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4The prosecution read to the jury at the Watergate coverup trial today the transcripts of two previously undisclosed conversations held in April, 1973, in which former President Richard M. Nixon offered $200,000 to $300,000 in cash to John D. Ehrlichman and H. R. Heideman.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: Minnesota, Los Angeles, Oakland and the American Conference Central Division champion will be the host teams in the opening National Football League division playoffs. Minnesota, the National Conference Central winner, takes on the Eastern championSt. Louis or Washingtonon Saturday, Dec. 21. Los Angeles faces the N.F.C. wildcard team the next day. Oakland, the A.F.C. Western winner, meets the conference's Eastern champion on Dee. 21 and the Central titleholderPittsburgh or Cincinnatigoes against a wildcard team.

title: Altitude of 727 Worried Crewman Before Crash
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4A reconstruction of the events in the Sunday airliner crash in& which 92 persons were killed shows that, just a few minutes before the plane, hit, a crewman may have qeustioned whether the plane was flying too low.

title: DECISION PUT OFF ON WATER TUNNEL
description: The Board of Estimate decided yesterday to deter until at least Jan. 9 a decision on whether to authorize sharply increased payment for completion of the Third Water Tunnel, a project that has run into costly delays and has threatened to embroil the city and a sixcompany consortium of contractors in protracted lawsuits.

title: William J. Evans, 81, Dies; Founded Lighterage Firm
description: William J. Evans, founder of the Evans Transportation Corporation, a harbor lighterage firm, died Tuesday. He was 81 years old and lived at 364 Stewart Avenue in Garden City, L.I.

title: LANDLORD PROTEST ON FUEL IS BLOCKED
description: The Department of Rent and Housing Maintenance served the directors of a landlord association, the Community Housing Improvement Program, with two restraining orders signed in Brooklyn and Manhattan Housing Courts to prevent its members from shutting their boilers down today.

title: Committee Debates Proper Title For Women on the City Council
description: A City Council committee yesterday debated what women members of the Council should be called.

title: Nixon Is Improving But Has Pneumonia, His Surgeon Says
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Dec. 4 (AP)  Former President Richard M. Nixon's health is improving, but he suffers from a slight case of pneumonia in his right lung, his surgeon said today.

title: Light Device and a Drug Used to Clear Psoriasis
description: BOSTON, Dec. 4Skin doctors at the Massachusetts General Hospital reported today that they had achieved complete clearing of psoriasis in 50 patients with an experimental technique that combines a newly developed ultraviolet light device and a naturally occurring drug that Egyptians and Indians have used since ancient times.

title: TRUSTEE IS PLANNED FOR I.T.T. ON AVIS
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 4A Federal. Judge indicated today that he would soon appoint a trustee to help the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation divest itself of its controling interest in Avis, the No. 2 car rental company.

title: French Sell Saudi Arabia $800Million in Weapons
description: PARIS, Dec. 4France has signed a contract to supply $800million in arms to Saudi Arabia.

title: ROCKEFELLER LOAN IN 1961 DISCLOSED
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4Laurance S. Rockefeller, making his second appearance before a Congressional committee in connection with his brother's. VicePresidentill nomination, discloted today that in 1961, he made a loan or $30,000 to William E. Miller, then chairman of the Republican National Committee.

title: Rowdyism Puts Onus On Playoffs
description: Financial prolems and a recent miniriot have made it clear that the Public Schools Athletic League has a long way to go before it can return its basketball playoffs toMadison Square the old Garden in Garden. When fans rioted after a playoff final at the early nineteen sixties, the playoffs went into hiding for several years. Two seasons ago, the games were moved off neutral high school courts and into the Garden's Felt Forum. Last season, St. John's University's Alumni Hall was used.

title: Treasury Gold Sale
description: Secretary of the Treasury William Simon has, made a wise and responsible move in announcing that the United States Government will sell two million ounces of its goldabout $360 million worth at present market priceson Jan. 6, a week after Americans will be legally able to buy gold for the first time since 1933.

title: Teachers and State Negotiators Open Talks on College Dispute
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, Dec. 5Negotiators for about 3,000 college faculty members met here today with representatives of the state's Office of Employe Relations in an attempt to settle the labor dispute that closed the eight state colleges for about two weeks just before Thanksgiving.

title: Brezhnev in Paris for Giscard Talks
description: PARIS, Dec. 4President Valry Giscard d'Estaing is preparing for his first meeting with President Ford next week with an air of optimism, that he can ease FrenchAmerican disputes on several key issues, among them the oil crisis.

title: The Feast Itself
description: There has to be set in motion a machinery to disseminate art. This itself is remarkable for art itself has nothing to do with machinery. It is human endeavor, springing from human passion.

title: Anita Ellis Puts Subtle Artistry Into Her Songs at the Bird Cage
description: Anita Ellis, who provided the soundtrack singing voice for Rita Hayworth in five films and for Vera Ellen in two Fred Astaire films, is a reclusive singer who appears in public so infrequently that an aura of mystique and legend has grown up around her. She has not been performing in public, her friends say, because she does not want to appear unless the conditions are precisely right.

title: Milk Strike Cuts Off City and L.I. Deliveries
description: Three thousand employes of 115 milk processing and distributing plants that supply nearly all milk consumed in New York City and on Long Island went on strike last night.

title: Modern's Show Is Proof Of the Power of the Print
description: You don't have to be in a wheelchair to remember a time when American prints, like American prehistory, were the concern of a small and learned minority. There were always people who gutted old sets of Harper's Magazine for engravings by Winslow Homer, just as there were always people who gutted old sets of The Illustrated London News for engravings after Constantin Guys. But as far as the mainstream of international art was concerned, American printmaking was a backwater, and a stagnant one at that.

title: VOLUME IS HEAVY IN SILVER TRADING
description: Silver and world sugar futures held centerstage yesterday in commodity futures markets. Trading in silver was marked by exceedingly heavy volume and wide price swings but ended with prices showing little change. In sugar, the long downtrend extended to the ninth trading session.

title: Pistons Defeat Rockets, 8669, Setting Team Mark for Defense
description: DETROIT, Dec. 4 (AR) The Detroit Pistons jumped to a 2816 firstquarter lead, Bob Lanier scoring 10 points, and then coasted to an 8669 National Basketball Association victory tonight over the Houston Rockets.

title: Ban Asked on Admissions To State Mental Hospital
description: TRENTON, Dec. 4The State Public Advocate today filed suit to prevent new patients from being admitted to Greystone Park, the state's largest psychiatric hospital.

title: RESIDENTS OPPOSE A BROOKLYN ARENA
description: Six Brooklyn resident sfiled suit yesterday in State Supreme Court there in an effort to prevent the Beanie administration, Borough President Sebastian Leone and the State Sports Authority from proceeding with feasibility study for a 15,000seat indor sports arena in Brooklyn.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: They Tell How They Feel About Being Single Women
description: About 100 women, most of them unmarried and many carrying their lunches in brown paper bags, trooped to the Y yesterday for a noontime lecture. The subject: The Single Woman.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: Rangers Beat Wings, 42; Villemure Excels in Goal
description: For the benefit of those diehards who believe the only good hockey available in the National Hockey League is played by the original six establishment teams, forget it  those days are gone forever.

title: Engelhard Extra Dividend
description: The Engelhard Minerals and Chemicals Corporation said yesterday that directors had voted an extra 15 cents cash and a 2 per cent stock dividend in addition to the regular quarterly, dividend of 15 cents a share. All are payable Dec. 31 to shareholders of record Dec. 14.

title: Chess: An Ad Hoc Team Triumphs, Pro Forma, in West Germany
description: When the Solingen Chess Club won the team championship of West Germany recently in West Berlin, its success came as a surprise to no one. Quite unlike the situation in New York, where the leading players of the prominent Manhattan and Marshall Chess Clubs are genuine members, the custom in West Germany is to stock the teams with wellheeled recruiting techniques.

title: 20 Held in British Bombings
description: LONDON, Dec. 4 (AP)Detectives in London and other cities today rounded up more than 20 persons suspected of terrorist attacks, and all were taken to Guildford, the town in Surrey where two bombs killed five people in October, police sources said.

title: HOUSE DEMOCRATS VOTE TO WEAKEN SENIORITY SYSTEM
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4House Democrats further undercut today the conservativeoriented seniority system, bolstered the power of the Speaker and added to the sweeping reforms whose effect will be felt at the White House as well as on Capitol Hill.

title: U.S. Business Told Not to AimAt 2 Cars in Every Saudi Garage
description: More than 300 American businessmen were told yesterday not to try to put two cars in every SaudiArabian garage, if they hope to do business successfully in the Middle East and benefit from the huge flow of money into the area.

title: Bruins Tie Canadiens On Two Late Goals, 44
description: MONTREAL, Dec. 4 (UPI)  Johnny Bucyk and Carol Vadnais scored goals 18 seconds apart in the final two minutes of play tonight, enabling the Boston Bruins to gain a 44 tie against the Montreal Canadiens in a National Hockey League game.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: LONDON, Dec. 4 (AP)Sotheby's announced a record price of $552,000 for a painting by Georges Braque sold at auction today.

title: Quiet Arabs in Israel Raising Voices
description: TEL AVIV, Dec. 3When Premier Yitzhak Rabin spoke to several hundred high school students in Nazareth last week, hostile questions and catcalls turned the questionandanswer session into an angry row.

title: CLOSE SATURN PASS CHOSEN FOR PIONEER
description: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif., Dec. 4 (UPI)  Space agency scientists decided today to angle the Pioneer 11 spacecraft inside the innermost ring of Saturn, less than 6,000 miles from the planet's surface.

title: Carey's Cabinet: Slow Pickings
description: Hugh L. Carey is discovering that the difficulties of becoming Governor only begin with the victory on Election Day. It has been four weeks since that victory, and he is still Working on making his first cabinet appointmentsa process very much dependent on a promise strong standards. Mr. Carey has said he will ask appointees to make a public disclosure of their net worth and to limit outside income while they are state employes.

title: AllAmerica Football
description: FIRST TEAM

title: Dr. Theobald Differs With Gold On Rules for Vocational Schools
description: Eugene Gold, the Brooklyn District Attorney, and John J. Theobald, a director for the Westlawn School of Yacht Design, a homestudy institute in Stamford, Conn., yesterday differed on the Federal Trade Commission's proposals to regulate the private vocational school industry.

title: Jurist Group Reports Proof Chile's Junta Curbs Schools
description: GENEVA, Dec. 4The International Commission of Jurists said today that it had documentary evidence that the military Government in Chile was exercising political control over public and private schools.

title: Jury Told Nixon Offered $200,000 Cash to 2 Aides
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 4The prosecution read to the jury at the Watergate coverup trial today the transcripts of two previously undisclosed conversations held in April, 1973, in which former President Richard M. Nixon offered $200,000 to $300,000 in cash to John D. Ehrlichman and H. R. Haldeman.

title: Boy, 4, and Man Die In Separate Fires In the North Bronx
description: A 4yearold boy and a 40yearold man were killed in two separate fires in the Williamsbridge section of the. North Bronx last night, fire officials reported.

title: JAPANESE LEADER SEES PARTY CRISIS
description: TOKYO, Dec. 4  Japan's Premierdesignate, Takeo Miki, said today that the governing LiberalDemocratic party was in its greatest crisis and needed drastic reform.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Members of the Forest Hills South Tenants Association gathered outside their sevenbuilding apartment complex in Quens to protest security provisions in the building and to announce a rent strike.

title: Leonard Bernstein Denies He Evaluated Henderson Library
description: Leonard Bernstein, the conductor and composer, testified yesterday that he had never evaluated a music library donated to the University of Wisconsin by Skitch Henderson, the musician charged with incometax evasion.

title: Philippines Plans To Try 2 Accused Of Plot on Marcos
description: MANILA, Dec. 4 (UPI)The Philippine Government announced today that it would soon put on trial a former Manila newspaper publisher and the son of a defeated presidential candidate who allegedly plotted to kill President Ferdinand E. Marcos.

title: 32Story Building With Over 300 Units Dedicated in Harlem
description: The Upaca Towers apartment building, a new, 32story addition to East Harlem's skyline, was dedicated yesterday by Federal housing officials who hailed the project as a brilliant example of city planning.

title: Events Today
description: Theater

title: 6 OLD WATER PIPES BURST IN ORANGE
description: ORANGE. Dec. 4 (UPI)The Rheingold brewery, coinoperated laundries and other highvolume water users were shut down and a state of emergency was declared today after six 70year  old pipes burst and crippled the city's water supply.

title: Strike by BakersFor Higher WagesUnsettles Britons
description: LONDON, Dec. 4Britain's bakers, normally the least militant of workers, struck this week for higher pay, leaving consumers with only about a fourth of their normal bread supplies. And Britons haven't been typically British about it.

title: TV: Primate, a Study by Wiseman
