description: The last time a member of the Jet family made his farewell appearance at Shea Stadium, the Buffalo Bills were the opponent and O. J. Simpson scooted for 200 yards, capping a recordbreaking season performance of 2,003 yards.

title: AdultEducation Programs Now Focusing on the Practical
description: GREAT NECKAs fast as the pinch on the pocketbook has grown into a stranglehold on salaries, adulteducation enrollments on Long Island have swollen with most of the students taking practical classes.

title: CAREY ROLE CITED IN PARTY DISPUTE
description: KANSAS CITY, Dec. 7Members of the New York State delegation to the Democratic miniconvention said Governorelect Hugh L. Carey was using some longdistance armtwisting today to end a dispute over proportionate representation at future conventions.

title: Traffic Deaths Set a State Record
description: TRENTON  Trafficaccident deaths in New Jersey rose to a new high last year, surpassing the previous record set in 1968, according to a study released last week by the State Police.

title: Excursionists Using Cape May Ferry
description: CAPE MAY  The Cape MayLewes (Del.) ferry, line, which recently accepted delivery of the second of its fleet of three new $4million liners, is becoming as, popular with oneday excursionists as it is with longdistance travelers.

title: OneMan Holding Company
description: DENVERGerald R. Armstrong, the 33yearold head of the Rocky Mountain Fuel Company, is not your typical company president. No trappings of office are provided for him, and he regularly performs other jobs that no table of management organization would contemplate: assessor, secretary, real estate salesman, surveyor, bookkeeper, driver, file clerk and sometime janitor.

title: A Mixed Record
description: Barely seven months after wageprice controls were dropped from the economic game plan they are again receiving serious attention in the debate over a strategy to beat inflation and recession. As time runs out, there is a rising probability that controls will make a comeback because the bench has been emptied of other alternatives.

title: Somerset Awarding Vocational Degrees
description: BRIDGEWATERSomerset County high school graduates are now receiving academic credit for courses that were considered stricetly vocational just a year ago.

title: Some Helpful Hints on Giving A Pet to Child for Christmas
description: With Christmas approaching, this is the time of the year many parents think about buying a puppy for their children. Some of the novice pet owners are not sure what to do with, or for, their newly acquired fourlegged friends. For a pup, or even an older dog being brought into a house, Christmas can be a time of too many strange people and too much excitement.

title: And then there's quiche Alsace
description: To many cooks, a quiche is a quiche Lorraine, that savory concoction of onions, cheese, bacon (or ham), eggs and cream cooked in a flaky crust. But quiche is really the generic name for a host of nonsweet pies. One of the finest we knowan Alsatian meat pieis made with ground veal or pork. It is an unusually tasty appetizer or luncheon dish.

title: FollowUp on The News
description: Dean Rusk was Secretary of State when his only daughter, Margaret Elizabeth, then 18 years old, was married to Guy Gibson Smith, 22, a black second lieutenant in the Reserve Officers Training Corps.

title: UtilityBills Hearing Slated by Assembly.
description: TRENTONThe Assembly Committee on Transportation and Communications will conduct a public hearing here tomorrow on several consumeroriented electricalutility measures. The bills have generated, intense opposition from industry and a cool reception from the state's Board of Public Utility Commissioners.

title: State Is Moving Cautiously on a Proposal to Fluoridate Public Water Supplies
description: TRENTON  The state's Department of Environmental Protection continued last week to move slowly and cautiously toward any order that would mandate the introduction of fluorides into community water supplies.

title: LAWYERS SOUGHT FOR PRISON SUITS
description: Lawyers should automatically be appointed to represent prisoners who bring Federal suits challenging the constitutionality of prison conditions, a committee of the Association of the Bar of the City of New York has concluded.

title: STRAUSS SYMBOL OF PARTY FUTURE
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Dec, 7 Ayear ago nobody dreaded the Democrats' midterm convention more than Robert Swartz Strauss, the party's chairman. But in the end it became his meeting and, most Democrats were saying, his triumpha peculiarly Straussian bit of arbitration that brought calm to the convention hall by moving the party's emotional and ideological baggage outside.

title: FOOD STAMP BENEFIT GOING UP IN JANUARY
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16 (UPI) The Agriculture Department has announced that it will inWASHINGTON, Nov. 16 (UPI) The Agriculture Department has announced that it will increase food stamp allotments $4 a month in January, but the rise will not offset the impact of rising grocery costs on needy families.

title: Boy, 15, Wins Run
description: RALEIGH, N. C., Dec. 7 (UPI)Jeff Moody, 15 years old, of Southern Pines, N. C. won the crosscountry championship of the Amateur Athletic Union's Junior Olympics today. His time was 14 minutes 22.6 seconds.

title: To the Rescue of Endangered Plants
description: Conservationists have been campaigning for decades to protect mammals and birds facing extinction, rarely stopping to consider the occasional voice in the wilderness warning that plantsupon which the welfare of all life is bound up absolutelymight also be an exhaustible resource.

title: But Recent Medical Evidence Shows Risks
description: Despite recent medical studies purporting to show evidence of physiological risks to smokers of marijuana, there is a clear and growing trend toward decriminalizing the drug. Opposition to pot, once centered in the lawenforcement community, seems to be crumbling.

title: 11 Counties and 43 Municipalities Get $2Million in U.S. Funds for Bikeways Along Roads
description: TRENTONEleven counties and 43 municipalities have received $2million in Federal funds to build bikeway's along major roadways.

title: Sailing to Cythera
description: There is a key to the writing of fantasy and though there are many ways to describe it, I know that its essence has to do with logic. Let one logical brick slip out of the story and Alice may not get to Wonderland. Use some device other than a Kansas cyclone and Dorothy's trip to Oz may not convince.

title: 300YearOld Sycamore Is Toppled by Storms
description: ROHRERSTOWN, Pa., Dec. 7 (AP)For 300 years the giant sycamore survived all storms, including hurricanes in 1954 and 1972.

title: State Offers Trees For Conservation
description: MILLBROOK, N.Y. Seedling trees and shrubs at a nominal cost are available to Long Island residents, according to an announcement last week by the State Department of Environmental Conservation.

title: Buddhist Chaplain on Coast
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Dec. (UPI)The Rev. Shoko Masunaga, head of a Buddhist church here, became the first Buddhist chaplain of the California Senate Monday.

title: NUMISMATICS
description: Although every reporter strives for clarity, it seems that the Numismatic column of Nov, 10which reported on the Mint's offering of packaged threepiece sets of Bicentennial coinsdid not quite fulfill that ideal. Letters and telephone calls received from readers would indicate that there is still some confusion about the content of these sets, as well as about ??ing details.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Knicks Top Blazers for 5th Straight
description: Henry Bibby staged a fourthperiod clinic for Phil Lumpkin last night and Bill Bradley turned his defensive skills on John Johnson in the third period as they led the Knicks to a 120112 victory over the Portland Trail Blazers at Madison Square Garden.

title: Lady Diana Beatty to Marry Dec. 21
description: LONDON, Dec. 6Lady Diana Adrienne Beatty and Henry Nicolas Gage, whose engagement was announced three weeks ago, will be married here Dec. 21.

title: Mine Hill Is Facing Showdown On Housing
description: MINE HILLArmed with petitions, expert opinion and the court challenge, residents of this former ironmining center are fighting the proposed construction of a huge Planned Unit Development.

title: SAIGON REPORTS RISE IN NOTING
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 7Heavy fighting has been reported in the Mekong Delta, where the important winter rice harvest is just beginning.

title: F.B.I. CENSORSHIP ON HISS CHARGED
description: A professor doing research on Alger Hiss says that the Federal Bureau of Investigation so heavily censored material it supplied at his request that one letter included only the salutation and the signature.

title: Gish to Continue School Fight
description: FACKENSACK  It has been more than two years since John N. Gish, a 37yearold English teacher, beoan battling the Paramus Board of Education on the issue of his sexual orientation.

title: At Mohonk, OldTime Pleasures
description: But the Smileys and their wives changed all that, and by the next summer had turned the establishment into a summer lodge that could accommodate 40 of their friends as paying guests. Liquor, card playing and dancing were out. Morning prayer services, nature walks, evening concerts, lectures and conversation were in. Sunday was a day when activities were curtailed; and because the guests were all friends of the Smileys in the first place, the rules were uncomplainingly accepted. That attitude still reigns because, after all, the Smileys are still Quakers and continue to run things with a kind of benevolent despotism. Dawn prayers and Sunday night hymnal services are still held. Vacationers can always go elsewhere to accumulate swizzlesticks, although acquiescence to the times include the aforementioned alcohol, card playing in the public rooms, square dances and such movies Little Chickadee.

title: News of the Realty Trade
description: Three major companies are planning to move their corporate headquarters out of New York City.

title: East Germans Say Bonn Agrees On Credit Until 1981 for Trade
description: BERLIN, Dec. 7East Germany announced today that West Germany had agreed to grant the Communist state longterm credit until 1981 to facilitate trade between the two nations.The unilateral disclosure of the secret deal by Neues Deutschland, the Communist party newspaper in East Berlin, caused acute embarrassment in Bonn and West Berlin because West German officials had sought to extract a political concession from the East Germans in return for the credit.

title: Yonkers Man Reappointed
description: ALBANY Dec. 7 (UPI)Edward J. Freeman of Yonkers has been reappointed to the State Law Revision Commission, Governor Wilson's office announced today. The commission examines laws and makes recommendations for changes. Members are paid $13.936 a year.

title: Sudan, Kenya, Tanzania All Have Sent Emissaries
description: LONDONEthiopia's crawling revolution, now in its tenth month, is inexorably breaking up the brittle stability of the old empire which was ruled for over 50 years by the former Emperor Haile Selassie; it is also threatening to upset the peace that prevails in and around the horn of Africa.

title: Asbury Park Host To Trailer Show
description: ASBURY PARK  The New Jersey Trailer and Camping Show, a threeday event, will be held at Convention Hall here, starting Jan. 24.

title: Stage Set for Thaw in Mortgage Lending
description: Mortgage money become easier to get early: in 1975, according to some bankers and economists.

title: Milk Employes Here Expected to Ratify 2Year Pact Today
description: Striking milk drivers and plant employes are expected to approve today a new twoyear contract that was negotiated yesterday morning and to end their fourday walkout at 115 milk processing and distributing concerns in the metropolitan area.

title: The Campus lmpact of Watergate: New Courses and Consciousness
description: MADISON, Wis.The day's topic was Presidential power and its limits, and Prof. Thomas Wolanin opened his class by handing out copies of U. S. V. Nixon, the Supreme Court decision that forced release of the incriminating, White House tapes.

title: THE ECONOMIC SCENE
description: ALMOST buried under the deluge of adverse developments descending daily on the American economic scene have been the first concrete signs of progress in the long and strenuous battle to bring our soaring rate of inflation under better control. Perception of that favorable development has not been widespread yet, but it has provided a faint glimmer of hope to those who have noted it.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Stores Expecting Profitable Holiday
description: The holiday trappings of tinsel and canned carols and shoppingcenter Santas have transformed malls around Long Island economically as well as physically.

title: The Games People Play
description: Playing games, in one form or another, is one of America's favorite pursuits. Although the games played are quite serious at one level (in Las Vegas or on Capitol Hill, for instance), for most of us games are for fun and offer a temporary respite from the hard realities of daytoday living. There are, however, some critics who view games as a childish attempt to avoid the real world and suggest that those who play are simply engaging in a little neurotic escapism. Viewing the growing mania for games in the United States and elsewhere, we might obviously draw some damning conclusions about the real workaday world. Chess, poker, Monopoly, backgammon, Scrabble, bridge, lotteries and horse race betting, Yahtzee and innumerable other playtime escapes consume more and more of our time. And game booksfor those committed realists who remain uninitiates to the game mania and, of course, for those of us dedicated to honing our neurosesare emerging faster than the games themselves. Unlike the games, however, some of these books might very well hasten your return to workaday reality.

title: Tennis Gets Deflated As Wind Bursts Bubbles
description: When several indoor tennis bubbles collapsed during the windstorm last week, the first question that might have come to mind was, Were any players hurt? The answer was no. Because the airinflated nylon or dacron structures had gone down in the early morning hours when nobody was in them.

title: When to, and When Not?
description: WASHINGTONThere was a time, not long ago, when newspapers regularly reported the private frivolities of public figures. The drunkenness and licentiousness, real or imagined, of politicians, were fair game for the press. The gamier the better, in Tact, and Presidents as different as Jefferson and Cleveland were not exempt.

title: Many City Projects Dropped
description: The impact of the city's, fiscal crisis was clearly felt in neighborhoods throughout Brooklyn and Queens last week when community board members got their first look at the proposed capital budget for the fiscal year that will. begin next July 1.

title: Elizabeth F. Meyer Engaged To Gerald Francis Costello Jr.
description: Mr. and Mrs. Kenneth Norman Meyer of Wilmington, Del., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Elizabeth Fairbanks Meyer, a descendant of Thomas Hook er, the founder of Hartford, to Gerald Francis Costello Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Costello of Northampton, Mass.

title: SCHOOLS DRAFTING A CODE OF ETHICS
description: A code of ethics for the school system's 125,000 employes as well as the seven members of the policymaking Board of Education is being drafted by a newly appointed special board committee.

title: Queens Coop to Get a Shopping Center
description: The City Planning Commission has approved a zoning change enabling the cooperative community at Breezy Point, on the Rockaway Peninsula bi Queens, to build a small shopping center, to renovate an existing volunteer firehouse and to erect a new community center.

title: Diane Inge Rohr to Wed
description: Mr. and Mrs. Edward Rohr of Scarsdale, N. Y., have announced, the engagement of their daughter, Diane Inge Rohr, to Michael Lea Franklin, son of Col. Truman L. Franklin, U.S.A.F., retired, and Mrs Fraklin of Amuquerque, N. M. Miss Rohr will receive a degree in May from the University of New Mexico, of which her fianc is a graduate.

title: G.O.P. REFORMERS WM FIRST ROE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7 (UPI) 4Trying to guard against future Watergates, a Republican party reform committee approved today a farreaching proposal to give the Republican National Committee chairman more direct control over campaign expenditums by the party's Presidential candidates.

title: 4 Quarterbacks Are Selected For '74 AllEast Football Team
description: Steve Joachim of Temple tosses a high, lofting pass that eventually gets to his receivers. Mike Kruczek of Boston College is more direct with a strong, linedrive pass. Tom Doyle of Yale directs his offense in a completely efficient manner as does Lynn Hieber, a junior at Indiana (Pa.) University.

title: Miss McGowan Bride of W. T. Inglis Jr.
description: Christine Cherie McGowan, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Thomas J. P. McGowan of Huntington Bay, L. I., was married yesterday at noon to William Thomas Inglis Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Inglis of Bellmore, L. I. The Most Rev. John R. McGann, Auxiliary Bishop of the Rockville Centre Diocese, performed the ceremony and celebrated the nuptial mass at St. Patrick's Roman Catholic Church in Huntington.

title: TV VIEW
description: Did anyone else find the first Ben Franklin extravaganza on CBS as much of a chore as I did? There will be three more of them in the next several months, 90 minutes each, with Lloyd Bridges, Richard Widmark and Melvyn Douglas variously impersonating F in. Lloyd Bridges? Franklin with fins? We are being hauled'sullen and nodding, by oil companies, government agencies and network producers to the sainted Bicentennial. First the playoffs, then the Super Bowl. The barge of state will sink under the weight of our pieties. Where are the Rhine Maidens?

title: Bensonhurst: An Italian Smorgasbord
description: Like a giant buffet, a milelong stretch of 18th Avenue through the Bensonhurst section of Brooklyn is lined on both sides with shops crammed full of cheeses, salamis, sausages, breads, pasta, vegetables, meats, seafood and pastry. The street is an Italian banquet from antipasto to dessert.

title: BAD AIR'S EFFECT ON YOUNG STUDIED
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 7New research has uncovered evidence that children, long considered to be basically immuse to air pollution's disabling effects, are significantly and adversely affected by the toxic ingredients in the air.

title: Ideas &Trends Education, Medicine, Space
description: Two ages of space exploration coexisted last week. The more familiar was manned orbital flight around the earth. The Soviet Union launched a Soyuz 16 spacecraft with two veteran astronauts aboard and apparently tested successfully a new docking mechanism that will be used in the RussianAmerican linkup in space set for next July.

title: Insulation Makers Stepping Up Drive
description: Those chilly blasts and drafts certainly can be countered in ways less costly than flipping up the thermostat.

title: WELFARE ABUSES BY FATHERS CITED
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7  A large proportion of the children of welfare mothers have fathers who could afford to make childsupport payments but are not doing so, according to a new government study.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Leonid I. Brezhnev, head of the Soviet Communist party, and President Valry Giscard d'Estaing of France completed three days of talks in Paris and issued a communiqu calling for steppedup efforts to conclude the current European security conference with a 35nation summit meeting. Both said in statements that their talks had provided an extremely important new momentum for peace in Europe as well as for FrenchSoviet relations. The joint communiqu reflected a close alignment of French and Soviet positions on major international issues, including the Middle East and the role of the United Nations. [Page 1, Cols. 12.]

title: Magazine Is Healthy at 30
description: PRINCETONAt a time when many popular magazines are struggling to make ends meet, a small, Princetonbased literary publication is celebrating its unusually long survival.

title: Arabs Criticize U. S. for Its Warning on Trend in U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 7Arab diplomats today termed unfair and regrettable yesterday's speech by the United States representative criticizing the recent trend in the United Nations toward dominance of the organization by a broad coalition of developing countries.

title: Lynn Ford Is Betrothed to Paul D. Alandt
description: Mr. and Mrs. Benson Ford of Grosse Pointe Shores, Mich., have announced the engagement of their Baughter, Lynn McNaughton Ford, a greatgranddaughter of Henry Ford, founder of the Ford Motor Company, to Paul D. Alandt, son of Mr. and Mrs. Clayton P. Alandt of Grosse Pointe Park.

title: DRIVE BEGUN TO STOP ABBREVIATING MAINE
description: AUGUSTA, Me., Dec. 7The editor and publisher of a monthly newspaper designed for those who live in Maine has begun a campaign to expunge the abbrveiation Me. from billboards, promotion and advertising sponsored by the state.

title: Teacher Is Appealing Ouster
description: BRICK TOWNSHIPKathleen Pietrunti, an outspoken teachers' rights leader, has asked the United States Supreme Court to reinstate her to her high school teaching post here.

title: Wall Hangings Express a Heritage
description: SAG HARBORLydie Egosi's search for identity is inexorably tied to her development as an artist. A French Jew who survived the holocaust, Mrs. Egosi found her creative milieu at abort the same time she began discovering her religious background.

title: Nutcracker' Due At the Paper Mill
description: MILLBURNThe New Jersey Ballet Company will present the first of 17 performances of Tchaikovsky's Nutcracker at the Paper Mill Playhouse on Dec. 18. Performances will continue through Dec. 29.

title: MUSIC VIEW
description: Nothing was made of it when the Indiana University Opera Theater gave its three performances of Busoni's Doctor Faust last month, but the revival (if the term can be used for such a littleplayed work) was also in the nature of an anniversary commemoration. Ferruccio Busoni, titanic pianist, and composer whose music is still a bit outside the repertory, died fifty years ago.

title: Governor's Concert Set for Thursday
description: TRENTONThe second annual Governor's Concert by the New Jersey Symphony Orchestra will be held here Thursday night.

title: UtilityRegulation Reform
description: MADISON, Wis.Last August the Wisconsin Public Service Commission, the agency responsible for, regulating utilities in this state, ordered the Madison Gas and Electric Company to revise its customer rates structure to a method which would make all customers pay for energy at a rate more closely related to the cost of producing and supplying it. Traditionally, the more a customer bought the less the charge.

title: Energy Rates Endangering Economy of the Northeast
How to Adapt Golf Game To the Chill of Winter
description: The typical weekend golfer plays until Labor Day and then hangs. up his clubs, assuming the season is over. He probably is passing up at least a dozen golf daysand a good chance to lower his handicap.

title: T. Christopher Thurlby to Wed Hope Alexie Leather
description: Sir Edwin Leather, Governor of Bermuda and Lady Leather of Pembroke Parish, Bermuda, and BathSomerset, England, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Hope Alexie Leather, to T. Christopher Thurlby of Bailey's Bay, Bermuda, son of Mr. and Mrs. Harold H. Thurlby of Pompano Beach, Fla., and Cataumet, Mass.

title: The World/ Continued
description: The white minority governments in South Africa and Rhodesia seem to have decided that some progress toward eventual racial equality is preferable to the risk of revolutions like those in other African countries.

title: Philip Hall Likes Me. I Reckon Maybe.
description: Anyone who has reached the saturation point on hearing songs of young love magnified and electronified and wailed by 8yearold rock stars in white studded suits may think that the last thing in the world they would want to read would be a book on an 11yearold's first crush. They'd be wrong. Because Philip Hall Likes Me. I Reckon Maybe is charming and fresh enough to waft away all strains of electronic luhhuhuve and bring first love back to what it isan intense, joydespair relationship somewhere between friendship and romance that seems, at the time, eternal.

title: Clark Residents Pull Together to Meet Growth Problems
description: CLARK  Longtime residents of this Union County township like to recall the days when most of the activity here centered around the output of the produce farms and excitement was provided by the goingson at the local airport or caddying for the outoftowners who came to play at the Locust Grove and Oak Ridge Golf Courses.

title: This Week in Sports
description: Nate Archibald and Jimmy Walker, two of the best shooting guards in pro basketball, will be on display in Madison Square Garden Tuesday night when the Kansas CityOmaha Kings face the New York Knickerbockers. Game time is 7:30. Saturday afternoon at 1:30, the Knicks will face the Buffalo Braves and their talented center, Bob McAdoo.Pete La Corte of Seton Hall, who will face St. Bonaventure Thursday as college basketball returns to the Garden.

title: Roster Changes Since the World Series
description: AMERICAN LEAGUE EAST

title: Gilbert, Sanderson Help Sink Hawks
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 7The New York Rangers trampled the Chicago Black Hawks tonight in a freewheeling, highscoring game, 74. The match in Chicago Stadium was the first meeting of the season between these two teams, and it was one of the Rangers' best efforts.

title: Let's Not Read Narrative Art Too Seriously
description: A perky, remarkably nice new avantgarde movement, or minimovement, has been attracting attention this year. Called Narrative or Story, it is the latest wrinkle in the manywrinkled Conceptual mode of the past few years, a mode that has presumed to elevate ideas about art over the traditional art work. Most other recent Conceptual offshoots have been pretty baleful, characterized by extreme and sometimes desperate behavior. In contrast, Narrative is a modest phenomenon involving work by some quite likable esthetic humorists and romancers.

title: G.O.P. REFORMERS WIN FIRST ROUND
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7 (UPI) Trying to guard against future Watergates, a Republican party reform committee approved today a farreaching al to give the Republican proposal Committee chairman more direct control over campaign expenditures by the party's Presidential candidates.

title: How well does the Consumer Price Index measure the inflated prices we pay for dog food and doctors, parking lots and paperbacks?
description: Statistics have changed, Julius Shiskin, Commissioner of the Bureau of Labor Statistics, was saying recently in his Washington office. When I came into the business, no one got excited except the professors. Now it's no longer an academic issue. Big bucks are involved. Shiskin, a short, stooped man of 62, has been shuffling numbers around most of his life, and he knows what he's talking about. His agency compiles the statistics that involve more money and probably exercise more people than any other: the Consumer Price Index, or C.P.I. And the faster the C.P.I, movesits 12.2 per cent increase in the last year is the highest annual rate since 1947the more people it seems to upset. It's not only the key indicator of the current runaway inflation but it also, in its own right, directly affects the income of millions of Americans.

title: Record U.S. Murder Rate Seen Lasting Into '80's
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7 (AP)A new Government report says that the record American murder rate rose, with the growth of the postWorld War II baby boom and a decline cannot be expected until that group ??aches age 30 or more in the 1980's.

title: Handbook Details
description: TRENTON  A handbook detailing how to lobbby bills through the State Legislature has been prepared by the Legislative Action Committee of the New Jersey Conference of Mayors. It will be available to the general public in many libraries throughout the state.

title: Teng TaiYuan Dead at 70; Central Committee Member
description: HONG KONG, Dec. 7 (UPI) Teng Taiyuan, member of the Chinese Communist party's Central Committee, died in Peking on Dec, 1 at the age of 70 after an undisclosed illness, the Hsinhua new agency said today.

title: Legislative Notes
description: TRENTONJust like every other New Jersey Governor, Brendan T. Byrne has finally run up against the legislative tradition of Senatorial courtesy, an unwritten rule that enables any State Senator to block a gubernatorial nominee from his (the Senator's) district.

title: SCHOOLS MAY KEEP DISTRICT BORDERS
description: Although the average daily attendance in some New York city school districts is below the requlred15,000 pupils, the Board of. Education said yesterday that. It would ask the State Legislature to permit the city's schooldistrict lines to remain unchanged at least for two years.

title: STAMPS
description: Sins of the past in the attitude of the government's postat service toward philatelyyears of disinterest and neglecthave been acknowl edged by a high official of the United States Postage Service, who voiced the promise of a new day.

title: Football Crown To Bergenfield
description: Bergenfield and Morristown High Schools coasted to New Jersey sectional football championships yesterday. Sterling also gained a title, but had a much tougher time in doing so.

title: SPACE FLIGHT TEST PLEASES SOVIET
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 7Two orbiting astronauts prepared today to return to earth in their Soyuz 16 spacecraft, winding up what has been described here as a successful rehearsal for the Joint SovietAmerican rendezvous in space planned for next July.

title: AROUND THE Garden
description: A number of gift plants in the metropolitan region, particularly poinsettias, will be wearing something new this year, a smell tag which reads, The soil in this pot contains Viterra.

title: Gay Bennett Fiancee of John Dworetzky
description: Mr. and Mrs. Allan Robert Bennett of Johnson County, Kan., have made known the engagement of their daughter, Gay Leslie Bennett, to John M. Dworetzky. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Lawrence H. Dworetzky of Devon, Pa. A wedding in August is planned.

title: CAMERA VIEW;A Guide to Compact 35's
description: As standard size fullframe 35mm single  lens  reflex cameras grow steadily larger and heavier, more and more photographers are turning to the multiplying bevy of compact 35mm cameras that have been introduced in the last few yearseither as a handy alternative to their bulkier big brothers, or as an easytocarry second camera for those occasions when their compact size or quickshooting capabilities are a decided asset.

title: The Region/continued
description: Lieutenant  Governor  elect Mary Anne Klupsak, a Democrat, has urged reforms in the state Legislature that constitute a challenge not only to the Republicans who control the Senate but also to her own party, dominant in the Assembly.

title: Miss M'Grath Bride of Paul Ahearn
description: Linda Ann McGrath, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edward J. McGrath of Short Hills and Bay Head, N. J., was married yesterday morning to Paul Matthew Ahearn, son of Mr. and Mrs. John Ahearn of Beverly, Mass.

title: Many Different Houses
description: There are two trends currently seizing public and publishers' fancy: doityourself and finding alternate lifestyles. The doityourself ethos has been at the heart of American consciousness since pioneer days. But alternate lifestyles, doing things differently teems to be a recent legacy of the sixties' sexual, political and cultural revolutions. Whatever the emphasis, from sex to psychotherapy, this attitude flourishes, bolstered by the shaky belief that humans can fashion, and thereby control, their own existences. Anyway, if you find you can't mold your own destiny, at least you can still shape your own immediate environment.

title: Research Library Appears Periled
description: MINEOLA  The Nassau County Research Library, a central resource facility in the planning stage for a decade, appears to be endangered by stringent cuts to be made in County Executive Ralph G. Caso's proposed 1975 budget. by the Board of Supervisors.

title: Which Tribe Do You Belong to?
description: Travelwriting is one of the less harmful expressions of perverse restlessness, an interlude for the portable imagination; all it takes is a strong stomach, a sense of occasion and an appetite for landscapes of dazzling sameness. There are mishaps, of course: a Lagos crowd looks as if it's going to trample you to death, a bantering African tries to snatch your expensive wristwatch, $1,000 gets' nicked from your hotel bedroom, and Pier Paolo Pasolini won't stop taking pictures of the colorful natives. But it is fairly glamorous as all travel seems in retrospect. (Why, are those really the famous Mountains of the Moon?) Before putting on my pith helmet and sitting down to read Alberto Moravia's collection of articles from 10 years' junketing in Africa, I read the South African novelist, Nadine Gordimer's superb new book The Conservationist and found myself writing later, There are so many versions of Africa it is almost possible to believe that the fixed place doesn't exist; not a continent, but an occasion. Miss Gordimer writes as a resident, and her version is a credible nightmare; Signor Moravia writes as a visitor, and his is much sunnier. Here he is describing an African dance: ... it must be said that the dance is merely the most striking aspect of the contagious primitive rhythm which the African has introduced into the modern world. This rhythm, which now seems to us an indivisible, ingrained part of industrial civilization, comes, on the contrary, straight from prehistoric, archaic times. It is the most precious gift that the African has ...

title: College to Present A Christmas Ballet
description: PEMBERTON  The Spell of Christmas Eve, a fulllength ballet choreographed by Phyllis Papa, director of the West Jersey Ballet Company, will be presented at the Burlington County College Little Theater Friday night. Curtain time is 8:30.

title: Union Reelects DeLury By Vote of 6,413 to 1,444
description: John J. DeLury, who has headed the 10,700member Unifotrned Sanitationmen's Association since 1938, survived the first challenge to his eadership by a vote of 6,413 to 1,444 in results of a mail ballot announced yesterday.

title: Married Veterans in School To Get Retroactive Pay
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7 (AP)Some married veterans going to school under the new G.I. education bill can expect to receive retroactive payments of nearly $300 during the week of Dec. 15.

title: STAGE VIEW
description: Suddenly everything has changed on Broadwayit's booming, that's what's changedand nobody knows why. In fact, one of the interesting things about it all is that nobody seems to want to know why. Ask around. One producer will give you a little shrug of a smile and suggest that business is always better in the theater when the economy as a whole is going to rot, a remark that may or may not be as idiotic as it sounds. Another, a soberer type, will point out that the upsurge, after all, says very little about the true state of the American theater inasmuch as the season's entire output thus far has consisted of revivals and British imports, an observation that is undeniably accurate but doesn't in the least dispose of the fact that there is an upsurge. A third may murmur something about the new Shubert regime's being good for the theater, helping to finance the shows it houses, and then instantly request that you not quote him by name. What I think is that everybody is terrified of talking about, or trying to analyze, the good fortune that has descended from the unpredictable heavens for fear that talking about it, or analyzing it, will somehow make it go away again. And of course it may go away again. The theater is right to be superstitious and has long since learned not to look gift in the mouth.

title: Fulbright Looks to Senate Vote On '25 Pact Banning Germ War
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7As of his final acts as chairman of the Senate Foreign Relations Committee, Senator J. W. Fulbright is seeking to obtain Senate approval for the 1925 Geneva protocol banning chemical and bacteriological warfare.

title: Ford Edges Muskie and Jackson iu Poll
description: If the Presidential election were being held now, either of two Democrats, Senator Edmund S. Muskie of Maine and Senator Henry M. Jackson of Washington, would give President Ford a close race, the Gallup Poll says.

title: The Fear to Lead
description: Times are nowhere near desperate enough to paraphrase President Franklin D. Roosevelt's great rallying Cry that the only thing we have to fear is fear itself. Still, it is a good thing to remember. This confusing assessment, voiced by President Ford in his news conference last week, is characteristic of the nation's leadership vacuum.

title: CARACAS DECREES MINE TAKEOVER
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, Dec.  President Carlos Andrs Prez announced today that the two American iron mining companies that comprise the country's ironore industry would be nationalized Jan. 1.

title: Letter Need For Review Is Stressed
description: To the Editor: The letter of the Great Neck Library director, Joseph Covino [BQLI Section, Nov. 24], has special significance for me. While I am not at the moment qualified to make a judgment as to whether the Nassau County Research Libraq should be built, I wholeheartedly concur with Mr. Cavino's demand that its feasibility and utility be reviewed.

title: Royal Shuttle to Athens
description: PARIS  Aristotle observed some 2,500 years ago: All men are ruled by their own interest and their interest lies in whatever preserves the state. He defined the forms of government as four: democracy, oligarchy, aristocracy and monarchy. Had he added one other Greek word, chaos, the spectrum would have been complete.

title: British Accuse 11 More In Pub Bombing Fatal to 5
description: LONDON, Dec. 7 (UPI)Eleven more persons faced charges today in connection with the bombing of a tavern in the town of Guildford two months agoin which five persons were killed.

title: Gift Prices Trimmed for Christmas
description: Christmas shoppers are being treated to some of the lowest prices in more than a year, and the price tags are likely to go even lower in the 14 shopping days that remain before Christmas.

title: Fraud by Computer Is Averted on Coast
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 7An alleged scheme to embezzle $2.5million from the Los Angeles City Treasury was broken up in two arrests here early today.

title: Aboard a Scottish Fishing Trawler: Not: for the Indolent
description: FOR 12 days I had been at sea aboard the Admiral Nelson, a fishing trawler operating out of the Scottish port city of Aberdeen. Now, as I sat in a local pub, someone asked me if I had enjoyed the trip.

title: Consumer Office Opens at College
description: A consumer center that will give students a chance to report frauds and errant business practices opened last week at Brooklyn College.

title: Nina McCullough, a Designer, Engaged
description: Mr. and Mrs. Donald F. McCullough of New York have announced the engage, ment of Mr. McCullough's daughter, Nina Kier McCullough, to David Rogerson Williams 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Williams Jr, of Nogales, Ariz., and New York. A wedding next summer is planned.

title: The men behind Nixon (or were they in front?)
description: To the televisionviewing public, Dan Rather's raised eyebrow may have conveyed more about the collapsing Nixon Administration than all the linear media combined. Now, together with Gary Paul Gates, a writer at CBS, Rather comes up with a book showing that, as CBS's White House correspondent, he was taking notes all those years, too. The resulting examination of The Palace Guard, while dotted with many gossipy new anecdotes, consists mostly of conventional analysis in the service of a thesis that is probably wide of the mark.

title: Oil Company Executives Assail Ford Effort to Reduce World Prices
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 7Executives of major international oil companies contend that the Ford Administration's campaign to drive down world oil prices cannot succeed and could even lead to price increases.

title: Watching the unemployment rate
description: The other great publicity glutton in the stable of economic statistics is the unemployment rate, and, like the Consumer Price Index, it's being used increasingly as a trigger mechanism to regulate Government programs. The Comprehensive Employment and Training Act  basically, revenuesharing to states and localities for manpower training programsincludes a formula that favors areas with the highest reported unemployment rates. White House proposals for supplemental unemployment benefits and public service jobs also focus on localities with the highest unemployment rates.

title: Kirsten Jacobsen Wed to W. H. Brown
description: Kirsten Jacobsen, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Jens W. Jacobsen of Glen Cove, L. I., was married yesterday afternoon to Wade Hampton Brown, Son of Mrs, Henry G. Frankenbach of Sands Point, L. I., and the late John H. Brown Jr. The, Rev. Jack H. Hascup performed the ceremony in the Brookville (L. I.) Reformed Church.

title: Art ARCHITECTURE VIEW
description: PETER COOPER was a selfmade man with a a fortune from glue and iron rails and a passionate attachment to. New York. He founded and endowed the Cooper Union for the Advancement of the Arts and Sciences, a tuitionfree school open to anyone of good moral character, and housed it in the Foundation Building at Astor Place in the 1850's. At the time, the building stood for the most advanced 19thcentury technology and style, in the structural use of early steel beams and in the Italianate chic of Fred A. Petersen's arcaded facade.

title: Winterproof the Greenery
description: Winter hardiness is a plant's tolerance of winter cold. Considerable knowledge in this area exists but horticulturists and plant scientists are still learning. When plants do not have or lose this tolerance, they are susceptible to cold damage.

title: Folklore Inspires Yule Tree Exhibit
description: LINCROFTAn exhibition of Christmas trees inspired by folklore and fairytales will be held at the Monmouth Museum from today through Jan. 11.

title: ACES PACE FIELD IN TITLE BRIDGE
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Dec. 7 The Aces team held a slender lead here today going into the semifinal stage of the toughest event of the American Contract Bridge League's Fall Nationals.

title: Barbara Matusow, TV Producer, Is Married to Jack Nelson
description: Barbara Joan Matusow, a television producer for NBC News in Washington, was married yesterday afternoon to Jack Nelson, chief of the Washington bureau of The Los Angeles Times. The Rev. Jerry Crossley, a Methodist minister, performed the ceremony at the Barclay in Philadelphia.

title: Future Social Events
description: Short for a Good Cause Dec. 9 Sixty dollars wilt give you a Carlyle Hotel dinner and An Evening with Bobby Short, whose torte for the piano is legend. The New York City Affiliate of the National Council on Alcoholism will benefit. Mrs. Andrew Goodman is chairman; Mrs. George Zauderer and Mrs. R. Brinkley Smithers are cochairmen. Tickets from Suite 200, 95 Madison Avenue.

title: Tenants Urged To Pay Arrears
description: Residents who have been resisting sharp increases in monthly carrying charges at the large Rochdale Village cooperative apartment development in Queens are now being advised by their leaders to pay the increases. They are also being counseled to pay up to an estimated $450,000 in carryingcharge arrears that have accumulated as a result of the resistance.

title: Article 4  No Title
FILM VIEW
description: The nineteenthirties did exist. At long last moviemakers have gotten around to certifying this fact, and with a vengeance. It used to be that people who were responsible for the production of films were only at ease in period films if they were about the Roaring Twenties and the Gay Nineties. Then they loosened up. They began to remember the Forties, the Fifties and even the Sixties. The Thirties were always there, of course, but except for isolated films, the Thirties were years most filmmakers avoided.

title: Caution Toward China
description: The announcement that President Ford will visit China next year, with its implication that diplomatic recognition will follow, simply underlines the growing uneasiness in Washington about our policy of dtente with the People's Republic of China.

title: The Arabs as Oil Salesmen
description: RIYADH, Saudi ArabiaThe national oil companies of the major oilproducing countries, with Saudi Arabia in the lead, have begun a drive to squeeze the big international companies out of their traditional role as primary suppliers of petroleum to the industrial world.

title: Howard Is Victor In soccer
description: ST. LOUIS, Dec. 7 Kenneth Ilodigwe; a freshman from Nigeria scored a goat in the fourth overtime today that give Howard a 21 victory over St. Louis and the National Collegiate Athletic Association soccer title.

title: Two Counties Act On Recalled Drugs
description: BRANCHBURGThe 100member SomersetHunterdon County Pharmaceutical Association has developed a program to get recalled drugs out of households as quickly, as possible.

title: BEAME ASKS M.T.A. TO CUT ITS BUDGET
description: Mayor Beame called yesterday for the Metropolitan Transportation Authority, which receives a sizable subsidy from city funds, to reduce its budget in conformity with the cuts in the city's budget that the Mayor is implementing.

title: India Sues Simon For Return of Idol Allegedly Stolen
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 7 (AP) The Government of India has filed a $1.5million damage suit against Norton Simon, alleging the millionaire investor and art collector had bought a rare religious idol knowing it was stolen from India.

title: Impact is Wide When Detroit Goes Flat
description: Detroit is deep in its own private depression, as the unsold cars pile up on the lots, and the lines of laid off workers lengthen outside the unemployment  benefit window.

title: Connecticut Researchers Study Humane Slaughter
description: STORRS, Conn.Prof. Rat P. Prince's research here at the University of Connecticut affects almost everybody, but most people would rather not hear about itor see it.

title: Roads of Cambodia Scarred by FiveYearOld War
description: PHNOM PENH, CambodiaThe roads of Cambodia, which radiate like spokes from the hub of Phnom Penh, are virtually, the samelong stretoches where not a single house stands.

title: Driver's Helpful Step Helps Stop a Theft
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 7 ((UPI) A bus driver heading home from a date saw what he thought was a fellow Chicago Transit Authority driver in a stalled bus early today. He stopped to help. The driver, Jossie L. Jollie, introduced himself and went to work on the engine. The driver of the stalled bus, John L. Jones, 21 years old, moved to a back seat.

title: The Great CoverUp
description: If Richard Nixon were not out of office, in disgrace and failing health, this would be among the most important books published about the Watergate scandal. It sets forth with clarity the compelling case for Nixon's complicity in the Watergate coverup that can be made without the enormouslyultimately fatally  damaging evidence contained in the White House tapes released last summer. The book thus makes all the more disturbing the prospect that without the smoking pistol that the tapes finally revealed, Nixon would still be in power today despite an awesome amount of evidence against him.

title: A PRISONER ESCAPES FROM U.S. JAIL HERE
description: A prisoner apparently used a volleyball net as an escape rope to help him flee the Federal House of Detention at 427 West Street at West 11th Street yesterday afternoon.

title: Behind Ford's Veto Spree Is Trumanesque Strategy
description: WASHINGTONShortly after President Ford assumed office last August, he had a portrait of Harry Truman hung in the Cabinet Room. When Mrs. Ford redecorated the Oval Office a few days ago, while the. President was in Last Asia, she had a bust of Mr. Truman, along with one of Lincoln, placed in a prominent position, presumably at her husband's request. Mr. Ford clearly has the former President from Missouri on his mind, and thereby hangs the best explanation available as to why he has challenged so unequivocally and so unsuccessfully the Congress in which he served for so many years.

title: Canadiens Turn Back Penguins
description: MONTREAL, Dec. 7 (UPI) Guy Lafleur scored three goals in the third period tonight as the Montreal Canadiens helped Coach Scotty Bowman celebrate his 500th National Hockey League game by defeating the Pittsburgh Penguins, 52.

title: The World
description: With West German Chancellor Helmut Schmidt as a pivotal figure, the Communist industrial nations have begun to achieve progress in their prolonged attempts at unity in dealings with the oil producers, even though some governments still seem inclined to enter bilateral deals with the oil nations.

title: Group Helps Cancer Victims and Families to Accept Disease
description: HAMPTON BAYS  For four months Regina Krajewski silently watched her husband, Zigmund, die of cancer.

title: 6 Children Killed as Blaze Sweeps a House in Beacon
description: BEACON, N. Y., Dec. 7 Six children died when a flash fire apparently caused by leaking gas engulfed a twostory 100yearold house shortly after 7 o'clock this morning.

title: Rape Unit Tries to Aid Victims
description: MINEOLA  To help the victim is the best feeling in the world, the lawyer Said. We are the prosecutor's office, but we are first interested in justice.

title: Child for Mrs. Aurelius
description: A daughter was born Nov. 27 to Mr. and Mrs. Brynn F. Aurelius of Houston in the Houston Northwest Medical Center. Mrs. Aurelius, whose husband is a lawyer with the Shell Oil Company, is the former S. Wren Kennard of Bloomfield Hills, Mich. The child has been named Carrie Wren.

title: B.H. Russell to Marry Miss Collins
description: Mr. and Mrs. Everett G. King of Troy, N.Y., have announced the engagement of Mrs. King's daughter, Marcia Ebin Collins, to Benjamin Harvey Russell, son of Mr. and Mrs. John B. Russell Jr. of Rumson, N.J.

title: Red Smith
description: Sixteen years ago last May, the 16 clubs in the major leagues resolved that the major leagues recognize the desire of certain groups to attain major league franchises, and since there is no existing plan to expand the major leagues, the two major leagues hereby declare they will favorably consider an application for major league status within the present baseball structure by an acceptable group of eight clubs. Ten qualifying requirements were listed, all of which were promptly met by charter members of a group called the Continental League. The cities in this league were New York, DallasFort Worth, Denver, MinneapolisSt. Paul, Toronto, Buffalo; Atlanta and Houston.

title: SOVIET SAID TO CUT ITS FOREIGN AID
description: PARIS, Dec. 7The Soviet Union cut back its aid to developing countries between 1970 and 1973, wilt considerably smaller amounts going tit Cuba and North Vietnam, the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development reported this week.

title: Boonton Building Is Volunteer Effort
description: BOONTON TOWNSHIPThis community's new Municipal Building does not have a traditional plaque embedded in its walls, one engraved with the names of the township fathers at the time of its dedication.

title: TWO ARE WOUNDED IN SUVW AY SHOOTOUT
description: A suspected robber was shot twice in the neck and a Transit Authority detective was slightly wounded in a shootout last night during an alleged holdup at an elevated subway station in the Bronx, the police said.

title: Charged in Sugar Theft
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 7 (UPI)A restaurant busboy, Kenneth Coe, 17 years old, was charged with theft after being spotted carrying a 50pound sack of sugar at a subway stop. The police said it belonged to Mr. Coe's employer and was worth $32.50.

title: Cynthia Kendall Fiancee of Donald Morrongiello
description: Cynthia Kendall of Oyster Bay, L. I., head of the social studies department at the Garden City (L. I.) Senior High School, and Donald Anthony Morrongiello of Floral Park, L. I., an English teacher at the Elmont (L I.) Memorial High School, plan to be married in June at the Episcopal Cathedral of the Incarnation in Garden City.

title: The 38th First Lady: not a robot at all
description: Pretty surreal, all this. Look at them. He has the hardest job in the world. She is recovering from radical surgery for cancer. He will be 62 in July, she 57 in April, but there they are beaming on the balcony of their new house, like carefree juniors at a prom. Tennessee Ernie, also surnamed Ford, is serenading them below. Television cameras whir as he sings Anniversary Waltzhardly a tune to make liberals hark back to the days of Camelot, but an apt one all the same. Elizabeth Bloomer married Gerald Rudolph Ford Jr. 26 years ago Oct. 15, and was a dancer before she ever heard of him.

title: District 9 SitIn Will Continue Until Meeting With Chancellor
description: A group of parents and employes of Community School District 9 in the Bronx said yesterday that they would continue their occupancy of district headquarters until they were gratited a meeting with Chancellor Irving Anker or had presented their side of the controvsy to the court.

title: Miss Orban, Tenney Cartmell Wed
description: In the chapel of St. Ignatius Loyola Roman Catholic Church here yesterday afternoon, Dorothy Otban, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John JohnsonOrban of New York, became the bride of Tenney Cartmell, son of Mrs. Van Henry Cartmell, also of New York, and the late Mr. Cartmell.

title: What They Are Saying
description: Don Fambrough, after resigning as head football coach at the University of Kansas: I know one thing. I'm not going to have that stomach ache on Friday nights anymore.

title: Anita Kernan, Denis A. Halton To Wed Jan. 18
description: Mr. and Mrs. Walter A. Kernan of New York have announced the engagement of their daughter, Anita Kernan, to Denis Alastair Halton, son of Mr. and Mrs. Denis C. Halton of Harrietsham, Kent. England, where the elder Mr. Halton is a horticultural contractor. Miss Kernan's father is a partner with the law firm of Carter, Ledyard & Milburn.

title: Paperbacks
description: 1 BURR, by Gore Vidal. (Bantam, $1.95.) Clever, irreverent historical novel about Aaron Burr and the founding fathers.

title: Cordero Wins Twice In a Split Discovery
description: Angel Cordero enjoyed a fine day at Aqueduct yesterday in winning both ends of the Discover? Handicap. He took the first section of the 1 mile test on Sigmund Sommer's Rube the Great, whom he steered to a 4length score over Holding Pattern in the field of eight.

title: Cities Sprucing Up Seedy Rail and Dock Area
description: CHICAGOBy the dawn of the 21st Century, if everything goes according to plan, the City of Chicago will have created in its bustling downtown business section a citywithinthecity housing some 120,000 people on what are now obsolete, unsightly railroad yards.

title: Suffolk Unit Seeks to Buy Housing In Hamptons
description: WFSTHAMPTONThe Suffolk Community Development Corporation will move to acquire 171 units of housing at the former Suffolk Air Force Base here. Vacant since 1970, when they were declared surplus, the twothree and fourbedroom apartments on 91 acres on the outskirts of Westhampton Beach will be offered for sale by the General Services Administration before the end of the year.

title: N. Y Fireboats Help State
description: CARTERET  New Jersey communities and industries along the Kill Van Kull, Newark Bay, Arthur Kill and Raritan Bay waterfronts must depend upon the marine companies of the New York Fire. Department for protection because none have their own fireboats. The shore is lined with many piers, warehouses, diversified heavy industries and refineries.

title: Public Hearings Slated By City Council Units
description: Following are public hearings by City Council committees to be held this week:

title: COAL BURNING BAN A SCHOOL PROBLEM
description: In the midst of a fuelsupply shortage that has made heating oil scarce and expensive, the Board of Education finds itself under a mandate to end the burning of coal in school buildings by next June to improve air quality in the city.

title: Brooklyn Directory For Aged Published
description: A directory of services available to senior citizens has been published by Kingsborough Comunity College.

title: Business/People
description: Small New Jersey enterprises, especially those beset with the joint problems of inflation and recession, may find, financial and Managerial assistance from the Small Business Administration.

title: Christmas Packages
description: Paperback publishers are young sprigs in the family of bookmen, but they have already developed a tradition or two of their own. One of the most seasonably agreeable of these is their practice of gathering some of their perennially popular titles into attractive boxes and shrinkwrapped packages to serve as stocking stutters, welcome alternatives to such Yuletide standbys as toys, candy and bottled goods. It's probably a sign of the economic times that retailers are already reporting that the sets are being grabbed up more eagerly this year than ever before. Here is a highly select list picked from the 150 packages you'll find at your dealer's:

title: The Revival of a LongLost Reputation
description: Elihu Vedder, the latest American artist to be selected for review by the Department of Rehabilitated Reputations, was born in 1836 and died in 1923. When he went to Italy to study painting, Ingres and Delacroix were still fighting it out in Paris as the academic champ versus the romantic challenger. But by the time Vedder died, Impressionism had come and gone and Picasso had put Cubism behind him in favor of his monumental neoclassical manner. Rodin, Renoir, C6zanne, Gauguin, Van Gogh, Modigliani and Schiele all were born and died during Vedder's lifetime. As a precocious adolescent he might have read The Scarlet Letter and Moby Dick upon publication; he missed The Great Gatsby by one year.

title: Owner of Queens Bar Slain, Apparently in a Robbery
description: The 64yearold owner of the Bear Bar and Grill at 18427 Jamaica Avenue, Jamaica, Queens, was found shot to death in the cellar of the bar yesterday in what detectives described as an apparent robberyhomicide.

title: News From the Cardboard Battlefront
description: In a war room in Germany three General Staff officersGeneral Adolf Galland of the Luftwaffe, General Heinz Trettner of the Airborne High Command, and Admiral Frederich Ruge, Commodore of the Kreigsmarine's minesweeping flotilla in the English Channel sat waiting for the precise moment to launch their attack on England. In another war room, in London, Air Chief Marshal Sir Christopher FoxleyNorris and Spitfire Squadron Leader Wing Commander Stamford Tuck waited to be attacked.

title: The Nutcracker Kids Ifs Hard Work
description: The Nutcracker, the New York City Ballet's traditional holiday extravaganza, is in full swing. Its 150 dancers and musicians, its 82 children, its magic Christmas tree, its winter wonderland, and its kingdom of the Sugar Plum Fairy can now be marveled at all month at the New York State Theater at Lincoln Center.

title: Gang Beating Causes Black to Leave Boston
description: BOSTON, Dec. 7 (AP)A 48yearold black man who was beaten by a gang of whites in South Boston this fall said today he was leaving Boston for good because he was afraid to walk the streets.

title: QUOTAS ASSAILED IN FACULTY HIRING
description: Several dozen prominent uni versity professors have signed a letter to President Ford opposing the Federal Government's affirmativeaction plan for increasing the proportion of women and minority members on the faculties of higher educational institutions.

title: Jennifer Anne Davoud Married To the Rev. Henri M. Whitman
description: Jennifer Anne Davoud and the Rev. Henri Morton Whitman were married yesterday afternoon in Williamsburg, Va. The Rev. Dominic Aquila, a Reformed Presbyterian minister, performed the ceremony in the Bruton Parish Church. He was assisted, by the Rev. James C. Petty Jr., an Orthodox Presbyterian minister, as is the bridegroom.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Reminiscing Brings Hunter Thoughts of Unicorns
description: Some time early in the 16th century, or late in the 15th, an unknown artist was inspired to marry the traditional medieval stag hunt and the quest for the legendary unicorn.

title: DEMOCRATS ADOPT A PARTY CHARTER; WALKOUT AVOIDED
description: KANSAS CITY, Dec. 7The Democratic midterm confer ence adopted the first national. party charter in American his tory tonight after a lastminute compromise averted the possibility of a walkout by militant blacks.

title: W. J. Vitale 3d Will Wed Miss Mermann
description: Dr. and Mrs. Alan Cameron Mermann of Guilford, Conn., and West Tisbury, Mass., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Constance McCree Mermann, to William Joseph Vitale 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Vitale Jr. of New Hyde Park, L.I., and Lake George, N.Y.

title: Job Market Eyed By More Women
description: MONfCLAIRVictims of social pressure caught in a growing economic crunch, suburban women in increasing numbers are contemplating reentry into the job market.

title: The man who bought and made The Washington Post
description: One day in 1933, Eugene L. Meyer, who was talking about retiring after making millions on Wall Street and serving 13 years as a superbureaucrat in Washington, walked down the front hall stairway of his home and spotted dust on the banister, This house is not properly run, he snapped at his wife.

title: Suffolk Acts on Farm Sites
description: HAUPPAUGE  Suffolk County's ambitious farmlandpreservation program, three years in the planning stages, will enter its initial phase next week when 1,200 owners of more than 56,000 open, agricultural acres will be invited to tell the county how much they want for the development rights to their property.

title: Oregon Gets Pornography Law, But Wide Crackdown Doubted
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Dec. 7 Oregon got a new pornography law this week, but most district attorneys. In the state said there would be no, sudden crackdowns, and a few said they would prosecute only after grand jury action.

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTON  Representative Thomas M. Rees, a Democrat from Los Angeles, has issued a press release that seems to argue that the oil industry can produce more oil than it doesand at a profitif it wants to.

title: Editors' Choice
description: Fiction

title: The Box Man
description: This is the record of a box man. So begins Kobo Ab's spooky novel that crawls under the bedclothes of our own mad century to examine the pathology of a murderous, spying everyman in a town called T. The landscape is hardly peculiar to Japan: trees, concrete, a bridge, a sweet potato field, a bathhouse, an anonymous hospital, and a seaside park. The novel's push is speculative rather than visual. It is one of those swirling fictions that pounce into nasty corners like an extravagant Ping Pong ball.

title: LETTERS
description: [This section received many letters in response to Richard Burton's article To Play Churchill Is to Hate Him, published on Nov. 24. In that article, Mr. Burton, who was to appear in the rote of Winston Churchill on an NBC television show, declared, I hate Churchill and all his kind. . . . all of history's . . . indirectly great killers. The following are a selection of the letters received.]

title: Tourne Valley Coalition Marks an Anniversary
description: BOONTON TOWNSHIPA picnic in Tourne Park, an area it trying to preserve, marked the Tourne Valley Coalition's first anniversary celebration.

title: MitchellLama Housing Beset by Problems, but City Sees Progress in Solving Them
description: Plagued by inflation, problems in renting certain new projects and serious construction defects In others already occupied, the city's key program for _ building come housing is experiencing serious financial problems that threaten its soundness.

title: INVESTING
description: Stock prices, is measured by the Dow Jones industrial average, tumbled to a 12year low Friday under the weight of plant shutdowns, rising unemployment and a malaise of disenchantment with the equity market.

title: STUDY DELINEATES JEWS IN AMERICA
description: A Jewish community of affluence and poverty, of college graduates with little Jewish education, of waning religious observance combined with rising rates of intermarriage is depicted in a study released by the American Jewish Congress and the American section of the World Jewish Congress.

title: Serving The Young
description: The results of the November elections, in which 75 generally younger and more liberal Democrats were added to the House of Representatives, have provided the thrust for perhaps the Most significant reorganization in 27 years in the way the House conducts its business.

title: Queens Protesting Growth of O.T.B.
description: Queens, the home county of Aqueduct Racetrack and the closest of the city's boroughs to Belmont, has developed an Inhospitable attitude toward expansion by the Offtrack Betting Corporation.

title: Snowball Throwing Penalty
description: HAMILTON, Ohio, Dec. 7 (UPI)Two 18yearold youths arrested for throwing snowballs containing rocks have been sentenced to six months in jail. Municipal Court Judge Richard Berridge handed dawn the sentences to William Curtis Price and Mark S. Gordon, charged with throwing snowballs at the home of a local couple.

title: Budget Debate in Nassau
description: MINEOLAMore than 400 Nassau County residents spent more than six hours at two public hearings on the county's proposed record budget for 1975 last Monday, but the effect that their presente and speeches will have on the final budget was//unclear.

title: Music: By Tiberiu Olah
description: In some of the Eastern European countries, composers of socalled avantgarde music are able to write as they please. One of those countries is Rumania, and one of its composers who is keeping up with the times is Tiberiu Olah. On Friday night, there was a chance to become acquainted with a sample of his music when the Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Center gave the premiere of his The Time of Memory. It had been commissioned by the Koussevitsky Music Foundation for the society.

title: CHESS
description: The positional pawn sacrifice is a gambit whose objective is the exploitation of superior mobility to capitalize on the opponent's pawn weaknesses, rather than the production of a mating attack. Its idea is the recovery of the offered material while retaining the advantage in maneuverability.

title: Mayor of San Juan Realizes a Dream in Becoming Head of League of Cities
description: HOUSTON, Dec, 7He relaxed with his glass of Scotch and water as aides scurried about, whispered in his ear and showed him pages of typewritten material. Carlos RomeroBarcel, Mayor of San Juan, smiled, because all was going well.

title: The Good Word. A Moral Problem
description: And I said to hint Dickie Bird, why do you sit, Singing wallow, tit wallow tit wallow?

title: A View From Con Ed's Dim Executive Suite
description: The Consolidated Edison Building on Manhattan's Irving Place, once the brightest and bestheated corporate headquarters in town, is a chilly place full of spooky corridors and dimly lit offices these winter days.

title: Alcoholism Bill Set for Assembly Action
description: TRENTON  Legislation designed to eliminate all criminal penalties for drunkenness and establish regional treatment centers for alcoholics has been cleared for action in the Assembly.

title: Cookbooks Continued
description: PLAYBOY'S WINE AND SPIRITS COOKBOOK by Thomas Mario (Playboy Press, $16.95) is excellent because in the recipes it goes easy on the hooch. The author, who started out as a professional cook, knows how to explain the virtues and pitfalls of cooking with wine and spirits.

title: No Further Contempt for Coast Writer
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 7 (AP)William T. Farr, a reporter who had been jailed for 46 days on contempt charges in connection with his reporting on the trial of Charles Manson, has come another step toward freedom from further imprisonment in the case.

title: Big Eight Rowing Slated
description: KANSAS CITY, Dec. 7 (AP) Kansas State, Nebraska and Oklahoma State will compete in the first Big Eight Conference rowing championship next May 3 at Shawnee Mission Park Lake in Kansas.

title: Girl, 8, Found Slain in Jersey
description: ROCKAWAY TOWNSHIP, N.J., Dec. 7An 8yearold girl was found slain this morning in the White Meadow Lake wee here, and a 13yearold boy was arrested.

title: An Arabwatcher perceives a grand design keyed to a peace settlement with Israel
description: In Arab politics, as in any, selfinterest and specific national objectives count most. If they did not, then the recent decision of the Arab summit to proclaim the Palestine Liberation Organization over King Hussein of Jordan as the rightful ruler of any part of Palestine that Israel may relinquishand indeed the entire texture of Arab tactics and strategywould seem to contain neither rhyme nor reason. True, the Arabs generally perceive that since the October war of last year the equation of power in the world has shifted in their favor, that with unity, perseverance and their vast wealth they will prevail in their common purpose of regaining the lands they lost to Israel in 1967. But there exist other convolutions we must consider to grasp the of things.

title: The Rise and Decline of Mr. Mills
description: Wilbur Mills's 35year career in the House of Representatives has been distinguished by all the hallmarks that lead to high office: He has worked hard, he has gained expertise in tax and fiscal matters, he has cultivated important friendships and he has seemed a model of prudence and propriety.

title: Pearl Harbor19411974
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7On the 33d anniversary of Pearl Harbor, the nation was not under serious military threat from any foreign power, but at home more people were unemployed than in thirteen years, the stock market was at its lowest point in a dozen years, and while the country was very rich, it wasn't very happy.

title: TUNIS HIJACKERS HANDED TO P.L.O.
description: A TUNIS, Dec. 7 (AP)Four dissident Palestinian guerrillas who hijacked a British plane to Tunis last month and executed a passenger have voluntarily surrendered to the Palestine Liberation Organization, Tunisla's Interior Minister, Tahar Belkhodja, announced today.

title: State's Refineries Are Cutting Back
description: PAULSBOROThe Mobil Oil Corporation, which has a refinery here that dates to 1917, is one of four major oil companies that are curtailing their longrange plans for refining petroleum at New Jersey installations.

title: FolkMusic Concert Slated in Princeton
description: PRINCETON  Lewis London, a musician and singer, will present a concert Friday at the Witherspoon Presbyterian Church, Witherspoon and Quarry Streets. The concert which will begin at 8:15 P.M., is sponsored by the Princeton FolkMusic Society.

title: David de Milhau, Bond Trader, Marries Marjorie S. Munson
description: In Trinity Episcopal Church in Southport, Conn., yesterday afternoon, Marjorie Smith Munson, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Charles S. Munson Jr., and David Livsey de Milhau, son of Mr. and Mrs. John W. de Milhau of Riverside, Conn., were married by the Rev. William A. Dimmick.

title: The Arab Money Is Going Into a Mixed Portfolio
description: LONDONShopping for investments in the West with some of the largest checkbooks in history, the oilproducer states are acting like big, but not overhasty, spenders.

title: 17 Survivors Gather to Remember Pearl Harbor
description: Seventeen survivors of the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor gathered at Fort Schuyler in the Bronx yesterday afternoon to take part in a memorial service for the soldiers and sailors who were killed 33 years ago.

title: Even Vitamin C Is Up in Cost
description: BELVIDERE  The retail price of Vitamin C do powder form, which many physicians contend is vital to the health of millions of Americans, has more than doubled over the last year.

title: Road Vote Is Delayed
description: HAUPPAGUEThe Suffolk County Planning Commission has postponed taking any action on the proposed Sunrise Highway extension. The 15member board, which had to schedule informational public hearings on the controversial issue before it either endorsed or rejected the bypass, voted Wednesday to table action until such time as the road becomes an active issue, according to Lee Koppelman, executive director of the NassauSuffolk Regional Planning Board.

title: Elderly Eagerly Await 158Unit Project
description: NORTH BRUNSWICKAlmost too good to be true. That, in essence, is the attitude of many of this community's elderly as they contemplate townshipUnited Auto Workers plans to break ground next summer for a sevenstory, 158unit apartment house in the center of town.

title: Greeks Are Voting Today On Future of Monarchy
description: ATHENS, Dec. 7The Greek people will decide tomorrow between restoration of the monarchy or creation of a republic.

title: Amy Tankoos Plans Bridal
description: The engagement of Amy Lynne Tankoos to Dr. Joseph Michael Ballo, son of Mr. and Mrs. Ballo of Bromine, N.Y., has been announced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Harry Tankoos Jr. of Lake Success, L.I. A wedding next June is planned.

title: Harmony Is Keynote Of Baseball Owners
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 7The major leagues traded 39 players and buried one hatchet here this week in one of baseball's most significant business conventions.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Dr. Paul Hardin, 43yearold former president of Southern Methodist University, was named yesterday as the ninth president of Drew University in Madison, N. J. Dr. Hardin, who is also a past president of Wofford College, will assume his new post Feb, 1. He succeeds Dr. Robert F. Oxnam, who served from 1961 until shortly before his death last summer.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given In Eastern Standard Time

title: Response to Commissioner Shiskin
description: The following comment was prompted by an article on recession last week by Julius Shiskin [The Changing Business Cycle]. It was written by Geoffrey H. Moore, vice presidentresearch of the National Bureau of Economic Research.

title: It's Mets Vs. Phils In Opener
description: Tug McGraw may open and close, the baseball season in Shea Stadium next year, but in a Philadelphia uniform. The Phillies, who traded for the popular bullpen pitcher, come in for both the Shea opener on Tuesday, April 8, (the first of 34 Mets afternoon, home games) and the finale on Sunday Sept. 21, according to the Mets' 1975 schedule, announced yesterday.

title: MONGOLIA AND U.S. FIND TIES ELUSIVE
description: ULAN BATOR, Mongolia, Nov. 30  Nearly two years ago, United States representatives at the United Nations approached the Mongolian delegation and proposed that they discuss establishing diplomatic ties between the two countries.

title: Israel Sees Herself in the Middle Of Power Politics in Sports
description: It is terrible and tragic that some nations find it impossible to separate sports from politics. The recent action by the Asian Football Confederation in ejecting Israel from further competition in its program is the latest in a lengthy list of violations of the goodwill created by international competition in sports.

title: Dave Anderson
description: Sometime soon, perhaps this week, a group of eight attorneys and garmentcenter millionaires will be introduced formally as the financiers of a new World Football League team in New York that plans to play in the remodeled Yankee Stadium, beginning with the 1976 season. They already have spurned an opening bid from Joe Namath, now of the New York Jets, to join their club as quarterback and principal owner. Namath's exorbitant price was 51 per cent of the stock plus a $1million bonus from the W.F.L. for deserting the National Football League.

title: Nobel Economist Sees Joblessness Growing
description: STOCKHOLM, Dec. 7 (Reuters)Unemployment in countries such as the United States, Britain and West Germany is likely to become much higher before the economic situation gets better, Prof. Friedrich Von Hayek, the Nobel Prizewinning economist, said today.

title: Top Award In Dog Show To Wire Fox
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 7A wire fox terrier, Ch. Aryee Dominator, who has been dominating the dog show scene in the Midwest, made a triumphant Eastern invasion today and dominated the 80th Philadelphia event in the Civic Center.

title: PRESIDENT SEEKS AN ENERGY POLICY
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7President Ford undertook today his first detailed examination of what is to be a national energy policy.

title: Christmas Wonderland in Miniature
description: MAYWOODWhat people in this tidy, little Bergen County community tend to forget is that Diane Boyce is only 15 years old. And small wonder! This is her second year as the local library's arts and crafts teacher, and the fourth year that the big case at the library entrance will feature her Christmastree ornaments.

title: Moscow's Food: A Tantalizing Guide
description: The notion of a Moscow restaurant guide is likely to evoke smiles of derision among visitors and foreign residents of the Soviet capital. Many of them count dining out, from the plea for admittance at the door to the excruciatingly slow serving of mediocre food in highceilinged, marblecdlumned premises, among the less pleasurable experiences of their stay.

title: Best Seller List
description: Bailed on reports from more than 250 bookstores in 110 ?? throughout the State States. Weeks are not ??.

title: Nancy Farber Betrothed
description: Mr. and Mrs. S. Edmond Farber of Bellmore, L. I., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Nancy Ellen Farber of Brookline, Mass., to Scott A. Wasserman of Brookline, son of Mr. and Mrs. Isadore Wasserman of Chestnut Hill, Mass. The bridetobe is a graduate of Fairleigh Dickinson University. Her fianc attended Boston University.

title: Makarios Back in Cyprus; Vows to Resist Partition
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, Dec. 7Amid jubilation and an outpouring of tens of thousands of Greek Cypriotes, President Makarios returned today to the capital from which he fled for his life daring a coup last July.

title: Paperbacks
