description: Getting and spending, we lay in waste our powers, leafing through catalogues for hours and hours, each of them predicted on a common assumption that the path to Nirvana is private consumption.

title: Heeding The Call For Help
description: The times call for action by voluntary agencies. For years it has seemed that the government might do everything and one wondered about the special role of a social agency like the Community Service Society. Now the government appears to be doing a great deal less, and the Society moves thoughtfully to serve the people of New York.

title: KISSINGER WARNS ARMS PACT FOES IMPERIL DETENTE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7Secretary of State Kissinger said today that a failure by Congress to approve the armscontrol agreement initiated at Vladivostok could spur a new arms race and pose extremely serious consequences to relations with the Soviet Union.

title: W.F.L. Needs Large (Financial) Reserves
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Dec. 6 Wanted: a halfdozen new team owners for an ongoing pro football league. Performance bond of $2.5million required. Future unlimited for get  poor  slowly scheme. Apply World Football League, Newport Beach, Calif. It would be appropriate for Chris Hemmeter, a construction magnate from Honolulu, and Don Regan, the league counsel, to place ads in financial journals so as to find the saviors of the World Football League, an organization that's not all bad. Hemmeter, the new president, and Regan are the heirs to Gary Lynn Davidson, the founder of the W.F.L., which concluded its first rocky season hereon Thursday night with assets and debits.

title: Dining Out in Jersey
description: The restaurants reviewed here are rated four stars to none, based on the writer's judgment of quality in relation to the price of meals and the quality of comparable establishments. Roughly, one star may be translated as fair, two stars as good, three as excellent and four as superb.

title: CHINA SAYS RELICS PROVE ISLES' PAST
description: PEKING, Dec. 7  Chinese archeologists digging in the disputed Paracel Islands have unearthed ancient relics supporting Peking's contention that Chinese have been active on the islands for centuries, according to an article published here Thursday.

title: FELSBERG TO TRY TO SHIELD PAPERS
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 7 (AP)Daniel Eisberg says private papers stolen from his home in suburban Mill Valley Oct. I are his personal property and he will resist in court any effort by the Federal Government to examine them.

title: If you're in the market for a real steal
description: In downtown Philadelphia there is a cluttered little store where you can purchase just about anything at incredibly low prices. The store is perhaps 15 feet wide and 40 feet deep and stacked from floor to ceiling with goodies of every description. Outside, except when it's raining, sits a lawn chair or two and, when the little store is empty of customers, the proprietor sits there too, sometimes in his Hanes undershirt, following the street action. Although to the casual passerby he hardly looks the part, this smallbusiness man sitting proudly in front of his modest general merchandise store in his sweaty Hanes undershirt is also an important East Coast underworld figure. He is fence.

title: TransferablePension Law Passed in West Germany
description: BONN, Dec. 7 (Reuters)West Germans who change jobs will no longer forfeit their pension rights under a law passed this week by the West German Parliament.

title: Dr. Ivor Seager Smith Marries Catherine E. Gribbin in Trenton
description: Trinity Episcopal Cathedral in Trenton was the setting yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Catherine Elizabeth Gribbin, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. James A. Gribbin of Trenton and Beach Haven Terrace, Long Beach Island, N. J., to Dr. Ivor Seeger Smith of Boston. The bridegroom's parents are Dr. and Mrs, R. Bryon Seager Smith of Bromley, Kent, England.

title: Legislature to Act On Deficit Problem
description: TRENTON  Governor Byrne and the Democratic legislative leaders conceded yesterday that the crisis surrounding the schoolfinancing issue and the impending state budget deficit had finally reached a decisive stage and that both questions most likely would be resolvedone way or anotherin the Legislature this week.

title: An Inexpensive Acrylic Terrarium
description: Terrarium boxes are easy and inexpensive to make from acrylic. A sixinch cube made of thick quarterinch costs $3. The polished edges form a wide luminous outline and accent the shapes of the boxes.

title: A.E.C. Files Bid for Patent On Vertical Wind Turbine
description: ALBUQUERQUE, N. M. Dec. 7The Atomic Energy Commission has filed a patent application on a wind turbine that has been tested for harnessing wind energy in remote areas, Sandia Laboratories has announced.

title: Cafe in Spain Bombed
description: BILBAO, Spain, Dec. 7 (Reuters)A bomb exploded today in a cafe in Portugalete, about six miles north of here, causing some damage but no casualties cording to the police. It was the latest of a series of bombings accompanying strikes in the northern Basque region in support of political prisoners who are fasting in jail.

title: Priscilla Margaret Dixon to Wed
description: Mr. and Mrs. Harold F. E. Dixon of Douglas Manor, Queens, and Hulett's Landing, N. Y., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Priscilla Margaret Dixon, to Alan Elliott Kellogg. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Donald R. Kellogg of Katonah and Baker Hills, N. Y.

title: Merchants Get Anticrime Aid
description: NEWARKThe Police Department and the Greater Newark Chamber of Commerce are the joint sponsors of an unusual crimeprevention program for smallbusinds men.

title: Belgium Asks Panel on European Political Union
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 7Belgium has proposed that at their next week's meeting in Paris the Common Market leaders set up a special, toplevel committee to examine how Europe could become a political union by the end of the decade.

title: New Hormone and Insulin Offer Hope for Diabetics
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec 5A considerably more effective treatment than any now available seems to be in prospect for diabetes of the type that manifests itself early in life.

title: Elderly Dining Service Solves Youth Problem
description: HAYWARD, Calif., Dec. 7 (UPI)Students who needed practical experience in feeding crowds have found a solution  a group of elderly persons who were recently deprived of their regular dining room service.

title: Gordon Lightfoot Sings, Fumes, Then Stalks Off
description: Gordon Lightfoot, the veteran Canadian folk singer, is a big star these days, with a recent enough hit and album in Sundown to fill Avery Fisher Hall for four concerts this weekend.

title: Long island Jewish Hospital and State Will Meet on Fate of South Shore Unit
description: LAWRENCEOfficials of Long Island JewishHillside Medical Center and, the State Department of Health will meet this week to discuss the Wile the hospital's South Shore Division.

title: Joint Space Flight: Not' Americans, Not Russians
description: Something is about to happen to the demonology on which millions of Russians and millions of Americans have been reared. In July, 1975, a joint RussoAmerican station will be in operation in space. Two great nations which have sometimes found it difficult to live together on earth will be living together in the far blue yonder. Their shared space in space will be manned, in effect, by a composite human being: a RussoAmerican hybrid of a particularly companionable sort.

title: C. Beverly Davison, 75, Dead; Operator of Hunting Preserve
description: C. Beverly Davison, who operated a shooting preserve in Millbrook, N. Y., and had originated the idea in this country of stocking game birds in paid shooting preserves, died Friday at his home in Millbrook. He was 78 years old.

title: BUDGET MAY SHUT NAVY'S COED SHIP
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7 (UPI) What Navy wives failed to accomplish may soon be achieved by the budgetcutters shutting down, the Navy's only coed ship.

title: Winter's Subtle Tides
description: Winter doesn't wait for the solstice. Winter comes on the great wind tides that curl about this earth, far subtler than those that obey the moon and move the oceans. Winter comes down from the tundra, and out of the mountains, and across the lonely distances of the high and timeforgotten plains.

title: Text of Statement on Economic Policy Adopted at Democratic Conference
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Dec. 7, (AP)Following is a draft of a statement of economic policy adopted by the Democratic Conference on Party Organization and Policy:

title: Texas Bus Strike Ends
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Dec. 7 (UPI)  State District Judge Robert R. Murray ordered to day the release of 21 jailed union leaders, ending a 23day strike by bus drivers who had said they would not return to work unless fellow employes were freed. Regular bus schedules resumed throughout San Antonio.

title: Savings Urged to Help State
description: TRENTON  A prominent New Jersey Democrat has proposed an innovative plan to pump large sums of money into the state's sagging economy.The plan, which would not cost the taxpayers anything, was offered last week by Daniel M. Gaby, an unsuccessful candidate for the Democratic nomination for the United States Senate in 1972.

title: The Nation
description: Judge John J. Sirica has decided that termer President Richard Nixon's testimony at the Watergate coverup trial is not worth, wafting for because it is not vital, as the defense contends, and it would be the evidence of a man involved in a conspiracy and therefore to be scrutinized with care.

title: The Floating Prime Rate, a Tarnished Experiment
description: A threeyear effort to take some of the mystery (and all of the accusations of price fixing) out of the way banks arrive at their prime lending rate may be in its death throes.both as rates went up earlier this year and in the last Couple of weeks as they flattened out after a steep decine.

title: Television/We don't know what to make of our history. (Cyclops)
description: The TVviolence bubble, it would seem, is about to burst, and everyone in the immediate vicinity is likely to be splattered with charges and countercharges. Concern about the issue of violent content on television, its potential and real effects, dates back at least to 1954 and Congressional hearings led by Senator Estes Kefauver. Twenty years later, following periodic jags of reform promises from broadcasters, the issue is still very much alive and highly controversial.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To THE EDITOR: We try to ignore irresponsible flak from misinformed critics. However, in reply to Charles Labrizzi's letter of Nov. 17, the construction of a 40foot abstract design at the local entrance to the Atlantic City Expressway could not have been contracted by the city without the express approval of the Atlantic City Fine Arts Commission.

title: Theater Benefits
description: Tickets for the following may be obtained from the beneficiaries unless otherwise indicated:

title: DANCE VIEW
description: Is music the ultimate ballet preservative? Why has Copplia, created by Arthur SaintLon at the Paris Opra, survived, in one form or another, for more than, a century? It was born in the shadow of the FrancoPrussian war in 1870. Shortly after its premiere the young Milanese ballerina who had created the role of Swanilda, Giuseppina Bozzacchi, died on her 17th birthday during the Siege of Paris. She had only danced Swanilda 18 times. Lo Delibes himself played the organ at her funeral. Delibes, of course, had composed Copplia. Was that the secret of the ballet's longevity? Perhaps.

title: Suit on Fish Sales Is Lost By Muslims in Louisiana
description: SHREVEPORT, La., Dec. 7 (UPI)Selling fish doortodoor to raise money for Black Muslims is not a religious experience protected by the Constitution, a Federal judge has ruled.

title: What's in the water we drink?
description: Every day, more than 200 billion gallons of water flow through pipes and conduits into the homes of the 160 million people in the U.S. who use community water systems. Until recently, most Americans hardly bothered to think about it: A flick of the faucet, and there it wasas much clear, potable water as anyone could want. But recently there has been disquieting news: This year, for example, public health officials have detected agents either known or believed to cause cancer in community systems ranging from Louisiana to Minnesota and from Ohio to Vermont. Uneasy doubts have stirred among many people: Is our drinking water really safe to drink?

title: Royal Manhattan Hotel, Once BigBand Center, Closes Its Doors
description: The Royal Manhattan Hotel, once bustled with businessmen, athletes, and tourists and its restaurant was a favorite gathering spot for theatergoers. But yesterday most of its rooms weer vacant its restaurant was locked and its facade was covered with heavy boards.

title: Crewmen of the France End Strike After 3 Months
description: LE HAVRE, France, Dec. 7 (UPI)Crew members of the luxury liner France voted today to give up their threemonthold strike to keep the ship from being put out of service.

title: LAWYER TO HEAD TEMPLE ElMANUEL
description: One of the most prestigious posts in American Judaism will go to Maxwell M. Rabb next Sunday when he is elected president of Temple EmanuEl, at Fifth Avenue and 65th Street.

title: Late TV Listings
description: The folowing information about today's television programs was not available in time to appear in Section 2:

title: Caracas TakeOver
description: Verieztlela announced that the expected nationalization of her ironore industry, run by subsidiaries of United States Steel and Bethlehem Steel, would take place Jan. 1. Details, Page 17.

title: Strip Mining: The Bill Was a Long Time Coming
description: WASHINGTONA new Federal law to curb abuses upon the land by companies strip mining for coal finally emerged last Wednesday from the SenateHouse conference committee where it had been bottled up for months, a prisoner of special interests. The measure's advance toward probable preadjournment passage illustrated a Congressional axiom: In the Capitol, large ideas ripen into law in agonizingly slow motion.

title: In Time of Need
description: Even in the best of times, the fruits of general affluence are unhappily not shared by all. In these days recession and economic uncertainty, the ranks of the needy grow. The poor, the sick, the aged and the infirm bear an even heavier burden. The cold months ahead will impose on them great hardships, unless they can count on help from their more fortunate neighbors.

title: HUSSEIN FEARFUL OF A BIGGER WAR
description: ROME, Dec. 7 (Reuters)king Hussein of Jordan was quoted in an interview published here today as saying that the Palestine problem threatened the world.

title: GENESIS OF BRITAIN DARING AT ACADEMY
description: Genesis, the British rocktheater group, was ambitious, even daring, at the Academy of Music on East 14th Street, on Friday. The quintet has made several recent tours in the United States, building an audience for its dadaesque songs and quietly sophisticated slideandlight show.

title: 18 Surrender in Philippines
description: MANILA, Dec. 7 (UPI)Eighteen Moslem rebel leaders surrendered today in a military camp they had overrun in the first uprising against the country's martial law regime two years ago, the official Philippine news agency reported Military authorities said the surrender brought to 1,070 the number of rebels in the MindanaoSulu region, home of the nearly two million Filipino Moslems, who have given up since last week under a governmerit Amnesty offer.

title: MISS CURTIN SUPERB AT HUNTER CONCERT
description: Phyllils Curtin may never sing Madame Butterfly 100 times at the Metropolitan Opera, but she is no less a diva for that. During the 22 years of her career, she consistently maintained the highest degree of vocal and artistic standards, and her Hunter tollege Concert Friday night was simply another example of liar superior qualities.

title: Recount Confirms Laxalt As Nevada Senate Victor
description: CARSON CITY, Nev., Dec. Former Gov. Paul A. Laxalt, was confirmed today as the winner of the Nov. 7 election for the United States Senate.

title: Hunter's Artificial Snow Gets Ski Season Started
description: HUNTER, N. Y.Twelveyearold Mark Hodges of Alexandria, Va., was munching on a slice of pizza last Sunday in Hunter Mountain's base lodge but he seemed to be disposing of his lunch with great haste. I want to get back to skiing, he said. The people who brought me are making an early start for home because a snowstorm is expected. Just my luck. We came here because of snow. Now we have to rush home because of it. Young Hodges had on his parka one of the approximately 10,000 lift tickets sold here last Friday, Saturday and Sunday. The turnout was considered noteworthy because, up to that time, there had been nothing resembling a snowstorm in this northern Catskill

title: Staff of the Brooklyn Museum, Show Their Own Works
description: One of the pet gripes of artists is that art critics and arsuleum curators manage to do much talking and writing about artwithout creating any of it. How oar these terlopers, the artists muse spin out their longwinded theofies and judgments if they have not even gottentheir feet or hands wet? What do they know of the artist's angst, his struggle with life and his turbulent compulsion to express himself?

title: Soviet and France Press For a 35Nation Summit
description: PARIS, Dec. 7  Leonid I. Brezhnev, head of the Soviet Communist party, and President Valry Giscard d'Estaing of France completed three days of talks today and issued a communiqu calling for stepped up efforts to conclude the current European security conference with a 35nation summit meeting.

title: Students and Monks Continue Protest in Rangoon
description: RANGOON, Burma, Dec. 7 (AP)The brothers of U Thant, former Secretary General of the United Nations, were negotiating tonight with the students who seized his casket two days ago.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: Fear can be an independent force in economic life. Action can be based on anxiety, not substance, and can then have a highly substantial effect. The great inflation of 1923 left Germans with an enduring fear of recurrence. This led to steps of suicidal severity to defend the mark. The action helped pave the way for Adolph Hitler and World War II.

title: Dallas Retains Playoff Hope
description: IRVING, Tex., Dec, 7Roger Staubach, booed early in the game, wound up throwing three touchdown passes today as the Dallas Cowboys kept their National Football League playoff hopes flickering with a 4117 victory over the Cleveland Browns.

title: Suicide at Bear Mountain
description: STONY POINT, N.Y., Dec. 7 (UPI)  A 37yearold man pulled his car, into a parking area of Bear Mountain State Park today, doused himself with gasoline and set himself afire, the police reported. He died immediately. The Palisades Interstate Parkway police said that several witnesses attempted to extinguish the flames but were unsuccessful. The man's name was withheld pending notification of his family.

title: Traffic Continues Decline in Nassau
description: MINEOLANassau County motorists have continued to cut their driving, despite recent decreases in gasoline prices, the Nassau County Department of Public Works said.

title: Nancy Kaplan Wed to Dr. Mark Belsky
description: Nancy Paula Kaplan, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Stanley H. Kaplan of Brooklyn and Lords Valley, Pa., was married last evening to Dr. Mark Richard Belsky,. son of Dr. and Mrs. Maurice W. Belsky of Highland Park, N.J., by Rabbi Jack D. Spiro of Congregation Beth Ahabah of Richmond.

title: Driver Is Denied Custody Of 4 Girls Left on Route
description: TULSA, Okla., Dec. 7 (AP)A 22yearold bus driver and his wife have lost their effort to gain custody of four children left on the driver's route last month.

title: Delaware Triumphs In Rice Bowl, 4911
description: BATON ROUGE, La., Dec. 7 (UPI) Vern Roberts set six records and combined with Nate Beasley for 319 yards and five touchdowns today to lead fourthranked Delaware to a 4911 Grantland Rice Bowl victory over previously unbeaten NevadaLas Vegas.

title: New Haven Home Not So Sweet
description: NEW HAVEN, Dec. 7Spider Lockhart says he likes Yale Bowl. Coach Bill Arnsparger says he doesn't believe in jinxes, or hexes or negative things he can't control.

title: Newark Exhibition Features Graphics
description: NEWARKGraphics are in the spotlight at the Newark Museum these days, specifically, an exhibition of the bluechip collection of Richard Brawn Baker.

title: Everybody's Doing the Whodunit
description: Last year was the year of the cop. From Serpico to Super Cops to Cops and Robbers, films about policemen battling crime  and sometimes battling one anotherbecame so popular that moviegoers were tempted to dial 911 to find out what time the picture went on.

title: An Old Soldier's Return to France: There Were No Flowers in 1918
description: AFRAMED yellowed map hung on the wall of my family's dining rom. It showed the line of march of the 308th Field Artillery of the 78th Division after the SaintMihiel drive of World War I. When I was In FainlesMoutiers... my father said.

title: Clinic's Inspiration Freud and Jesus
description: HICKSVILLEA handful of psythoanalysts, clinical social workers and other experts in the mental health field has opened a new center for counseling and professional training here, dedicated to combining the Christian philosophy with the methodology of Freud.

title: Beatrix Potter in Paper
description: Last month, when I was sorting used children's books for the local library sale, it struck me that at least one in four were not about children at all; they were about animals. If you added in books about petsSam's Baby Skunk, Polly Wanted a Pony, and all their variantsthe proportion rose to nearly half. And among picture books it was even higher.

description: There was new, forceful evidence last week of New York City's economdistress.

Sidney Lovett Jr., a United Church of Christ minister of Chevy Chase, Md., who serves as Central Atlantic Conference minister in Silver Spring.

description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7The former head of intelligence for the State Department has called on President Ford to remove Secretary of State Kissinger from his other Job AS Special Assistant for National Security Affairs to open up the toplevel decisionmaking style of the Government.

title: The Rio Grande ZephyrDown but Not Out Rolls Through the West
description: IT'S Saturday, 6:30 A.M., and Dentver's Union Station proves to be shabby, grimy, almost empty. A bad omen. My son and I are about to embark on whit we hope will be a relaxed land voyage to Salt Lake City  14 hours to be spent loafing aboard a train. You could get there in an ur by plane, the cab driver advised us. I only haul about three passengers here a month  you're the first from the Brown Palace Hotel in a long, low time. And the way things are going, maybe the last.

description: Miami real estate dealers report that former President Richard M. Nixon will put his two houses at Key Biscayne up for sale within the next few days. Page 48.

description: BASKETBALL

title: Nets Top Squires By 10386
description: HAMPTON, Va., Dec. 7It took Julius Erving and Brian Taylor an entire first half to get their offense working properly, but after they did they scored 25 and 21 points respectively and led the New York Nets to a 10386 victory over the Virginia Squires tonight.

title: 5 Hurt by Bomb in Bremon
description: BREMEN, West Getniany, Dec. 7 (Reuters)A bomb exploded in a luggage locker in Bremen's main railroad station today, injuring five people, a railroad police spokesman said.

title: Police Arrest 150 Students in Drug Raids on Coast
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 1The police responded to reports of extensive drug use in the city's high schools this week by arresting students considered to be the chief suppliers of campus drugs.

title: Congress Has Its Reform;Now What?
With No Real Help in Sight Traffic Will Get Worse
description: The halcyon traffic of list February and March, retrospect, seems almost a fantasy: parking lots nearly empty; parkways and expressways often deserted; rush hour tieups curiously ameliorated.

title: Chicano Activist Paroled
description: SANTA FE, N.M., Dec. 7Reies Lopez Tijerina, the Chicano activist whose protest tactics in New Mexico led to four convictions against him, has been granted parole and has been ordered released by the State Parole Board from the state penitentiary which he entered on June 29 to serve two concurrent twoto10 years sentences.

title: ART VIEW
description: HARTFORD THE sculpture of Christopher Wilmarth, although still little known to the large art audience that depends on news of a trend for its acquaintance with contemporary reputations, has been a subject of fairly consistent serious interest to critics and curators since the artist's first oneman show in 1968. Now, with the exhibition called Nine Clearings for a Standing Man at the Wadsworth Atheneum, Mr. Wilmarth is likely to be more widely recognized as one of the leading sculptors of his generation. (He is 31.) This is a small exhibition and not one easily encompassed by the untutored eye, but it is something of an event all the same. It is the kind of, exhibition that connoisseurs of contemporary sculpture will not want to miss.

title: Residency Rule for Divorce Is Upheld in Pennsylvanial
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 7 (UPI) The State Supreme Court has ruled that a Pennsylvania law setting a residency requirement in divorce actions was not a violation of the United States Constitution.

title: New Legal Aid Office Serves Elderly in Brooklyn
description: What can aging pensioners with limited incomes do when their landlords are harassing them in an effort to push them out of rentcontrolled apartments? Where can they turn when they decide to get a divorce? Who can tell them their rights to Medicaid and Social Security?

title: Old Bottles, Glass Up for Sale Today
description: YARDVILLE A showing and sale of antique bottles and glass will be held today at the PolishAmerican Club, Route 130.

title: St. John's Conquers Temple
description: St. John's improved its basketball record to two victories and one loss last night with an 8868 triumph over Temple at Alumni Hall in Hillcrest, Queens.

title: Ballet: Gods Amused
description: The Eliot Feld Ballet has expanded its repertory for its current engagement at the New York Shakespeare Festival's Newman Theater. Last summer the company gave too few performances of The Gods Amused, and so it was a pleasure Friday to welcome back the revival of this 1971 Feld ballet.

title: Calendar of Motor Sports Events
description: Dec. 13Long Island Sports Car Association Christmas Party at Pandora's Box, 8030 Jericho Turnpike, Woodbury, 9 P.M. Information: John Searight, phone (516)9219794.

description: BELLEVILLE  To Adolfo Morciano, owner of Cataldo's bakery at 90 Franklin Street, breadbaking is no hobby. And it's no picnic, either. It's literally a way of life.

description: Five Protestant churches in Poughkeepsie, N.Y., have been designated as a generating community by the Consultation on Church Union, an organization dedicated to the search for a united Protestantism.

description: Mr. and Mrs. Lloyd H. Smith of Houston, New York and Southampton, L. I., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Sydney Carothers Smith, to E. Coe Kerr 3d, son of the late E. Coe Kerr Jr. of New York and the late Mrs. Sarah Marsh Nichols Kerr. He is the stepson of the present Mrs. E. Coe Kerr Jr. of New York and East Hampton, L. I.

description: San Diego, Calif.Mike Nixo 160 pounds, Glendale, Calif., ?? Dave Love, 156 San Die?? fought to no decision, 9 rooun?? Fight ruled no decision when ?? couldn't continue after low bl?? by Nixon.

title: Italians Fire U.S. Missiles
description: ALAMOGORDO, N. M., Dec. 7Italian Army troop units for the first time in history fired missiles at the White Sands Missile Range, near here, this week. A contingent of 120 soldiers arrived from Fort Sill Okla., where they had been undergoing training, and fired a sixround series of the Lance, the mediumrange artillery weapon designed for support of ground combat units.

title: Miss Proell Takes Ski Race With Miss Kaserer 2d
description: VAL D'ISERE, France, Dec. 7Rebounding from a defeat in her specialty, the downhill, Annemarie ProellMoser easily won a giant slalom today in World Cup skiing competition.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: HOLLYWOOD, Fla., Dec. 7 (UPI)A crowd of high school students, upset over their school's loss in a football playoff game last night, vandalized the game site and pelted authorities with rocks for about an hour after the contest WAS over. Four Hollywood policemen were taken to a hospital after they were struck with rocks and, in one case, beaten with a football helmet. All were listed in satisfactory condition.

title: I.R.S. REPORTS FILES BACK SPYING STAND
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 7. (AP) The Internal Revenue Service says it has discovered docu, ments that help support its contention that it set up a secret intelligencegathering unit on its own and not at the request of the White House.

title: BEAME AND GOLDIN SCORED BY DELURY
description: John J. DeLury, president of the Uniformed Sanitatiomnen's Union, said yesterday that the Mayor and the Controller should stop playing newspaper games and oneupmanship in squabbling over budgetary figures in the city's fiscal crisis.

title: Music: James Bugwell
description: In this time of coarsening tastes and musical populism, the violin recital is an endangered species. But if we encounter fewer of them than our parents did, the compensatory fact is that the standards of performance in those we do hear is probably as high as or higher than at any time in the past.

title: Funeral Set Today for Slain Girl, 8
description: ROCKAWAY, Dec. 8 (UPI)Funeral services will be conducted in St. Cecelia's Roman Catholic Church here tomorrow for 8yearold Danielle Hunter, who was found, murdered, in the woods behind her home here this weekend. Her throat had been cut.

title: Red Smith
description: After the first shock of hearing that he had been traded to the Phillies, Tug McGraw had second thoughts. He said he really shouldn't have been surprised, because he had pitched for the Mets eight seasons and if he were around much longer his employers would have to give him a voice in his own future. Tug is a quicksilver guy, lefthanded and lighthearted and not necessarily more predictable than the screwball he throws, but he is no dummy. He has no more illusions than the next player about the spectacular breakthrough effected in baseball's reserve system a couple of years ago. Spectacular breakthrough, was the term Bowie Kuhn used to describe a minor modification of the reserve system when the men who own baseball proposed it during labor negotiations in 1972. It was a meaningless concession which the players had already brushed off as worthless and the commissioner knew this when he spoke, but he still chose to call it a historic offer. Eventually the proposal, somewhat revised, found its way into the basic agreement between owners and players. It provides that instead of being owned outright throughout his professional life, a player may refuse to be traded provided he has served 10 years in the major leagues and the last five years with one club.

title: About New York
description: Mrs. David Evanier was driving to Brooklyn to teach an evening class the other night when her car ran out of gas on the approach to the Brooklyn Bridge, She pulled it over to the side, wondering whether she should simply stay there until help arrived, or else try to hail a taxi, or perhaps get out and look for a gas station. She decided on the gas station, and getting out of the car she looked about her. There was no gas station, and indeed there was nothing except darkness. Unhappily, Mrs. Evanier began walking along a catwalk off the bridge.

title: A Look at Sex Roles In BlueCollar Jobs
description: A longrange research program to restructure the labor market to accommodate women workers was one of five major points agreed on at the first national conference on women in bluecollar industrial and service jobs.

title: Sheriff in Georgia Killed
description: HIAWASSEE, Ga., Dec. 8 (UPI)A Georgia sheriff and a passenger in a car he stopped for alleged drunken driving were killed early today in a shootout. A police spokesman said items from two burglaries were found in the car. Sheriff Jay Chastain was killed by a man identified by the police as Roy Struben Lockaby, who then was killed by other officers.

title: BARGAINING STALLED FOR 6,000 IN U.M.W.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec 8 (UPI) With contract talks stalled, Federal mediators sought to get negotiators hack to the bargaining table today and head off picketing by 6,000 mine construction workers.

title: G. O. P. UNIT MOVES TO REFORM RULES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8A special committee of the Republican Party took steps today to encourage states to select women, young people and members of minority groups as delegates to the party's national convention.

title: 2 ACQUAINTANCES ARE FOUND DEAD
description: The bodies of a young Middlesex County couple who had been stripped and apparently beaten to death were found lying about 50 yards apart in Sayreville early yesterday about an hour after they had been seen drinking together in a nearby tavern.

title: Wave of Clashes Reported By Saigon for Second Day
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 8For the second day, the Saigon command reported widespread fighting today in the Mekong Delta as well as several major clashes in Tay Ninh Province west of here.

title: HEAVY RAIN SOAKS DISASTER AREAS
description: TOMS RIVER, Dec. 8Four seaside counties that were declared disaster areas following last week's severe storm survived another buffeting today wth no noticeable new damage.

title: Record Rains Produce Bitter Harvest for the Dutch
description: GOES, the Netherlands, Dec. 6The wettest and bitterest harvest in memory is drawing to a close in the rich dikeprotected farmland of Zeeland in the southwest of the Netherlands.

title: FARMERS HURT BY MILK STRIKE
description: ALBANY, Dec. 8  The surprise rejection of the proposed labor contract by drivers and other employes of milk processing plants in the New York Metropolitan area will result in a cut in the income of 20,000 dairy farmers in New York, New Jersey and Pennsylvania who supply those plants, according to upstate dairy experts.

title: U.S. ENERGY GROUP URGES OUTPUT RISE
description: The Committee for Economic Development contended in a report issued for release today that the supply of energy from American domestic sources must increase more rapidly than demand.

title: By Jupiter
description: The voyage into the space beyond known space by Pioneer 11 is such an inventive scientific achievement that only man's limitless imagination can match it. The spacecraft entered and emerged from Jupiter's environs, through belts of radiation hotter than Dante's Hell, blacking out but recovering, flying at peak speeds of 107,000 miles an hour, sending back astronomical news about the mysteries of the solar system.

title: Ballet: The Real McCoy
description: The spirits of Fred Astaire and Gene Kelly twinkle around Eliot Feld's new ballet, sometimes a little heavyfootedly. The ballet is called The Real McCoy, and although it gets its title from Cole Porter; its music comes from George Gershwin. (Porter aficionados will recall that your feelings being the real McCoy counted among the acid tests, together with the good turtle soup or merely the mock, of whether it was in fact At Long Last Love.) The ballet had its first performance Saturday night at the Newman auditorium of the New York Shakespeare Festival's Public Theatre in Lafayette Street, more briefly known as Joe Papp's pad.

title: Monmouth Official's Son Slain in Police Stakeout
description: LONG BRANCH, N.J., Dec. 8 The unarmed 16yearold son of the executive director of onmouth County's Antipoverty Program was shot to death by the police today as he fled an area authorities had staked out in search of a rapist.

title: Recasting the Reforms
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Dec. 8There have been two great bursts of reform in the postwar Democratic partythe one symbolized by Senator Hubert H. Humphrey that grew out of the 1948 convention at Philadelphia and the one symbolized by Senator George McGovern that grew out of the 1968 convention at Chicago. In a sense, what happened in Kansas City constituted a climax to both the call for civil rights in '48 and the call for more convention openness in '68.

title: 4 Women Seize Hostage And Flee Florida Prison
description: LOWELL, Fla., Dec. 8 (AP)Four women prisoners escaped tonight from the Florida Correction Institution after stabbing a guard and taking switchboard operator as a host. age, prison officials said:

title: Pioneer 11's Flight Path to Take Spacecraft Inside Saturn's Rings
description: The path that Pioneer 11 is to follow as it whips around Saturn five years from now, according to current plans, will carry it inside the Saturnian rings, past the giant moon Titan and finally out of the solar system.

title: A Police Informer Here Boasts He Got Away With 200 Crimes
description: A 22yearold man who has spent six years as a police informer is scheduled to go on trial today for one of the 200 crimes he claims to have committed since 1968.

title: Borg Triumphs In Tennis Final
description: ADELAIDE, Australia, Dec. 8. (AP)  Bjorn Borg of Sweden defeated Onny Parun of New Zealand, 64, 64, 36, 62, today and won the South Australian tennis championship.

title: Middlesex, Ramapo Capture Jersey Football Titles
description: ATLANTIC CITY, N.J., Dec. 8Middlesex defeated Hillsborough, 24.6, for the Central Jersey, Group 2 title, and Ramapo routed Dumont, 4614, for the North Jersey, Section 1, Group 3 crown today in Convention Hall. This was the final day of the state's first high school football playoffs.

title: Boxers Battle to Draw
description: EUPEN, Belgium, Dec. 8 (AP)  Christian Mossoux of Belgium and H. D. Schwartz of West Germany boxed to a draw today in a 10round lightheavyweight match.

title: Ecuador Is Finding Trouble Selling
description: QUITO, Ecuador  After weeks of rumor and conjecture in foreign petroleum circles the fact is finally out: Ecuador, the second major oil exporter in Latin America, is having trouble selling its highgrade crude.

title: Swiss Reject Tax Increase And State Health Insurance
description: GENEVA, Dec. 8Swiss voters twice rebuffed the Federal Government and Parliament in nationwide referendums today by rejecting proposed tax increases and a statesubsidized national health insurance plan.

title: Nearby Horse Shows
description: AT WHITE PLAINS

title: BLACKS ANALYZE ROOTS OF CRIME
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8 Mayor Maynard Jackson of Atlanta implored his audience at the National League of Cities meeting, I beg you, I plead with you to pass the resolutions favoring registration of hand guns!

title: Iranian Financial Help To Pan Am Air Weighed
description: The Iranian Government has been holding preliminary diseussions with Pan American World Airways, Inc., on the possibility of supplying Iranian financial aid to the shaky airline.

title: Pope Visits Downtown Rome To Pray at Virgin's Statue
description: ROME, Dec. 8Pope Paul VI drove in an open car to the Spanish Steps in downtown Rome today to pay homage to a statue of the Virgin Mary on the 120th anniversary of the proclamation of the dogma of Immaculate Conception.

title: Sugar at 9 Cents a Pound Lures Shoppers South of the Border
description: TIJUANA, Mexico, Dec. 8With food prices under tight inflation controls and great stocks of sugar selling at 9 cents a pound, Mexican merchants are hoping for sweet revenge against the American supermarkets just across the border that have been taking trade away from them for years.

title: 2 Seized and 3 Sought In Los Angeles Check Plot
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 8 (AP)  The authorities were searching today for three other suspects in an alleged scheme to loot millins of dollars from the city treasury after two men were arrested yesterday in Beverly Hills carrying what they thought was their share of the loot.

title: The Proceedings in the U.N. Today
Schaufass Dances Cavalier in Style In The Nutcracker
description: Peter Schaufuss, the Danishtrained, Danishbred dancer, partnered Violette Verdy as her cavalier with great gallantry and sureness Saturday afternoon in The Nutcracker. Miss Verdy, returning to her role as the Sugar Plum Fairy for the first time since her return after an injury, obviously found him a congenial partner and together they treated their audience to a dramatically conceived grand pas de deux.

title: 0.7% Decline in G.N.P. Viewed as Likely
Barbara M. Simmons Married To James R. Eustis Jr., Lawyer
description: Barbara Michelle Simmons, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Mitchell Forrest Simmons of Lookout Mountain, Tenn., was married there yesterday afternoon to James Ross Eustis Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Eustis of Winnetka, Ill.

title: FRANCE PREPARES FOR EUROPE TALKS
description: PARIS, Dec. 8  President Valry Giscard d'Estaing met with advisers today to complete preparations for the twoday European summit meeting beginning tomorrow, which will bring new faces, new problems and anew style to the intense yearend diplomatic activity.

title: FORD TO BE ASKED TO APPROVE RISE IN U.S. FOOD AID
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8President Ford will be asked this week to approve a budget increase for foreign food assistance and to settle an interagency fight over the amounts of aid to be supplied to individual countries.

title: College Results
Vorster Still Hopeful
description: CAPE TOWN, South Africa, Dec. 8Prime Minister John Vorster of South Africa today let his voice to the view that hopes still remain of further negotiation on a Rhodesian settlement.

title: URBANAID PLANK IN '76 IS BEAME AIM
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Dec. 8Feeling that the Democratic midterm conference has overlooked many of the problems of the cities, Mayor Beame of New York said today that he and other Democratic mayors were beginning a concentrated drive for a strong urban program in the 1976 Presidential convention platform.

title: The Next Move Is Matter of Controversy
description: After squeezing the financial system this summer with a tightfisted monetary policy that sent interest rates to record highs, the Federal Reserve Board has begun in recoil months to loosen its rein on the money supply.

title: Triumph And Skepticism
description: BOSTON, Dec. 8I am surprised, said Henry Kissinger at the criticism of the tentative new arms control agreement with the Soviet Union.

title: 5 of Sextuplets Survive
description: A woman who took fertility drugs gave birth to sextuplets yesterday in San Jose, Calif. The sixth and smallest of the babies died, but doctors said the others appeared to be in good health. Page 31.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: Walter Annenberg, former Ambassador to Britain, is one of four new trustees elected to the board of the Metropolitan Museum of Art. The others are Mrs. Charles W. Engelhard, director of the Engelhard Minerals and Chemicals Corporation; Mary R. Morgan, daughter of Vice Presidentdesignate Nelson A. Rockefeller, and State Supreme Court Justice Frank D. O'Connor.

title: Schaufuss Dances Cavalier in Style In The Nutcracker
description: Peter Schaufuss, the Danishtrained, Danishbred dancer, partnered Violette Verdy as her cavalier with great gallantry and sureness Saturday afternoon in The Nutcracker. Miss Verdy, returning to her role as the Sugar Plum Fairy for the first time since her return after an injury, obviously found him a congenial partner and together they treated their audience to a dramatically conceived grand pas de deux.

title: Dance: Gypsy Orchestra
description: Gypsies have always been among the great entertainers of the world, and it came as no surprise that the Rajko Hungarian Gypsy Orchestra and Dancers performed as superbly as they did Saturday night at Carnegie Hall.

title: David Rockefeller Cites World Peril
description: David Rockefeller, the chairman of the Chase Manhattan Bank, called last night for broader spirit of international cooperation and sacrifice to prevent general human tragedy and global economic disaster.

title: 3 ExOfficials of Dairylea Are Counted as Fugitives
description: Three former executives of the Dairylea milk cooperative remain fugitives from justiceone of them in Canadafor failure to appear in court to answer charges that they played a part in Dairylea's admitted adulteration of millions of quarts of milk. The three have been fugitives for more than three weeks.

title: Today's Ultra Secrets
description: WASHINGTONBritish actor Leslie Howard, whom generations of Americans remember as the gentle Ashley Wilkes in Gone With the Wind, boarded an aircraft early in World War II on a secret mission. The Germans knew about it and shot down the unarmed plane. The British knew beforehand that the Germans knew, but to protect the secret of how they knew, British intelligence let the plane go down and the actor died.

title: Dropping Highway Project Could Cost City U.S. Funds
description: If the city abandons its $1.1billion proposal for an Interstate System highway on the West Side of Manhattan south of 42d Street, it could recoup only a third of that money for masstransit purposes, according to Federal highway officials.

title: Nixon's Taped Remarks on Apparent Slush Fund Called Key Evidence in Rebozo Inquity
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8Two taperecorded allusions by Richard M. Nixon to an apparent slush fund gathered from campaign contributions has been described by Watergate investigators as a central riece of evidence in the government's inquiry into the affairs of Charles G. Rebozo, Mr. Nixon's closest friend.

title: New Jersey Sports
description: TEANECK, Dec. 8Jeannette Reid decided to bury a dream that has tantalized her since childhood. She recently became women's fencing coach at Fairleigh Dickinson University, where she also conducts a coed fencing class. In accepting her new job, she lost any chance of participating in the Olympics, under whose rules she is now considered professional and is ineligible.

title: RIVALS SAY RABIN IMP AIRS U.S. TALKS
description: TEL AVIV, Dec. 8A parliamentary Opposition group charged today that Premier Yitzhak Rabin had tipped Israel's hand in advance of the start of talks in Washington tomorrow between Foreign Minister Yigal Allon and Secretary of State Kissinger.

title: TV: Feld at Wolf Trap
description: Tonight at 8 the Eliot Feld Ballet brings a portion of its repertory to television as part of public TV's In Performance at Wolf Trap series on Channel 13. The company, currently performing at the 300seat Public Theater of Joseph Papp's New York Shakespeare Festival, was recorded last summer at Wolf Trap Farm's huge outdoor theater near Washington.

title: DENKTASH ASSAILS MAKARIOS SPEECH
description: NICOSIA, Cyprus, Dec. 8Vice President Rauf Denktash, leader of the Turkish Cypriote community, said today that President Makarios's speech on his return here yesterday gave only very, very slight hope for a settlement in Cyprus.

title: Adm. Nikolai Kuznetzov Dies; Navy Commander During War
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 8 (AP)Admiral of the Fleet Nikolai G. Kuznetsov, commander of Soviet naval forces during World War II, has died at the age of 72, Tass, the official press agency, reported today.

title: Bruins Win on Orr Goal
description: BOSTON, Dec. 8 (AP)Bobby Orr's 16th goal of the season at 15 minutes 33 seconds of the third period gave the Boston Bruins a 32 victory tonight over Pittsburgh and preserved a sixyear Boston mastery over the Penguins in the National Hockey League.

title: Archbold van Beuren Dies; Founder of Cue Magazine
description: Archbold van Beuren, a founder and later chairman of Cue magazine, died yesterday in Newport (R.I.) Hospital. He was 68 years old and lived at Gray Craig, in Newport, R.I.

title: Shipping/Mails All Hours Glean Eastern Standard Time
description: No passenger ship arrivals scheduled for today or tomorrow.

title: China Truck Sale Set
description: PEORIA, Ill., Dec. 8 (UPI)The Wapco Construction and Mining Company, a subsidiary of AmericanStandard, announced over the weekend it had agreed to sell $7million worth of trucks and parts to China. A company spokesman said he believed the offhighway vehicles will be used for open pit mining.

title: Churchill Again Toast of Washington
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8  At a commemorative dinner touched with pageantry and memories, some 70 prominent Americans and Britons lifted wine glasses last night to toast the memory of Sir Winston Churchill.

title: Videotapes to Be Used in Courts hi Bronx in U.S. Pilot Program
description: The confessions and police lineups of felony defendants in the Bronx will go on videotape for the first time in New York State, beginning on Jan. 1, Bronx District Attorney Mario Merola disclosed yesterday.

title: Sheriff in Georgia Killed
description: HIAWASSEE, Ga., Dec. 8 (UPI)A Georgia sheriff and passenger in a car he stopped for alleged drunken driving were killed early today in shootout. A police spokesman said items from two burglaries were found in the car. Sheriff Jay Chastain was killed by man identified by the police as Roy Struben Lockaby, who then was killed by other officers.

title: Democrats Hail Charter And Adjourn in Harmony
An UrbanRural Squabble Brews Over Green Acres
description: ORANGE, Dec. 8A conflict appears to be emerging between New Jersey's urban and rural communities over who should receive first priority in the allocation of the $200million Green Acres bond issue approved by the state's voters last month.

title: Cristina Negrin Becomes Bride Of Albert Drolet
description: Cristina Laurel Negrin, daughter of Mrs. Gerald Kean of Westport, Conn., and Miguel Negrin of Willingboro, N. J., was married yesterday afternoon to Albert Francis Drolet, son of Mr. and Mrs. Albert Drolet of Danvers, Mass.

title: MISS TURECK PLAYS THE PIANO WITH DASH
description: At the first two of her three Bach concerts at the Metropolitan Museum, Rosalyn Tureck played solo pieces on various keyboard instruments. For the final session on Saturday night, she brought along a piano with a Plexiglas lid and Frederick Waldman's Musica Aeterna Orchestra, the better to treat the full house to the Clavier Concertos Nos. 4 in A, 5 in F minor and 7 in G minor. Mr. Waldman also conducted a robust performance of Bach's Suite No. 1 as the substantial curtain raiser.

title: Two Historic Buildings Are Facing Destruction
description: ASBURY PARK, Dec. 8Two noted Monmouth County buildings, including one that was recently designated a historic site by New Jersey, will be destroyed soon, victims of edonomic circumstance.

title: None Hurt in Miami Blasts
description: MIAMI, Dec. 8 (AP)A series of small but loud explosions rocked Miami early today. No injuries were reported a fire official said. A telephone caller told The Associated Press the blasts had been set off by Cuban exiles. The fire official said the blasts apparently were caused by dynamite.

title: SCHMIDT BACK HOME AFTER VISIT TO U.S.
description: BONN, Dec. 8 (AP)Chancellor Helmut Schmidt returned to West Germany today from his first official visit to the United States intent, a spokesman said, upon healing AmericanFrench disagreement over ways of coping with the fuel crisis.

title: Democrats Hail Charter And Adjourn in Harmony
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Dec. 8Democrats went off a football game today and then headed home after a novel midterm convention that brought all segments of the coalition except one faction of organized labor into euphoric solidarity.

title: Soyuz Returns to Earth
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 8The Soyuz 16 spacecraft parachuted back to earth today after a sixday mission that was quickly hailed by officials here as a successful dress rehearsal for next July's planned linkup in space with American Apollo astronauts.

title: Kings' Late Surge Tops Pistons
description: DETROIT, Dec. 8 (AP)Jimmy Walker and Nate Archibald led the Kansas CityOmaha Kings with 18 points each in a 9692 National Basketball Association victory today over the Detroit Pistons.

title: Democrats Abroad Seek Voting Law
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Dec. 8 One of the hundreds of red, white and blue placards jutting up this week from the floor of the Democratic convention read, Dems. Abroad.

title: Man Who KilledGambino Nephew Survives Poisoning
description: The killer of Emanuel (Manny Gambino, nephew of Carlo Gambino, the Mafia leader, was given cocoa laced with strychnine in the Federal House of Detention here Nov. 22, but his life was saved at St. Vincent's Hospital emergency room, hospital and Federal officials disclosed yesterday.

title: News Summary and Index
description: MONDAY, DECEMBER 9, 1974

title: 7 Teams Set for Playoffs
Thant Buried at Site In Rangoon Chosen By Defiant Students
description: RANGOON, Burma, Dec. 8 (Reuters)U Thant, former Secretary General of the United Nations, was buried here today at a site chosen by students in defiance of his relatives, who wanted him buried elsewhere in the city.

title: New Day in the House
description: The Democrats in the House of Representatives, greatly strengthened by the Nov. 5 election, have made dramatic strides in recent days toward democratizing power in the House and making it more responsible to the will of the majority.

title: MIHAIL STOLAREVSKY
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 8 Mihail Stolarevsky, who retired last year as a violist with the Pittsburgh Symphony Orchestra, died yesterday in PresbvterianUniversity Hospital. Mr. Stolarevsky, who was in his seventies, had been with he orchestra for 28 years.

title: Jersey Aide's Son Is Slain by Police
description: LONG BRANCH, N. J., Dec. 8 The unarmed, 16yearold son of the executive director of Monmouth County's Antipoverty Program was shot to death by a policeman early today as the youth fled an area authorities had staked out in search of a rapist. The officer was later ordered suspended from duty.

title: G.O.P. UNIT MOVES TO REFORM RULES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8A special committee of the Republican party took steps today to encourage states to select women, young people and members of minority groups as delegates to the party's national convention.

title: Bridge: Siebert Team Takes Lead In Reisinger Play Finals
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Dec. 8A darkhorse team was strongly placed going into the final session of the Reisinger boardamatch team championship at the American Contract Bridge League Fall Nationals here tonight. David and Allan Siebert of Little Rock, Ark., and Procter Hawkins and John Jeffrey of Las Vegas, Nev., outdistanced a starstudded field in the afternoon's play by winning 19 boards of a possible 30, to lead by more than two boards.

title: Longtime Donors Give for Neediest
description: The New York Times Needlest Cases Fund started its 63d annual appeal yesterday with $450,257.48 already donated by estates, trust funds and 284 contributors.

title: Vital Trade Reform
description: The debate over trade with, and emigration policies of, the Soviet Union has distracted attention from the chief purpose of the longpending trade reform bill: to open the way for the free world's next round of GATT negotiations to reduce trade barriers. If the bill is not approved by the time Congress adjourns, the next legislature will have to start from the beginning and action may well be delayed until after the 1976 election.

title: Charlie Is Best Dog
description: PENNSAUKEN, N.J., Dec. 8  Ch. Cummings GoldRush Charlie, 4yearold golden retriever took the best inshowhonors today over 1,118 rivals at the 42d annual Camden County Kennel Club event at the Ivystone Inn.

title: Spanish Children Pledge Loyalty to Franco at RightWing Rally
description: MADRID, Dec. 8  Thousands of children and youths were marched into the grounds of the Pardo Palace outside Madrid today to pledge loyalty to Generalissimo Francisco Franco and his regime.

title: H.E.W. Bars Full Matching Aid For the Poor in Abortion Cases
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8 (AP) The Department of Health, Education and Welfare proposed today that sterilizations, but not abortions be considered family planning services for which the department will pay 90 per cent of the costs for poor people.

title: Panassie, Jazz Critic, 62, Dies; Founder of Hot Club de France
description: PARIS, Dec. 8Hughes Panassi, the foremost French authority on American jazz, died today of a heart attack at his home in Montauban, in southwestern France. He was 62 years old.

title: U. S. OPTIMISTIC OVER WHEAT CROP
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8An increase in planted acreage and favorable fall weather have raised prospects for the nation's largest wheat harvest ever, agricultural specialists will be told during a fourday conference on the farm economy that opens tomorrow.

title: REGULATORY BODY PONDERS REFORM
description: SAN DIEGO, Dec. 8An 85yearold organization of state regulators of public utilities has taken a first, tentative step to democratize itself.

title: Family Food Fashion Furnishing
description: SAIGON, South VietnamIf Saigon is not categorically a capital of gaiety, it is similarly by no stretch of the imagination a gray or sullen, sad and somber place. The vehicular traffic in the streets is a multifaceted conglomeration of pedicabs, bicycles, motorbikes and motorcycles. Plus automobiles of various vintages and makes including antiquated, dilapidated taxis, a sorry assortment of Simcas, Dauphines and Renaults, seemingly held together with faith and baling wire, many with door handles improvised from screwdrivers and other assorted hardware. Children play sidewalk games and men and women go about their affairs with a brisk step and an air of admirable good cheer.

title: Transsexual Starting New Life in Catskills
description: CATSKILL, N.Y.A historic 18thcentury house has become a refuge for a white, Britishborn writer, once in the whirl of Charleston society, and her black husband. Their move here, earlier this year, has gone virtually unnoticed.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: A 3yearold girl was killed and two other children were seriously burned in a fire that broke out at their Seaside Heights home while their parents were watching television, authorities reported.

title: Ribicoff Plans Hearings Into Laxity on Oil Prices
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8 (AP) Senator Abraham Ribicoff, Democrat of Connecticut, will open hearings Wednesday into alleged laxity in price regulation of the oil industry.

title: SATELLITE LIFTOFF DELAYED BY REPAIR
description: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla., Dec. 8 (UPI)The launching of West Germany's Helios sun satellite was delayed today by a problem in the Atlas Centaur booster rocket and rescheduled for 2:11 A.M. Tuesday.

title: Sextuplets Born to Woman, 26, Who Lost Quadruplets in 1973
description: SAN JOSE, Calif. Dec. 8 (UPI)A woman who took fertility drugs gave birth prematurely to sextuplets today. The sixth and smallest died four hours after birth, but doctors said the five surviving babies appeared to be in good health.

title: Longtime Donors Give for Neediest
description: The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund started its 63d annual appeal yesterday with $450,257.48 already donated by estates, trust funds and 284 contributors.

title: Villard Houses: Option for the Future
description: The future of the Villard Houses, the superb Ushaped group of Italian Renaissance brownstones by McKim, Mead & White on Madison Avenue behind St. Patrick's Cathedral, has been uclear for some time. The Archdiocese of New York, the owner of the houses, no longer needs the buildings and would like to be rid of them. Several developers have come forth with projects for skyscrapers on the site, a prime piece of midtown real estate, but all of these have involved demolition, which is prevented by the Landmarks Preservation Commission's designation of the buildings as official city landmarks in 1968. Now Harry Helmsley, the realestate developer, has a new plan, which will be presented to the Landmarks Preservation Commission at a public hearing tomorrow afternoon. Mr. Helmsley wants to build a hotel and office tower on the site, and he proposes to retain the Villard grouping as an entrance to the hotel.

title: New Contacts Expected
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Dec. 8Prime Minister Ian Smith plans to renew contact soon with President Kenneth Kaunda of Zambia despite the lastminute collapse of talks in Lusaka that promised to achieve a ceasefire in Rhodesia's guerrilla war, according to sources close to the Rhodesian Government.

title: Woman Killed, 13 Are Hurt as Car Sideswipes a Bus
description: NORTH BERGEN, Dec. 8 (UPI)One wwoman was killed and at least 13 persons were injured today when a car sideswiped a commuter bus, forcing it against a guard rail on Interstate 495 near the North Bergen viaduct, the police said.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Health Department summonses have been issued against three Brooklyn daycare centers for children 1 to 6 years old, alleging that they were operating without a license and were overcrowded, illequipped and without proper firealarm systems.

title: JUDGE HALTS SUIT ON HORSE KILLING
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8A Federal judge here has dismissed a suit charging that the Interior Department Illegally allowed the roundup and slaughter of a herd of wild horses on Federal land in Idaho in early 1972.

title: Sports News Briefs Jockey Wins 8 Over Weekend
description: GRANTVILLE, Pa., Dec. 8Chris McCarron concluded a highly successful weekend with two victories today at Penn National but the 19yearold jockey was upstaged somewhat by the local debut of Cindy Reggi, 18. Miss Reggi also won twice after arriving from Charlestown Race Track, where she was the leading rider at the meeting that closed last night. McCarron finished the weekend with 495 victories for the year, only 20 behind Sandy Hawley's record. He won six races last night at Penn National. His two seconds today came behind Miss Reggi, one in the ?? tured $5,000 seventh race.

title: Rector Disobeys Bishop
description: OBERLIN, Ohio, Dec. 8 (AP) An Episcopal rector permitted two, women priests to celebrate the Eucharist in two public worship services today despite opposition from his bishop. The Rev, L. Peter Beebe, rector of Christ Episcopal Church, had been ordered by the Right Rev. John H. Burt not to allow the women to celebrate the sacrament because the church does not sanction female priests.

title: Jets Win 5th in Row
description: Joe Namath rallied the New York Jets to their fifth consecutive victory, a 2010 decision over the Buffalo Bills yesterday at Shea Stadium. The Giants lost their fifth straight game, 207, to the Philadelphia Eagles at New Haven. Page 49.

title: 5 of Sextuplets Survive
description: A woman who took fertility drugs gave birth to sextuplets yesterday in San Jose, Calif. The sixth and smallest of the babies died, but doctors said the others appeared to be in good health. Page 31.

title: Miss Ostacher Is Wed Here to Bert Pulitzer
description: Corinne Ostacher, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Murray Ostacher of Jericho, L. I., was married yesterday afternoon to Bert Kenneth Pulitzer, son Of Mrs. Benjamin Pulitzer of Long Beach, L. L, and the late Mr. Pulitzer. Rabbi Samuel Press performed the ceremony at the Plaza.

title: Miller 7Shot Victor In Japan With a 274
description: MIYAZAKI, Japan, Dec. 8 (UPI)Johnny Miller shot a fiveunderpar 67 today and won the $170,000 Dunlop Phoenix golf tournament by a sevenstroke margin.

title: Greeks Reject Monarchy By Wide Margin of Votes
description: ATHENS, Monday, Dec. 9Greece voted decisively yesterday to become a republic and eliminate the monarchy that was installed here 142 years ago.

title: Fillmore East, Clean, Pleasant And Promising, Rocks Again
description: The old Fillmore East rock auditorium on Second Avenue at Seventh Street reopened Saturday night with the kind of concert that makes one hope that the new proprietor can keep it going.

title: JACKSON DISPUTES KISSINGER ON ARMS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8Senator Henry M. Jackson disputed today the contention of Secretary of State Kissinger that Congressional rejection of the Vladivostok agreement on arms control would spur a new arms race and imperil SovietAmerican relations.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Greece voted decisively to become a republic and to eliminate her monarchy that was established in 1832. The votes were running about 2 to 1 in favor of uncrowned democracy, as it was designated on the ballot. This means that King Constantine, who has been in exile for seven years, will be stripped of his title. He was the sixth member of his dynasty to reign as King of the Hellenes. [Page 1, Columns 56.]

title: Jersey Consumer Notes
description: Flammable plastic umbrellas, a musical ferris wheel with sharp edges that can cut and small parts that can be swallowed, bright yellow cutouts colored with a hazardous dye and a rifle that goes off with a potentially deafening bang are among the 62 varieties of dangerous toys. that have been found on New Jersey departmentstore shelves in recent weeks.

title: FUNDS AGAIN FLOW INTO THRIFT UNITS
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 8Funds are starting to flow back slowly into the California savings and loan associations, reversing slightly a huge, sixmonth drain.

title: Giants Bow By 207 for 5th Straight
description: NEW HAVEN, Dec. 8 Maybe Mike Boryla will wake up soon and realize that rookie quarterbacks are supposed to bomb out in bad weather, like drab dramas in this preBroadway town.

title: Pacific8 Powers Not All Named U. C. L. A.
PLAYBOY ASSOCIATES FACE DRUG INQUIRY
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 8 (AP) Seven associates and employes of Playboy Enterprises are cheduled to appear this week before a Federal grand jury in a narcotics investigation of the Playboy concern, Chicago newspapers reported today.

title: HANUKKAH TORCH IS CARRIED TO CITY
description: Undaunted by the rain, groups of youngsters running in relays for a total distance of more than 15 miles yesterday afternoon carried a blazing Hanukkah torch from Kennedy International Airport in Queens to the Zionist Organization of America headquarters at 4 East 34th Street, Manhattan.

title: Charlie Is Best Dog
description: PENNSAUKEN, N.J., Dec. 8  Ch. Cummings GoldRush Charlie, 4yearold golden retriever took the best inshowhonors today over 1,118 rivals at the 42d annual Camden County Kennel Club event at the Ivystone Inn.

title: Tracy Nadel Is Bride Of Richard B. Stanger
description: Tracy Sue Nadel, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Melvin Nadel of New York, was married yesterday afternoon to Richard Bennett Stanger, son of Mr. and Mrs. Abraham Stanger of White Plains. Rabbi Murray Grauer performed the ceremony at the Pierre.

title: Namath Rallies Jets to 5 in Row
U.S.SOVIET ACCORD ON RANTS SIGNED
description: Grains, vines, herbs and trees will be jointly cultivated by The United States and the Soviet Union under an agreement aimed at preserving endangered plant species in the two countries.

title: Oil Concerns Canceling Refinery Plans But a Lagging Demand Offsets Impact
description: Despite a recent rash of cancellations of additions to American refining capacity, the United States is presently in better shape with regard to petroleuin processing facilities than in the last few years.

title: Islanders Lose to Flyers, 32
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 8The Philadelphia Flyers made almost three times as many shots as New York tonight, but Glenn Resch and the Islanders at least managed to scare the National Hockey League's team of speedy roadrunners before losing, 32.

title: NEWS INDEX
'76 Plank on Urban Aid Is Beame's Aim
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Dec. 8 Feeling that the Democratic midterm conference has overlooked many of the problems of the cities, Mayor Beame of New York said today that he and other Democratic mayors were beginning a concentrated drive for a strong urban program in the 1976 Presidential convention platform.

title: Steelers Take Division Title
description: FOXBORO, Mass., Dec. 8 Franco Harris carried the Pittsburgh Steelers into the National Football League playoffs today. The broad shouldered, 230pound fullback smashed at the New England Patriots' defense for 136 yards, his second highest rushing total of the season.

title: British Football
description: RUBY LEAGUE

title: French to Switch Off Night Lights of Paris
description: PARIS, Dec. 8 (Reuters)The French Government, in an effort to cut down on consumption of energy, has issued a series of decrees that, could change this city of light into a city of darkness.

title: Beame Defends Naming Rabbi Of His Synagogue to City Post
description: Mayor Beame said yesterday that a rabbi affiliated with his Brooklyn synagogue had been named to a $32,000ayear Human Resources Administration post last April because he felt the clergyman was wellqualified and had more impressive credentials than the rabbi who held the post under John V. Lindsay.

title: Outlook Mostly Gloomy For Japanese Economy
description: TOKYO, Dec. 8Analyzing the Japanese economy these days is a bit like the old saw about looking at the whisky bottlethe pessimists see it half empty and the optimists half full.

title: Enthusiastic Spirit Warms Gondoliers From Village Opera
description: There were milestones galore on Saturday as the Village Light Opera Group opened its season with The Gondoliers at the Fashion Institute Auditorium, 227 West 27th Street. It was 185 years to the day that the Gilbert and Sullivan classic began its original run at the Savoy, Theater. The show opened the group's 40th anniversary year. The occasion marked the 33d operetta that Ronald W. Noll has directed since his debut with the troupe in 1958, also conducting Gondoliers.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE GLORY AND PAGEANTRY OF CHRISTMAS. By the editors of TimeLife Books. 220 Pages, Illustrated. Hammond, Inc. $14.95.

title: Beame Defends Naming Rabbi Of His Synagogue to City Post
description: Mayor Beame said yesterday that a rabbi affiliated with his Brooklyn synagogue had been named to a $32,000ayear Human Resources Administration post last April because he felt the clergyman was wellqualified and had more impressive credentials than the rabbi who held the post under John V. Lindsay.

title: Recasting the Reforms
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Dec. 8There have been two great bursts of reform in the postwar Democratic partythe one symbolized by Senator Hubert H. Humphrey that grew out of the 1948 convention at Philadelphia and the one symbolized by Senator George McGovern that grew out of the 1968 convention at Chicago. In a sense, what happened in Kansas City constituted a climax to both the call for civil rights in '48 and the call for more convention openness in '68.

title: Widow of Slain Jerseyan Held as Plotter
description: The 32yearold widow of a New Jersey jeweler whose chauffeur admitted shooting him fatally nearly a year ago was in the Camden city jail yesterday, accused of conspiring with the chauffeur to kill her husband.

title: Weather Reports and Forecast
description: Cloudy skies and colder temperatures are expected today throughout the Middle Atlantic States, and rain is forecast for New England. Though sunny skies will prevail in the southern twothirds of the country, a cold front from the Atlantic Coast to the Mississippi River will lower temperatures considerably. Snow is likely to fall in the upper Mississippi Valley and from the northern Appalachians to the lower lake region. Milder temperatures will be felt for a while in the northern and Central Plains States. A pattern of rain in the valleys and snow in the mountains will cover the western portion of the country from the northern Rockies to the Pacific Northwest.

title: RHODESIA BLACKS SIGN UNITY PACT
description: LUSAKA, Zambia, Dec. 8The longdivided black Rhodesian liberation movements signed an agreement today to unite and to prepare for any conference for the transfer of power to the majority that might be called with the white minority Rhodesian Government of Prime Minister Ian D. Smith.

title: Cosmetics Gift Race Goes On
description: Need a handbag? Some jewelry? A game? A decanter or a jam jar? You needn't chase up and down department store escalators: these varied items can be found within the confines of the cosmetics department.

title: Japanese Parliament Names Miki Premier
description: TOKYO, Monday, Dec. 9 (UPI)Takeo Miki was elected Premier by Parliament today. He replaces Kakuei Tanaka, who formally resigned earlier in the day to pave the way for Mr. Miki.

title: Arkansas Sniper Flees Into Tower, Threatening Police
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., Dec. 8 (UPI)A sniper armed with a, high powered rifle fired at police and passing freight trains late today, then fled into a railroad tower and threatened to kill anyone who came within range.

title: Foes of President Grapple With the Police in Seoul
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Dec. 8 The opposition members of the National Assemblyended a threeday sitin today and were met by about 800 riot policemen outside Parliament. They were dragged into black police jeeps and taken to their homes.

title: Jets Win 5th in Row
description: Joe Namath rallied the New York Jets to their fifth consecutive victory, a 2010 decision over the Buffalo Bills yesterday at Shea Stadium. The Giants lost their fifth straight game, 207, to the Philadelphia Eagles at New Haven, Page 49.

title: A Police Informer Here Boasts He Got Away With 200 Crimes
description: A 22yearold man who has spent six years as a police informer is scheduled to go on trial today for one of the 200 crimes he claims to have committed since 1968,

title: DEMOCRAT REJECTS NEW HAMPSHIRE TIE
description: CONCORD, N.H., Dec. 8 (AP) John A. Durkin, a Democrat, has dismissed suggestions that he and his Republican rival for a seat in the United States Senate, Louis C. Wyman, call their Senate race a tie and ask for a new election.

title: Ludlam's Stage Blood, Hamlet With Happy Ending
description: Charles Ludlam's Stage Blood is Hamlet with a happy ending, which is of course, ridiculousas in Ridiculous Theatrical Company. In Mr. Ludlam's latest comic invention (he is director, author, and also Hamlet), a seedy troupe of actors is in Mudville, U.S.A., preparing to open Hamlet without an Ophelia.

title: ECONOMIC PINCH SPURS BUS TRAVEL
description: Inflation, growing unemployment and higher gasoline prices have touched off a resurgence of bus travel.

title: Sex Change Sends Two To Catskills
description: CATSKILL, N.Y.,  A historic 18thcentury house has become a refuge for a white, Britishborn writer, once in the whirl of Charleston society, and her black husband. Their move here, earlier this year, has gone virtually unnoticed.

title: Dance: Gypsy Orchestra
description: Gypsies have always been among the great entertainers of the world and it came as no surprise that the Rajko Hungarian Gypsy Orchestra and Dancers performed as superbly as they did Saturday night at Carnegie Hall.

title: Allen Arrives for Talks, Calls Kissinger Teacher
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8 (AP) Foreign Minister Yigal Allon of Israel arrived at Washington's, National Airport today for talks with Secretary of State Kissinger.

title: COMPUTER PUT BY F.P.C STUDIED
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8 (AP)the General Accounting Office is investigating alleged irregularities and a possible conflict of interest in the Federal Power Commission's award of a $10million computer contract, according to Government and industry sources.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I have been following The Times's articles on the world food situation with great interest and feel that an outstanding public service has been performed by this coverage. Quite a few of the articles, however, have directly or indirectly praised an approach to the problem of world hunger which I think is highly questionable.

title: COSTA RICA ALLOWS VESCO TO STAY ON
description: SAN JOSE, Costa Rica, Dec. 8 (AP)  President Daniel Oduber announced today that Robert L. Vesco, the fugitive American financier, would be permitted to stay in Costa Rica despite a public campaign to expel him as an undesirable.

title: Mr. Ford's Little List
description: The deeper the economy slides into recession and the longer the ranks of the joblessthere are now six million out of work and the unemployment rate has jumped to 6.5 per centthe more fatuous appear President Ford's proposals for cutting the budget.

title: Soviet Shuns Nobel Function
description: STOCKHOLM, Dec. 8 (UPI)The Soviet Union and five of its Eastern European allies have refused to send delegates to the Nobel Prize award ceremonies Tuesday, the Swedish Foreign Ministry said today. Nobel committee sources attributed the refusal to the planned presence of the exiled Russian author Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn, who will pick up his 1970 Nobel Prize in literature.

title: Greeks Reject Monarchy By Wide Margin of Votes
description: ATHENS, Monday, Dec. 9Greece voted decisively yesterday to become a republic and eliminate the monarchy that was installed here 142 years ago.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 37

title: Man Who Killed Gambino Nephew Survives Poisoning
description: The killer of Emanuel (Manny Gambino, nephew of Carlo Gambino, the Mafia leader was given cocoa laced with strychnine in the Federal House of Detention here Nov. 22, but his life was saved at St. Vincent's Hospital emergency room, hospital and Federal officials disclosed yesterday.

title: U.S. Sees Kissingers Meeting With Allon Today as Crucial
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8Foreign Minister Yigal Allon of Israel arrived today for talks with Secretary of State Kissinger that American officials believe may largely determine whether Israel and Egypt can make further diplomatic progress and move the Middle East a little closer to peace.

title: Austrians Finish 1,2 In Downhill Ski Race
description: VAL D'ISERE, France, Dec. 8Paced by Franz Klammer and Werner Grissmann who finished first and second, the Austrian team won five of the first 10 places today in a World Cup downhill competition. The other places were taken by skiers from five countries.

title: PRESIDENT PREPARES FOR A BUSY WEEK
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8 (AP) President Ford spent a quiet Sunday clearing his desk for a busy week ahead that will include discussions on energy policy and the 1976 budget, and a summit meeting in Martinique with the President of France.

title: She Plays Santa Claus With Aplomb
description: GARDEN CITY, L.I.,There is a jolly round Santa Claus at the Saks Fifth Avenue store here, one who shouts Merry Christmas at almost everyone, who passes out balloons to children, kisses them and listens patiently to what' they want for Christmas.
