title: Optimism Voiced on Starting Parleys to Seek Sinai Accord
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 4Despite the succession of diplomatic and political setbacks Israel has suffered in recent months, her leaders are still hopeful that a new round of negotiations with Egypt will get under Way soon.

title: Sports Today
description: Sports Today

title: RHODESIA BLACKS SIGN UNITY PACT
description: LUSAKA, Zambia, Dec. 8The longdivided black Rhodesian liberation movements signed an agreement today to unite and to prepare for any conference for the transfer of power to the majority that might be called with the white minority Rhodesian Government of Prime Minister Ian D. Smith.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: Walter Annenberg, former Ambassador to Britain, is one of four new trustees elected to the board of the Metropolitan Museum of Art. The others are Mrs. Charles W. Engelhard, director of the Engelhard Minerals and Chemicals Corporation; Mary R. Morgan, daughter of Vice Presidentdesignate Nelson A. Rockefeller, and State Supreme Court Justice Frank D. O'Connor.

title: Personal Finance: New Mortgage Aid
description: For decades, the overwhelming preponderance of mortgages for one  family homes have been selfamortizing, in which the principal and interest are repaid together in equal monthly payments, according to a deliHite schedule. As a result, the debt owed to the bank or other institutions is fully paid at the conclusion of the mortgage period, generally 20 to 30 years.

title: PRICES OF BONDS EXPECTED TO RISE
description: Prices of bonds and Government securities are expected to rise today in response to the early Christmas present unwrapped late Friday by the Federal Reserve Board. The Fed announced a cut in the discount rate it charges on its loans to member commercial banks and, with this single action, dramatized its shift toward further ease in monetary policy.

title: DOCK WORKERS VOTE TO STRIKE IN BOSTON
description: BOSTON, Dec. 8 (UPI) Members of the International Longshoremen's Association, working since their contract expired Sept. 30, voted today to strike the port ob Boston tomorrow.

title: Arabs Are: (1) Stereotyped (2) Ditto (3) Both of the Above
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif.  People's stereotypes of particular groups tend to serve as a basis for action or policymaking. Therefore, an understanding of the general American stereotypes of the Arabs is basic to an understanding of United States politics involving the Middle East.

title: JAY GORDON GAINES
description: EAST SETAUCKET, L.I., Dec. 8  Jay Gordon Gaines, a qualitycontrol representative for Grumman Aircraft for spaceprogram projects, died at his home here today of a heart ailment. He was 53 years old.

title: Fireman Dies in Ohio Blaze
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 8 (AP)Fire swept through the first floor of the 92yearold Hawley House late last night, killing a fireman trying to rescue occupants on upper floors of the hotel. Eleven persons were reported injured.

title: Victims of Upstate Crash Identified
description: A 28yearold lighting engineer whose college roommate had been killed in a plane crash just a week earlier was identified yesterday as the pilot of private plane that crashed in Harriman State Park on Saturday, killing all three persons aboard.

title: Rangers Tied, 33, By Canadien Rally
description: Any time the Montreal Canadiens come to town to play the New York Rangers should be a holiday. Last night at Madison Square Garden was such an occasion of electric atmosphere, with the players and even the fans thoroughly up with anticipation. The two teams skated, checked and hit as they seldom do against lesser opposition, and their lively encounter ended in a 3.3 tie.

title: Blazers Say Walton Isn't Going to Quit
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Dec. 8 (AP)  Bill Walton, the rookie center of the Portland Trail Blazers, has ended speculation that he might abandon his National Basketball Association career.

title: Advertising
description: The high, command of Redbook, which prides itself on having the highest concentration of 18to 35yearold readers among the top women's magazines, decided some time ago that The Magazine for Young Mamas was no longer the appropriate advertising theme for the magazine.

title: Gunman Slays Yale Junior
description: NEW HAVEN, Dec. 8Gary C. Stein, a 20yearold Yale University junior from Irvington, N. Y., was shot on a street here about 11:30 last night and died in YaleNew Haven Hospital about two and a half hours later.

title: FORD TO BE ASKED TO APPROVE RISE IN U.S. FOOD AID
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 8President Ford will be asked this week to approve a budget increase for foreign food assistance and to settle an interagency fight over the amounts of aid to be supplied to individual countries.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: FLASHBACKS An art exhibition on the 33d anniversary of the attack on Pearl Harbor, which includes more than 150 paintings and sketches of World War II battles by such artists as Reginald Marsh, Thomas Hart Benton and Jon Whitcomb, begins a sixweek, weekday display today from 8:30 A.M. to 4:30 P.M, in the lobby area of the new United States Custom House, 6 World Trade Center.

title: MILK DELIVERERS REJECT CONTRACT; STRIKE CONTINUES
description: A tentative settlement aimed at ending the fourday strike by 2.700 milk drivers and plant employes was rejected by union members yesterday, dashing hopes that normal delivery would resume today in stores, schools and homes in the New York area.

title: New Books
description: Approaching OblivionRoad Signs on the Treadmill Toward Tomorrow, 11 uncollected stories by Harlan Ellison, foreword by Michael Crichton (Walker, $8.95).

title: WIDOW ARRESTED IN JERSEY KILLING
description: The 32yearold widow of a New Jersey jeweler whose chauffeur admitted shooting him fatally nearly a year ago was in the Camden city jail yesterday, accused of conspiring with the chauffeur to kill her husband.

title: MILK DELIVERERS REJECT CONTRACT; STRIKE CONTINUES
description: A tentative settlement aimed at ending the fourday strike by 2,700 milk drivers and plant employes was rejected by union members yesterday, dashing hopes that normal delivery would resume today in stores, schools and homes in the New York area.

title: Miss Post's Golf Victory Ends a 6Year Dry Spell
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Dec. 8 (UPI)Sandra Post shot a twooverpar 218 today and won the $72,000 Far East women's golf tournament at the Victoria Golf Club by one stroke.

title: ALI KHAN MANSOUR, EXPREMIER OF IRAN
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Dec. 8 (AP)  Ali Khan Mansour, Premier of Iran from 1939 to 1941, died here today at the age of 79. He was the father of Hassan Ali Mansour, who became Premier in 1964 and was assassinated in January, 1965.

title: Major Bills in Congress
Text of Party Charter Adopted at Democratic Conference Following Compromise
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Dec. 8Following is the text of the charter of the Democratic party as adopted here by the 1974 Democratic conference on party organization and policy:

title: Vietnamese City Calm Despite Prediction of Attack
description: TAY NINH, South Vietnam, Dec. 5In Saigon, staff officers and intelligence analysts pore over captured documents and predict that this exposed outpost of Government control will shortly be attacked or encircled by nearby North Vietnamese regiments.

title: Police Team: Six Shooters With Sticks
description: To a small group of New York City policemen, ice isn't a bad wordit stands for hockey.

title: Ethiopian Junta's Grip Is Suffocating Liberty
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Dec. 5A breath of liberty and exciting hopes of a new democratic future that were felt briefly earlier this year have nearly disappeared as an almost anonymous and hardfisted military junta has replaced centuries of absolute monarchy.

title: JOHN E. CARROLL, 62, OF AMERICAN HOIST
description: John E. Carroll, chairman and chief executive officer of the American Hoist & Derrick Company, died Saturday in St. Paul at the age of 62.

title: '69 AID EXPLAINED TO M'CRANE JURY
description: SCRANTON, Pa., Dec. 9 (AP) The former general manager of a company that took tax writeoffs for donations to the 1969 campaign of former New Jersey Gov. William T. Cahill testified today that his company also might have contributed to the campaigns of two Cahill opponents  William Ozzard and Robert B. Meyner.

title: Rockefeller Debate Opens; Senate Vote Is Due Today
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9The Senate began today its formal debatewhich was more like a polite discussionon the confirmation of Nelson A. Rockefeller as Vice Presiident, using less than the time allotted before the final vote scheduled for tomorrow.

title: BYRNE SIGN BILLS ON ENVIRONMENT
description: TRENTON, Dec. 9Governor Byrne signed into law today three bills designed to protect and enhance the state's environment.

title: Gov. Kneip's Last Term
description: PIERRE, S. D., Dec. 9 (UPI) Gov. Richard F. Kneip, a Democrat, said today that his election to a third term last month was probably his swan song as a political candidate. My desire right now is to be the best Governor I can be for the next four years and this yeaves me free to do the best job I can, he said.

title: COURT BARS REVIEW ON AIRCARGO RATES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 (AP)The Supreme Court refused today to hear arguments by Maryland's Department of Transportation and the Commonwealth of Virginia that federally regulated airfreight rates to Europe are discriminatory.

title: Books of The Times
description: LISZT: The Artist as Romantic Hero. By Eleanor Pernyi, 466 pages. Illustrated. AtlanticLittle, Brown. $15.

title: East Germans Offer Bonn Broad New Concessions
description: BERLIN, Dec. 9East Getmany offered a package of concessions and proposals today to ease travel, improve relations and strengthen economic cooperation between the two Germanys and West Berlin.

title: Deer Hunt Delayed
description: A Federal judge in Newark issued a temporary stay order against deer hunting in the Great Swamp in New Jersey scheduled to start today, pending further court action this morning. If the stay is then dissolved, the hunt could go on later in the day. Today's hearing will be in Philadelphia. Page 49.

title: Hyland Urges Graft Fight To Restore Public's Faith
description: SOUTH ORANGE, Dec. 9William F. Hyland, the New Jersey Attorney General, told a gathering of assistant county prosecutors today that they must mount an effective attack on official corruption before public confidence government will be restored.

title: Panel Bids C.C.N.Y. Remove Professor, Censure 4 Others
description: The removal or suspension of Dr. Stanley W. Page, a tenured full professor in the history department at City College, and his censure along with the censure of four of his colleagues has been recommended by a special committee of inquiry following a sevenmonth investigation of the strifetorn department.

title: People in Sports
description: Earl Weaver and his wife, Marianna, escaped serious bijury, but the Baltimore Oriole manager's 71yearold parents were hospitalized after a fourvehicle collision yesterday near Washington, Pa.

title: New Jersey Sports Dispute on Playoffs
description: New Jersey's first sanctioned postseason high school football playoffs are now history, and apparently they accomplished two things: They created wide interest in the state and even wider controversy. Whether the controversies can be resolved so that there will be future playoffs remains to be seen. State officials weren't ready to commit themselves yesterday.

title: Business Briefs
description: LONDON, Dec. 9 (UPI)Britain had an estimated currentaccount deficit of $1.87billion in the third quarter of the year, the Treasury said today.

title: Firestone Tire Earnings And Sales Set New Highs
Warriors, Barry surprise of N.B.A.
description: Franklin Mieuli, the freespirited, wealthy owner of the Golden State Warriors, can start spending more money on his California wine collections and on cruise ships charters. The once financially troubled Warrior franchise doesn't need his money, not this season at least.

title: Census Finds BlackOwned Businesses Rose by 19% in 3 Years
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9, Black ownership of businesses, much espoused in the early years of the Nixon Administration as black capitalism, is still limited in the United States but it is growing, according to a study released today by the Census Bureau of tie Department of Commerce.

title: Coaches' Worry: Play or Rest Stars
description: This year some teams backed into the National Football League's playoffsthe Rams and Steelers, for example. Others, like the Cardinals, staggered into the elite company of eight quailfiers. All are glad to be there, to have realized the first goal of every N.F.L. season, but no one seems very secure about achieving the ultimate goal, the Super Bowl.

title: VOTE STILL DISPUTED IN NEW HAMPSHIRE
description: CONCORD, N.H., Dec. 9, (AP)Legal, battles surruonding New Hampshire's disputed United States Senate seat spread today to two additional arenas.

title: Market Place
description: Small companies have found that it has become increasingly difficult in this depresied period to maintain a market for their shares. Scores of brokers who are market makers have stopped making markets in the shares of small companies, and other over the counter brokers have gone out of business.

title: Senate Backs Monument
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 (AP)The Senate approved today a bill authorizing erection of a monument to commemorate the establishment of a permanent Marine Corps barracks in Washington 19 years ago. The bill, approved by voice vote without dissent, now goes to the House.

title: Press Party at White House
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 (AP) A Christmas reception will be held at the White House Dec. 19 for members of the news media who regularly cover the Presidential family. The 7 to 9 P.M. affair will be by invitation only, a White House spokesman said.

title: Waldheim Urges Extension Of U.N. Mission in Cyprus
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 9  Secretary General Waldheim in a report to the Security Council today recommended extending the mandate of the United Nations Force in Cyprus for six months.

title: Stress Is on Economy in Miki's Cabinet
description: TOKYO, Dec. 9Takeo Miki, Japan's new Premier, selected a cabinet today that appeared to be a mixture of oldtime factional balancing with an attempt to bring in new talent to meet Japan's pressing economic and political problems.

title: ROBERT C. DUFFY
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 9 (AP) Robert C. Duffy, former chairman of the Republican City Committee of Philadelphia, died yesterday in a hospital, here. He was 71 years old.

title: Pickets Keep Some Coal Mines Closed
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., Dec. 9 (AP)Most of the nation's coal mines resumed production today after a monthlong shutdown, but about a fifth of the mines remained closed because of picketing by mine construction workers.

title: Spirit of '74, and '76 Inspires the City to Refurbish for the Bicentennial
description: One clay last spring, visitors to the Statue of Liberty who looked up to admire her fine, strong face silhouetted the sky gasped to see a man strapped to a ladder swaying some 300 feet above the harbor. He was recaulking the glass panes in Liberty's torch.

title: EHRLICHMAN SAYS NIXON IS TO BLAME FOR THE COVERUP
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9John D. Ehrlichman took the stand in his own defense today at the Watergate coverup trial, a defense that sought to shift the blame to former President Richard M. Nixon.

title: E.P.A. Aides Say Commerce Dept. Amendments Would Weaken Clean Air Act
description: WASHINGON, Dec. 9The Department of Commerce has sent to the White House Office of Management and Budget proposed amendments to the Clean Air Act that the Environmental Protection Agency regards as deliberately designed to make the act ineffective.

title: JOB DIP IS TERMED EUROPE'S BIG ISSUE
description: PARIS, Dec. 9The heads of governments of the nine European Common Market countries agreed today at the first session of their conference that with all facing economic recession, the most urgent need was coordinated action against unemployment.

title: Wilson Accused of Delay on Willowbrook Decree
description: A bitter complaint that Governor Wilson had held up a consent judgment on reforms at the Willowbrook Developmental Center was voiced yesterday by counsel for the New York Civil Liberties Union and the executive director of the New York State Association for Retarded Children.

title: Namath Playing Guessing Game; One Jet Owner Feels He'll Stay
description: It is obvious that Joe Namath loves the game. Not footballthe guessing game.

title: Still No Milk
description: Under the rules governing contract ratification in the New York City milk union, all that is needed to sustain an agreement recommended by the union bargaining committee is a yes vote by onethird of the members plus one.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 47

title: Pro Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: Manpower Specialists Discuss Ways To Give the Unemployed Public Jobs
description: As the nation's economic outlook grows grimmer by the day, planners, manpower specialists and Federal, state and local officials are talking not about whether the nation needs a new, expanded program of public service employment but about what kind of a program should be.

title: RICHARD ALTSCHULER
description: Richard W. Altschuler, a movieindustry executive, died yesterday at the Columbia Presbyterian Medical Center. He was 67 years old and lived at 155 West 68th Street.

title: Scott Says Tapes Prove Nixon Lied To Him on Scandal
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 (UPI) The Senate Republican leader, Hugh Scott, said today that President Nixon had lied to him about White House involvement in Watergage.

title: Sara Yarborough Dances Splendidly In Billie Portrait
description: Performers on stage draw the public in droves to adore them, but the lives of performers offstage draw even larger attention. John Butler cleverly designed his Portrait of Billie as a form of ballet expose of the private life of the singer Billie Holiday. A compelling and compassionate work, it was superbly danced by Sara Yarborough on Sunday with Ulysses Dove at the Alvin Ailey City Center Dance Theater.

title: Chile Accused of Torture By O.A.S. Investigators
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9The military Government of Chile has been charged with extremely serious violations of hurnen rights, including extensive torture of political prisoners, in a report by a fivenation investigating team of the Organization of American States.

title: State Certifies Election Results; Carey's Margin Put at 808,836
description: ALBANY, Dec. 9The StateBoard of Canvassers reported today, in certifying r??ults of the Nov. 5 election, ?? Representative Hugh L. Carey defeated Governor Wilson by a plurality of 808,836 votes.

title: British Seek 10% Fuel Cut By Heat and Speed Curbs
description: LONDON, Dec. 9The Government announced a broadly based mandatory energysaving program today, including lower speed limits on many highways and a maximum temperature of 68 degrees in most buildings other than homes and hospitals.

title: Aqueduct Feature To Princely Native
Inquiry Sought on Bronx School Funds
description: Deputy School Chancellor Bernard R. Gifford has asked the City Department of Investigation to look into the failure of the local board of Community School District 8 in the Bronx to account for more than $10,000 in pettycash funds from 1971 to 1973.

title: Hundreds Protest Closings of Fire Companies
description: Hundreds of angry residents in four boroughs marched yesterday in front of the eight fire companies that the Fire Department has announced would be closed as part of the city's austerity program.

title: Bridge; Storming Finish Wins Title In Reisinger Team Tourney
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Dec. 9A storming finish in the Reisinger team championship brought victory here late last night to a foursome led by Ira Rubin of Paramus, N.J., teamed with Fred Hamilton of Madison Heights, Mich.; Erik Paulsen of Los Angeles, and Hugh Ross of Oakland, Calif. In the concluding event of the American Contract Bridge League's Fall Nationals, he piled up 20 boards out of a possible 30 in the final session to take the title.

title: Mexican Mission to Cuba Reaches Accord on Trade
description: MEXICO CITY, Dec. 9Cuba and Mexico have agreed to step up trade and to cooperate more in industry and tourism following a weeklong visit to Havana by a Mexican mission of officials and businessmen.

title: MARY M. KANE
description: Mary Magennis Kane, a retired teacher at George Washington High School and Walton High School in the Bronx, died Sunday when a car sideswiped a bus in which she was a passenger in North Bergen, N.J. She was 72 years old and lived in Yonkers. Mrs. Kane was the widow of Edwin A. Kane, a retired assistant to the principal of the High School of Music and Art.

title: People in Sports
description: Earl Weaver and his wife, Marianna, escaped serious injury, but the Baltimore Oriole manager's 71yearold parents were hospitalized after a fourvehicle collision yesterday near Washington, Pa.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Possible Abuses in Job Training Scrutinized in Newark and Gary
description: GARY, Ind.,The Depart ment of Labor has begun extensive investigations into possible serious abuses in job trainining programs in several cities, including Gary, Ann Arbor, Mich., and Newark.

title: Holdup Style Recalls Parker House 5
description: The mustached robbers who fled with jewelry and other loot valued at more than $200,000 from the SherryNetherland Hotel yesterday may have left behind one cluetheir style of operation, associated with the Parker House Five.

title: Spirit of '74, '75 and '76 Inspires the City to Refurbish for the Bicentennial
description: One day last spring, visitors to the Statue of Liberty who looked up to admire her fine, strong face silhouetted against the sky gasped to see a man strapped to a ladder swaying some 300 feet above the harbor. He was recaulking the glass panes in Liberty's torch.

title: U.S.I.S Center Bombed
description: PESHAWAR, Pakistan, Dec. 9 (Reuters)A bomb exploded in a United States Information) Service center here today, injuring two Pakistani employes. The explosion blew out the entrance door and some windows of the building.

title: CITY RAISING FEES AT PARK FACILITIES
description: The Parks Department, seeking to cope with rising operational costs in the face of the budget austerity adopted by the Beame administration, has announced a schedule of higher fees for the use of most of its facilities.

title: U.S.Soviet Arms Memo Is Unresolved
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9The White House said last week that the United States and the Soviet Union had agreed on a memorandum of the Vladivostok arms agreement. Today, the Administration acknowledged that the exact language of that document was still being discussed with the Russians.

title: Gloomy Sandhogs Quit Tunnel
description: The sandhogs stepped off the elevator cage at the head of the 780footdeep shaft on Roosevelt Island yesterday afternoon and trudged across the gray mud to the paymaster's shack to pick up what they expected would be their last checks for a long time.

title: Seatbelt Change Cuts G.M. Car Prices $13
description: DETROIT, Dec. 9The General Motors Corporation announced today that it was reducing the base price of its cars by $13 because the Federal Government no longer required installing of an ignition interlock system.

title: Plane Crash Injures Two
description: BENNINGTON, Vt., Dec. 9 (AP)A New York man was reported in fair condition at Putnam Hospital here after the light plane he was piloting crashed shortly after takeoff at the Mount Snow Airport in Dover. The State police said Vincent Milo Jr. of Himtington, Li., was hospitalized after the Saturday night crash with fractures of his facial bones, facial cuts and bruises. A passenger, Frank C. Munn of Forest Hills, Queens, was treated for facial cuts at the Bennington hospital and released.

title: Who's Who Offers Style No Substance
description: WHO'S WHO IN HELL, a comedy by Peter Ustinov. Directed by Ellis Rabb; setting by Douglas W. Schmidt; costumes by Nancy Potts; lighting by John Gleason; production supervisor, Jerry Adler; stage manager, Barbara Cohen. Presented by  Alexander H. Cohen and Bernard Delfont; associate producer, Roy A. Somiyo; production associate, Hildy Parks. At the LuntFontanne Theater, 205 West 46th Street.

title: Mother Seton Due To Be Saint, First Of American Birth
description: Final steps were taken by Pope Paul VI yesterday to clear the way for the formal announcement Thursday of the first Americanborn saint, Blessed Elizabeth Ann Bayley Seton.

title: Big Output Held Reversing Increases in Food Prices
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9Increasing world production will reverse the present upward spiral of food prices, a leading agricultural economist told apecialists attending a national conference on the outlook for the farm economy today.

title: A Summary of Supreme Court Actions
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9The Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: HAZEL C. LORD
description: PORTLAND, Me., Dec. 9 Hazel C. Lord, who served three terms in the Maine House and four terms in the Senate, from 1944 to 1958, died Saturday in the Maine Medical Center. She was 87 years old.

title: Consumers Getting Milk By Crossing State Lines
description: NORWALK, Conn., Dec. 9By the quart and by the truckload, milk is steadily trickling into New York City, Long Island and parts of Westchester County, despite the fivedayold deliverers strike.

title: DROPS CONTINUE IN AMEX TRADING
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market fell again yes terday for the sixth consecutive session.

title: Pacific8 Rejects A RunnerUp Bowl
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 9 (UPI)The Pacific8 Conference rejected today a policy that would have allowed its. No. 2 team to play in a postseason football bowl.

title: EHRLICHMAN SAYS NIXON IS TO BLAME FOR THE COVERUP
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9John D. Ehrlichman took the stand in his own defense today at the Watergate coverup trial, a defense that sought to shift the blame to former President Richard M. Nixon.

title: Panov Injures Muscle; Postpones U.S. Debut
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 9 Vallery Panov injured a muscle in his right leg while rehearsing yesterday and was forced to postpone his first ballet appearance in the United States since being given permission to emigrate from the Soviet Union.

title: Dave Anderson
description: He didn't look like an outlaw. He had on a dark brown sports jacket and a dark brown tie with tiny white polka dots.

title: Service Held for Slain Girl, 7; Violence Is Assailed in Eulogy
description: ROCKAWAY, Dec. 9  A Mass of Christian Burial was celebrated in St. Cecilia's Roman Catholic Church here at 9:30 A:M. today for Danielle Hunter. who would have been 8 years, old next Monday.

title: SENATORS SUGGEST CHECKS ON SPYING
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9Four witnesses told a Senate Committee today that Congress must improve it's overseeing of United States foreign and domestic intelligence operations, but disagreed on the method.

title: 5 Cheetah Cubs Born in Zoo
description: CINCINNATI, Dec. 9 (AP) Five cheetah cubs were born at the Cincinnati Zoo over the weekend. If the cubs live, it would be the third time cheetah cubs have been born and survived in zoos, Ed Maruska, the zoo director, said today.

title: GEORGE M. CRAWFORD
description: George M. Crawford, a retired partner in Jas. H. Oliphant & Co., stockbrokers, died Sunday at his home, 215 East 68th Street. He was 80 years old.

title: VETERAN PENSIONS RAISED BY HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 (AP)The House passed a bill today to increase by 12 per cent pension payments for more than two million veterans and one million survivors of veterans.

title: ALLON SPENDS DAY WITH U.S. OFFICIALS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9Foreign Minister Yigal Allon of Israel held seven hours of talks with top American officials today but any decision on how to move the Middle East peace talks forward was apparently putt off until after the United States has contacted Egypt and other Arab countries.

title: Advertising
description: The programing changes and switches being planned by the ABCTV network for January and February are called unprecedented by Stephen Leff, a senior vice president of McCannErickson.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: Nader Chides Legislative Chiefs For Domination by Governors
description: Legislative leaders from across the nation gathered here yesterday to hear some sharp advice from Ralph Nader, the, consumer activist, that they had better drop their contrived inability to resist domination by strong governors.

title: City's Plan for West Side Road Is Approved by 2 State Officials
description: The city's proposal for a $1.1 billion sunken and covered sixlane interstatesystem highway west of the Ma nhattan shoreline south of 42d Street won the approval yesterday of the state's top transportation and urbanrenewal officials.

title: Suspect in Beatings Held
description: MACON, Ga., Dec. 9 (UPI)The police captured today an 18yearold boy they said had beaten an elderly couple to death and had assulted four neighbors with an assortment of weapons that included a fire poker, a hatrack and soft drink bottles. John Young was arrested at a relative's home in Milledgeville, the police said they traced his identity through fingerprints and a bloodstained Tshirt found at the homes of victims.

title: American Woman Held in Argentina Charges Torture
description: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 9An American woman who has been under police detention for four weeks has charged that she was subjected to electric shocks and beatings, the United States Embassy here reported today.

title: Ship Nearly Hits Bridge
description: PHILADELPHIA, Dec. 9 (AP) A 650foot Liberian ore carrier narrowly missed colliding with the TaconyPalmyra bridge last night when a power failure prevented the span from opening, the Coast Guard said today. When, the captain of the Rio Caroni realized the bridge was malfunctioning he reversed engines and accompanying tugs pushed the ship against the oncoming tide.

title: Risk of a Mideast Money Influx To Defense Industry Is Studied
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9The Administration, concerned that some oilrich countries might try to take over financial control of critical defense industries, has begun a study into whether improved safeguards are needed to keep track of foreign investments.

title: ,Sugar Prices Are Reduced Again by 2 Major Refiners
description: Sugar prices were reduced yesterday for the second time in little more than a week by two of the nation's leading sugar refiners reflecting recent declines in the cost of raw sugar.

title: ExHead of UNESCO Warns of Emotional Acts
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 9  Ren Maheu of France, who was Director General of UNESCO for 12 years, said today that the agency's emo. tional acts against Israel should not be countered with other emotional acts, such as boycotts.

title: Rockefeller Nomination
description: The impending votes in the Senate today and in the House Judiciary Committee later in the week will bring two steps closer the confirmation of Nelson A. Rockefeller as Vice President of the United States. If, as expected, both votes are favorable to Mr. Rockefeller, the only remaining hurdle will be the decision by the House Representatives itself a few days later. This, too, will probably be a vote of approval, and with it the long inquiry into Mr. Rockefeller's qualifications for the VicePresidency will at last have culminated in the necessary endorsement by the Congress.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: JOHN J. FITZGERALD
description: John J. Fitzgerald, manager for utility sales with the New England Petroleum Corporation, died Sunday at Overlook Hospital, Summit, N.J. He was 59 years old and lived at 2150 Seward Drive, Scotch Plains, N.J.

title: NORMA COHEN KLEIN
description: Norma Cohen Klein, who joined the staff of the National Council of Jewish Women in 1958 and was active in its community affairs department, died yesterday at her home, 152 West 58th Street. She was 67 years old and was the wife of Dr. Solomon A, Klein, a dermatologist.

title: TRIAL OF CARRANZA DELAYED BY JUDGE
description: TRIAL OF CARRANZA DELAYED BY JUDGE

title: Kuh Says Phillips Juror Sought Staff Job
description: A former Columbia University student testified in State Supreme Court that while serving as a juror in the murder trial of William R. Phillips, he had applied for a job as an investigator in the Manhattan District Attorney's office.

title: THOMAS L. STANLEY
description: Thomas L. Stanley, who formerly headed a marine engineering consulting concern here, died Sunday at a nursing home in Raceland, La. He was 85 years old and formerly lived in Essex Fells and Caldwell, N.J.

title: SUPERMARKETS CITED ON HIGH MEAT PRICES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 (UPI) The nation's three largest supermarket chains are responsible for high meat prices and should be broken into smaller competitive units by Congress, Mayor Joseph L. Alioto of San Francisco said today.

title: Fed Sought a Slight Expansion Of Money Supply in September
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9The Federal Reserve's Open Market Committee decided at its September meeting to reduce its target for the key Federal Funds interest rate and to raise its target for growth of the money supply, it was disclosed today.

title: Morton Cites Need of Balanced Effort In Conserving and Developing Energy
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 (AP)The United States must develop a dual policy of conservation and resource development to meet its energy needs in the years to come, Rogers C. B. Morton, Secretary of the Interior, said today.

title: Giants Also Plan Change In Uniforms
Missouri Compromise
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo.  The very blandness of the Democrats' first midterm convention was one of the best things about, it. The gathering went far to dispel the prevailing fear that the great party rifts of 1968 and 1972 would make it impossible for 2,000 Democrats to meet so soon without renewed and extensive bloodshed.

title: Check for $902,000 in Los Angeles Swindle Plan Is Cashed Here
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 9At least one of 18 bogus checks involved in an alleged scheme to defraud the city of Los Angeles of several million dollars through computer manipulation was cashed in New York, city officials said here today.

title: KUWAITIU.S. PACT ON ARMS REPORTED
description: KUWAIT, Dec. 9 (UPI)Kuwait has signed an agreement with the United States for the purchase of modern weapons and is awaiting a reply from the Soviet Union on a request for military supplies, the Minister of Interior and Defense, Sheik Saad alAbdullah, said today.

title: Greece Rejects the King
description: In their sixth referendum on the monarchy in this century, the voters of Greece appear at last to have consigned the 111yearold Glucksburg dynasty to the scrap heap of history already occupied by most royal houses that reigned in Europe prior to World War II Constantine II of the Hellenes is out of a job at 34, and the ruling New Democracy party of Premier Caramanlis must fashion a constitution for the new Republic of Greece.

title: GREEKS REINSTATE THEIR PARLIAMENT
description: ATHENS, Dec. 9The Greek Parliament met for the first time in seven years today, one day after the nation voted resoundingly to become a republic.

title: Alabama's State Police Leads In Black Percentage With 4.5%
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Dec. 9After three years under a Federal court injunction imposing racial hiring quotas, Alabama now has a larger percentage of blacks among uniformed state policemen than any other state police agency in the nation, a national survey by the Race Relations Information Center says.

title: Vote in U.N. Upholds Korea Command
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 9The General Assembly's Political Committee approved tonight a United Statessupported resolution providing for maintenance of the United Nations Command in South Korea.

title: Suppressed China Book Sees the Light Again
description: A book printed in 1960 and then destroyed under still obscure circumstances by its publisher, Macmillan, has been published by Harper & Row and Octagon Books. The work is The China Lobby in Amercan Politics, by Ross Y. Koen, a specialist on East Asian affairs. His book wag strongly critical of the China Lobby, a disparate group of Americans and Nationalist Chinese who sought to influence United States foreign policy toward China in the decade of the nineteenfifties.

title: Saudis, Oil Companies In Nationalization Talks
description: LONDON, Dec. 9 (UPI)Saudi Arabia and four American oil companies began talks at an undisclosed location today, on complete nationalization of their operations and assets in the desert kingdom. Their outcome could influence the cost of oil to the West.

title: Swiss Defend Franc
description: Bankers in Switzerland are divided on the effectiveness of barriers erected by that nation to repel a rush of currencies held by Middle East oilproducing nations seeking security in the Swiss franc. Details on Page 71.

title: Tokyo Bomb Blast, the Third In Recent Months, Injures 13
description: TOKYO, Tuesday, Dec. 10The third bomb in recent months exploded in downtown Tokyo this morning, injuring 13 persons, including a policeman. Damage was minimal.

title: New Embassies Opened By U.S. and East Germany
description: BERLIN, Dec. 9 (AP)  The United States Embassy in East Berlin opened its doors for business today. It marked the first time that the United States was officially represented in East Germany.

title: TV: Miller's After the Fall on NBC
description: Arthur Miller's After the Fall was first produced for the stage in January, 1964. Tonight at 8:30 o'clock the plpay is being presented as an NBCTV special. At the end of two and a half hours, it is clear that age cannot wither its infinite pretensions.

title: 10 NATO MEMBERS PLAN RISE IN ARMS
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 9  Ten European members of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization announced plans here today for arms increases next year to improve the military capacity of the alliance.

title: Optimism Fades for Fast End to Area Milk Strike
description: Negotiators for the milk industry and striking drivers and plant employes resumed their efforts yesterday to reach an agreement.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given in Eastern Standard Time

title: Dame Kathleen Courtney, Headed U.N. Association
description: LONDON, Dec. 9Dame Kathleen Courtney, a former Chairman of the United Nations Association, died today at her home here. She was 96 years old.

title: Presidential Press Talk Without TV Advocated
description: BOSTON, Dec. 9 (AP)John W. Hushen, deputy White House press secretary, said tonight that he would like to see some Presidential news conferences held without live television coverage.

title: Paper in Capital Votes on 4Day Week
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 (AP) News and business employes of The Washington StarNews voted today on a proposal to initiate a fourday work week, at four days' pay, in a move to avoid threatened layoffs. A spokesman said the results might not be known until tomorrow.

title: Newcombe Is Eager to Meet Connors Laver
description: The last major tennis tournament of 1974, the $100,000 Commercial Union Grand Prix Masters, opens today on grass at Kooyong stadium in Melbourne, Australia And as an indication of how fortunes fluctuate, Ilie Nastase, who wan the event the last three years, is only a 151 shot this time. The Rumanian has not been at his best, but he should get strong backing at those odds because of his rich talent to infuriate, entertain and hit winners.

title: Recital
description: Opera singers who on occasion take to the recital stage have problems, as a rule, in adapting to the quite different kind of vocal and dramatic demands of the intimate song. So no realist expected Veronica Tyler, the New York City Opera soprano, to score an unqualified success in her first recital here.

title: Little Added Output Found As Newsprint Price Rises
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 (AP)Although newsprint prices have far surpassed the level at which producers have said they could afford to expand capacity, expansion remains limited, according to a Senate study.

title: Mayor Daley Will Run For 6th FourYear Term
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 9Mayor Richard J. Daley put an end today to the few lingering doubts about his future: He will run again for Mayor.

title: Bid for Great Western Stock Is Extended by Hunt Brothers
description: Nelson Bunker Hunt and William Herbert Hunt said yesterday that they had extended until 5 P.M. next Monday, their joint offer to purchase 910,000 shares of common stock of the Great Western United Corporation, the country's largest producer of beet sugar. As of last Friday, the Hunt brothers disclosed that about 234,000 shares of Great Western had been tendered and that these shares would be purchased at the $27.50 a share price.

title: Beame Defends His Policy on Layoffs
description: For the city to lay off provisional employes exclusively and to refrain from similar layoffs of career civil servants would effectively cripple many vital City services if we moved in that direction only, Mayor Beame said yesterday.

title: TV: An Inflation Special
description: In a rare and imaginative gesture for an independent station, WORTV (Channel 9) is turning over three hours today, from 8 P.M. to 11 P.M., to a treatment of Inflation: A Few Answers. Moderated by Sander Vanocur, the program has been produced by the station in association with Business Week magazine.

title: Court Delays Action in Case Of Recanted Testimony
description: The United States Court of (Appeals for the Second Circuit reserved decision here yesterday after a hearing to request a new trial in the case of Martin Sostre, a convict who has fought for prisoner rights.

title: Liddy Requests High Court To Reverse His Conviction
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 (UPI) G. Gordon Liddy, who helped plan the Watergate burglary, asked the Supreme Court today to overturn his conviction on the grounds that United States District Judge John J. Sirica had made important trial errors.

title: CONGRESS PASSES NIXON TAPES BILL
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 (AP) The House passed and sent to the White House today a bill requiring the Federal Government to take possession of former President Richard M. Nixon's papers and tapes.

title: New Ellingtonians Uphold the Duke's Tradition
description: Six months after Duke Ellington't death last May 24, his orchestra, which is now under the leadership of his son, Mercer, is beginning to move beyond the function it had for 50 years as a vehicle for Duke Ellington's current compositions and is becoming a contemporary carrier of the Ellington tradition.

title: Antitrust Violators Face New Penalties
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9Legislation making criminal violations of the antitrust laws a felony, punishable by jail sentences of up to three years, was passed by the Senate today.

title: High Official Backs Policeman Who Shot Boy in Long Branch
description: The Long Branch Director of Public Safety said yesterday that he did not think a policeman who killed an unarmed 16yearold boy, allegedly fleeing from a breakin at a building where an attemptedrape victim lived, had used excessive force.

title: Treasury Bills Decline At the Weekly Auction
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9Yields declined on Treasury bills auctioned today in both the 91day and 180day maturities.

title: CLASSIFIED ADVERTISING INDEX
Albert H. Foster, 69, Dies; A Management Consultant
description: Albert H. Foster, a management consultant, died Saturday of a stroke at his home, 26 Richelieu Road, Scarsdale, N.Y. He was 69 years old.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: AFRICAN WAY A conference honoring writers from Africa will be held at Columbia University, sponsored by the School of Arts. With more books on the subject appearing on library and store shelves, the public is invited to attend the free assembly featuring discussions by more than 16 novelists, poets, playwrights, pub. fishers and scholars whose indigenous work reflects and explores life on the African continent. The admissionfree sessions are from 10:30 A.M. to 6 P.M. in the faculty room of Low Library, 116th Street and Broadway.

title: Soto Is Outpointed By Mike Quarry
description: Mike Quarry of Houston snapped the 10bout unbeaten string of Pedro Soto of Carolinas, P.R., last night at the Felt Forum When he scored a unanimous decision in their eightround heavyweight bout.

title: People and Business
description: The Federal Reserve Board's authorization last Friday of a reduction to 7 per cent, from 8 per cent, in its discount rate on borrowings by member banks may have given Wall Street a psychological lift but it failed to repress Senator William Proxmire, Democrat of Wisconsin.

title: BURTON J. PHILBRICK
description: BEVERLY, Mass, Dec. (UPI)Burton G. Philbrick, whose testing led to the use of cartons instead of bottles for the distribution of milk, died Saturday at a hospital in Salem. He was 93 years old.

title: Sonny Carson Guilty
description: Robert C. (Sonny) Carson, once a black militant leader from Brooklyn and the subject of a film, The Education of Sonny Carson, was found guilty, along with four other men, of kidnapping in a 1973 vigilante action against two robbery suspects. The defendants still face murder charges. Page 49.

title: Homer Hendrickson, 50, MaritimeAffairs Reporter
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9Homer L. Hendrickson, a reporter who specialized in maritime affairs, died Friday in a plane crash near Pine Bluff, Ark. Mr. Hendrickson and three other victims were going from New Orleans to Pine Bluff after a board of directors meeting of the American Waterways Operators. He was 50 years old and was editor of the A.W.O. Weekly Letter.

title: Walton Shows Up At Blazers' Drill
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Dec., (UPI)Bi??Walton was on hand today when the Portland Trail Blazers held??practine The giant center Wasn't in practice togs, but hi street clothes and he said he didn't care to dissuss reports that he had become disenchanted with pro basketball.

title: Ethiopian Junta's Grip Is Suffocating Liberty
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Dec. 5A breath of liberty and exciting hopes of a new democratic future that were felt briefly earlier this year have nearly disappeared as an almost anonymous and hardfisted military junta has replaced centuries of absolute monarchy.

title: Production of Steel Hits Lowest Level Since Aug. 26, 1972
description: Steel production last week fell to its lowest level since the week ended Aug. 26, 1972. This was due almost entirely to side effects of the coal strike.

title: Where Charity Ends
description: The Thunderous Futility Award for 1974 will doubtless go to the two Congressional committees that spent months investigating Nelson Rockefeller and discovered that he comes from a very rich family. This is reminiscent of Molire's social climber who went in for learning in middle life and was delighted to discover that he spoke prose.

title: OPTIMISM FADING IN MILK WALKOUT
description: Negotiators for the milk industry and striking drivers and plant employes resumed their efforts yesterday to reach an agreement.

title: Judge Says Listerine Won't Cure Colds
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9A Federal administrative judge ordered the manufacturerers of Listerine today to state in each of its advertisements over a two year period that the mouthwash will not prevent or cure colds.

title: 5 Sarviving Sextuplets Termed Very Fragile
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., Dec. 9 (AP)The five survivors of sextuplets born yesterday to a woman who lost quadruplets a year ago were said to be in very fragile condition today, with the, next few days crucial for their survival.

title: Old Ring Hero Gets Hungarian Sendoff
description: People on the sidewalk between 80th and 81st Streets on Second Avenue gathered outside Eva's Hungarian Restaurant, peeking through doors and windows to witness the celebration for Laszlo Papp, the premier sports hero of Hungary's past. A man played a violin, emotional Hungarians hugged and kissed the former prize fighter and sang songs of their country, and a waitress danced with a tray of dishes.

title: Ali, the Greatest, Is Given the City's Mostest
description: He sparred with the Mayor in City Hall and with an 11yearold in the ring. He accepted medallions and plaques and a portrait of himself by a convicted forger. He boasted of his prowess, he read his poetry and he won the hearts of thousands of New Yorkers.

title: South African Army to Accept Black Enlisted Men at Equal Pay
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Af rica, Dec. 9. (AP)The South African Army announced today that it was opening its ranks to black soldiers.

title: Stiff Antitrust Law
description: Legislation making criminal violations of the antitrust laws a felony, punishable by jail sentences of up to three years, was passed by the Senate. Page 65.

title: Mother Commits Suicide, Kills Son Accidentally With Monoxide
description: WEST ORANGE, Dec. 9The police reported today that a 62yearold widow who committed suicide yesterday by running her automobile engine in a closed garage after posting a suicied note on the garage door apparently caused the accidental death of one of her sons who was in house at the time.

title: Church Agency Plans Drive to Improve Local TV Programing
description: The Office of Communical tion of the United Church of Christ, whose activities have centered on the public's rights in broadcasting, announced yesterday the inauguration of a national project aimed at improving the performance of local television stations through citizen participation.

title: Lampoon Radio's Final Hour
description: The National Lampoon Radio Hour, the syndicated program based on The National Lampoon magazine, will have its final broadcast on Dec. 29. The Radio Hour, which began in November, 1973, will stop because the writers and performers involved had overextended themselves on a National Lampoon touring show, a spokesman said.

title: COURT WON'T EASE RULES FOR SEARCH
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9The Supreme Court rejected today a request by the Department of Justice that it consider relaxing its rules against breaking into a home without a search warrant to obtain criminal evidence.

title: JIM BURTON TURNS AN EAR TO SOUND
description: Jim Burton, who, until this season was music director of the Kitchen, has often mixed theater with music at his own concerts  so much so that sound itself seemed subordinated. But it was always obvious that he had a nice ear for sound, and his Phisiks of Metaquavers program Sunday at the Kitchen, although still highly theatrical, addressed itself refreshingly to aural matters.

title: Museum Fund Drive Opened
description: BOSTON, Dec. 9 (AP)  A $1.7million fundraising drive to build a U.S.S. Constitution Museum in the Charlestown section was started today. Charles Francis Adams, chairman of Raytheon Corporation, announced the drive.

title: Appliances Cited as Fire Hazards in U.S. Report
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 (AP)Defective television sets ignited 196,000 house and apartment fires during the 12month period ending last April, according to the first Government survey designed to pinpoint the cause of 5.5 million household and personal property fires.

title: STRIP MINE ACTION FAILS BY 30 VOTES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 Backers of a bill that would impose tough Federal environmental controls on the strip mining of coal today failed to minter the twothirds majority required for Congressional approval in a maneuver to thwart a possible Presidential veto. The attempt lost by 30 votes in the House of Representatives.

title: Sensitive City Zoning
description: The line between the possible and the impossible New York is often zoning. Just as often, it is the line between pleasure preserved and violated. There has long been a real estate axiom that it is impossible to keep trees or grass, or green woods or handsome hills, the face of development pressures; brooks and rills yield to fill and concrete as inevitably as the All New Country Club Living signs follow the bulldozer.

title: 5 Gunmen Rob the SherryNetherland of $200,000
description: Five gunmendescribed as very polite and very professional  invaded the SherryNetherland Hotel before dawn yesterday and held 13 persons hostage for more than two hours as they emptied safe deposit boxes of jewels, travelers' checks and cash.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: Night Sttolls
description: Those who enjoy walking at night, whether through woods and fields, along a surfswept beach, or in the dark streets of a town, are probably incurable romantics, for, once established, the habit is rarely relinquished.

title: Nursing Home Employes Reach Agreement on a Twoyear Pact
description: Negotiators for the city's private nursing homes and its unionized employes reached a tentative contract settlement early today, thereby averting a srike that had been threatened for midnight last night.

title: Panel Bids C.C.N.Y Remove Prof toot; Censure 4 Others
description: The removal or suspension of Dr. Stanley W. Page, a tenured full professor in the history department at City College, and his censure along with the censure of four of his colleagues has been recommended by a special committee of inquiry following a sevenmonth investigation of the strifetorn department.

title: Consumers Getting Milk By Crossing State Lines
description: NORWALK, Conn., Dec. 9By the quart and by the truck load, milk is steadily trickling into New York City, Long Is land and parts of Westchester County, despite the fivedayold deliverers strike.

title: PRESIDENT SIGNS FUNDING MEASURE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 President Ford signed a $33billion appropriations bill today for the Department of Labor and the Department of Health, Education and Welfare, but warned that Congress had underestimated the cost of mandatory welfare programs by $1.2billion.

title: British Seek 10% Fuel Cut By Heat and Speed Curbs
description: LONDON, Dec. 9The Government announced a broadly based mandatory energysaving program today, including lower speed limits on many highways and a maximum temperature of 68 degrees in most buildings other than homes and hospitals.

title: PRESIDENT CALLED READY TO ACCEPT QUICK JOBLESS AID
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 President Ford, concerned about the rapidly growing unemployment rate, has agreed to abandon his proposal for a public service program and accept a broader, more accelerated Congressional program, Government officials reported today.

title: South Korea Won Devalued
description: SEOUL, Dec. 9 (AP)South Korea announced today a 20 per cent devaluation of its currency, effective immediately, to help improve its worsening balance of payments and business slump. The exchange rate was posted 480 won per dollar against the old rate of 400 won per dollar.

title: Police Team Six Shooter With Sticks
description: To a small group of New York City policemen, ice isn't a bad wordit stands for hockey.

title: Israelis Sentence Archbishop to 12 Years for Smuggling Arms
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 9  The head of the Greek Catholic Church in Jerusalem was sentenced to 12 years in prison today after being convicted of smuggling arms into the Israelioccupied West Bank for Palestinian guerrillas.

title: Sports Today
description: Knicks vs. K.C. Omaha Kings, at Madison Square Garden, Eighth Avenue add 33d Street, 7:35 P.M. (TelevisionChannels 10 and H (cable), 7:30 P.M. (RadioWNBC, 7:30 P.M.)

title: DR. ADA KESTENBAUM
description: Dr. Ada Kestenbaum, widow of Dr. Alfred K. Kestenbaum, an ophthalmologist, died Sunday at the home of her daughter, Dr, Helen C. Meyers, 4560 Delafield Avenue, Riverdale, the Bronx. She was 80 years old and lived at 40 West 72d Street.

title: SOYBEANS, WHEAT AND CORN DECLINE
Stiff Antitrust Law
description: Legislation making criminal violations of the antitrust laws a felony, punishable by jail sentences of up to three years, was passed by the Senate. Page 65.

title: MAKARIOS VISITS CYPRUS REFUGEES
description: LARNACA, Cyprus, Dec. 9Archbishop Makarios, in his first move since his return from exile on Saturday, came to this southern town today to visit some of the camps for the Greek refugees from the Turkish invasion of last summer.

title: G.E. Will Lay Off 670 in Bridgeport
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., Dec. 9 AP)The General Electric Co. has announced it will place 670 workers at its plant here on furlough for varying periods of time during the next two weeks.

title: Wielding a Scholarship Ax
description: If an intercollegiate sport does not make money its participants should not receive athletic scholarships; according to Elroy (Crazy Legs) Hirsch, director of athletics at the University of Wisconsin The former Wisconsin (1942) and Michigan (1943) allAmerica halfback scoffed at the idea of returning to oneplatoon (limitedsubstitution) football to save money.

title: PARIS FAVORS DELAY ON BRITISH RAIL LINK
description: PARIS, Dec. 9 (Reuters) France today accepted a proposal to delay construction of a British rail link to the proposed channel tunnel between the two countries.

title: Rockefeller Debate Opens; Senate Vote Is Due Today
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9The Senate began today its formal debatewhich was more like a polite discussionon the confirmation of Nelson A. Rockefeller as Vice President, using less than the time allotted before the final vote scheduled for tomorrow.

title: Chess:
description: William Lombardy, the United States grandmaster who was Bobby Fischer's second for the 1972 world championship match in Reykfavik, once told me, When it comes to material advantage, I would far rather be a pawn ahead than have a rook for my opponent's minor piece, or two minor pieces for a rook.

title: U.S. Plans to Expand Jobless Aid Coverage
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 (AP) With joblessness rising sharply, the Labor Department is preparing proposals to bring nearly seven million more workers under the nation's unemployment insurance system at an added cost of $3.5billion.

title: USO Founded in 1941
description: Since its founding in 1941, the United Service Organizations has been a warm, personal, supportive community for American servicemen, at home and abroad.

title: HOWARD E. SEAVER
description: Howard E. Seaver, vice president for newspaper relations of Parade magazine, died Sunday of cancer in Stamford (Conn.) Hospital. He was 54 years old and lived at 83 Stonehenge Drive, New Canaan, Conn.

title: Mother Seton Due To Be Saint, First Of American Birth
description: Final steps were taken by Pope Paul VI yesterday to clear the way for the formal announcement Thursday of the first Americanborn saint, Blessed Elizabeth Ann Bayley Seton.

title: FAX COMPROMISE DRAWN IN JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Dec. 9Faced with an apparent deadlock in resolving the slate's financial crisis, the Democratic legislative majorities have agreed to consider a compromise tax plan here tomorrow. It is calculated to bridge an anticipated $400million budget deficit and to comply, as well, with the yearend deadline by the State Supreme Court for creating a new system of financing public schools in New Jersey.

title: 2 Youths Held in Shotgun Death of Yale Student
description: NEW HAVEN, Dec. 9Two youths, 15 and 15 years old, have been arrested in connection with the shotgun slaying early yesterday morning of a Yale University junior, 20yearold Gary C. Stein of Irvington, N.Y.

title: London Bank Makes Loan to Abu Dhabi In Arab Currency
description: LONDON, Dec. 9The United International Bank, Ltd., announced today that it had arranged for a loan of 20million dirhams to the Abu Dhabi Telegraph and Telephone Company in an unusual example of an Arab financing arranged by a Western bank.

title: MARION BREWINGTON, MARITIME HISTORIAN
description: Marion V. Brewington, a maritime historian who headed the Kendall. Whaling Museum in Sharon, Mass., from 1966 until this year, died Sunday in a New London, Conn., hospital. He was 72 years old and lived in Mystic, Conn., where he was an associate in maritime art at Mystic Seaport.

title: VultureHeaded Parrots On View
description: Three vultureheaded parrots from New Guinea went on display yesterday at the Bronx Zoo's World of Birds.

title: Redskins Win, Gain Playoffs
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 9Aided by an incomprehensible gamble by the Los Angeles Rams early in the second period, the Washington Redskins went on to 2317 victory tonight that earned them the eighth and final berth in the National Football League playoffs.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Sonny Carson Is Found Guilty

title: Autumn Tells Summer's News
description: SPENCER, Mass.Every day I see on TV and read in the papers examples of the horrible plight of the elderly. I'm not hardhearted but I often think, It's your own fault, you know. Of course I realize that the reporters have to make the greatest possible sensation for the media. But, didn't she expect the children to leave when they were grown? Why didn't she learn some hobby or handicraft to fill some happy hours later?

title: COURT REAFFIRMS INTEGRATION ORDER
description: CINCINNATI, Dec. 9 (UPI)In a 2 to 1 decision, the United States Court of Appeals for the Sixth Circuit upheld today desegregation and busing plan Ordered for schools in Kalamazoo, Mich, in 1971.

title: Henry Ford Asks U.S. Plan To Avert Economic Crisis
description: Henry Ford 2d, chairman of he Ford Motor Company, said yesterday that President. Ford nust quickly develop a decisive, substantive program of fiction to avert a prolonged and leepening national economic crisis.

title: FLAWS ARE FOUND IN FUND SHARING
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9A yearlond examination of Federal general revenue sharing made by four civic and public interest organizations has concluded that the $30.2billion program has several serious flaws and has not worked out in the way most legislators intended it to.

title: Kentucky Surprises N. Carolina
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky. Dec. 9 (UPI)  Jimmy Dan Conner scored a careerhigh 35 points tonight to lead the Kentucky Wildcats to a 9078 upset over fifthranked North Carolina.

title: News Summary and Index
description: The Major Events of the Day

title: Prof. Joseph Pearl, Headed Classics Unit at Brooklyn
description: Joseph L. Pearl, retired chairman of the department of classical languages at Brooklyn College, died Sunday at Trafalgar Hospital. He was 88 years old and lived at 175 Riverside Drive.

title: CORPORATE BONDS STAGE BIG RALLY
description: Corporate bondsand Government securities staged a dyInamic rally yesterday in their initial response to Friday's late reduction in the discount rate by the Federal Reserve. Shortterm rates, meanwhile, fell across a broad front. The Fed lowered the rate it charges on its loans to member commercial banks in a single action that understored its shift toward further ease in Monetary policy. The rate was cut to 7 per cent from 8 per cent initially at the Federal Reserve Banks of New York and Philadelphia.

title: Motorist Is Found Who Ran Over Body On Sayreville Road
description: The Middlesex County Prosecutor said yesterday that the police had found a motorist who had driven over the body of Daniel Deathridge as it lay in the roadway of Main Street in Sayreville early Sunday morning.

title: SAVINGS DEPOSITS TOP WITHDRAWALS
description: Savers deposited more money in New York's savings banks in November than they withdrew the first deposit gain since March, the Savings Bank Association of New York State reported yesterday.

title: Panel Cites Risk in Excess Vitamin D
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9A committee of the National Research Council advised today against concentrated. Vitamin D supplements for most Americans on the grounds that excess intake could be hazardous and that modern diet, including fortified milk, contained enough of the vitamin.

title: RACE DATA CENTER CLOSES ABRUPTLY
description: NASHVILLE, Dec. 9The Race Relations Information Center, which for 20 years has specialized in collecting information on problems of minorities, has abruptly closed because of a fund shortage.

title: Lambs, at Century Mark, On Brink of Foreclosure
description: The Lambs, which just passed the century mark as a club for New York theater folk and is unhappily refuting the old belief that the first 100 years are the hardest, is facing a deadline to extinction on Thursday.

title: Swiss Bankers Split on Efficiency Of Measures to Defend the Franc
description: GENEVA, Dec 9  Swiss bankers are divided on the effectiveness of the barriers newly erected by the nation's monetary authorities to repel a rush of dollars held by Middle East oilproducing nations and other foreign currencies seeking security in the Swiss franc,

title: Long List Of Events Scheduled
description: Next May 22 at noon, thousands of New Yorkers, having marched in procession through through the narrow old streets of Lower Manhattan, will mass at City Hall for the ceremonial inauguration of the city's Bicentennial program.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Woman, 65, Killed in Bronx Fire

title: G.M. Executive Dies in Fire
description: ROCHESTER, Mich., Dec. 9 (AP)A General Motors executive and his three children died this morning when fire destroyed their $100,000 home in Oakland County, the authorities said. The victims were identified as William Metzel, 43 years old, sales manager for Oldsmobile's Central Division, and his children, Jody, 12, Julie, 14, and William Jr., 16. Mr. Metzel's wife escaped with only minor injuries by jumping from a secondstory window. The cause of the blaze was not immediately determined.

title: CAIRO ASKS HELP IN PEACE EFFORT
description: CAIRO, Dec. 9Egypt needs the support of both the Soviet Union and the United States in seeking a negotiated settlement in the Middle East, according to a statement by Foreign Minister Ismail Fahmy published here today.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 47

title: Bombs and Jobs in Puerto Rico
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., Dec. 7The bombs, that damaged several United Statesowned business establishments and an Army Reserve motor pool earlier this week appear to have gone off prematurely.

title: Henry Ford Asks U.S. Plan To Avert Economic Crisis
description: Henry Ford 2d, chairman of the Ford Motor Company, said yesterday that President Ford must quickly develop a decisive, substantive program of action to avert a prolonged and deepening national economic crisis.

title: OLIVER G. PRATT
description: SALEM, Mass., Dec. 9 (AP)Oliver G. Pratt, former executive vice president of Rhode Island Hospital, died Saturday in Providence, R.I. He was 78 years old. Mr. Pratt was executive director of Salem Hospital from 1931 to 1945. He joined Rhode Island Hospital in 1945 and retired in 1968.

title: PRESIDENT CALLED READY TO ACCEPT QUICK JOBLESS AID
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 President Ford, concerned about. the rapidly growing unemployment rate, has agreed to abandon his proposal for a public service program and accept a broader, more accelerated Congressional program, Government officials reported today.

title: Declining Quality in Clothes: The Makers and Sellers Tell Why
description: An increasing number of consumers are complaining about a deterioration in qualityfood doesn't taste the same, automobiles don't last as long, appliances collapse, the list is endless.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: The large number of British presentations on Broadway this season was given as one of the reasons for the upswing in current business at a symposium held at Sardi's Belasco. Room under the auspices of the Drama Desk, the organization of theater writers.

title: Stage: Portfolio Revue
description: Those evenings with great lyricists and composers, such as Sammy Cahn's Words and Music, have revealed a neglected performing talent as well as art form. Songwriters love a spotlight. It gives them a chance to show off (this is the way their songs really should be sung) and also a chance to explain their failures.

title: PRICES ARE MIXED ON STOCK MARKET
description: A technical recovery in the afternoon enabled the stock market to finish mixed in slower trading yesterday following last week's sharp decline.

title: FEAR MEETS PLAN ON NORWAY'S OIL
description: OSLO, Norway, Dec. 9  A controversial Norwegian government proposal for a 90 per cent tax on oil profits has raised fears that investment in North Sea development will be inhibited. North Sea development will be inhibited.

title: Hearing Scheduled Today on Protest In School District
description: The sitin at the District 9 Community School District offices in the Bronx went through its fifth day yesterday as the central Board of Education remained apparently unwilling to move against the protesters pending arguments for a permanent injunction in Bronx Supreme Court today.

title: Brazilian to Pepperdine
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 9 (AP)  Adilson Nascimento, the Olympic basketball star from Brazil, will enroll at Pepperdine University in January, Coach Gary Colson said today. The 23yearold lefthander was the leading scorer for the Brazilian national team last year, averaging 21 points and 16 rebounds a game.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Saigon Tells of More Fighting Nearby
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 9Scattered fighting on a wide scale was reported again today in the southern part of South Vietnam, with infantry attacks and shelling in provinces around Saigon.

title: THOUSANDS AT RITES FOR WIDOW OF BENES
description: PRAGUE, Dec. 9 (AP)Several thousand persons attended the funeral on Saturday of liana Benes, widow of former President Eduard Benes, even though the press in Czechoslovakia gave no advance information of the event.

title: Great Swamp's Deer Hunt Delayed for Court Hearing
description: NEWARK, Dec. 9A Federal Appeals Court judge today ordered a temporary delay in a sixday deer hunt scheduled to start at dawn tomorrow in the Great Swamp National Wildlife Refuge in Morris County until a threejudge Federal panel in Philadelphia has a chance to hear a plea by conservationists for a ban on the hunt.

title: Disaster Relief Urged
description: TRENTON, Dec. 9 (AP)New Jersey's two United States Senators sent a telegram to President Ford today urging him to give prompt consideration to a request that most of the New Jersey shore he deIclared in a state of emergency to make it eligible for Federal disaster relief. The telegram came from Senators Clifford P. Case, Republican, and HarIrison A. Williams Jr., Democrat.

title: Long List Of Events Scheduled
description: Next May 22 at noon, thousands of New Yorkers, having marched in procession through the narrow old streets of Lower Manhattan, will mass at City Hall for the ceremonial inauguration of the city's Bicentennial program.

title: Sabres Writing N.H.L. Success Story
description: The young Buffalo Sabres and especially their French Connection line are writing what is currently the National Hockey League's most exciting success story. Coming off their 11th consecutive victory, a 50 victory Sunday against the Minnesota North Stars, the Sabres lead all teams with 46 points in the N.H.L. Their star center, Gil Perreault, with 48 points, has just passed Bobby Orr for the individual scoring lead. Each man in the French Connection line Perreault, Rick Martin and Rene Robertscored his 20th goal Sunday.

title: Notes on People
description: In Stockholm to receive the Nobel Prize for literature he was awarded four years ago, the exiled Soviet author Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn met with the Rev. Billy Graham, the American evangelist, for a discussion of world trends in religion. Afterward, Mr. Graham said: Solzhenitsyn has the kind of intellect and moral courage that the world so desperately needs today. His grasp, of both history and theology is amazing.

title: Sonny Carson Among Five Guilty in Kidnapping Case
description: Robert C. Carson, the black activist from Brooklyn whose past as a juvenile street hoodlum was featured in the successful film The Education of Sonny Carson, was found guilty yesterday of kidnapping, in Nassau County Court in Mineola.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: A.B.A. Players Told to Sign Pact

title: NEW SIZES LOOM IN U.S. GOLD SALES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9The Treasury opened the way today for gold refiners and processors to acquire additional gold between now and the end of the year in order to let them prepare consumersize gold bars and wafers before Dec. 31, when private ownership of gold will become legal.

title: Early Donors Helping Neediest
description: The 63rd annual Christmas appeal of The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund began Sunday and contributions from its generous supporters will soon be added to the $450,257.48 thus far donated by estates, trust funds and by amost 300 individual.

title: Bipartisan Reform
description: A large new infusion of democracy has been injected into the structure of American politics as a result reforms approved by both major parties last weekend.

title: Early Donors Helping Neediest
description: The 63d Annual Christmas appeal of The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund began Sunday and contributions from its generous supporters will soon be added to the $450,257.48 thus far donated by estates, trust funds and by almost 300 individuals.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Corporate bonds stage a big rally. Page 65

title: STATE DEPARTMENT REPLIES TO ATTACK
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9The State Department reacted with irritation today to, an article by the department's former intelligence director, who complained that his office was not consulted about the alerting of American forces in October of last year to deter possible Soviet moves in the Middle East.

title: Meskill Denies Warning About Lease
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 9 Gov. Thomas J. Meskill of Connecticut denied today that he had been warned ahead of time that the state was making an exorbitant lease arrangement with an uncle of the Republican state chairman.

title: This Is An Arms Limitation?
description: As citizen and taxpayer, do you ever get the feeling that you are being doubletalked?

title: Final Vote on Diego Garcia Postponed Until Early 1975
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 (AP) A SenateHouse conference agreed today to defer final action until early next year on plans by the Navy to expand its base on the island of Diego Garcia in the Indian Ocean.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The Supreme Court of the United States yesterday let stand the dismissal of a New Jersey high school teacher who had been highly critical of school administrators. The justices declined to hear an appeal by the teacher, Kathleen Pietrunti, who was discharged by Brick Township after a speech she had made as president of the teachers union. She claimed that her critical comments were protected under the First Amendment to the Constitution.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: On Nov. 19, The Times printed a letter from Nicholas Johnson, chairman of the National Citizens Committee for Broadcasting. In my opinion, much petroleumbased ink was wasted on this irresponsible attack on the motor vehicle.

title: Miki Takes Action on Economic Front
description: TOKYO, Dec. 10Japan's new Premier, Takeo Miki, moved on several economic fronts today but ran immediately into skepticism and opposition from within the ruling establishment.

title: Cahn Says He Used Group's Funds to Pay Informer
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Dec. 10District Attorney William Cahn of Nassau County said today that he had used $18,000 in expense money given to him over the last five years by the National District Attorneys Association to pay a confidential informer.

title: EUROPE TALKS END WITH HINT OF GAINS
description: PARIS, Dec. 10Leaders of the nine European Common Market countries ended their twoday conference here tonight with a declaration reflecting moves toward compromise on the key issues of oil diplomacy and the terms of Britain's membership.

title: GUILT ADMITTED BY A NIXON DONOR
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10Former Gov. Tim M. Babcock of Montana pleaded guilty today to allegations that he illegally channeled $54,000 from a millionaire oilman, Dr. Armand Hammer, into President Nixon's political treasury in 1972 and 1973.

title: I.T.T. BAKING UNIT ACCUSED BY F.T.C. OF ILLEGAL ACTS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10The I.T.T. Continental Baking Company, Inc., the nation's largest baker of bread, was accused by the government today of attempting to monopolize the wholesale baking business through the useof a large number of illegal predatory practices.

title: Pentagon to Drop Pacific Command Of the Air Force
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 10 (AP)  The Pentagon announced plans today to abolish the Air Force's Pacific Command.

title: Notes on People
description: Seven years after the Government tried him on charges of refusing to be drafted into the Army, Government officials, including the President, greeted Muhammad Ali in Washington yesterday. The heavyweight champion was guest of honor at a Capitol Hill reception given by Sen. Walter D. Huddleston, Democrat of Mr. Ali's native state of Kentucky, in the eSnate Office Building caucus room where the Watergate hearings were held.

title: REPORTED REBUFF BY ARABS DRIVES POUND TO A LOW
description: PARIS, Dec. 10Market reports suggesting that Persian Gulf oilproducing states were no longer willing to take sterling in payment for their stateowned oil drove the pound to historic lows today and forced the Bank of England to spend an estimated $250million in an effort to support the currency.

title: City, With Little Money to Build, Is Assailed on Design Expenses
description: City officials were sharply criticized yesterday for proposing to allocate $380milliononefifth of the 197576 capital budget of $1.79billionfor architectural design, planning and other staff expenses when almost nothing will be available to start new building projects.

title: Soviet, to peter Emigrants, Tells About Jews Who Returned From U.S.
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 10 The Soviet press today warned citizens against emigration by circulating the tale of a homesick Jewish couple who had come to Odessa after living fewer than three months in Philadelphia.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: In what Nassau County Excutive Ralph G. Caso called a move reflecting the county's deepening financial crisis, he said yesterday that he was giving up his cabana at Nassau Beach, his countyowned chauffeured limousine and $2,500 of his $60,000 annual salary.
