description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 17Communist attacks, shifting in intensity from province to province in the last 12 days, have pushed Government troops out of two district capitals Isolated a border province Capital and sharply reduced security on several important road.

title: Lot of a Rural Postman: Snow, Gloom and Moose
description: HUNGRY HORSE, Mont.Just about every letter that Virgil Lane delivers in these parts is a special delivery.

title: Full Disclosure of Income Adopted by Council, 411
description: The City Council adopted a strict disclosure bill yesterday requiring elected officials and all city employes earning more than $25,000 a year to report the sources of their income. The vote was 41 to 1.

title: Parkinson Says Mitchell Denied Links Between Nixon Campaign and BreakIn
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17Kenneth Wells Parkinson testified at the Watergate coverup trial today that after he had been hired by the Nixon reelection campaign to handle the legal problems resulting from the Watergate breakin, John N. Mitchell told him that there was no connection between the breakin and the campaign committee.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: Assembly Moves to Curb Abuses on Migrant Farms
description: TRENTON, Dec. 17The Assembly overwhelmingly passed a bill today to make farmers responsible for the misdeeds of their migrant worker crew leaders, then went on to pass overwhelmingly, a second bill that appeared to nullify the first.

title: New jersey Briefs
description: An explosion, apparently caused by a spark that ignited flamable liquid, damaged part of a Newark chemical plant. The blast demolished part of the Honig Chemical and Processing Corporation. No injuries were reported, although four men were working in the building at the time.

title: Turkey Aid Would Resume Under Bill Voted by Senate
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17The Ford Administration and members of a SenateHouse conference committee have worked out a compromise foreignaid package that would allow the United States to resume military assistance to Turkey through Feb. 5 while efforts continue for a Cyprus settlement.

title: People in Sports
description: Robert Wayne (Bud) Moore offensive coordinator uncle Paul (Bear) Bryant at Ala bama, was named head foot ball coach at the University of Kansas yesterday. Moon succeeds Don Fambrough, who resigned two weeks age after Clyde Walker, the athletic director, had refused to extend his contract beyond next season. The 35yearold Moore signed a fouryear pact for a reported $30,000 a year.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The Traffic Department is rearranging alternatesideofthestreet parking schedules in a large section of the upper West Side, bounded by 84th and 97th Streets from Riverside Drive to Central Park West. Noparking times had been changed in the area several months ago to accommodate new streetsweeping routes and schedules.

title: CONCERNED FORD TELLS U.S STEEL TO JUSTIFY RISES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17President Ford, described as concerned and very disappointed, demanded today that the. United States Steel Corporation justify in writing the reasons for the price increases it announced yesterday.

title: Turkish Cypriote Refugees Bar Makarios From Visiting Their Camp
description: EPISKOPI, Cyprus, Dec. 17 (AP)Turkish Cypriote refugees forced Archbishop Makarios to retreat today when he attempted to visit their camps inside this British base area.

title: The Class Of 1974
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17  The 93d or Watergate Congress is now breaking up, and the chances are that the 94th, which convenes on Jan. 14, will be more liberal, more spendthrift, more partisan and increasingly critical of the Ford Administration.

title: U.S. Lease Linked to Friend Of Scott Is Under Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17The Justice Department is in vestigating the award of Federal contract worth at least $46million for the leasing of Government office space in Philadelphia building developed by a close friend of Hugh Scott, the Senate Republican leader.

title: Audit, Criticizes Board, On District 9 Problems
description: A state audit of fiscal irregularities in Community School District 9 in the Bronx, which was officially made public yesterday, criticized the city Board of Education for not having done more to prevent and correct abuses.

title: Limits Are Upheld On Negligence Fees Given to Lawyers
description: The State Supreme Court yesterday upheld its own rules limiting the size of contingency fees lawyers may charge in negligence cases and set the stage for a test of the regulations in Federal court.

title: Blazers' Bad Check Investigated
description: ORLANDO, Fla., Dec. 17 (UPI)State Attorney Robert Eagan said today he was investigating a $1.5million check that bounced after it was presented to the floundering Florida Blazers of the World Football League. The prosecutor said he was conducting an investigation of possible fraud and trafficking in bad checks. The cheek was flashed before television cameras just before kickoff at the Nov. 21 playoff game between the Blazers and the Philadelphia Bell. A Cocoa Beach financier, Robert Prentice, landed the check to the Blazers' attorney, Robert Deutsch, saying he represented a group of unnamed investors. The players and coaches were promised it would be used in part to make up several weeks of back pay. A few days later the check was returned to the Sun First National Bank of Orlando because of insufficient funds.

title: Unmaking of the City Budget: A Case Study
description: Painstakingly, an $11billion budget was constructed during the first six months of this year to meet the demands of the variety of groups that have a claim on the New York City government. Painfully, for the first time in generations, that budgettumbled into the red by the national inflation and recessionHis now being dismantled.

title: U.S.China Relations
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass. When in the Shanghai Communiqu of 1972 the United States and China decided that. cultural, journalistic and academic exchanges were desirable to broaden the understanding between the two peoples, they recognized that there are essential differences between their social systems.

title: Safeway's President Defends Prices Found Identical With A. &P.'s
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17Senator William Proxmire said today that investigators for the SenateHouse Joint Economic Committee had found identical prices on 2,969 items among 3,959 checked in Kansas City stores of the nation's two largest retail food chains.

title: DOLLAR AND POUND FALL TO NEW LOWS
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 17 (UPI)The United States dollar and the British pound were dumped by money dealers today, forcing the currencies to record lows against European currencies, and raising the Swiss franc under heavy buying demind. The price of gold rose With the decline of the dollar.

title: Entertainment Events Today
description: Theater

title: Losing Trend Is Reversed on a Sharp Reduction for 1st Half of 1975
description: A late technical recovery, especially in many of the blue chips and glamour stocks, enabled the stock market to close higher in heavier trading yes, terday.

title: Flames Bow, 53, To Bruins
description: BOSTON, Dec. 17 (UPI)The Boston Bruins capitalized on Atlanta mistakes to defeat the Flame, 53, tonight and move within 5 points of the Buffalo Sabres, leaders hi their National Hockey League division.

title: About New York
description: Now I'm going to show you something you'll probably never see again in your life, Henry B. Platt said. Mr. Platt, the president of Tiffany & Co., was caught up in rapture. He looks like Richard Nixon without jowls, and when he is happy he laughs and goes, Heh, heh, heh.

title: Majority of House Panel Terms Rockefeller Qualified for VicePresidency
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17The House Judiciary Committee, in the draft of its majority report, found Nelson A. Rockefeller fit and qualified to be Vice President and recommended his confirmation, while noting that some of those voting for confirmation did go with certain reservations.

title: Housing Starts Decline To Low for Eight Years
description: WASHINGTON, Dec, 17 (AP) The number of new housing units started in November dropped to the lowest level in eight years, the Government reported today.

title: Utility to Cut Outlays
description: The Union Electric Company said it plans to reduce its spending for new construction next year by $96million. The utility said that work stoppages at the Rush Island, Mo., plant precluded the possibility of commercial operation of the first two units as scheduled. The first unit is now scheduled for operation in late 1975 and the second in the Spring of 1977.

title: N.Y.U. DROPS PLAN ON RESEARCH BASE
description: New York University, which has been consolidating operations at its Washington Square campus in Greenwich Village, has dropped a plan to construct a $40million research center in the Sterling Forest industrial complex in Orange County, university officials said yesterday.

title: 2 Boston Schools to Be Closed Until Jan. 2 to Avert Trouble
description: BOSTON, Dec. (AP)Two high schools that have been tenter of racial turmoil will remain closed until Jan. 2, after the Christmas holidays, because of the threat of further trouble, school officials said today.

title: The Increase in Prices Is Laid to Bargain Hunting and Short Covering
description: New York City's outstanding bonds, mauled by losses in recent weeks, improved in price yesterday after the city set forth a sharply curtailed schedule of public borrowing for the first half of 1975. The city said it planned to issue only notes in the amount of $620million in January, in contrast with previous estimates that its debt issues next month might total $500million in bonds and as much as $800million in notes. Oneyear notes are scheduled for sale on Jan. 7.

title: Officers' Private Dining Rooms Retained in Ruling of Pentagon
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17Af. ter months of highlevel study, the Defense Department has decided that it should standardize the prides and reduce the staffs but not abolish five private dining rooms for topranking officers and officials.

title: Damage Shocks Japanese Art Exhibitors
description: The apparently accidental mutilation of a sacred Japanese artwork while it was clearing Customs inspection at. Kennedy International Airport has shocked its Japanese trustees and briefly jeopardized the opening of a showing of their collection of religious art here.

title: Swede, 18, Wins Slalom
description: MADONNA DI CAMPIGLIO, Italy, Dec. 17 (UPI)Ingemar Stenmark, an 18yearold Swede, rallied from 23d position today to win the opening men's World Cup special slalom in which Geoff Bruce of Coming, N. Y., finished fourth after leading the field in the first run.

title: Pro Soccer Goes Indoors For Tourney
description: The North American Soccer League announced yesterday that it would hold an indoor tournament this winter and that CBS would provide television coverage of two games.

title: Pentagon Denies Training Of Troops to Seize Oil
description: WASHINGTON, Dec 17, (Reuters)The Defense Department today denied reports that United States troops were being trained to take over Middle East oilfields in the event of another embargo by the Arab oilproducing countries.

title: Business Briefs
description: Directors of the Manufacturers Hanover Corporation, he holding company that owns the Manufacturers Hanover Trust Company, said yesterday that there would be no increase in the dividend during 1975 in compliance with a condition laid down last week by the Federal Reserve Board in approving the acquisition of the Ritter Financial Corporation, a consumer finance company based in Wyncote, Pa.

title: Assembly Leaders In Jersey Propose A 2% Income Levy
description: TRENTON, Dec. 17The Assembly's Democratic leadership disclosed today that it would push still another state income tax proposalthis one a 2 per cent tax on gross income earned in New Jerseydespite the fact that it had less of a chance of being approved by the Senate than the smaller tax that the Senate Democratic caucus rejected yesterday.

title: Egypt and Syria Divided On U. S. Peace Proposals
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, Dec. 12 A serious rift has developed between Egypt and Syria over United States proposals for a second step in the disengagement of Arab and Israeli armies.

title: KISSINGER HINTS U.S. MAY BEND ON CUBA
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17Secretary of State Kissinger was reported today to have said that the United States might be willing to support a mechanism that could lead to the lifting of economic and diplomatic sanctions against Cuba.

title: Renaissance Band Brings Back Sonorities of Yore
description: A few days ago a photographer dropped in on a rehearsal of the New York Rentissance Band to take some pictures.

title: Fatal Bomb Is Traced
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 17 (AP) The police said today that package bomb that killed United Parcel Service worker Dec. 5 was mailed in Erie by shaggyhaired white male who may have been a member of an area motorcycle gang. An investigation is continuing to find the man.

title: JIM WALTER NET AND SALES CLIMB
description: The Jim Walter Corporation, a major building materials and shell housing producer, reported yesterday net income rose 37.9 per cent in the first fiscal quarter ended Nov. 30 to $20million, or $1.15 a share, from $14.5million, or 83 cents a share, a year ago. Sales advanced 29.1 per cent to $359.3million from $278.3million.

title: Rhodesian Blacks Link Talks to Majority Rule
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Dec. 17 (Reuters)The official leader of Rhodesia's 5.5 million blacks said today that a constitutional conference with the Rhodesian Government could not begin until agreement was reached on majority rule.

title: 2 Patriot Aides Quit
description: FOXBORO, Mass., Dec. 17 (UPI)Bill Nelsen, quarterback coach, and Phil Bengston, director of pro scouting, have resigned from the New England Patriots, Coach Chuck Fairbanks said today.

title: Their French Lesson C'tait Dlcieuse
description: In just an hour yesterday, Jean Vergnes whipped up breakfast (scrambled eggs), lunch (omelettes of all sorts), dinner (Suprme de Yolaille Gismonda)and the enthusiasm of a youthful audience that decided that the chef himself was the most delightful treat of the day. Mr. Vergnes kept the class of 70 sixth and seventhgrade girls from the Convent of the Sacred Heart School entranced as they feasted on the fantasies that he cooked for them and, at the same time, made the French vocabulary they had studied come alive.

title: Public Jobs Agreed Upon, With Wider Help to Idle
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17 Congressional conferee's agreed today on legislation that would provide 375,000 public service jobs next year and pay Federal cash benefits to as many is 3 million workers not now covered by unemployment compensation.

title: JOE RICHARDS
description: Joe Richards, bowling columnist of The Daily News, died at his home here Sunday at the age of 81.

title: YEAR'S PROGRESS CITED BY WILSON
description: Governor Wilson assessed his own brief term in office yesterday., as a year of progress' during which he both undertook historic initiatives and charted a new course, essential to our time, for state government.

title: Forego, 8Race Winner, Is Horse of Year
description: Forego, big in size aand achievement, was named yesterday the horse of the year in thoroughbred racing. The 4yearold gelding, owned by Martha L. Gerry and trained by Sherrill Ward, also was selected as the year's top handicap horse and No. 1 sprinter voting for the Eclipse awards by the Thoroughbred Racing Associations, the National Turf Writers Association and The Daily Racing Form.

title: Jockey, 19, Wins Record 516th
description: LAUREL, Md., Dec, 17At 3:21 this afternoon, Chris McCarron, a babyfaced, 19yearold jockey just two years out of high school, culminated one of the most astonishing ragstoriches feats in racing history.

title: Plantless Manufacturer Winner in New Lottery
description: Persistence, steady habits and a lucky barber for a talisman have paid off for Ernest M. Steele, an unemployed former children'swear manufacturer, who has become the first $250,000 winner in the state's new 50cent weekly lottery.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: LEND AN EAR The New York University Choral Arts Society will give a bon voyage concert of early classics tonight at 8:30 before flying to Rome to perform at the Vatican. The place is the School of Education Auditorium, 35 West Fourth Street (east of Washington Square). Admission is $3, and $1,50 for students.

title: E.E.C. SETS PLAN TO SAVE ENERGY
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 17The European Economic Community took a first step toward creating a common internal energy policy today as its nine members agreed at a meeting of energy ministers on joint objectives for energy use by 1985.

title: Treasury Aide Foresees the OnceCentral Role of Metal Shifting
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17Jack F. Bennett, Undersecretary of the Treasury for Monetary Affairs, said today the agreement yesterday on gold between France and the United States would not have much immediate practical significance but was another step toward ending the oncecentral role of gold in the world monetary system.

title: U.S. to Boycott U.N. Fund To Aid Countries in Crisis
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 17The United States has decided to boycott a special fund being set up here to provide emergency relief and development aid to the cuntries hardest hit economically.

title: WORLD IS WARNED ON OIL PAYMENTS
description: An international panel of bankers and economists has warned that both industrialized and developing countries face an immediate danger of progressive collapse because of the payments problem created by the sharp increase in the price of oil.

title: Rabbi Korff Asks Public To Leave Nixon Alone
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17 (UPI)Rabbi Baruch Korff asked Americans today, in the spirit of peace on earth, goodwill to men, to leave former President Richard M. Nixon alone, If they do not, the Rabbi said, Mr. Nixon may die.

title: A's Plan Suit Today Over Hunter
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Dec. 17 Charles O. Finley, owner of the Oakland A's, plans to seek a restraining order against Jim Hunter tomorrow in Alameda County Court here, preventing the pitcher from negotiating with any other team. He will also ask the court to overturn the arbitrator's decision that made Hunter a free agent.

title: Ani Kavafian Plays Violin Impressively In Museum Recital
description: Ani Kavafian has been a fixture of New York's chambermusic activity for several years now and has been giving annual solo recitals here since 1972. This year's installment, Monday night at the Metropolitan Museum, was enormously impressive. Miss Kavafian presumably still growing as both a technician and a musician; if she grows much past her present point of development, she will be one of the great violinists of today. Perhaps she is already.

title: LOCKHEED FACES FRAUD QUESTIONS
description: The Navy has asked the Justice Department to look into the question of possible fraud in connection with a multimilliondollar shipbuilding claim by the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation.

title: Mercy Killing Conviction
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 17 (AP) A 65yearold retired maintenance man was convicted yesterday of thirddegree murder in the stabbing of his wife, who was afflicted with multiple sclerosis. Joseph Saveikis, of suburban McKess Rocks, had performed a mercy killing, last July, the defense argued. Judge Nathan Schwartz delivered the nonjury verdict.

title: Not So Grand Canyon
description: Under the guise of protecting the rights of a tiny Indian tribe, a bill is on its way through Congress that would drastically reduce the acreage of public lands in the Grand Canyon and virtually declare open season on the area's Desert Bighorn sheep.

title: Bridge: Luck of Draw in Team Play Can Be Highly Significant
description: In almost all forms of tournament play, chance plays a role away from the card, table. A lucky pair can find themselves in a weak section, in spite of the efforts of organizers to seed them equally. And in most team events, the luck of the draw is highly significant.

title: CITY WILL CURTAIL BORROWING TO CUT COST OF iNTEREST
description: New York City announced a major curtailment in public borrowing yesterday in a move intended to reduce a glut of its obligations on the market and to cut interest costs by stimulating competition for its bonds.

title: Father of Coach Dies After Game
description: MEMPHIS, Dec. 17 (UPI) W. R. Battle, the father of Tennessee's football coach, Bill Battle, died early today of a heart attack after collapsing in the stands during last night's Tennessee's Liberty Bowl victory over Maryland.

title: Housing Is Dedicated at Schomburg Plaza
description: After 10 oftencontrovefsial years, the symbolic pillars of the gateway to Harlemthe Arthur A. Schomburg Plazawere dedicated yesterday.

title: Pro Transactions
description: VIRGINIA (ABA)Signed Lamar Green, forward, free agent.

title: The Stage: A Cornucopia of Benchley
description: Few people, probably only one, ever qualified as a Robert Benchley and, even though he's gone, it is pleasant to report that generous servings of his amiable and Confusing humor have been integrated, along with songs by Bert Kalmar and Harry Ruby, into a sparkling short revue now running weekends in the cozy Subplot Cafe of the American Place Theater, one flight down at 111 West 46th Street.

title: An Israeli Force Destroys 6 Houses In Raid on Lebanon
description: TEL AVIV, Wednesday, Dec. 18An Israeli force drove five miles into southern Lebanon this morning and blew up six houses in Majdal Zun, it was officially announced here.

title: Some Institutions Defy the Slump and Stand Firm
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17The Cleveland Symphony Orchestra, which played to empty seats and was in financial distress four years ago during the last recession, is now performing to sellout audiences and is in sound economic condition.

title: Israleli Says Soviet Soldiers Aid Syria
description: TEL AVIV, Dec 17Defense Minister Shimon Peres said today that Syrian groundtoair missile, batteries near Damescus were manned by Soviet soldiers.

title: CORN LEADS DROP FOR GRAIN PRICES
description: Corn led a downturn in grain prices yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade, amid discussion of the latest export inspection figures Issued late Monday. The figures indicated that exports were moving at a much slower rate than a year ago.

title: Trial Set in Poisoning
description: HOUSTON, Tex., Dec. 17 (AP)Ronald Clark O'Bryan, a Deer Park, Tex., optician being held without bond in the poisoning death of his 8yearold son, will go on trial May 5, District Court Judge Frank Price ruled today.

title: Missing Politician No Spy, British Say
description: LONDON, Dec. 17The British Government sought today to clear up some questions surrounding a missing member of Parliament who disappeared last month in Miami Beach.

title: CHURCH UNIT ENDS HUNGER MEETING
description: GARRISON, N.Y., Dec. 17A National Council of Churches Conference on world hunger ended a twoday session today by adopting a broad statement that includes an appeal to its constituent denominations todouble their food aid next year.

title: Mighty Voices Raised in Song Around the City Almost Every Evening
description: It was a highlight of the week for most of them. Bank employes, editors, housewives, accountants teachers175 people of sundry pursuitssat at the edges of their metal chairs and held their music high.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Dec. 17 (Reuters)Topseeded John Newcombe of Australia beat Uli Pinner of West Germany, 64, 64, in a secondround match at the New South Wales open tennis championships today. Americans Mike Machette and Raz Reid won their secondround matches but John Andrews and Steve Docherty lost. Machette, of Belvedere, Calif., beat Fred Stolle of Australia, 64, 63, and Reid, of Greenville, S.C., beat Reggie Lewis of Australia, 64, 16, 63. Geoff Masters of Australia beat Andrews, of Fullerton, Calif., 64, 75, and Tony Roche of Australia beat Docherty, of Los Angeles, 61, 64.

title: Carey Offers Post To Campaign Foe, Harry J. O'Donnell
description: Harry J. O'Donnell, the press secretary and adviser to Governor Wilson who worked hard and unsuccessfully to defeat Representative Hugh. L. Carey in the last month's election, has received a job offer from Mr. Carey.

title: Neighbors Call Slain Rabbi Friend to All
description: Max Koppel, the 69yearold rabbi shot to death Monday night in an apparent holdup attempt, was described yesterday by neighbors in Washington Heights and by members of his family as a gentle man, always seeking to help others whatever their denomination or color.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: The winning New Jersey daily lottery number yesterday was:

title: ASH RESIGNS POST; MORE CHANGES DUE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17The resignation of Roy L. Ash as director of the Office of Management and Budget was announced today by the White House, and several other Cabinetlevel changes were reported imminent.

title: Passport Office to Be Retained At Rockefeller Center Location
description: The offices of the New York Passport Agency, a feature of the Rockefeller Center area for almost 40 years, will remain in its present location.

title: Copper Sales Move Is Set
description: The Inspiration Consolidated Copper Company said yesterday it had declared a partial force majeure against its December sales and commitments for returns to toll customers. The company said the action was being taken because of in termittent operating problems and interruptions at is recently constructed facilities at Miami, Ariz. A spokesman estimated scheduled December deliveries of rod and cathodes and toll returns of blister copper would be reduced by about 25 per cent.

title: Sports Today BASKETBALL
description: Baruch at Lehman, 8 P.M.; East Stroudsburg at William Paterson, 8 P.M.; Fairleigh Dickinson (Rutherford) at Montclair State, 8 P.M.; Hunter at Newark Rutgers, 8 P.M.; Jersey City State at Brooklyn College, 8 P.M.; C. W. Post at Wagner, 8 P.M.; Ramapo at Trenton State, 8 P.M.; St.. Francis at Queens, 8 P.M.; Scranton at Army, 8 P.M.

title: Assembly Democrats Suggest A 2% Tax on Jersey Incomes
description: TRENTON, Dec. 17The Assembly's Democratic leadership disclosed today that it would push still another state income tax proposalthis one a 2 per cent tax on gross income earned in New Jerseydespite the fact that it had less of chance of being approved by the Senate than the smaller tax that the Senate Democratic caucus rejected yesterday.

title: Police Report Offer Of $130,000 Bribe
description: Leroy Barnes, whom lawenforcement authorities described as one of the nation's major drug traffickers, was charged yesterday with offering a $130,000 bribe to policemen after they stopped his MercedesBenz sedan in the South Bronx and allegedly found a gun in it.

title: Ford to Leave Sunday For Colorado Vacation
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17 (AP) President Ford said today that he and his family would fly to Colorado Sunday morning for their annual holiday skiing vacation in the resort town of Vail.

title: Swede, 18, Wins Slalom
description: MADONNA DI CAMPIGLIO, Italy, Dec. 17 (UPI)Ingemar Stenmark, an 18yearold Swede, rallied from 23d position today to win the opening men's World Cup special slalom in which Geoff Bruce of Coming, N. Y., finished fourth after leading the field in the first run.

title: Solidarity at Martinique
description: The common, or at least complementary, international energy policy worked out by Presidents Ford and Valery Giscard d'Estaing in Martinique marks a highly important dtente in the economic and political conflicts between the United States and France, hitherto the most contentious of the Western allies. The agreement increases hope that the industrial nations of Europe, North America and Japan will be able to hold together in efforts to resolve what are probably the greatest threats to the world economy and to world peace since the nineteenthirties.

title: Attica Defendant Charged With Robbery of Widow, 74
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 17 (AP)A man awaiting dial on indictments growing out of the 1971 Attican prison revolt has been arrested on charges of robbing a 74yearold widow.

title: A Wild Whirl Evokes the Old Cotton Club
description: When Mayor Beame introduced Livia Weintraub to the 1,500 merrymakers gathered at Roseland Dance City Monday night, he said he wished the city had more women like her. Oh, please God, no, murmured a guest. One is enough.

title: DUDLEY A. SCHLOSSER
description: Dudley A. Schlossor, City Attorney and law director for Hoboken, N. J., died Sunday at Christ Hospital in Jersey City. He was 58 years old and lived at 1022 Garden Street, Hoboken.

title: World Bank to Get $750Million Loan From Saudi Arabia
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17 Saudi Arabia and the World Bank jointly announced today that Saudi Arabia will lend the bank $750millionthe largest borrowing in the bank's guartercentury history.

title: U.S. Asks Action on I.T.T. Divesting
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17 (UPI)The Justice Department announced today it has asked the United States Court in Hartford, Conn., to order a special study of options for splitting off Avis, Inc.; Levitt & Sons, Inc., and the Hartford Fire Insurance Company from the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation.

title: Forego, 8Race Winner, Is Horse of Year.
description: Forego, big in size and achievement, was named yesterday the horse of the year in thoroughbred racing. The 4yearold gelding, owned by Martha L. Gerry and trained by Sherrill Ward, also was selected as the year's top handicap horse and No. 1 sprinter in voting for the Eclipse awards by the Thoroughbred Racing Associations, the National Turf Writers Association and The Daily Racing Form.

title: Holdup Suspect Is Shot By His Intended Victim
description: A holdup suspect was shot and critically wounded last night when he reportedly pulled a .22caliber Saturday night special, on a man armed with a .38caliber revolver.

title: No Gothic for Nivelles
description: There is something reassuring, at a time of cosmic international disasters, about a Belgian town voting on whether to put a Romanesque tower or a Gothic steeple on its restored medieval church. The world may be going down the drain, but in Nivelles, twenty miles south of Brussels, Romanesque versus Gothic is the hot issue.

title: I EDWARD DARLING, 67, EDITOR AND AUTHOR
description: Edward Darling, author and editor, died last Thursday at his home at Dennis, Mass. He was 67 years old.

title: Business Records
description: Involuntary Petition Filed Against: UNITED CARPET, INC, 42 Avenue A, N.Y. Petitioners are the Kane Carpet Company; the Miami Carpet Corporation and David Chassler, Inc. On Nov. 7, 1974, United Carpet made a general assignment for the benefit of creditors to Charles S. Nemser in N.Y.

title: MARIA DE WONG
description: MEXICO CITY, Dec, 17 Maria Constanza Cavazos de Wong, wife of Benjamin Wong Castaneda, editor of El Sol, died Sunday of a heart attack. She was 42 years old.

title: New Lawyers Take Over Carter Case
description: A new team of three lawyers yesterday took over the defense in the Rubin (Hurricane) Carter murder case and said they would file a second application for a new trial in New Jersey on the basis of newly discovered evidence.

title: Tories in Britain Propose Annual Election of Leader
description: LONDON, Dec. 17The Conservative party has decided for the first time to hold an annual election for its leader. But the new rules have to be approved by Edward Heath, the party leader who faces possible defeat under the proposals.

title: GOVERNOR ORDERS MEDICAID INQUIRY
description: TRENTON, Dec. 17Governor Byrne, citing personal knowledge of huge fees being paid to physicians or other healthcare providers, today directed the State Commission of Investigation to open an inquiry into possible fraud in New Jersey's Medicaid program.

title: The Real Connection
description: PARISMoscow has followed up its increasing dtente with Paris by opening here a rather boring exposition called France and the U.S.S.R.The Great Moments of a Tradition. This displays some socialist realist paintings, some ceramics with hortatory slogans and preCommunist mementos including French paintings front Russian museums.

title: Chicago Republicans Name Alderman for Mayoral Race
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 17 (AP)Alderman John J. Hoellen, describing himself as a work horse not a race horse, announced today that he would be the regular Republican party's candidate to oppose Mayor Richard J. Daley of Chicago in 1975. Mayor Daley, a Democrat, is seeking a sixth term.

title: ASH RESIGNS POST; MORE CHANGES DUE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17The resignation of Roy L. Ash as director of the Office of Management and Budget was announced today by the White House, and several other Cabinetlevel changes were reported imminent.

title: What Do We Do?
description: Lately, I've been running across friends from college, many of whom I haven't seen in the, two and a half years since I graduated. After we dispense with a few facetious references about the good old days, the conversation inevitably leads to What are you doing these days? This is logical question, but unfair because requires the person answering it to condense into a few sentences a complex of events which may well be fraught with existential torment.

title: EXPERTS EXAMINE GAMMA RAY DATA
description: DALLAS, Dec. 17  Specialists in the most violent events known, such as the stellar explosions called supernovas, examined today the evidence for one class of occurrence in the universe whose nature and location remain unknown.

title: Police Report Offer Of $130,000 Bribe
description: Leroy Barnes, whom lawenforcement authorities described as one of the nation's major drug traffickers, was charged yesterday with offering a $130,000 bribe to policemen after they stopped his MercedesBenz sedan in the South Bronx and allegedly found a gun in it.

title: Blazers' Bad Check Investigated
description: ORLANDO, Fla., Dec. 17 (UPI)State Attorney Robert Eagan said today he was investigating a $1.5million check that bounced after it was presented to the floundering Florida Blazers of the World Football League. The prosecutor said he was conducting an investigation of possible fraud and trafficking in bad checks. The check was flashed before television cameras just before kickoff at the Nov. 21 playoff game between the Blazers and the Philadelphia Bell. A Cocoa Beach financier, Robert Prentice, handed the check to the Blazers' attorney, Robert Deutsch, saying he represented a group of unnamed investors. The players and coaches were promised it would be used in part to make up several weeks of back pay. A few days later the check was returned to the Sun First National Bank of Orlando because of insufficient funds.

title: Rangers' LineUp
description: AT GARDEN7:35 P.M. CABLE TVCHANNEL 10, 7:35 P.M.

title: Highs and Lows
description: Tuesday, Dec. 17, 1974

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The problem of ascertaining and dealing, with what economists call social costs seems to become ever more pervasive. Without defining such costs in social scienceese, I shall give one example and then indicate what I feel is necessary to deal with the problem.

title: TV: Missiles of October Recalls the Cuban Crisis
description: The Missiles of October, which usurps the entire ABC schedule this evening from 8 to 11 o'clock, could be subtitled Advertisements for the Memories of the Kennedy Brothers. The subject is the Cuban missile crisis of 1962, when for 13 days the presence of Soviet nuelear offensive weapons in Cuba. sparked an eyeballtoeyeball brinkmanship confrontation between the United States and the Soviet Union.

title: Public Jobs Agreed Upon, With Wider Help to Idle
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17 Congressional conferees agreed today on legislation that would provide 375,000 public service jobs next year and pay Federal cash benefits to as many as 3 million workers not now covered by unemployment compensation.

title: Agreement Seen Having a Potentially Wide Reaching Impact
description: PARIS, Dec. 17  Europe's bullion trading centers reacted bullishly today to the FrenchAmerican decision at Martinique to permit nations to adopt current market prices as the basis of valuation for their gold holdings, instead of the official price of $42.22 an ounce.

title: '76 Mats Landing Gains With Launching of Titan
description: The first successful launching last week of a giant new rocket has bolstered confidence in the $1billion Viking program to land, two American scientific craft on Mars in 1976 to search for signs of life.

title: ALCOA SUPPLEMENTS GAS SUPPLY WITH OIL
description: The Aluminum Company of America said yesterday that it would use standby oil supplies to augment natural gas supplies in its Tennessee operations. The company has been notified that its gas supply in that state would be cut 35 per cent below earlier December allocations, Electrical energy for its smelter at Alcoa, Tenn., has not been affected but the company has been notified that the gas supply in January through March could be cut as much as 60 per cent.

title: CITY WILL CURTAIL BORROWING TO CUT COST OF INTEREST
description: New York City announced a major curtailment in public borrowing yesterday in ra move intended to reduce a glut of its obligations on the market and to cut interest costs by stimulating competition for its bonds.

title: Gibrob, All 7 of His Assistants Dismissed in Bear ShakeUp
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 17 (AP)In a move that had been expected, Abe Gibron was dismissed today as coach of the Chicago Bears of the National Football League. No replacement was named.

title: Chilean Assumes Presidency
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Dec. 17 (Reuters)Gen. Augusto Pinochet, leader of Chile's ruling military junta, today officially assumed the title of President General Pinochet, formerly called supreme chief of the nation or president of the junta, will exercise executive power while the entire junta will exercise legislative power, according to an official decree.

title: U.N. COUNCIL ASKS A FREE NAMIBIA
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Dec. 17The Security Council today unanimously adopted a resolution calling on South Africa to take the necessary steps to withdraw from SouthWest Africa, the former German colony that South Africa has been administering since the end of World War I.

title: U.S. Says Egypt Can Get Reactor if Israel Forgoes It
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17 (AP) The United States is prepared to provide Egypt with an atomic power plant if a companion sale to Israel falls through, the State Department said today.

title: PRICES IRREGULAR ON AMEX AND OTC
description: After being down most of the session, prices closed mixed yesterday on the American Stock Exchange as a result of a buying spurt near the close. Prices in the overthecounter market also were irregular as trading in both markets rose slightly.

title: European American Dropped as Islip Bank for Municipal Funds
description: Led by a Councilman who reportedly declared that he would not approve putting public funds in a foreign bank, the fivemember Town Board of Islip, L.I., yesterday struck the EuropeanAmerican Bank and Trust Company from the list of banks authorized to receive deposits of municipal funds.

title: 18 State Congressmen Ask Carey To Start a NursingHome Inquiry
description: Eighteen New York Representatives and Representativeselect yesterday called on Governorelect Hugh L. Carey to name a special commission to investigate the nursinghome industry. In response, Mr. Carey named Mario M. Cuomo, a close adviser, as a factfinder to study the situation immediately and report after the inauguration on Jan. 1.

title: Gifts to 3d Fund for the Neediest exceed $500,000
description: The 63d annual appeal of The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund passed the $500,000 mark yesterday with the receipt of $15,624.50 from 310 contributor. The overall figure now stands at $500,765.48.

title: STATE PROBLEMS CITED BY RUTGERS
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, Dec. 17 Rutgers University today released a volume of reports on New Jersey's population, energy, housing, transportation and environmental problems that researchers hope will be used by state planners and political leaders in mapping solutions.

title: VICTORY BY HUNTS ON G.W.U. IS SEEN
description: Although they made no claim of victory, it appears that Nelson Bunker Hunt and William Herbert Hunt of Dallas have been successful in their fight to acquire the Great Western United Corporation of Denver, the nation's largest producer of beet sugar. In making an announcement yesterday that they were extending their offer to purchase Great Western United common shares at $27.50, until 5 P.M. today, the Hunt brothers disclosed that they control approximately 51.26 per cent of the 2.1 million common shares of Great Western United.

title: City Will Expand Landfill Parks
description: An ecological experiment harnessing the efforts of city agenties and community volunteers is converting piles of construction debris deposited as landfill on the shore of Jamaica Bay into a landscaped public park at the foot of Pennsylvania Avenue in the Canarsie section of Brooklyn.

title: HOW TO AID THE FUND
description: Checks should be made pay able to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund and forwarded to P.O. Box 5193, Church Street Station, New York N. Y, 10249 or to any of the following eight organizations that certify these cases:

title: Notes on People
description: Chairman Mao Tsetung met, with. President Mobutu Sese seko of Zaire in China yesterday, according to Hsinhua, the Chinese news agency. It was the first official report in recent, weeks that the80yearold Chinese leader was not in seclusion. Secretary of State kissinger spent five days last month without seeing him...An invitation to yisit Peking, probably :pest spring, has been accepted by Premier Leo Tindemans of Belgium. Prime Minister Harold Wilson of Britain, who is to visit Washington in January, told Parliament yesterday that he would visit the Soviet Union early in 1975.

title: New Lawyers Take Over Carter Case
description: A new team of three lawyers yesterday took over the defente in the Rubin (Hurricane) Carter murder case and said they would file a second application for a new trial in New Jersey on the basis of newly discovered evidence.

title: North Victor, 29 to 24
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Dec. 17 (AP)Steve Grogan, Kansas State quarterback, led the North to a 2924 seesaw victory over the South in the annual BlueGray college football game tonight.

title: Devine Tells Fans Game Plan
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind., Dec. 17 (UPI)Dan Devine promised Notre Dame's football fans the same type of game they had under Ara Parseghian as Devine made his first appear. ance today as coach of the Fighting Irish, 11 years after he was first considered for the job.

title: Stage: Stoppard's Enter a Free Mran
description: Over the years, the British playwright Tom Stoppard has built up a reputation as the. playboy of the Western word But what was he like when he was a slip of a lad, before the metaphysical histrionics and dramatic conjuring tricks of such plays as Jumpers and Travesties? Last night at St. Clement's we were given an introduction to the young Stoppard, when his very first play, Enter a Free Man was given its New York premiere.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: The Public Service Company of Indiana filed yesterday a registration statement with the Securities and Exchange Commission in connection with a public offering of 1.3 million common shares. The utility said the shares were expected to be offered, through underwriters headed by Morgan Stanley & Co., and Dean Witter & Co., Jan. 14, 1975.

title: Nixon's Bay Lane Qpened, Rebozo's Bank Robbed
description: MIAMI, Dec. 17  Richard M. Nixon, for six years the most powerful person in the most powerful nation on earth, wad turned down today by the Dade County Board of Commissioners on a petition to keep tourists off the road in front of his Key Biscayne house. The vote was 5 to 3.

title: Barry's 44 Points Help Warriors Rout Knicks
description: Rick Barry staged a oneman show last night at Madison Square Garden.

title: Senate Unit Defers Action on Judgeship for Meskill
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17The Senate Judiciary Committee today in effect killed for this session of Congress the controversial nomination of Gov. Thomas J. Meskill of Connecticut as a judge on the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit.

title: CONCERNED FORD TELLS U.S. STEEL TO JUSTIFY RISES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17President Ford, described as concerned and very disappointed, demanded today that the United States Steel Corporation justify in writing the reasons for the price increases it announced yesterday.

title: Laxalt to Be Sworn Today As New Nevada Senator
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17 (AP) Paul Laxalt, the only Republican to capture a Democratic Senate seat in last month's election, is to be sworn in tomorrow as the new Senator from Nevada.

title: Prices Rolled Back By 15 Oil Companies
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17 (AP) The Federal Energy Administration has obtained price rollbacks totaling about $77million to correct alleged overcharging on petroleum products by 15 oil companies, a spokesman said today.

title: Surviving Coast Sextuplet Is Said to Be Doing Well
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., Dec. 17 (AP)Jolene Rene, now the only survivor of the Lange sextuplets, is progressing well and displaying only mild respiratory problems, doctors say.

title: 18 State Congressmen Ask Carey to Start Inquiry on Nursing Homes
description: Eighteen New York Representatives and Representativeselect yesterday called on Governorelect Hugh L. Carey to naive a special commission to investigate the nursinghome industry. In response, Mr. Carey named Mario M. Cuomo, a close adviser, as a factfinder to study the situation immediately and report after the inauguration on Jan. 1.

title: 2 Patriot Aides Quit
description: FOXBORO, Mass., Dec. 17 (UPI)Bill Nelsen, quarterback coach, and Phil Bengston, director of pro scouting, have resigned from the New England Patriots, Coach Chuck Fairbanks said today.

title: Dabney Stars as Rutgers Defeats Princeton, 7367
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., Dec. 17 (AP)Mike Dabney scored 22 points to lead Rutgers to a 7367 victory over Princeton tonight.

title: Wings, But No Halo
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Dec, 17 (AP)  After four seasons as the Class A Pacific Coast League baseball team now will be known as the Salt Lake Gulls, Merle Miller, the owner and general manager, said he changed the name to give the Utah team its own identity.

title: Herstatt Accord Averts Bankruptcy Proceedings
description: COLOGNE, West Germany, Dec. 17 (Reuters)Hans Gerling said today he would accept an outofcourt settlement under which 87.86 per cent of Bankhaus I.D. Herstatt creditors would grant him and other leading figures in the Herstatt case immunity from possible legal claims, Judge Wilhelm Uhlenbruck said. Mr. Gerling, an insurance executive, was the insolvent bank's majority stockholder.

title: Full Disclosure of Income Adopted by Council, 411 By EDWARD RANZAL
description: The City Council adopted a strict disclosure bill yesterday requiring elected officials and all city employes earning more than $25,000 a year to report the sources of their income. The vote was 41 to 1.

title: Caramanlis Proposes Election Of Jurist as Interim President
description: ATHENS, Dec, 17  Premier Constantine Caramanlis today proposed a leading jurist and man of letters as his Government's choice for the first president of the new Greek Republic.

title: BETHLEHEM BACKS STRIP MINE CURBS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17 A number of the nation's major companies were reported today to have sent letters to President Ford urging him to sign, rather than veto, a stripmine control bill that has beer bitterly opposed for years by the mining industry's trade as sociations here.

title: Books of The Times
description: GENTLEMAN JIMMY WALKER. By George Walsh. 362 pages. Illustrated. Praeger. $10.95.

title: JUSTICES NARROW COMMERCE RULE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17The Supreme Court narrowed its definition of interstate commerce today and, in the process, denied Federal relief to labor unions forbidden to picket by state courts and to a California manufacturer trying to invoke the antitrust laws against pricefixing.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Dec. 17 (Reuters)Topseeded John Newcombe of Australia beat Uli Pinner of West Germany, 64, 64, in a secondround match at the New South Wales open tennis championships today. Americans Mike Machette and Raz Reid won their secondround matches but John Andrews and Steve Docherty lost. Machette, of Belvedere, Calif., beat Fred Stolle of Australia, 64, 63, and Reid, of Greenville, S.C., beat Reggie Lewis of Australia, 64, 16, 63. Geoff Masters of Australia beat Andrews, of Fullerton, Calif., 64, 75, and Tony Roche of Australia beat Docherty, of Los Angeles, 61, 64.

title: World Bank to Get $750Million Loan From Saudi Arabia
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17 Saudi Arabia and the World Bank jointly amounced today that Saudi Arabia will lend the bank $750millionthe largest borrowing in the bank's quartercentury history.

title: Housing Is Dedicated at Schomburg Plaza
description: After 10 oftencontroversial years, the symbolic pillars of the Gateway to Harlemthe Arthur A. Schomburg Plazawere dedicated yesterday.

title: WILLIAM C. MAYER
description: William C. Mayer, a lawyer here for more than half a century, died yesterday in Long Island College Hospital, Brooklyn. He was 82 years old and lived at 81 Columbia Heights, Brooklyn.

title: New Hartford School Superintendent
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 17Edythe Gaines, the New York City educator, will face some familiar problems when she takes over Hartford's public schools on July 1. Among them are a tight education budget, shifting populations concerned about new racial balances and rising taxes and a fastgrowing Puerto Rican community seeking changes in the school system, beginning with the need to teach in Spanish.

title: NEW POLICING PLAN ON FUTURES TRADING
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 17 (UPI) Agriculture Department officials today unveiled a proposal for a new computerized system of reports designed to help strengthen Federal policing of abuses in commodity futures trading.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today

title: Cubans Admit Bombings
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., Dec. 17 (AP)A Cuban exile group in Fuerto Rico that calls itself the AntiCommunist Latin  American Army, said today that its agents carried out recent bombings of a shipping office in Miami.

title: Vladivostok's Gaps
description: One stark fact towers above all the other elements in the confusing debate over the nuclear arms agreement reached by President Ford and Mr. Brezhnev at Vladivostok.

title: Baruch College Will Be Moved To $73Million Site in Brooklyn.
description: The city's Board 0f Higher Education has approved a plan to move Bernard M. Baruch College from Manhattan to a $73million campus to be constructed in Brooklyn.

title: P.U.C. AIDES SCORE JERSEY CITY MOVE
description: NEWARK, Dec. 17A, team of hearing examiners today recommended to the State Board of Public Utilities Commissioners that Jersey City be required to reopen the city's major incinerator unit, which was shut down last month after Mayor Paul T. Jordan charged that the company operating the plant had obtained its contract by fraud.

title: Concert
description: The Chicago Symphony Stomping and Cheering Society, New York Chapter, convened at Carnegie Hall once again last night, which is to say that Sir Georg Solti brought his remarkable orchestra to town for the first of four concerts.

title: retrospective of Carter and Babbitt Given
description: For some years now, Milton Babbitt and Elliott Carter have served as gurus of the academic avantgarde heareabouts, and young composers have Watched them closely to know which way the winds were blowing. So it made particularly good sense for the Group for Contemporary Music to present a retrospective concert of Babbitt and Carter pieces on Monday night at the Manhattan School of Music.

title: Opera: A Stark Boris
description: As everybody interested in music knows, Mussorgsky's masterpiece, Boris Godunov, is seldom presented as it originally was written. Ever since 1908, the reorchestration (and, often,. reharmonization) by RimskyKorsakov has been in use. Only recently has the original orchestral score been made generally available. But the back  to  Mussorgsky movement is taking hold. Only last year the San Francisco Opera staged an original Boris. Indeed, it was the same version that came to the stage of the Metropolitan Opera last night, and it also had Martti Talvela in the title role.

title: Tennis Is Just a Game to Vilas
description: He's a new breeder with flair and artistry, the talk of the tennis world, conqueror of John Newcombe and Ilie Nastase with a bankroll of $250,000, and yet Guillermo Vilas takes it all in stride. The winner of the Grand Prix Masters title, proving he could play well on grass as on clay, is a 22yearold Argentine southpaw who is a refreshing edition of the Cinderella story. A year ago, hardly anybody had heard of him.

title: BOMBS IN LONDON HIT PHONE OFFICES
description: LONDON, Dec. 17  Bombs exploded tonight outside three telephone exchanges in central London, killing a man and injuring at least five persons, including policemen.

title: Coin Dealer Agrees to Pay $240,000 in Consumer Suit
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 17 (UPI) About 130 customers will receive refunds totaling up to $240,000 from a gold and silver coin dealer to settle a city consumer protection suit.

title: 76ers Beat Celtics; Cunningham Gets 33
description: PROVIDENCE., R. I., Dec. 17 (AP)  Billy Cunningham scored a seasonhigh 33 points, 13 in the fourth quarter, to lead the Philadelphia 76ers to a 113109 victory over the Boston Celtics tonight, in a National Basketball Association at the Providence Civic Center.

title: Jockey, 19, Wins Record 516th
description: LAUREL, Md., Dec, 17At 3:21 this afternoon, Chris McCarron, a babyfaced, 19yearold jockey just two years out Of high school, culminated one of the most astonishing ragstoriches feats in racing history.

title: Macmillan Gets Rights to Soviet Music
description: Macmillan, Inc., has obtained exclusive rights to the publication and performance of all Soviet music in the Western Hemisphere, it was announced yesterday.

title: UNICEF to Provide 100 to 200 Schools For North Vietnam
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, Dec.17 (Agence FrancePresse)A mission sent by the United Nations Children's Fund has completed a week's visit here during which it discussed delivery of 20 Swissmade prefabricated schools to North Vietnam.

title: 3 Coast Guard Crewmen Rescued as Boat Capsizes
description: Three Coast Guard crewmen were rescued early yesterday from the cold, choppy waters off Rockaway, Queens, two hours after their launch had capsized, trapping two of them In a cabin inside. They survived thanks to an air pocket while the third man was able to crawl onto the upturned bottom of the vessel.

title: CITY TO EXPAND LANDFILL PARKS
description: An ecological experiment harnessing the efforts of city agencies and community volunteers is converting piles of construction debris deposited as landfill on the shore of Jamaica Bay into a landscaped public park at the foot of Pennsylvania Avenue in the Canarsie section of Brooklyn.

title: One Hurt and Second Held In Fight Over Girl Friend
description: BETHPAGE, L. I., Dec. 18 (AP)A fight by rivals for a girl friend last evening ended with one college student critically wounded with an axe and another under arrest for attempted murder.

title: AllStar Loss Is Eased By Player, Owner Gifts
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 18 (AP)Chicago Tribune Charities announced today that the National Football League Players Association gave $20,000 and N.F.L. club owners $106,000 to help make up for the loss sustained when the 1974 AllStar football game was canceled because of the players' strike.

title: Italy's Gros Wins Giant Slalom
description: MADONNA DI CAMPIGLIO, Italy, Dec. 18 (UPI)The defending champion, Plero Gros of Italy, won his second World Cup giant slalom of the season today by a margin of seventenths of a second over Greg Jones of Tahoe City, Calif., who came out of the pack to ski the fastest run of the day in the twoheat event.

title: Test for Mr. Carey
description: Governorelect Carey is now engaged in putting together his administration, to take office in January. Of the many appointments that should be made without ulterior political consideration, one of the more significant is that of Commissioner of the Department of Environmental Conservation.

title: Theater: Of Mice and Men Returns to Broadway
description: During the nineteenthirties there was a vogue for the unrealistic realistic Broadway drama. These were plays that were slightly larger than life with sentiments drooping nervously over into sentimentality, yet with characters and situations that were recognizable, identifiable and even moving. Eventually the genre was absorbed by Hollywood, which, generally speaking, made rather a better thing of it. Nevertheless, some of these Broadway semiverismo epics were so soundly constructed and interestingly realized that against almost all expectation they have a survival factor. They are the kind of plays you hardly expect to want to see again, but when you do see them, you find the old emotion surging and the old reactions remaining unexpectedly valid.

title: SCHOOLS PICK AIDE FOR MANAGEMENT
description: Dr. Irving Berchuck, superintendent of Community School District 24 in Queens, will become top assistant to Deputy School Chancellor Bernard R. Gifford as part of a continuing effort to strengthen managewent of the school system and curb abuses in the districts.

title: F.D.A. Approves a Challenged Food Dye
description: The Food and Drug Administration plans to approve the permanent use of an artificial food coloring although some of the agency's own scientists say there are questions about whether it may cause cancer and fetal death.

title: Ski Injuries Found Occurring More to the Upper Body
description: The pattern of skiing injuries has drastically changed over the last 12 years, with skiers suffering more sprains and fractures Of their shoulders and arms and less damage to their ankles and legs.

title: HOUSE APPROVES FOREIGN AID BILL
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 18The House of Representatives today passed and sent to the White House a bill authorizing $2.69billion in foreign aid during the fiscal year ending next June 30 The vote was 209 to 189.

title: Yanks List Five Games With Mets
description: The Yankees will play fivegames against the Mets during a 31game 1975 spring training exhibition schedule. A twoday trip by the Yankees to Puerto Rico is included. Both of these games will be played with the Pittsburgh Pirates.

title: Books of The Times
description: I have always hated the phrase compulsively readable  and not just for grammatical reasonsyet this is precisely what comes to mind When I try to sum up my feelings about Elia Kazan's new novel, The Understudy. It expresses my ambivalence about the book and also conveys the fact that I read it as if I had no choice. Though I hardly cared about any of the characters, though the main theme of the book did not interest me, I cannot say that I was bored by The Understudy.

title: William D. Lamborn Dies at 51; Led Sugar Brokerage Concern
description: William D. Lamborn, President of Lamborn & Co., Inc., international sugar brokers here, died Sunday after a fall in his home in Rye, N. Y. He was 51 years old and lived at 70 Overlook Place

title: Rangers Top Stars, 70; Sanderson Gets 3 Goals.
description: The vagaries of the National Hockey League schedule gave the New York Rangers a pushover Match last night and they made the best of it, trashing the helpless Minnesota North Stars, 70.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Dec. 18 (AP)Three Australians, John Newcombe, Ken Rosewafl and Tony Roche, led the advance today into the men's quarterfinals at the New South Wales tennis tournament. Newcombe beat a fellow Aussie, Colin Dibley, 64, 63; Rosewall outlasted Raz Reid of Greenville, S.C., 76, 46, 62, and Roche eliminated Ulli Martin of West Germany, 62, 75. Also advancing was Alex Metreveli of the Soviet Union, who defeated Mike Machette of Hollywood, Calif., 64, 16, 63.

title: Deficit in Payments Deepens in Quarter
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 18The deficit in the basic United States balance of payments deepened to $3.6billion in the third quarter from $2.5billion in the second, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Notes on People
description: Lee Scherer, a retired Navy captain who joined the National Aeronautics and Space Administration on temporary assignment 12 years ago, will be the new director of the Kennedy Space Center at Cape Canaveral, Fla. Ten years ago, Captain Scherer retired from the Navy after 25 years' service and has since been program manager for the lunar orbiter project, director of lunar exploration for the Apollo program and, most recently, director of the Flight Research Center at Edwards Air Force Base in California.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: ROBERT A. WRIGHT, REPORTER, IS DEAD
description: Robert A. Wright, economic correspondent for The New York Times based in Los Angeles, died, apparently of a heart attack, last night in Van Nuys, Calif. He was 44 years old.

title: Players Pleased by Move; Team Needs New Image
description: The Giants' decision to play their 1975 home games in Shea Stadium may be the biggest victory of the 1974 season for their players.

title: Inquiry Finds Air Force Buses Carry Pupils to Private Schools
description: A Justice Department official in Montgomery, Ala., has confirmed that Air Force buses are being used to transport the children of military personnel at Maxwell Air Force Base to some allwhite or nominally integrated private schools in the area.

title: Water Tunnel Diggers Sue City To Stop Declaration of Default
description: A group of contractors who had been working on the Third Water Tunnel project took their dispute with the city to court yesterday as the Board of Water Supply prepared for hearing today on whether to declare them in default of its contract to build the 13.7mile conduit.

title: Cape Verde Isles to Get Independence in July
description: LISBON, Dec. 18 (Reuters)  Portugal will grant independence to the Cape Verde Islands next July 5, Antnio de Almeida Santos, the minister in charge of African affairs, announced today.

title: Future of the U.N.: West's Realism Vs. New Majority
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 18  When the General Assembly suspended its annual session tonight, instead of formally closing it, delegates skipped the traditional minute of silent prayer or meditation, but this year they and the people at home will need considerably more time for reflection on what the or ?? nization means to them, and where it is going.

title: Montreal Airport is Shut
description: MONTREAL, Dec. 18 (UPI)Montreal International Airport was shut down today by striking snowremoval crews, disrupting the travel plans of tens of thousands of persons. An airport spokesman said about 275 maintenance workers had walked off the job at 12:01 A.M. for a 24hour study session, They want higher pay.

title: When the Singles Meet the Singles They Talk About Meeting Singles
description: Brenda Workman has now met 310 men as the result of an ad she placed about herself in a dating magazine called The Black Book. The last time we heard from her, the number was 300. Andy Rudisin has finally found a woman who will pay her share of a night on the town. Shes really a liberated woman) and Hank Cha has gotten married.

title: Rockefeller Vote Today
description: House debate today on the nomination of Nelson Rockefeller as VicePresident will be limited to six hours. If confirmed, he will be sworn in later in the day. Page 38.

title: The Gift Tie That Glitters And Is Gold
description: Of course, there will be a new tie in every man's Christmas stocking. And, without doubt, he already has a tie. But is he likely to own, an 18karat gold one with sapphires or diamonds to wear with a dinner Jacket or whenever he feels dashing?

title: Consumer Notes
description: A shopper in a branch of a leading Supermarket chain yesterday faced the problem of deciding among extralarge eggs at $1.05 a dozen, large at 97 cents and medium at 89 cents. All were Grade A.

title: Text of Letters and Excerpts From Testimony on Moscow's Emigration Policy
description: Following are the texts of an exchange of letters between Secretary of State Kissinger and Senator Henry M. Jackson on Soviet trade benefits and emigration policy made public Oct. 18; a letter on the subject presented to Mr. Kissinger by Foreign Minister Andrei A. Gromyho in Moscow on Oct. 26, and excerpts from testimony on the issue by Mr. Kissinger before the Senate Finance Committee on Dec. 5:

title: VOLKSWAGEN SALES SHOW DROP OF 13.5%
description: WOLFSBURG, West Germany, Dec. 18 (Reuters)Volkswagenwerk, A. G., said today group sales fell 13.5 per cent to 1,867,000 vehicles in the first 11 months of 1974 while parent company sales dropped 132 per cent to 1,235,000.

title: SADAT STILL PINS HOPE ON KISSINGER
description: CAIRO, Dec. 18President Anwar elSadat is continuing to voice a sense of urgency about United States peace efforts in the Middle East and warning that the time is running out for the American stepbystep approach.

title: CHINA'S ATTITUDE ON U.S. ASSAYED
description: HONG KONG, Dec. 18The reappearance yesterday of China's aging leader, Mao Tsetung, to meet an African leader indicated that it wasn't illness but considerations of international politics that kept him from meeting Secretary of State Kissinger last month.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: SHAMROCK SPECIAL Most of us probably will never get to savor the worldrenowned flavor and impact of Dublin's Abbey Theater on home ground, which is why Home Is the Hero is so welcome as a somber but brightgreen holiday package. With little fanfare and acclaim an enterprising Off Off Broadway unit, the Irish Rebel Theater, is doing a firstrate job of this drama by William Macken, which 20 years ago misfired on Broadway, via the Abbey people (with the late playwright also starred).

title: Handicapped Get a Hand
description: VIENNA (AP)  People in wheelchairs will soon be able to attend performances at Vienna's famous traditional Theater an der Wien, which is now being rebuilt especially to accommodate them. Until, recently, strict fire regulations excluded those confined to wheelchairs.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: British Building Unit Gets Arab Investment
description: LONDON, Dec. 18 (Reuters) Arab investors have bought a 20.7 per cent share in one of Britain's biggest construction concerns in a deal worth more than $9.2million, it was announced today.

title: Old Friends of Neediest Cases Turn Up in Increasing Numbers
description: Old friends of the New York Times Neediest Cases Fund are turning up in increasing numbers. Yesterday gifts from 215 donors totaling $11,007 were recorded. The donations, which will help the destitute, the ill and the lonely, brought the overal ltotal of the 63d annual appeal to $511,773.32.

title: Rockefeller Faces Final Vote Today
description: WASHINGTON, Dec, 18The House Rules Committee cleared the way today for final debate on, and probable confirmation of Nelson A. Rockefeller's nomination as Vice President. It voted to limit floor debate tomorrow on the nomination to six hours.

title: Constable Will Pay $3Million to Buy Kay's Tweed Units
description: The Arnold Constable Corporation and the Kay Corporation yesterday announced that they had signed a letter of intent providing for a $3.3million purchase by Constable of 75 Tweed Ladies' fashion boutiques from Kay.

title: Business Briefs
description: TOKYO, Dec. 18 (UPI)Oilrich Arab countries led by Saudi Arabia have bought more than $134million in Japanese bonds over the last year, a Japanese financial source disclosed today.

title: Hunters in Great Swamp Bag 126 Deer in 6 Days
description: One hundred and twentysix deer were killed during the sixday hunt in the Great Swamp National Wildlife Refuge that ended yesterday at 5 P.M., according to a refuge spokesman.

title: City Took 3 Hours to Cut Off Water at Break
description: They keep paving over everything  nobody knows nothing.

title: Rickenbacker Is Honored.
description: KITTY HAWK, N. C., Dec. 18 (UPI)Capt. Edward V. Rickenbacker, World War I flying ace, has been admitted into the aviation shrine of the First Flight Society, Captain Rickenbacker, who died in July, 1973, was enshrined here in ceremonies at the Wright Brothers Memorial yesterdaythe 71st anniversary of Orville and Wilbur Wright's first flight in a mechanically powered plane.

title: 4 Months After Nixon, His Legacy Haunts New President
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 18On the night of Nov. 2, when President Ford was speaking in an auditorium in Wichita, Kan., a ragtag band of youths marched through the cold rain chanting: NIXON . . What does it spell? Ford!

title: Because It's There
description: The Search for the Northwest Passagea Water route from Europe to Cathay across the frozen wastes of North Americawas one of the great adventure stories of all time, the vain quest of Sir Francis Drake and Henry Hudson, finally discovered at the turn of this century by Arctic explorer Roald Amundsen.

title: Experience in Private Ownership Of Gold Finds Japanese Indifferent
description: TOKYO, Dec. 18With ownership of gold becoming legal in the United States Dec. 31, the experience of Japan in taking a similar step 20 months ago might be reccalled: A gold fever developed, but it proved shortlived.

title: F.B.I. AGENT GETS WASHINGTON POST
description: NEWARK, Dec, 18 (UPI)J. Wallace LaPrade, the special Federal Bureau of Investigation agent who headed the investigation of the John Calzadilla kidnapping case, was promoted to a top Washington post today as one of 10 assistant F.B.I. directors.

title: Soviet Bill: Step by Step
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 18Following is a chronology of developments on the questions of trade benefits to the Soviet Union and Soviet emigration:

title: Cost of Market Basket Unchanged for Week
description: The City Department of Consumer Affairs reported yesterday that the 38item market basket, by which it measures food costs for a family of four in the city, was unchanged at $64.55. A year earlier, the market basket cost $54.91.

title: Conferees Curb Eximbank Credits for Soviet Gas
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 18 (AP) A bill adopted today by a SenateHouse conference sharply limits United States Government credit for energy development in the Soviet Union.

title: Jersey Legislature Will Convene Today On School Financing
description: TRENTON, Dec. 18Both houses of the Legislature will reconvene here tomorrow in what Democratic leaders have described, at a final attempt to reach agreement on an income tax plan for a new system of financing public schools in New Jersey.

title: POLICE KILL L.I. MAN WHO FIRED IN RAGE
description: A 43yearold pressman, enraged, at his dismissal yesterday from a Valley Stream stationery concern, fired several shots, one of them wounding a fellow employe, and was killed by police gunfire, the Nassau police said.

title: British Football
description: ENGLISH LEAGUE CUP

title: RAYMOND R. SCHWARTZ
description: Raymond R. Schwartz, vice president for finance and planning of CBS/Records Group, a division of CBS Inc., died Monday at his home in Upper Saddle River, N. J. He was 51 years old.

title: Kremlin Reports a Failure In 5Year Consumer Plan
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 18  The Soviet leadership conceded today that it had failed in its attempt during the current fiveyear plan to reorient the Soviet economy, in favor of the longneglected consumer.

title: Courts Again Making Employes Take Time Off During Holidays
description: In a departure from tradition, employes of state and city courts in all boroughs of the city and in the neighboring counties will be required this year to take vacations during the quiet holiday season and to charge that time against their vacations.

title: Bill Advances in Congress Despite Russian Disavowal
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 18A HouseSenate conference committee agreed tonight on the final version of the trade, reform bill despite a lastminute disavowal by Moscow of any deal linking trade concessions to easier emigration from the Soviet Union.

title: Advertising
description: About a week ago, East/ West Network announced that it would be taking over the publication of the Holtday Inns magazine.

title: Two Killed in New Zealand
description: AUCKLAND, New Zealand Dec. 18 (UPI)A cable car plummeted 300 feet out of control today and killed two American women tourists in the resort town of Queenstown on South Island.

title: South Africa Weighing Pullout From U.N. on Issue of Namibia
description: CAPE TOWN, Dec. 18 (AP)South Africa is considering withdrawal from the United Nations as a result of the latest United Nations Security Council call that the government relinquish control of SouthWest Africa, or Namibia, Foreign Minister Hilgard Muller said tonight.

title: Sabres Set Back Islanders
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 18  It wasn't a brilliant deduction on the part of Don Luce, who had scored twice for the Buffalo Sabres in their 32 victory over the New York Islanders tonight.

title: Lefkowitz Peking Special Grand Jury On Nursing Homes
description: Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz announced yesterday that he would seek the impaneling of a special grand jury to investigate alleged crimes in the nursinghome industry.

title: Task Force on Child Abuse Enlarged by Mayor
description: Mayor Beame yesterday increased from 22 to 27 the membership on his task force on child abuse and neglect and directed the group to evaluate thoroughly child  protective. and rehabilitative services offered by the city and private agencies.

title: News Summary and Index
description: The Soviet Union denied yesterday having given any specific assurances of easier emigration in return for American trade benefits and government credits. An official Tess statement said leading circles rejected as unacceptable any attempts to attach conditions to United States tariff reductions or otherwise intefere in internal Soviet affairs. It published a letter, dated Oct. 26, from Foreign Minister Andrei A. Gromyko to Secretary of State Kissinger rejecting any interpretation that emigration from the Soviet Union would increase. It has in lad shown a tendency to decline, Mr. Gromyko said. [Page 1, Columns 68.]

title: People and Business
description: A tax reduction to halt the decline in the United States economy was suggested yesterday by Irving S. Shapiro, chairman of the board of E. I. du Pont de Nemours & Co., Inc. In a yearend statement, Mr. Shapiro conceded that 1975 would be difficult for many people and many lines of business but added that a projected 1 per cent decline next year in gross national product is not a depression by any stretch of the imagination.

title: Rockefeller Vote Today
description: House debate today on the nomination of Nelson Rockefeller as VicePresident will be limited to six hours. If confirmed, he will be sworn in later in the day. Page 38.

title: FUGITIVE APPEARS IN DAIRYLEA CASE
description: A former top executive of the Dairylea milk cooperative who has been listed as fugitive from justice for the last three weeks appeared in an Albany courtroom yesterday and pleaded not guilty to a charge that he was a conspirator in the Dairylea milkadulteration case.

title: JOBLESS CLAIMS RISE BY 693,000 IN A WEEK
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 18 (AP) Nearly 700,000 more Americans applied for unemployment insurance benefits during the first week of December, the Labor Department reported today.

title: City BeltTightening Squeezing 3 Schools Out of Football Fields
description: The city's fiscal crisis may shelve plans to construct at least three new athletic facilities for public high schools and stunt the growth of the Public Schools Athletic League football program. Beneath that is the threat of mass demonstrations and a lawsuit by at legst one of the schools involved.

title: Youth Stabs 3 in Family Then Dies in Auto Crash
description: SOUTH BOUND BROOK, Dec. 18  The police in three towns in this Somerset County area joined today with the county Prosecutors office in trying to unravel the mystery of a 20yearold youth who stabbed his father, mother and sister Tuesday morning and later died in an automobile accident.

title: Carey Appoints Gribetz as His Counsel
description: Governorelect Hugh L. Carey announced yesterday the appointment of Deputy Mayor Judah Gribetz as counsel to the Governor.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 47

title: Indictment of Mayor's Wife Shocks Raleigh
Criminal: Contempt Barred for Boston School Officials
description: BOSTON, Dec. 13Federal Judge W. Arthur Garrity Jr. declined today to cite for criminal contempt the three Boston School Committee members who had defied his order by refusing to approve a citywide busing plan to achieve school desegregation for next fall.

title: Detail on Breeds Supplied in New Books
description: Dog breed books are written for a special publicthe actual or prospective owners of a particular breed. They cover more or less extensive information, dealing with the history, standard, characteristics, diseases, advice on training, grooming and showing. The volumes are usually well illustrated and frequently carry the pedigrees behind great show dogs of the past and present. They fill a need for both the experienced fahcier and the rank tyro.

title: WALTER R. MOOK
description: Walter R. Moolc, who retired in 1941 as president of Standard Oil Transport, now the Exxon International Company, died Tuesday at his home, 36 Highland Avenue, Metuchen, N. J. He was 92 years old.

title: Stage: GoodNatured Horse Opera
description: There is a childlike innocence to the work of Leonard Melfi, even his contribution to Oh! Calcutta!, a sketch about Jack and Jill. His new show, Horse Opera (now at La Mama), written in collaboration with the composer John Braden, is a happy, goodnatured musical celebrating life and love.

title: VENTURA DISPLAYS SAXOPHONE DRIVE
