description: BONN, Dec. 19West Germany took another major step today to stimulate its flagging domestic economy by lowering the central bank's discount rate from 6.5 per cent to 6 per cent, effective tomorrow.

title: Nominee Takes His Oath On the Old Family Bible
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19In a simple but wellorganized ceremony in the Senate chainber, Nelson A. Rockefeller held a black family Bible in his left hand tonight and took the oath of office as Vice President.

title: Vineland Judge Withdraws
description: TRENTON, Dec. 19 (UPI) Thomas K. J. Tuso of Vineland, a municipal court judge, withdrew today from consideration for a post on the Delaware River Port Authority. Mr. Tuso said in a letter to Governor Byrne that he was aware of criticism that his appointment could create a conflict of interest by involving a judge in politics.

title: Apartment Project 106Million in Debt
description: DALLAS, Dec. 19Details of the collapse of a $100million conglomerate to build houses in four states unfolded in Federal Bankruptcy Court here today.

title: Brown Five Triumphs
description: ATHENS, Ga., Dec. 19 (UPI) Jim Busam gave Brown 28 points tonight as the Bruins held off a late surge by Georgia to give the Bulldogs their first defeat of the basketball season, 7975.

title: Nevada Oddsmaker Gets Pardon From President
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19 (AP)  President Ford has granted a full and unconditional pardon to a Las Vegas, Nev. oddsmaker known as Jimmy the Greek Snyder for a conviction 11 years ago on. gambling violations.

title: Notes on People
description: After six months of a 2to10year sentence, Reies Lopez Tijerina left the New Mexico State Prison in Albuquerque on parole and indicated that he planned to give more attention to the very unequal justice in prisons than to his land claims for his fellow Chicanos. The 48yearold founder of the Alianza movement, which sought title to public lands that were once Spanish land grants, was imprisoned after a raid on the Rio Arriba County courthouse. He said he would campaign for brotherhood awareness but first would use his $60 in release money to buy Christmas presents for his wife, Patsy, and their eight children.

title: First Thai Vote Drive in 6 Years, An Exciting but Nervous Time
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Dec. 14  The sound truck was in place, the campaign banners hung, the loudspeakers connected. Shortly before dusk, the five candidates arrived and, as they limbed the truck, the park before them filled with neighborhood residents who came towing their children, then sat crosslegged listening attentively.

title: Ireland's Articulate New President
description: DUBLIN, Dec. 19Cearbhal O Dalaigh, who was sworn in today as the fifth President of the Irish Republic, began his term of office with an appeal for peace in Northern Ireland. As we approach the feast of the Prince of Peace, he said in his inaugural address, can we, could we, may we find a truce in Ireland as we approach that Day of Days, and if this be granted, is it too bold to hope thereafter for a temporary extension, to be prolonged indefinitely and to eventuate at last, one day, in a durable, just peace among all who lives in our beloved seagirt land?

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary ant index, Page 39

title: REEL PRICE RISE CHALLENGED ANEW
description: The White House confrontation with the steel industry widened yesterday as price increases by the CF&I Steel Corporation were challenged by the Federal pricemonitoring panel.

title: Albany Bustling as It Prepares To Say Hello to the Carey Clan
description: ALBANY, Dec. 19The Capitol Building smells of fresh paint, With a certain aimlessness, the outgoing Republicans chat in the marble corridors. They clean out desks. With a certain polite diffidence, the incoming Democrats arrange to move in.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: Stottlemyre: I'm Going to Pitch

title: Fed Injects Banking Funds
description: The Federal Reserve acted yesterday to inject both permanent and temporary reserves into the banking system. This move, basically a seasonal one, came on the heels of a strong rally lasting more than two weeks in the Government securities market. In other developments, the tone of the beleaguered municipal bond market continued to improve and prices in the industrial bond market turned slightly lower on modest volume. The corporate market went out to lunch and never came back,

title: Dr. Judith Gurland Wed to Professor
description: Dr. Judith E. Gurland of New York, an ophthalmologist, was married last evening to Dr. J. Warren Blaker of Poughkeepsie, N. Y., where he is professor of physics at Vassar College. Rabbi Shlomo. Twersky performed the ceremony at the Conservative Synagogue of Riverdale in the Bronx.

title: George Harrison Returns to the Garden
description: On July 31, 1971, George Harrison presented two charity shows to help Bangladesh refugees. Other players included Ravi Shanker, Bob Dylan, Ringo Starr, Leon Russell, Billy Preston and Eric Clapton. Both concerts were genuine events in the history of rock n roll.

title: DOLLAR UP ABROAD AS GOLD PRICE DIPS
description: BRUSSELS, Dec. 19 (UPI) The dollar rallied slightly today from the alltime lows on European markets earlier in the week. Dealers said the recovery was due largely to several central banks supporting the currency.

title: Funds Sent to Neediest As Remembrance Gifts
description: Many donors to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund give in remembrance of someone who has died, using the fund as a way to renew their love for the departed.

title: E. DeH. Steel Jr. Weds Martha Chapple
description: The marriage of Martha Field Chapple, a former staff associate with the Population Council here, to Edwin DeHaven Steel Jr., Senior Judge of the United States District Court of Delaware, took place in Westport, Conn., yesterday afternoon. The Rev. Edwin Lane of Westport's Unitarian Church performed the ceremony at the church parsonage.

title: Bridge: Indonesian Continues Hold On Far East Championship
About New York
description: Teddy Topper, a salesman from Kew Gardens, Queens, bought a Chevy Nova last September for his daughter, Mrs. Jane Wolin. Mrs. Wolin was driving it along the Belt Parkway the other day when it sputtered, died, and refused to move. By the greatest of good fortune then, twa Chevrolet mechanics came along in another car, Stopped, and fixed the Nova. It was nothing, they said, only a small adjustment in the carburetor.

title: Congress Votes $1Billion For Jobs for Unemployed
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19The House and Senate gave final approval tonight to legislation appropriating $1billion for jobs for the unemployed next year.

title: TRADE BILL MOVES TOWARD APPROVAL
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19Congress moved toward possible final passage tonight of the sweeping trade reform bill, hammered into final shape by, Senate and House conferees.

title: Outlook for Rockefeller
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19Even before Nelson A. Rockefeller was sworn into office, the Washington sharpshooters were reminding him that the principal assignment of most Vice Presidents has been to stay reasonably healthy. In his whimsy for today, for example, Art Buchwald wrote of the Vice President who had to pretend he was the March of Dimes poster child's father just to get into the President's office.

title: Advertising
description: When she was growing up, Shirley Young always knew that she wanted a career and because her family had been in the diplomatic service she thought that would be it.

title: Congress Votes $1Billion For Jobs for Unemployed
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19The House and Senate gave final approval tonight to legislation appropriating $1billion for jobs for the unemployed next year.

title: 230 Nurses Resign
description: QUINCY, Mass., Dec. 19 (AP) Resignations have been submitted by 230 nurses at Quincy Hospital in a contract dispute. The resignations, effective, Jan. 18, were submitted yesterday. The old contract expired last Jan. 1.

title: R.F.C. HULL, 61, DIES; JUNG'S TRANSLATOR
description: R. F. C. Hull, translator of the collected works of C. G. Jung, the founder of analytical psychology, died Monday at a hospital in Ascot, England. He was 61 years old and lived in Ascot.

title: Analyst Picks Redskins, Vikings, Dolphins, Steelers
description: It wrenches his very soul but Bud Goode, the sports computer analyst from Los Angeles, believes the Washington Redskins are going to beat his beloved Rams on Sunday in the National Football League's playoffs. After honing his numbers, Goode yesterday brought forth his selections for the four weekend games, selections different from yours and mine or even from the Las Vegas line. They are different because Goode and the CalComp computer have far more input106 different statistical items each with its own weight of importance. Furthermore, Goode has a good track record. In the last three seasons he has had the winner in 18 of the 21 N.F.L. playoff games.

title: Youth Convicted of Slaying A Friend Goes on Probation
description: MORRISTOWN, Dec. 19 (AP)  Eighteen  year  old Michael Walsh, convicted of manslaughter in the stabbing death of an acquaintance he believed had given drugs to his girlfriend, has been placed on probation.

title: Mistakes Laid to Crew in Samoa Crash
description: The National Transportation Safety Board reported yesterday that a series of mistakes by crew members apparently caused the crash of a Pan American World Airways jet as they were attempting a rainynight landing in Pago Pago, American Samoa, last January.

title: Chase Forms Management Committee
description: In a move to strengthen its corporatewide performance, The Chase Manhattan Corporation and its principal subsidiary, the Chase Manhattan Bank, announced yesterday the formation of a new sevenman management committee.

title: American Team Wins College Golf
description: CORONA, Calif., Dec. 19 (AP)Chris Voges and Scott Simpson each shot fourunderpar 140's today to lead a United States collegiate team to a 114stroke victory in the second United StatesJapan student goodwill golf matches.

title: PAPER PRODUCTION OFF FROM '73 LEVEL
description: Production of paper and paperboard in the United States cased slightly in 1974 below the record of 62 million tons reached in 1973, the American Paper institute said yesterday

title: Red Smith
description: Selfish, callous and ungrateful were the adjectives the Mayor of New York applied to Wellington Mara in 1971 when the owner of the football Giants decided move his team from Yankee Stadium to a garbage dump on the Hackensack Meadows of New Jersey. That mayor was John V. Lindsay, and his indignation over the defection that particular team seemed to disqualify him as a football authority. However, aides made haste to explain that what really burned John up was that Hackensack wasn't far enough. Yesterday the present tenant Gracie Mansion, Abe Beame, revealed himself as more tolerant than his predecessor, if not more knowledgeable about football. Warmly, he welcomed Tim Mara (he meant Wellington) back to Fun City for the season of 1974 (he meant 1975).

title: President Offers a Compromise On Bill to Regulate Strip Mining
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19The White House said today that President Ford would agree sign the bitterly disputed Federal strip mine control bill Congress would pass a companion bill before adjournment correcting its deficiencies. Adjournment was scheduled for tomorrow.

title: FORD OUTPUT CUT BY ANOTHER 25%
description: DETROIT, Dec. 19The Ford Motor Company, with 1975model sales off by onethird last month and unsold cars mounting in a threemonth backlog, announced today it was cutting firstquarter production another 25 per cent. The move will idle more than 50,000 additional workers.

title: Amex Sets Trading In Options Jan. 13
description: The longawaited start of trading in stock options on the American Stock Exchange was officially set here, yesterday for Jan, 13.

title: Books of The Times
description: BIRDS OF NEW YORK STATE. By John Bull. 655 pages. Doubleday/Natural History Press. $29.95.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 39

title: Moody's Lowers Ratings Of Some Chrysler Bonds
description: Moody's Investors Service lowered yesterday its ratings on the publicly traded senior debt issues of the Chrysler Corporation to Bea, or medium grade, from A, of upper medium grade.

title: CHICAGO JOB PLAN IS CALLED DOOMED
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 19 Chicago city officials said today that a Federal District Court order cutting off general revenuesharing funds to the city because of discriminatory use of the monies would doom a courtapproved plan to hire 400 blacks, Latins and women for the city's police force.

title: The Boston Issue
description: Federal District Judge W. Arthur Garrity is known as a patient but persistent man, characteristics that have earned him criticism over the course of the Boston school desegregation case. Just this week, Judge Garrity declined to hold in criminal contempt the majority of the Boston School Committee, which refused to submit the school system's own desegregation plan to the court. But he told them to show up in court next week prepared to explain why they should not be held in civil contempt and to answer some searching questions about their willingness and ability to carry out court orders.

title: Catholic Diocese of Brooklyn Has Budget Deficit
description: In a consolidated financial report the Roman Catholic DioI cese of Brooklyn disclosed yesterday that spending had exceeded revenues on the diocesan as well as the parish level in 1972.

title: Rocky's Rocky Road
description: WASHINGTONThe adjustment period in Washington for Vice President Nelson Rockefeller is likely to be prolonged and difficult. After all, even Franklin Roosevelt discovered that moving from Albany to Washington was a stormy passage.

title: City Is Leaning to Keeping Steeplechase a Fun Place
description: The city is on the verge of abandoning its plans for a park on the site of the old Steeplechase amusement area in Coney Island. Five years ago, the city paid $4million for the 15acre site.

title: ExNixon Aide Gets 4Month Jail Term
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19 (AP) Edward L. Morgan, a lawyer who illegally backdated the deed timing over Richard M. Nixon's prePresidential papers to the Government, was sentenced today to four months in prison and 20 months' probation.

title: Mrs. Abzug Sees U.S. Funds Available for West Side Road
description: Repfesentative Bella S. Abzug declared yesterday that a bill approved by Congress would make it practical to reconstruct the West Side Highway rather than convert it into an interstate highway, but some city officials expressed skepticism.

title: DISTANT ARABS GET WARNING BY ISRAEL
description: TEL AVIV, Dec. 19 (Reuters) Israel has warned distant Arab countries against sending armed forces to take part in any Arab attacks.

title: No TV in the House and They Want It That Way
description: Patricia Malarcher was doing her very best not to giggle the other day when Big Research Outfit telephoned to inquire about the family's television viewing habits.

title: Brazil Lists Meningitis Toll
description: SAO PAULO, Brazil, Dec. 19 (UPI)Meningitis has killed more than 2,400 people in Sao Paulo state this year, and an average of nine lives a day have been lost in the first week of this month, according to statistics released yesterday. The state was the worst hit in an epidemic that first struck Brazil nearly a year ago.

title: LOTTERY NUMBERS
Man, 98, Strangled In Brooklyn Robbery
description: A 98yearold former yeshiva principal was choked to death with his yarmulke early yesterday morning by thieves who climbed into his groundfloor apartment in the Crown Heights section of Brooklyn as he slept, the police said.

title: Publisher Suspends Luciano Paperback
description: New American Library is suspending its plans to publish a paperback edition of The Last Testament of Lucky Luciano, for which it was going to pay $800,000, according to a company spokesman.

title: BILL TO REVIVE BAN ON CHROME PUT OFF
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19 (Reuters)  A controversial measure to revive the boycott on imports of Rhodesian chrome died today when leaders of the House of Representatives postponed a showdown vote until next year.

title: Allan C. Eustis Jr., Headed Securities Dealers Group
description: Allan C. Eustis Jr., who retired last June as a partner in Spencer Trask & Co., Inc., and had been a chairman of the National Association of Securities Dealers, died Wednesday in the Medical Center Hospital in Tucson, Ariz. He was 70 years old and lived in Wilton, Conn., and had been spending the winter in Tucson.

title: Uruguayan Dies in Paris
description: PARIS, Dec. 19A Uruguayan military attach who formerly was an intelligence officer was shot and killed in the basement garage of his apartment building today. A group calling itself the Raul Sendic International Brigade, after a Tupamaro urban guerrilla, claimed responsibility for the killing.

title: Appeals Court Upholds Finding That Boston Segregates Schools
description: BOSTON, Dec. 19In a strongly worded decision, the United States Court of Appeals for the First Circuit upheld today Federal District Judge W. Arthur Garrity's finding that the Boston School Committee had deliverately operated a segregated school system.

title: 6 SUGAR REFINERS INDICTED BY JURY
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Dec. 19Six major sugar refining companies were indicted today by a Federal Grand Jury on charges of illegal price fixing after an 18month investigation.

title: Judge Denies Resisters' Request To Alter the Clemency Program
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19 Federal District Judge Aubrey E. Robinson Jr. turned down today a request by war resisters to halt a major portion of President Ford's clemency program.

title: City's Fire Alarm Boxes Are Called Undependable
description: The city's firealarm boxes, connected to a deteriorating network of cables laid more than half a century ago, are becoming dangerously unreliable, according to Fire Department dispatchers, maintenance men and fire fighters.

title: The New Rhodesia
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Dec. 18Many of Rhodesia's 270,000 whites are reluctant to share their long monopoly on power with more than five million blacks, who call this county Zimbabwe. And black leaders, unscarred and uncowed by years of imprisonment, are reluctant to settle for less than firstclass citizenship.

title: Savings Agencies Increase Deposits for Second Month
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19 (AP) Savings and loan associations recorded their second consecutive month of increased savings deposits in November, reflecting an easing of tight credit conditions, the Federal Home Loan Bank reported today.

title: Montreal Airport Reopened
description: MONTREAL, Dec. 19 (UPI)Montreal airport reopened today despite a strike by airport maintenance men. A spokesman said the two main runways were clear of snow and ice and opened at 7 A.M., 31 hours after the maintenance men walked off the job.

title: Wood, Field & Stream: Limiting Seiners
description: At the recent annual meeting of the Striped Bass Fund, Inc., in New York City, the National Park Services recornmendatich to set aside a section of Cape Hatteras National Seashore for sport fishing only was announced.

title: People and Business
description: William E. Simon, the Secretary of the Treasury, warned yesterday that trading in gold, which will become legal on Dec. 31, could be treacherous for unwary investors.

title: Nominee Takes His Oath On the Old Family Bible
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19In a simple, but wellorganized ceremony in the Senate chamber, Nelson A. Rockefeller held a black family Bible in his left hand tonight and took the oath of office as Vice President.

title: Young Killer of Mrs. Park Is Hanged in Seoul Prison
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Friday, Dec. 20Moon Se Kwang was hanged today in a Seoul prison for killing the wife of President Park Chung Hee during an attempt to assassinate her husband.

title: CITY AND UNIONS SEEK RETIREMENT ON ELECTIVE BASIS
description: The city and a group of leaders representing the municipal unions agreed yesterday to seek voluntary retirements of city employes aged 63 to 70 to save the jobs of 860 younger employes. The latter are scheduled to be dismissed in the budgetcutting layoffs recently announced by Mayor Beame.

title: A Record Total of 2,616 Applicants Pass Written Exam for Admission to the Bar
Goodrich Is Cutting Output; 1,800 Workers to Be Idled
description: AKRON, Ohio, Dec. 19 (UPI) The B. F. Goodrich Tire Company announced today it was cutting back production of nonradial tires at five of six plants. About 1,800 workers will be laid off temporarily because of the cutback.

title: BRITISH LABORITES FACE PARTY SPLIT
description: LONDON, Dec. 19The right wing of the governing Labor party, long a silent majority, has decided to open a campaign against the troublesome left, generating new problems for Prime Minister Harold Wilson.

title: Law Experts Critical Of 25th Amendment
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19The 25th Amendment to the Constitution, which today elevated Nelson A. Rockefeller to the VicePresidency, was hailed by its Congressional authors and generally accepted in the academic world until the time came to put it to use.

title: 2 Sugar Corporations Declare Extra Payouts
description: The Sucrest Corporation, a large producer of refined sugar, and the United States Sugar Corporation, a major refiner of, raw cane sugar, declared yesterday extra dividends on the common stock in addition to voting their regular quarterly dividends.

title: Study Finds Fewer Coronaries in ExSmokers
description: Men under 65 who give up smoking cigarettes suffer fewer heart attacks and live longer than men who continue to smoke, according to results of a longterm study of residents of Framingham, Mass.

title: Yanks Visit Hunter; Mets Keep Distance
description: While Gabe Paul was back in New York playing Santa Claus at a Yankee Christmas party, the team's scouting director, Clyde Kluttz, was in Ahoskie, N.C., yesterday telling Jim (Catfish) Hunter how wonderful the big city was for righthanded pitchers.

title: Albany Bustling as It Prepares To Say Hello to the Carey Clan
description: ALBANY, Dec. 19The Capitol Building smells of fresh paint. With a certain aimlessness, the outgoing Republicans chat in the marble corridors. They clean out desks. With a certain polite diffidence, the incoming Democrats arrange to move in.

title: Funds Sent to Neediest As. Remembrance Gifts
description: Many donors to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund give in remembrance of someone who has died, using the fund as a way to renew their love for the departed.

title: The Chief of Police Of Paterson Heard
description: NEWARK, Dec. 19 (UPI)Paterson's police chief, James Hannan, testified for an hour today before a Federal grand jury that is reportedly investigating the police vice squad, Mr. Hannan, 54 years old, later denied any wrongdoing.

title: KENYA SAID TO CURB TANZANIA CROSSINGS
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Dec. 19 (Reuters)Kenya has closed all but one of four major road border crossingpoints with Tanzania and has suspended all rail and steamer traffic between the two countries, a Government official said today.

title: Finley Hope Hangs By a Legal Thread
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Dec. 19 Charlie Finley's lastditch effort to keep Jim (Catfish) Hunter on the Oakland A's is based on a single legal point, which will be pressed in a hearing set for Jan. 3 before an Alameda County judge.

title: PROSECUTOR GIBES AT 5 AT COVERUP
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 19The chief prosecutor at the Watergate coverup trial began his final argument to the today after 46 days of testimony and accused, mocked and scorned the five defendants.

title: COUNT MERCATI, 73, OF ATHENS BREWERY
description: Count Leonardo Mercati of Georgica Lane, East Hampton, L.I., and Athens, died of a heart attack yesterday in England while shooting grouse, He was 73 years old.

title: Medical Journalism
description: To the Editor:

title: Suffolk Legislature Halts Participation In Erosion Program
description: RIVERHEAD, L.I., Dec. 20The Suffolk County Legislature today refused to continue the county's participation in a jettybuilding program designed, its backers maintain, to stop erosion along beaches in the Westhampton area.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: HAVANA, Dec, 20 (Reuters)Cuba and the Vatican have officially normalized relations. Msgr. Cesare Zacchi, who for the last 12 years has acted as the Vatican's charge d'affaires in Cuba, yesterday presented his credentials as Papal Nuncio to Foreign Minister Ral Roa.

title: PRICES OF GRAINS IN MIXED MOVES
description: Grains and soybeans turned in a mixed performance on the Chicago Board of Trade yesterday. Early in the session, prices of wheat and corn declined, reacting to a late Thursday comment from the Department of Agriculture relating to cancellation of shipments of grains to foreign buyers.

title: GREYSTONE KEEPS RIGHT TO OPERATE
description: MORRISTOWN, Dec. 20A State Superior Court judge today denied a request by the New Jersey Public Advocate's Office to bar the admission of new patients to Greystone Psychiatric Hospital in neighboring Morris Plains. It is the state's largest psychiatric treatment center.

title: Iran to Spend Several Billion in U.S.
description: The Iranian Government plans to spend several billion dollars in the United States within the next five years on equipment for developing Iranian agriculture and technologyand on training personnel, an Iranian diplomat says.

title: LOTTERY NUMBERS Dec. 20, 1974
description: New York4381767 N. Y. Jackpot5771903 N. J. Daily44747

title: Wyman Wants Senate to Settle Race
description: CONCORD, N. H., Dec. 20 (AP)Representative Louis C. Wyman, Republican of New Hampshire, said today that if he held on to his fourvote lead in the disputed race for the United States Senate, he would take his case to Washington and discontinue further state court proceedings.

title: CLASSIFIED  ADVERTISING INDEX
JURORS HEAR DEAN TERMED PERJURER
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 20  H. R. Haldeman's chief defense lawyer told the jury at the Watergate coverup trial today that the prosecution's chief witness, John W. Dean 3d, was a mastermind of chicanery and a perjurer.

title: TV's Newest Victim
description: As a teacher of biology I was shocked and disturbed to see that it is now time for science to be sacrificed at the altar of television in bloody orgy of quasidocumentaries that show operations and dissections that were once reserved for medical students. To relegate the human body to a thirdrate side show, billed not for the squeamish, under the guise of scientific Inquiry is the epitome of television's quest for new nerve endings to stimulate. Is television so intellectually exhausted and emotionally bankrupt that the sight of blood and viscera only can produce new heights of awareness for the public?

title: Screen: Top of World
description: A civilized movie for children, Robert Stevenson's Island at the Top of the World is a Jules Vernish adventure fantasy, concerning a small group that voyages by airship to the Arctic in 1907. They wind up on a mysterious volcanic island, among the furry descendants of a lost Viking expedition. There are pleasing glimpses of polar bears, whales, and reindeer, and some quite stunning shots of the airship maneuvering between canyons of ice. The movie opened yesterday at neighborhood theaters.

title: Times to Start Increasing Advertising Rates on Feb. 1
description: The New York Times will begin increasing advertising rates in various categories on Feb. 1 and by June 29 all will have been raised by 10 per cent, Warren Wolfe, advertising director, announced yesterday.

title: FREDERICK W. WOOD
description: Frederick William Wood, a retired partner in the law firm of Arthur, Dry & Kalish, died Thursday in Memorial Hospital. He was 70 years old and lived in Weston, Conn.

title: BLACKS UNLIKELY TO UNSEAT DALEY
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 20In a city long dominated by Mayor Richard J. Daley and his Democratic party organization, the black community is making yet another move to win a measure of political power. But the odds against nearterm success are great.

title: Empathy of Elderly Benefits the Neediest as Senior Citizens Group Contributes
description: The elderly have long been aware of the problems that beset others of their age, and the Briarcliff, N. Y. Senior Citizens Center yesterday did its share to help, sending a check for $50 to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.

title: RALPH M. PARSONS, INDUSTRIALIST, 78
description: Ralph M. Parsons, founder of the Ralph M. Parsons Company, one of the largest engineering and construction concerns in the country, died yesterday in San Marino, Calif., where he lived. His age was 78.

title: S.E.C. SAID TO TAKE NO POSITION ON GOLD
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission has no present intention of taking a position as to whether certain forms of gold dealings with the public should be subject to S.E.C. regulation, sources close to the Government agency said today.

title: HIGHER VALUE SET BY FRANCE ON GOLD
description: PARIS, Dec. 20The French Government announced today it would write up the value of its gold holdings in line with an understanding reached last weekend at a meeting of President Valry Giscard d'Estaing and President Ford on Martinique.

title: I.R.A. Provisionals Announce a Christmas Truce
description: DUBLIN, Dec. 20The militant Provisional wing of the Irish Republican Army announced today a Christmas, ceasefire in Britain and Northern Ireland, and said the sust pension could be made permanent if the British Government responded positively.

title: Concert
description: The Orpheus Chamber Ensemble gave its Friday night concert at Alice Tully Hall the tongueincheek billing of Music Minus One, to point up the fact that the twoyearold chamber orchestra performs without a conductor. That particular sort of selfdenial, while rare, is by no means unheard of. (In the nineteentwenties, something called the Conductorless Orchestra had a brief vogue, for instance.) More important, the concert demonstrated that Orpheus is a crack young musical group in the kind of varied but carefully chosen repertory presented on this program.

title: Court Rules Road Agency Must File An Environmental Report on Route 7
description: Environmentalists won a significant victory in their longstanding battle with the highway builders last week when a Federal appellate court here ruled that the Highway Administration must prepare afull environmental impact statement of its own on a road planned to run through several states.

title: 24 Hurt in Five Alarm Blaze on West Side
description: A fivealarm fire reportedly touched off when a cigarette lighter was accidentally dropped destroyed the top floor of a sevenstory apartment house on the Upper West Side last night, injuring at least 24 persons and forcing evacuation of the building.

title: G.M. of Canada to Cut Back
description: OSHAWA, Ontario, Dec. 20 (UPI)  General Motors of Canada announced today it would close nearly all of its production facilities for one week in January, idling more than half the company's 31,000 Canadian employes.

title: 28 COUNCILMEN SWORN BY BEAME
description: Mayor Beame yesterday swore in 27 reelected City Councilmen and one elected to his first term.

title: Retirement at 63? Few Take It Kindly
description: It's like cutting down tree, said a 63yearold secrotary, who is caught in the Mayor's plan to retire senior civil servants early to balance the city budget. I like my workI feel it is stimulating. Here I feel like somebody, but at home I'm nothing.

title: EINSTEIN'S THEORY LINKED TO FLIGHT
description: DALLAS, Dec. 20It is be lieved that, for the first time an object has been found whose flight through space is strongly controlled by the general theory of relativity.

title: R. PALME DUTT, 79, BRITISH MARXIST
description: LONDON, Dec. 20R. Palme Dutt, a founder and for many years the leading theoretician of the British Communist party, died here today after a long illness. He was 79 years old.

title: The Future of Religion
description: There are times in which the present is taken as a matter of course, times in which the present seems a safe and secure shelter from which no one feels prompted to question the future. This is not merely the case during times of outward security; when life runs calmly and = smoothly. Even during periods of extreme oppression, great misery and dreadful atrocities people accepted their fate as something inescapable, as a trial or punishment imposed by God.

title: RABIN BIDS SADAT MEET HIM ON PEACE
description: TEL AVIV, Dec. 20 (UPI)Premier Yitzhak Rabin of Israel challenged President Anwar elSadat of Egypt today to meet him facetoface for the purpose of a peace between their two countries.

title: State Set to Start Building For West Side Renewal
description: State housing officials say they expect to start construction next spring on four of the seven sites in the West Side ur ban renewal area that the city turned over to the state last February.

title: Thousand Acres a Week
description: It is reported that President Ford may be having second thoughts, about the stripmine control bill that he has warned he would veto. If he does in fact change his mind about the most important environmental action of the 93d Congress, he will be responding not only to the pleas of environmentalists, but to surprising pressures from elements of the coal industry itselfincluding the Bethlehem Steel Corporation.

title: TREASURY WILL SELL $2BILLION IN NOTES
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 20 (AP) The Treasury Department said today it would raise an additional $52billion to meet its financial commitments by auctioning new issues of outstanding notes.

title: Duran Defends Tonight
description: SAN JOSE, Costa Rica, Dec. 20 (Reuters)Roberto Duran of Panama defends his World Boxing Association lightweight championship in a 15round bout against Masakatsu Takayama of Japan here tomorrow night.

title: Business Records BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS
description: SOUTHERN DISTRICT

title: Filion Drives 4 Winners And Breaks HiS Record
LINCOLN HOSPITAL IS REACCREDITED
description: The Joint Commission on Accreditation of Hospitals has voted to reverse an earlier decision and renew the accreditation of Lincoln Hospital in the Bronx for one year.

title: Curb Those Dogs!
description: For a city as financially strapped as New York, it fatuous to suggest additional services that might be undertaken, However, there are certain selfservices that residents can perform which will improve the city's livability without burdening the municipal treasury.

title: Votes in Congress
description: 1. Vote on motion to close debate on conference report on bill extending the ExportImport Bank for four years, which required a twothirds vote of those present for pasage. Motion rejected, 54 yeas to 34 nays, Dec. 16.

title: Swiss Drug Concern Reports A Synthesis of Huthan Insulin
description: BASEL, Switzerland, Dec. 20 (Reuters)  The Swiss drug firm CibaGeigy said today that one of its research teams had achieved the first chemical synthesis of human insulin a discovery that could eventually be a major help in treating diabetes.

title: Carey Transit Panel to Check On Needs of Six Upstate Cities
description: Governorelect Hugh L. Carey announced yesterday that Raymond T. Schuler, whom he is retaining as State Commissioner of Transportation, and Ken Patton, head of his transportation panel, are to fly to six upstate cities to discuss the cities' transportation needs.

title: 33 Killed in South Africa
description: STERKSTROOM, South Africa, Dec. 20 (AP)A truck overturned today, killing 33 workers and injuring 26 others seriously the South African Press Association reported. The accident occurred eight miles from here.

title: Flames Win To End Run Of 8 Losses
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 20 (UPI)The Atlanta Flames snapped an eightgame losing streak, the longest in their history, with a 62 defeat of the St. Louis Blues in National Hockey League action tonight.

title: The Theater: Yentl
description: Issac Bashevis Singer already has a formidable reputation as a short story writer, and it now seems that he wants to rival it with a reputation as a playwright. He has already had two plays produced by the Yale Repertory Theater in New Haven, and yesterday a third play was presented by the Chelsea Theater Center of Brooklyn at the Brooklyn Academy of Music.

title: U.S. Economy: The SovietArab Plot
description: To the Editor:

title: Over Here! Tour Is Off in Dispute
description: A salary dispute between the Andrews Sisters, stars of Over Here!, and the producers of their musical has resulted in the cancellation of the show's national tour, scheduled to begin after its closing here at the Shubert Theater on Jan. 4.

title: A Gazelle Threatens the Dolphins
description: When the National Football League owners chiseled nine new stone tablets for their rule book this season, two preserved the game's gazelles, the wide receivers who had been an endangered species. No longer could they be leveled at the line of scrimmage by the jackals on defense. No longer, after they were three yards downfield, could they be tortured more than once by any one defender. Paul Brown of the Cincinnati Bengals had campaigned firmly for those two commandments. By mere coincidence, Paul Brown employs a wide receiver with the speed of light, Isaac Curtis, who had been all but butchered by the Miami Dolphins when the Bengals were eliminated from last year's N.F.L. playoffs. But the rules weren't put in just for him, Brown insisted. They were put in to make the game more exciting. They have, but not for the Bengals, who did not qualify for the playoffs this time. The primary beneficiary has been the Oakland Raiders, who, in Clifford Branch, had a gazelle hidden in their private preserve. He's not hidden now. Once a world class sprinter clocked in 9.2 seconds for the 100 yard dash, he led all the N.F.L. pass receivers with 13 touchdowns and 1,092 yards. He might be the most significant member of the Raiders when they attempt to dethrone the Dolphins, the twotime Super Bowl champions, today in the most significant of the weekend's N.F.L. playoff games.

title: City Gets the Right to Evict Tenant in Steeplechase Park
description: Brooklyn Civil Court Judge Samuel A. Welcome ruled yesterday that the city could evict a small amusement park from the site of the old Steeplechase Park in Coney Island at the end of next summer.

title: U.S. STEEL DATA ON PRICE OFFERED
description: WASHINGTON, Dec, 20The United States Steel Corporation, the country's biggest steel maker, sought to justify to White House officials today the price increases on a broad range of products that it put into effect just two days ago.

title: Byrne Questions Raise For Port Authority Aide
description: Governor Byrne of New Jersey has demanded an explanation by the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey of its decision to raise the salary of its executive director, A. Gerdes Kuhbach from $70,000 to $80,000 without mentioning the matter the official minutes. The Gov ernors of New York and, New Jersey have veto powers over actions taken at meetings of the 12 bistate agency commissioners, and Governor Byrne said this week that he strongly questioned whether a raise should have been given.

title: Art: Herbin's Limited Perfection
description: The paintings of Auguste Herbin (18821960) mirror a world that in almost every case is stilled and in equilibrium. One shape, one color, on strict rectangular compartment answers to another with all possible politeness. Clashes are rare, and tumult is, unknown. Everything, everywhere, looks as if it had been cut out with a pair of very sharp scissors and set down in exactly its intended place.

title: Contract Award
description: Two contracts worth more than $40million have been received by a subsidiary of the MorrisonKnudsen Company, Inc., and a joint venture associate for coatings for 366 miles of large diameter pipe to be used in the North Sea oil fields. The contracts were awarded by British Petroleum, London, and Total Oil Marine, Paris, to the MorrisonKnudsen International Company and the Shand Group of Companies, London.

title: Volkswagen's Chief Executive Resigns
description: BONN, Dec. 20Giving poor health as his reason, Rudolf Leiding is resigning as chief executive of the troubled Volkswagen automobile producer.

title: ANDRE JOLIVET, 69, PROLIFIC COMPOSER
description: PARIS, Dec. 20 (Reuters)Andr Jolivet, composer, conductor and former musical director of the Comdie Frangaise, died yesterday. He was 69 years old.

title: There May Be a Bit Less Under the Christmas Tree This Year
description: Christmas this year isn't going to be what it used to be, if one thinks of the day in terms of gifts.

title: BAR UNIT TO STUDY SHIFT OF A JUDGE
description: The reassignment of Criminal Court Judge Bruce McM. Wright to Civil Court will be looked into by The Association of the Bar of the City of New York, Paul Dewitt, its executive secretary, said yesterday.

title: Vikings Ranked 7 Points Better Than Cards
Lisbon Minister to Visit India to Heal Long Rift
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 20 (AP) Foreign Minister Mrio Soares of Portugal will visit India, next week to end formally a decade of bitterness over Goa, the Indian Foreign Ministry announced today.

title: Dow Index Declines by 5.95 to 598.48
description: Prices closed lower yester day in moderately active trading on the New York Stock Exchange against a backdrop of more bleak economic developments.

title: Ship Burns Off Dutch Coast
description: THE HAGUE, Dec. 20 (Reuters)Ten crewmen were taken off the Greek coastal ship Parimar today after she had run aground off the Netherlands near Scheveningen, following an explosion and fire in her engine room. A Dutch Navy spokesman said two men were still missing. The ship was bound for Rotterdam from Norway.

title: Japanese Steel Makers Lowering Export Prices
description: TOKYO, Dec. 20 (Reuters)Japanese steel companies are lowering export prices in view of a slowdown in demand and shortages of foreign exchange in some importing countries, industry sources said today.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: NOT THE USUAL Two movie programs of special interest begin today. At the New York Cultural Center, 2 Columbus Circle, there is a selection of 50 cartoons not included in last year's successful, comprehensive series on the development of the Hollywoodmade cartoon. The Fifth Avenue Cinema, at 12th Street, is offering a twoday assortment of representative works marking the first anniversary of the Association of Independent Video and Film makers.

title: Secret Service Removes Guards at Key Biscayne
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 20 (UPI)  The Secret Service said today that it had removed its security agents from former President Richard M. Nixon's estate in Key Biscayne, Fla.

title: Guerrilla Said to Escape
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, Dec. 20 (UPI)  A statement by a spokesman of the Palestine Revolution Forces, distributed in Damascus by the Palestinian press agency, said a guerrilla who had placed the explosives in Jerusalem returned safely to his base in the occupied territories.

title: Finding of Dud Shell Halts Tunnel Traffic
description: Traffic in the Lincoln Tunnel was halted in both directions for 30 minutes yesterday morning when a dummy mortar shell was found at the tunnel's New York exit.

title: Redskins: Washington's Common Bond
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 20  The groundskeeper at George Washington's old farm at Mount Vernon leaves a gate open for one of the neighbors, Sonny Jurgensen, the Washington Redskins' ageless quarterback, who does his daily running in the backyard of the father of his country. But that is perhaps the least example of the way legend and politics, power and pro football are all entwined in the nation's capital  all the more so on the eve of the Super Bowl playoffs.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 29

title: Three Top Editorial Executives At McKay Resign in Policy Rift
description: Three key editorial officials of the David McKay Company, a mediumsize book publisher, resigned yesterday in what was described as irreconcilable policy differences with the company's owner, MorganGrampion, Ltd., of London.

title: Mrs. Whitley Wed to Ramsey Wetherill
description: Dorothy Cullen Whitley, widow of Charles Holbrook Whitley of Salt Lake City, was married here yesterday atfernoon to Ramsey Wetherill of Haverford, Pa., and Jamestown, R. I. Tile ceremony was performed in St. Jean Baptiste Roman Catholic Church by the Rev. Adrian Herbert. A small reception was held in the Georgian Suite at lA East 77th Street.

title: Manhattan Wins, 8173, In Upset of Washington
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Dec. 20Tom Lockhart came off the bench to score 30 points and help Manhattan College knock Washington from the unbeaten ranks, 8173, in the opening game of the Michigan Invitational basketball tournament tonight. Manhattan will meet Michigan, 8463 victor over Virginia Tech, in tomorrow night's final.

title: ETHIOPIAN RULERS PLEDGE TO BUILD SOCIALIST STATE
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Dec. 20  The governing military council announced today that it would turn Ethiopia into a socialist country with a oneparty system, collective farms and direct Government control over all property useful for economic progress.

title: People in Sports
description: George Foreman, who lost the world heavyweight title to Muhammad All in Zaire last October, has discarded his boxing gloves for the role of Santa Claus. Foreman is sending $1,000 to each of 13 American cities to be distributed among the poor.

title: Drew Helps Hawks Top Braves, 113102
description: BUFFALO, Dec. 20 (AP)John Drew scored 24 of his 26 points in the second half tonight and Herm Gilliam had a seasonhigh 20 points, leading the Atlanta Hawks to a 113102 National Basketball Association victory over the. Buffalo Braves.

title: Memphis Player Hurt
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec, 20 (UPI)  Memphis State University announced today that Dexter Reed, who injured his left knee yesterday in practice, would not be able to play weekend basketball games. He will probably miss the Gator Bowl tournament, which begins Dec. 26.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Port Agency Raise Opposed

title: Engineer Is Given 6 Months In Agnew Kickback Case
description: BALTIMORE, Dec. 20 (UPI) Commenting that only a unique situation kept former Vice President Spiro T. Agnew out of prison, a Federal judge gave a sixmonth jail term today to an engineer who admitted paying several thousand dollars in kickbacks to Mr. Agnew.

title: Sing A Song of Commerce
description: Some years ago, being in love and knowing little of the art of wooing, I went at Christmas time to my friend Merle, who ran a bird store, and asked his advice about what to give my true love.

title: Japanese Oil Trial
description: Thirty executives of 12 large oil companies and the Petroleum Association of Japan pleaded not guilty to charges of violating Japan's AntiMonopoly Law as the trial of what's known in Japan as the Blackmarket Cartel Case opened in Tokyo High Court. Details on Page 42.

title: Tombs Closes as Last of Its Inmates Depart
description: After a tumultous 33year history, during which it symbolized the hopes and frustrations of New York City's penal system, the Tombs closed yesterday, with the last group of inmates leaving reluctantly.

title: Big Gold Rush Seen
description: CHICAGO (Reuters, Dec. 20 Henry Weissblatt, President of Mocatta Corporation, said today he expects as much as $4billion in American dollars to flow into gold in the first year after possession by United States citizens becomes legal on Dec. 31. He said he does not expect more than a 5 to 6 per cent change in gold prices between now and Dec. 31.

title: LIAISON ON FILMS NAMED BY BEAN
description: Walter Wood, a former motionpicture producer who is now a city official, was named yesterday as director of the city's Office for Motion Pictures and Television.

description: MILTON BERLE: An Autobiography. With Haskel Frankel. Illustrated. 337 pages. Delacorte Press. $8.95.

description: News Summany and Index, Page 29

title: Complaints on Care of Captive Wildlife Expected to Spawn Protective State Law
description: A growing number of complaints from the public about the care of wild creatures in private and roadside zoos will probably lead to state legislation for better care.

title: 436 Discharged by City; Lag Laid to Some Aigencies
description: Fewer than half of the group of 1,000 appointed provisional workers ordered dismissed by Mayor Beame as a budgetcutting measure on Nov. 22 left the city's service yesterday, the. Budget Bureau disclosed last evening.

title: Crusaders Top Whalers by 30
description: CLEVELAND (AP)  Ron Ward, Grant Erickson and Russ Walker scored firstperiod goals as the Cleveland Crusaders defeated the New England Whalers, 30, in a World Hockey Association game tonight.

title: CONGRESS PASSES MAJOR TRADE BILL AND ENDS SESSION
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 20The 93d Congress adjourned tonight after giving final approval to a major foreign trade bill and several less significant measures.

title: Music: An Unusual Choice for Solti
description: For the Chicago Symphony Orchestra's third program in its current visit to Carnegie Hall, Sir Georg Solti made what seemed like an unusual choice, Elgar's Second Symphony. It is' certainly not played here very much. Yet it is just the kind of music that the conductor obviously loves and does superbly.

title: Suffolk Legislature Halts Participation In Erosion Program
description: RIVERHEAD, L.I., Dec. 20The Suffolk County Legislature today refused to continue the county's participation in a jettybuilding program designed, its backers maintain, to stop erosion along beaches in the Westhampton area.

title: Britain Won't Revalue
description: LONDON, Dec. 20Sources in the British Government and at the Bank of England generally declined to offer any official reaction today to the decision of France to revalue her gold holdings. However, officials indicated that they did not expect any major response.

title: Airlines Admit to Paying Travel Agents Kickbacks
description: More than a dozen foreign and domestic airlines have agreed to admit to Federal prosecutors that they made illegal rebates to travel agents, and now face criminal prosecution and fines as a result.

title: Market Place
description: Beginning Dec. 31 individuals in this nation may own gold for the first time in over a generation, and there is a great deal of excitement over the prospect in Wall Street.

title: British Football
description: By Reuters

title: C.A.B. Is Urged to End Opposition to Charters
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 20 (UPI)The Justice Department said today that the Civil Aeronautics Board should abandon plans to eliminate affinitygroup charter operations because they are the backbone of the charter travel market.

title: Lon Nol Adviser Selected To Head Defense Ministry
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia, Dec. 20 (Reuters)Hou Hong, a senior adviser to President Lon Nol, was appointed Defense Minister today, replacing Maj. Gen. Thappana Nginn.

title: Some Ford Aides Project $35Billion Budget Deficit
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 20Some of President Ford's eco nomic advisers are projecting I huge budget deficitas much as $35billionfor the next fiscal year, even without the tax cut that Is under intense debate within the Administration.

description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 20President Ford was urged by several leaders of American Jewish groups today not to use his new authority to grant lower tariffs to the Soviet Union until he was convinced that Moscow would ease its emigration procedures.

title: INDEXES DECLINE ON AMEX AND OTC
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and the overthecounter market closed lower in moderate trading on the American Stock Exchange yesterday.

title: Credit Executives Foresee 1975 as a Difficult Year
description: A majority of respondents in an annual survey of credit executives here foresees a difficult year in 1975, marked by an erosion of sales and earnings, reduced inventories, increased bankruptcies and more acute collection problems.

title: Tipping Probably Will Be Much Leaner This Year
description: Christmas lagniappe, treated by some recipients as a pleasant surprise and by others as a matter of right, will be considerably leaner this year.

description: MINEOLA, L. L, Dec. 20Judge Con G. Cholakis reserved decision today in the nonjury perjury trial of Family Court Judge Martin Ginsberg. Following summations, Judge Chola kis, a visiting judge from Rensselaer County, said he would make his decision in due course.

title: Avco Estimates Its Loss For Year at $15Million
description: The Avco Corporation, diversified industrial company based in Greenwich, Conn., yesterday, estimated its consolidated net loss at about $15million to $20million for the fiscal year ended Nov. 30.

description: The Coast Guard said yesterday it had recovered a body and a capsized boat in which three New York City police officers disappeared Wednesday while fishing off Bay Shore, L. I.

Weather descriptions are forecast conditions for today. (All times are in Eastern Standard Time.)

description: On July 31, 1971, George Harrison presented two charity shows to help Bangladesh refugees. Other players included Ravi Shankar, Bob Dylan, Ringo Starr, Leon Russell, Billy Preston and Eric Clapton. Both concerts were genuine events in the history of rock n roll.

title: Price Index Rises 0.9% As Real Incomes Decline.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 20Consumer prices rose strongly again in November, the Labor Department reported today.
