description: The Morningside Heights Community Planning Board, in a reversal, has now decided that it will not force the demolition of a 109car garage, on Broadway at 113th Street to make room for a relocated public library branch.

title: JACOB BLANK, 68, AUTHOR, IS DEAD
description: Jacob Nathaniel Blanck, an author and bibliographer, died Monday at Faulkner Hospital, Jamaica Plain, Mass. He was 68 years old and lived in Chestnut Hill, Mass.

title: Pope in Christmas Message Praises Jesus as the Brother of All
description: ROME, Dec. 25Pope Paul VI in a Christmas message to the world praised Jesus today as the brother of all, the advocate of the poor, the friend of the lowly, the companion of the suffering, the redeemer of sinnersin a word, our Savior.

title: Loans of City Banks Rise; Economic Weakness Seen
P.U.C.'S JURISDICTION ON CABLE TV UPHELD
description: TRENTON, Dec. 26 (AP)A state appeals court today upheld the authority of the State Public Utility Commission to regulate cable television in New Jersey.

title: Spirits Win, 119118
description: ST. LOUIS, Dec. 21 (UPI)The Spirits of St. Louts scored 8 straight points to break an 8989 tie at the start of the fourth quarter and then repelled a strong San Antonio rally to post a 119118 victory tonight.

title: Venezuela Will Take 99% Of Creole Petroleum Net
description: Venezuela will take 99 per cent of the profits of the Creole Petroleum Corporation in 1974, Robert N. Dolph, president of the company, Venezuela's largest oil producer, told employes in a Christmas message released yesterday.

title: LIFO ACCOUNTING SET FOR RCA '74 RESULTS
description: The RCA Corporation announced yesterday it was adopting the lastin, firstout (LIFO) method of accounting for most of its domestic inventories in reporting 1974 results.

title: U. S. Agency Gives Funds
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 (Reuters)  The United States Agency for International Development said today that it had allocated $60,000 for two emergency airlift missions to Darwin.

title: CITY TO DROP FEES TO HOME BROKERS
description: The city's Department of Social Services next Wednesday will end an 18yearold practice of paying brokers to find apartments for welfare families except in cases of severe emergency, the Human Resources Administrator, James R. Dumpson, announced yesterday. The action will save the city $4million a year.

title: Warranties on Mobile Homes Are Target of F.T.C. Action
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 (AP) The Federal Trade Commission moved today to eliminate what it called unfair and deceptive warranty practices in the mobilehome industry by reaching agreements with large manufacturers and by proposing a new rule on all future mobile. home warranties.

title: College and School Results
description: BASKETBALL

title: Baraka Abandons Racism as Ineffective And Shifts to Scientific Socialism of Marx
description: NEWARK, Dec. 26Amid Baraka, the prolific poet and playwright turned political activist, who has emerged during the last decade as a major intellectual force in the blacknationalist movement in this country, now says that movement must change its focus and direction because it has become ineffective and racist.

title: FOOD STAMP LINES ABATE IN ARIZONA
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Dec. 26  PHOENIX, Ariz., Dec. 26 Allnight food stamp lines, in which applicants at the main food stamp office here start to line up at 5:30 P.M. for the next day's certification procedure, reflect Arizona's economic plight.

title: Restaurant Reviews
description: Uncle Peng, who is well known for his ability in Taipei, is the chef at Yunnan Yuan. Photographs of him with Secretary of State Kissinger are in the window of the restaurant, but despite this moment of glory he is reported to be in the kitchen and cooking most of the time.

title: Barry Scores 46
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Dec. 26 (UPI)  Rick Barry scored 12 of Golden State's 22 points in the final period, tonight as the Warriors stemmed a Portland Trail Blazer rally for a 112101 victory.

title: LORTON INMATES END THEIR REVOLT
description: LORTON, Va., Dec. 26 (UPI) Ending a 20hour encampment in the Lorton Reformatory's mess hall, inmates armed with butcher knives quietly freed their last seven hostages unharmed today in return for a Federal prosecutor's statement on amnesty for the ringleaders of the uprising.

title: The House Guests of Bantry Bay Bay
description: WASHINGTON Were such a bay lying upon an English shore, it would be the world's wonder.

title: Saigon Street Scene: Childhood Dies
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 26Down the middle of the street strode Nguyen Van Thanh, a wiry 12yearold boy known in the neighborhood as ach bichthe ace of spades.

title: DAN BEARD DIES; AIRLINE PIONEER
description: M. G. (Dan) Beard, who contributed to the development of transport aircraft, died Wednesday in the Veterans Hospital in Northport, L.I. He was 78 years old and lived in Manhasset, L.I.

title: Tarkenton No Secret To Dryer
description: Fred Dryer knows something about Fran Tarkenton, but he's keeping it secret. How can it be a secret, though, if Tarkenton knows what Dryer knows about him? Well, it still would he a secret from anyone else, because neither Dryer nor Tarkenton will say what it is, even though Dryer might know that Tarkenton knows what Dryer knows about him.

title: GRAND BROKERAGE A HAPPY BUSINESS
description: We have a happy little business, Henry F. Marcelle the executive vice president of Grand Brokerage, Inc., said with a chuckle during an inter view yesterday, and if you reporters would just leave us alone, we could get on with it.

title: EHRLICHMAN HELD NIXON SCAPEGOAT; TRIAL NEARS RID
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26  John D. Ehrlichman's chief defense lawyer told the jury today as the Watergate coverup trial neared an end that Mt. Ehrlichman was a loyal serve ant whom Richard Nixon had thrown to the wolves to protect himself.

title: Nixon's Homes Draw Key Biscayne Crowds
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Dec. 26 (UPI)Hundreds of persons snarled traffic, ignored barricades and trampled lawns on Christmas Day to get a glimpse of former President Richard M. Nixon's vacation compound here.

title: Connors Gains at Aussie Net
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Dec. 26 (AP)Jimmy Connors and John Newcombe took their first steps today toward a title showdown the Australian open tennis championships with firstround triumphs over young Australians.

title: S.E.C. Is Not Listing 3 Gold Sales Plans
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26The Securities and Exchange Commission said today that it would not require registration of gold investment programs by three New York concerns proposing to offer to sell gold to the public after Dec. 31.

title: Decline of Liberty Found in 7 Nations By Freedom House
description: A global survey of political and civil liberty indicates that personal freedom diminished Otis year for 85 million people in seven countries.

title: Israel and Egypt Reported Far Apart on Sinai Stands
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 26New Viand conspicuous diplomatic tension seems to be building between the United States and Israel in advance of the next round of negotiations with Egypt over the Sinai Peninsula.

title: Gold Risk for Investors ...
description: In less than a week American citizens will be legally able to own gold bullion and speculate in it for the first time since the bottom of the Great Depression in 1933. It will be well for them to remember that gold buying is as risky as any other form of commodity speculation. If the current world recession deepens, the recent inflationary boom in world commodity prices could turn around, and gold could plummet as copper already has.

title: It's All About to Come Tumbling Down
description: PARISThe institutions that were created to represent the members of society are all in critical condition.

title: Nebraska Ousts Oklahoma
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Dec. 26 (UPI)Nebraska, paced by the guard play of Jerry Fort and Steve Willis, upset Oklahoma and eliminated the Sooners from the Big Eight tournament, 7564, tonight in the first round.

title: Bulls Win Rough Game
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 26 (AP)Bob Love connected on a 25foot shot with 12 seconds to play tonight, giving the Chicago Bulls a 9291 victory over the Philadelphia 76ers in a game in which seven technical fouls were called.The Bulls' victory, coming with Norm Van Lier and Jery Sloan ejected from the game, was helped by the shooting of Love and Chet Walker, who combined for 17 points in the final quarter.

title: INDUSTRY OPERATES AT REDUCED LEVEL
description: United States manufacturing, mining and utility companies operated at 77 per cent of capacity in November, against October's revised 80 per cent level and last November's 87 per cent in November, 1973, preliminary report by McGrawHill, Inc.'s economics department reported yesterday.

title: No More Me Too?
description: It would be comforting  but far from realistic believe that the city had been immunized against the costly consequences of its own official folly by the decision of the State Public Employment Relations Board declaring me too clauses improper in civil service union contracts.

title: FED AGAIN MOVES TO BOLSTER CREDIT
Publisher to Go Ahead With Luciano Book
description: The publisher of The Last Testament of Lucky Luciano, challenged last week on its claim that the book is the dictated memoirs of the deceased Mafia boss, said yesterday that it had reviewed all the available data on which the manuscript was based, and would issue the book as scheduled.

title: Israel and Egypt Reported Far Apart on Sinai Stands
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26Israel and Egypt were reported today to be very far apart in their initial positions for the next round of negotiations over Sinai.

title: Steingut and Esposito Face Inquiry on Nursing Homes
description: A United States Senate subcommittee yesterday asked Stanley Steingut, who is scheduled to become Speaker of the new State Assembly, and Meade H. Esposito, the Brooklyn Democratic leader, to describe their involvement with the nursinghome industry in New York.

title: LATE CITY EDITION
description: Weather: Partly sunny today; rain likely late tonight and tomorrow. Temperature range: today 26.43; Thursday 2836. Details on Page 62.

title: Citizen Group Asks Tough Energy Policy
description: Two former Secretaries of Commerce, John T. Connor and Peter G. Peterson, and the executive director of the National Urban League, Vernon E. Jordan Jr., called yesterday on the Ford Administration to adopt tough new energy policies that would probably lead to sharply higher fuel prices.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: DETROIT, Dec. 26 (AP)Marcel Dionne scored two goals tonight, including one on a thirdperiod power play, as the Detroit Red Wings tied the Minnesota North Stars, 44, in National Hockey League play.

title: William H. Draper Jr. Is Dead; Served on Population Panels
description: William H. Draper Jr., a member of the governing body of the International Planned Parenthood Federation and United States representative on the United Nations Population Commission, died yesterday of a heart attack in Naples, Fla. He was 80 years old.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: KISSINGER PLANS 2 LATIN TRIPS IN '75
description: SAN JUAN., Puerto Rico, Dec. 26 (AP)Secretary of State Kissinger arrived here tonight for a vacation and said that he plans two visits to Latin America during the early months of 1975.

title: Louisville Wins Rout
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Dec. 26 (AP)  Allen Murphy scored 24 points to lead Louisville past Western Kentucky, 10781 in the opening round of the Holiday Classic Tournament tonight.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: PLAZA SWEET Hallelujah for The Collector's Item, for the richly melodious and happy sounds of this new young quintet of vocalists gracing the Persian Room of the Plaza Hotel. They sing beautifullyeverything from tender gospel to plaintive torch to razoredged rockand almost continually, for 50 minutes.

title: DRINKING BY YOUTHS IS FOUND ALARMING
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 (UPI) Many teenagers have either driven while drunk or been passengers in cars with heavydrinking drivers, the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said today.

title: Providence Five Wins, 7675
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., Dec. 26 (AP)A twisting layup by a freshman, Bruce Campbell, with 13 seconds left gave 12thranked Providence College a 7675 victory over Holy Cross in the opening game of the Eastern Collegiate Athletic Association Ocean State basketball tournament tonight.

title: Ford, on Eve of Energy Parley, Says Gasoline Tax Rise Is Dead
description: VAIL, Cola, Dec. 26 (UPI)President Ford, heralding a major policy conference with his chief energy advisers tomorrow at this winter resort in the Rocky Mountains again rejected today any increase in the gasoline tax to curb oil consumption.

title: Fulbright Resigns Senate Seat Early; Pension Will Rise
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 (AP) Senator J. W. Fulbright, Democrat of Arkansas, has resigned effective Dec. 31, the Senate secretary's office said today.

title: PARENTS/CHILDREN
description: There are times when being a parent isn't all it's cracked up to be, and you might find yourself looking around for a fresh point of view, a revitalizing notion.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Governor Byrne of New Jersey said that he would not tolerate the $10,000ayear raise granted recently by the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey to its executive director, A. Gerdes Kuhbach. At its December meeting, the agency raised Mr. Kuhbach's pay from $70,000 to $80,000, retroactive to last Aug. 8. There was no mention of in the minutes of the meeting, which are subject to the veto of the Governor of either state.

title: Texas Chased by Rain
description: AUSTIN, Tex. Dec. 26 (UPI)  The Texas Longhors attempted to get in some outdoor practice today in prepration for next week's Gator Bowl game, but were forced indoors by a chilled rain.

title: Early Goals by Sabres Down Black Hawks, 31
description: BUFFALO Dec. 26 (AP)Larry Carriere and Gil Perreault scored firstperiod goals tonight, leading the Buffalo Sabres to a 31 N.H.L. victory over the Chicago Black Hawks.

title: Books of The Times
description: CHINA'S THREE THOUSAND YEARS: The Story of a Great Civilization. By Louis Heren, C. P. Fitzgerald, Michael Freeberne, Brian Hook, David Bonavia, 252 pages. Macmillan. $8.95, Collier Paperback. $3.95.

title: The Pop Life
description: That'll Be the Day and Stardust are two British films that between them tell the story of a rock star's rise from provincial adolescence to lonely splendor at the top. Whatever their appeal for general moviegoers, the films should be of great interest to rock fans.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: OwensIllinois, Inc., has been granted a hearing to contest naturalgas priorities established last week by the State Public Utility Commission. A commission spokesman said the hearing would be held Jan. 3 at commission offices here. Industrial customers using large quantities of natural gas, such as OwensIllinois, were given a low priority for obtaining the fuel, expected to be in short supply this winter. The company contends that the glassmanufacturing process requires natural gas, and that it would be forced to close its plants in Vineland and Bridgeton unless sufficient supplies were made available.

title: G.O.P. FOE WILLING TO TAKE ON DALEY
description: CHICAGO.For weeks Chicago's emaciated Republican party wandered about Quixotelike, looking for somebody. not necessarily a Republican to run against Mayor Richard J. Daley, the 72yearold Democratic boss who treats opponents like irksome gnats.

title: Guinea Is Voting Today
description: ABIDJAN, Ivory Coast, Dec. 26 (Reuters)Guineans will vote tomorrow to reelect President Sekou Tour who is running unopposed for a third (consecutive sevenyear term.

title: Speculative Buying Lifts Silver Prices On Exchange Here
description: Speculative buying pushed silver prices ahead yesterday on the Commodity Exchange here, attracting a number of chartists whose buying gave a further impetus to the market Traders also did a large amount of switching, moving out of one month and into another, January silver closed at $4.80 2/5 an ounce, up 10 cents.

title: MARSHALL TO REVIEW SURVEILLANCE CASE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26 Associate Justice Thurgood Marshall of the United States Supreme Court agreed today to hear arguments on whether the Federal Bureau of Investigation should be barred from monitoring a political convention of young Socialists. Associate Justice Thurgood Marshall of the United States Supreme Court agreed today to hear arguments on whether the Federal Bureau of Investigation should be barred from monitoring a political convention of young Socialists.

title: Richard Kaufman Marries Jean Aberlin
description: Jean Emma Aberlin, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Isador Aberlin of Silver Lake, Staten Island, was married yesterday evening to Richard James Kaufman, son of Dr. and Mrs. Harry Kaufman of Sherman Oakes, Calif. The ceremony was performed at the home of the bride's parents by Rabbi Emeritus Marcus Kramer of Temple Israel in West Brighton, Staten Island.

title: Contract Awards
description: The Austin Company, Cleveland, international designer and builder, has been awarded a $60million contract to build a plant to make television sets and other entertainment products. The contract was signed with GTE International, Inc., a subsidiary of the General Telephone and Electronics Corporation, The facility will be built for Socit Nationale de Fabrication et de Montage de Materiel Electrique, an Algerian state corporation.

title: P.B.A. to Defy NameTag Rule
description: Ken McFeeley, president of the Patrolmen's Benevolent Association, directed 27,000 police officers yesterday to defy a departmental order to begin wearing name tags on their uniforms next Thursday.

title: WOMAN RESPONDS IN CLIFTON KILLING
description: PATERSON, Dec. 26A 44yearold Clifton woman, accused in a lawsuit of shooting her wealthy husband to death three years ago, said in a sworn statement filed here today that she was in Secaucus when the murder occurred.

title: Deposed Premier Returns to Thailand
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Friday, Dec. 27 (AP)Thanom Kittikachorn, the deposed military dictator who was overthrown in a student uprising 14 months ago, returned to Thailand early today, reliable sources reported. The sources said that Marshal Thanom, who has been living in exile in Boston, had arrived at Bangkok alone aboard a Lufthansa plane.

title: Supreme Court to Hear Westchester Rent Dispute
description: WHITE PLAINS, Dec. 26A dispute over recommended rent increases that would affect 60,000 apartments in eight Westchester County communities will be heard in State Supreme Court tomorrow morning.

title: Soviet Dooms Ukrainian On Charge of War Crimes
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 26 (Reuters)  A Ukrainian court has sentenced a man to die by the firing squad on charges of having tortured and murdered Soviet citizens in collaboration with the Germans in World War II.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Dec. 26 (UPI)  Unbeaten Arizona State broke away early in the second half tonight and held on for an 8173 victory over Boston College In the opening game of the Far West Classic.

title: Paroled in '68 Killings
description: CRANSTON, R. I., Dec. 26 (AP)Raymond L. S. Patriarca, a reputed New England organized crime boss who was serving a 10year sentence for conspiracyto murder, was paroled today. Mr. Patriarca, 66 years old, was convicted in the 1968 slayings of Rudolph Marfeo and Anthony Melei, who were gunned down in a Providence grocery store.

title: GIACOMO DEVOTO, 77, LINGUISTICS SCHOLAR
description: FLORENCE, Italy, Dec. 26 (AP)Giacomo Devoto, an authority on linguistics, died here yesterday. He was 77 years old.

title: Jack Benny Is Dead; Comedian Was 80
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 26 (UPI) Jack Benny, the master comedian who won America's laughter for 50 years by portraying himself as a violinplaying miser, died today of cancer. He was 80 years old. Jack Benny, the master comedian who won America's laughter for 50 years by portraying himself as a violinplaying miser, died today of cancer. He was 80 years old.

title: Switchboard Manufacturer Sues Continental Telephone
description: The Control Networks Corporation, a manufacturer of telephone switchboards, filed suit yesterday against the Continental Telephone Corporation to compel Continental to complete its acquisition of Control Networks.

title: Expatriate New Yorkers Aid Neediest
description: Native New Yorkers who have moved away and recent arrivals who have adopted the city as their new home were among 280 donors yesterday to the New York Times Neediest Cases Fund in its 63d annual appeal.

title: CHICAGO REBUFFED IN PLEA FOR FUNDS
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 26A Federal judge here refused today to countermand the order of a Fed eral judge in Washington depriving Chicago of $19million in Federal revenuesharing funds because the city has been discriminating against minorities and women in hiring policemen.

title: Chairs for Castro
description: It is ridiculous for the United States to exacerbate its already strained relations with Canada in defense of bankrupt policy of trying to embargo trade with Cuba. Yet, that is what is involved in the instructions sent on Washington's advice by Litton Industries to its Canadian subsidiary to cancel a $500,000 Cuban order for desks, chairs and filing cabinets.

title: ... and for Nations
description: As risky a proposition as gold is for individual investors, it could be even more hazardous for nations and the world economy, especially if some countries go on a goldbuying spree and seek to push up its price.

title: Customer Vs. Moving Company: Curbside Mediators Try to Help
description: Between now and next spring, Vincent Kehoe and Donald Curran will watch approximately 6,000 tenants move into Starrett City, the huge new housing complex in the Canarsie section of Brooklyn.

title: HELMS WAS VAGUE IN 1973 ON SPY BID
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26  Richard Helms told the Senate Foreign Relations Committee in 1973 that he could not recall whether the White House had urged the Central Intelligence Agency to engage in domestic spying because of increasing antiwar activity in 1969 and 1970.

title: Egyptians Outrow Harvard
description: CAIRO, Dec. 26The Cairo Police Rowing Club did what few crews have been able to achieve. They defeated Harvard University's eightoared shell in the second and final race of the International Rowing Regatta on the Nile.

title: Nuggets on Top
description: DENVER, Dec. 26 (AP) Mike Green hit two clutch baskets in the last three minutes tonight to help the Denver Nuggets to a 107102 victory over the Utah Stars.

title: HOW TO AID THE FUND
description: Checks should be made payable to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund and forwarded to P.O. Box 5193, Church Street Station, New York, N. Y. 10249, or to any of the following eight organizations that certify these cases:

title: Islanders Lose to Flames
description: ATLANTA, Dec. 26  The opposing piper rushed down on a breakaway. The goaltender came far out and was lying horizontally on the ice. Still in control of the puck, the skater pulled it around the prone body and shot it into the net.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 33

title: Thief Takes Watermelons
description: TUCSON, Ariz. (AP)The President Fruit Stand on the city's south side was broken into after midnight and the burglar took 25 watermelons, the police reported.

title: TV: ABC Illusion of Safety Surveys Air Crashes
description: Taking off from the fact that 1974 has been the single worst year in airline historymore than 1,200 people have died across the world in crashes, tomorrow night's ABC News Closeup provides still another valuable demonstration of how a television documentary can be tough and pointed while falling comfortably within the requirements of the Fairness Doctrine.

title: Phone Rate Increases Will Remain in Jersey
description: NEWARK, Dec. 26In an unusual split decision, the New Jersey Board of Public Utility Commissioners decided to retain New Jersey Bell Telephone Company's controversial rate escalator clause in effect for next year, pending a State Supreme Court decision on its legality.

title: ANSWER TO PREVIOUS PUZZLE
SOVIET CLARIFIES PASSPORT RULES
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 26The Soviet Minister of Internal Affairs asserted today that collective farmers and statefarm workers would be entitled to new internal passports, putting hem on an equal footing with the rest of the population.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Dec. 26 (AP)Billy Keller and George McGinnis of Indiana combined for 64 points tonight as the Pacers beat the Kentucky Colonels, 122111, in the A.B.A.

title: About Real Estate
description: BABYLON, L.I.The executive vice president of the National Audubon Society says that Murray Barbash, a builder, is a committed conservationist.

title: 4th Welfare Client At 102d St. Building Is Murder Victim
description: For the fourth time in the last three months, a welfare recipient with a record of narcotics arrests has died as a restilt of an attack in the single roomoccupancy building at West 102d Street.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given in Eastern Standard Time

title: Bethlehem to Confer With Price Officials
description: Officials of the Bethlehem Steel Corporation, the nation's No. 2 steel producer, are scheduled to meet this afternoon in Washington with the Administration's Council on Wage and Price Stability.

title: NineYear Term is Asked In Ukrainian Bribery Case
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 26 (AP)  The prosecution today demanded a sentence of nine years at hard labor for Mikhail Shtern, a 56yearold Jewish doctor being tried in the Ukrainian town of Vinnitsa on charges of bribery and swindling, sources at the trial said.

title: U.S. Steel Ordered To Close a Hearth Or Face Daily Fine
description: HAMMOND, Ind., Dec. 26 (UPI)A Federal judge told the United States Steel Corporation today it must either shut down its No. 4 open hearth Dec. 31 as an airpollution source or pay a $2,300 daily fine to keep it open up to 90 days.

title: Gleeful About Forecast Of Cold
description: It's going to be a cold winter. The Old Farmer's Almanac is predicting freezes, local squirrels are bushier and the Sanitation Department is girding for heavy snows. And what with energy crises and thermostats set at chilly levels, baby, it's going to be cold both outside and in.

title: Red Smith
description: The next step in baseball's Dred Scott Case will be taken a week from today when Massa Charley Finley asks the Alameda County Superior Court in California to return Jim Hunter, a fugitive slave whose name on the plantation was Catfish, to bondage with the Oakland A's. The case is scheduled for a hearing that day on its merits, although nobody seems sure what merit it may have. If Hunter should decide before then to sell himself to one of the teams whose representatives have been parading through Ahoskie, N. C., with ballpoint pens unsheathed, this could complicate the situation agreeably. Although Finley is being backed surreptitiously by owners of all 23 other clubs in the majors, one of those backers would be betting the price of this priceless pitchersay $1million, give or takethat Finley would lose.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: U.S. Victim of Bus Attack In Israel Loses Her Leg
description: TEL AVIV, Dec. 26Miss Dejean Repologle,. 16 years old, of Jacksonville, Fla., lost a leg today as a result of a terrorist grenade attack Sunday on a busload of Americans on a Christmas pilgrimage to the Holy Land.

title: Carey Appoints a Task Force on Agriculture
description: Governorelect Hugh L. Carey dispatched a vanguard of staff aides o Albany yesterday, set up a series of budget meetings for today and named the 17th task forcethis one on agricultureof his administrationtobe.

title: HIGHER '74 NET SEEN BY CONTINENTAL CAN
description: The Continental Can Com pany said yesterday that 1974 earnings will be in the range of $4 to $4.25 a share, up from $3.25 in 1973, despite all of its inventories being converted to lastin, firstout (LIFO) valuation. Sales wil exceed $3billion although there has been softening in demand for metal cans and forest products.

title: Delay of His Return Flight Kept Slain Engineer Here
description: The Alitalia flight engineer slain in an East Side muggingl Christmas night had been, scheduled to fly back to Rome at the hour of his death, but the flight had been put off for one day. ing them, the captain recounted but they thought it was just people a little hit drunk. Suddenly a man grabbed her from behind and with his right hand he put a knife in her throat.

title: Baryshnikov Is Skater in Ballet Theater's Patineurs
description: When Mikhail Baryshnikov left the Soviet Union for the West, one of the main reasons for his move was his desire to work with Western choreographers. So far New York has seen him only in such classic ballets as Giselle and Coppelia, but during American Ballet Theater's season at the City Center 55th Street. Theater, he will be seen in a number of ballets by modern choreographers, including Sir Frederick Ashton, George Ashton, George Balanchine and Roland Petit.

title: Ford Formally Admits Girls to Little League
description: VAIL, Colo., Dec. 26 (AP) President Ford has signed legislation that officially opens the Little League baseball program to participation by girls. President Ford has signed legislation that officially opens the Little League baseball program to participation by girls.

title: Cordero Scores Twice, Gains in Winning Rides
description: Angel Cordero rode two winners at Aqueduct yesterday and gained slightly on Jorge Velasquez in their duel for the New York riding championship. Velasquez, held to one winner, finfished the day with 220 for the New York thoroughbred season, eight ahead of Cordero. Eight rating days remain in the extended season, which runs through Jan. 4, but only four of those are on the 1974 calendar.

title: Thais and Malaysians Set On Natural Rubber Supply
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Dec. 26 (Reuters)  Thailand has agreed in principle to a Malaysian proposal to cut back the supply of natural rubber in the world market by about 10 per cent, a Ministry of Agriculture official said today.

title: Hunter, Lehman in Final
description: The stage was set last night for an intraCity University of New York battle in the final of the first Hunter Hawk invitation tournament. Hunter College, the host team, defeated St. Thomas Aquinas 9268 after Lehman, the City University champion, crushed Oneonta State, 6244.

title: Brazilian Halts Scot
description: ZURICH, Switzerland, Dec. 26 (AP)  Eleno Ferreira of Brazil stopped John McCluskey of Scotland today in the eighth round of a scheduled 10round bantamweight fight. Ferreira was ahead on points through seven rounds, when McCluskey was forced to quit because of a bloody nose and exhaustion.

title: STATE TO APPLY SURTAX OF 25%
description: New York State's onagain, offagain 2.5 per cent incometax surcharge is scheduled to go into effect again next week. If it lasts throughout the year, the tax will add about $15 to the average citizen's tax bill, but Senate Republicans are expected to work for its suspension.

title: N.A.A.C.P. Asks a Judge to Jail 3 Boston School Board Members
description: BOSTON, Dec. 26 (AP)The National Association for the Advancement of Colored People asked a Federal judge today to jail three members of the Boston School Committee.

title: Flyers Topple Capitals
description: LANDOVER, Md., Dec. 26 (UPI)The Philadelphia Flyers scored two goals late in the second period to overcome a stubborn Washington Capital defense and gain a 41 N.H.L. victory tonight.

title: STORES TO SHIFT PRICEFIXING PLEA
description: Three of the city's most prominent stores have notified the Government that they want to change their pleas from not guilty to no contest on charges that they conspired to fix the prices of women's clothes.

title: P.B.A. to Defy NameTag Rule
description: Ken McFeeley, president of the Patrolmen's Benevolent Association, directed 27,000 police officers yesterday to defy a departmental order to begin wearing name tags on their uniforms next Thursday.

title: Goodrich, Allen Spark Lakers' 9989 Triumph
description: CLEVELAND, Dec. 26 (AP)  Gail Goodrich and Lucius Allen scored 28 points each, leading the Los Angeles Lakers to a 9989 National Basketball Association vic tory over the Cleveland Cavaliers tonight.

title: E. R. Murrow Fellowship Now Open for Applications
description: The Council on Foreign Relations has announced that applications for the Edward R. Murrow Fellowship for 197576 are now available to men and women from American print and electronic media who are interested in working in international affairs.

title: Nets Victors By 45 Points, Club Mark
description: NORFOLK, Va., Dec. 26 (AP)The New York Nets won by the largest margin in their history tonight as they trounced the Virginia Squires 13085 in an American Basketball Association ation game.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: U.S. ratification of the Geneva Protocol in the form in which it was passed by the Senate Foreign Relations Committee would constitute a giant step backward in the international control of chemical and biological warfare. The committee version fails to ban herbicides and tear gas and it explicitly permits retaliatory use of bacteriological weapons.

title: VETERANS DETAINING SEOUL REGIME'S FOES
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Dec. 27  About 100 army veterans early this morning stormed a provincial hotel 140 miles south of here and detained a group of opposition legislators, including the Opposition party leader, Kim Young Sam.

title: Gurney Is Again Denied Separate Trial in Florida
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Dec. 26 (AP)A Federal judge has 26 (AP)A Federal judge has again denied Senator Edward J. Gurney a trial separate from six other defendants accused of conspiring with him to sell influence in connection with Federal housing contracts.

title: Stricken Darwin Gets Aid; Thousands Are Flown Out
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Friday, Dec. 27Airliners and military aircraft have been shuttling since yesterday between cycloneshattered Darwin and other Australian cities, carry ing emergency supplies in and thousands of refugees out.

title: F.A.A, IS CRITICIZED ON DC10 CHANGES
description: In a hitherto secret report on the DC10 crash near Paris last March, the Federal Aviation Administration has been charged by its own inquiry board with questionable actions in certifying the plane and with being ineffective in enforcing corrective steps after a neardisaster in 1972.

title: Letters Reveal a Henry James at Ease
description: Using the uncommon clay that is Henry James, Leon Edel moulded a likeness of the writer in three dimensions and five volumes.

title: Indiana Escapee Kills 2 Hostages, Then Gives Up
description: MICHIGAN CITY, Ind. (UPI) The Indiana State Police recaptured an escaped state prison convict tonight, but two hostages, a woman and a teenaged girl, were killed before the inmate surrendered at a farm house west of the prison.

title: Entertainment Events Today
description: Music

title: Article 2  No Title
description: GREENVILLE, S. C., Dec. 26 (UPI)  Todd Tripucka scored 28 points to lead Lafayette to a 10584 victory over the Baylor Bears tonight in the opening game of the 16th a

title: Stores to Shift Plea In U.S. Pricing Suit
description: Three of the city's most prominent stores have notified the Government that they want to change their pleas from not guilty to no contest on charges that they conspired to fix the prices of women's clothes.

title: SelfDestruct Cities
description: America the beautiful is the land of the disposable beer can and the disposable city. The American dream is of unlimited growth and profligate consumption. But the throwaway society isn't working anymore; it has backfired environmentally. With scarcity of money and resources added to a litany of familiar ills, it is now necessary to save, reuse, recycle and make do to help American cities survive.

title: Of Helicopters and YoYos
description: FORT RUCKER, Ala. (UPI)The United States Army Silver Eagles claim to have one of the largest yoyos around. The precision flying helicopter team uses its 58pound, 4footindiameter yoyo as a recruiting device. The Silver Eagles are attached to the Fort Becker Army post in south Alabama.

title: Memphis State Tops Temple
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Dec. 26 (UN)  Marion Hillard scored 22 points to pace Memphis State in a 7168 victory over Temple tonight in the opening game of the Gator Bowl tournament.

title: Federal Reserve Statement
description: (Millions of dollars)

title: Mencken Play Shifts Dates
description: The opening of Blast's and Bravos: An Evening With H. L. Mencken, starring Paul Shyre, which was scheduled for Monday at the Cherry Lane Theater, has been rescheduled for Jan. 16. Mr. Shyre requested the change because of illness in his family. Previews will start Jan. 8.

title: EHRLICHMAN HELD NIXON SCAPEGOAT; TRIAL NEARS END
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26  John D. Ehrlichman's chief defense lawyer told the jury today as the Watergate coverup trial neared an end that Mr. Ehrlichman was a loyal servant whom Richard Nixon had thrown to the wolves to protect himself.

title: Advertising
description: The day of the freebie is passing for the American Express credit card holder. No more free magazine subscriptions.

title: P.U.C. Will Keep Clause On TelephoneRate Rises
description: NEWARK, Dec. 26In an unusual split decision, the State Board of Public Utility Commissinners voted today to keep New Jersey Bell Telephone Company's controversial rate escalator clause in effect next year, pending a State Supreme Court decision on its legality.

title: RESEARCH STATION ORBITED BY SOVIET
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 26The Soviet Union launched a new orbital research station today, indicating that it might attempt another linkup in space, possibly early next year.

title: Stricken Darwin Gets Aid; Thousands Are Flown Out
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Friday, Dec. 27Airliners and military aircraft have been shuttling since yesterday between cycloneshattered Darwin and other Australian cities, carrying emergency supplies in and thousands of refugees out.

title: U.S. Steel Faces Order
description: A Federal judge has told the United States Steel Corporation it must shut down an open hearth as an airpollution source or pay a fine. Details on Page 52.

title: U.S. Hockey Juniors Lose
description: WINNIPEG, Manitoba, Dec. 26 (UPI)  Canada defeated the United States 93 today in the opening game of the first international junior hockey tournament held in North America. The Canadians, an allstar team from the Western Canada Hockey League, were led by a threegoal performande by Bryan Trottier, who assisted on two other scores.

title: Bolivia Sells Tin to Soviet
description: LA PAZ, Bolivia, Dec. 26 (AP) Bolivia has agreed to sell 1,720 tons of refined tin to the Soviet Union next year compared with 720 tons in 1974, it was reported today. The price was not disclosed.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: The city has been almost completely wrecked, and the unanimous opinion of the people is that it should all be bulldozed and rebuilt.Maj. Gen. Alan Stretton, director general of the National Disasters Organization, during visit to Darwin, Australia. [1:2.]

title: Secret Service Reviews Security at White House
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26The Secret Service began reviewing White House security man today after a young man crashed his car through gate leading to the executive mansion yesterday morning.

title: F.A.A. IS CRITICIZED ON DC10 CHANGES
description: In a hitherto secret report on the DC10 crash near Paris last March, the Federal Aviation Administration has been charged by its own inquiry board with questionable actions in certifying the plane and with being ineffective in enforcing corrective steps after a neardisaster in 1972.

title: South Vietnamese Expel an American Who Wrote of C.I.A.
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Friday, Dec. 27The immigration police today expelled from South Vietnam and American. Writer and former Foreign Service officer, John D. Marks, who was coauthor of the controversial book The C.I.A. and the Cult of Intelligence.

title: Byrne, in Review of '74, Sees Himself as Lucky
description: TRENTON, Dec. 26 (AP) Reflecting on his first year in office, Governor Byrne said today that he considered himself a lucky man despite the current deadlock over taxes and school financing and other, political setbacks.

title: STONEHOUSE GIVES BLACKMAIL DATA
description: LONDON, Friday, Dec. 27 (Reuters)  John Stonehouse, (Reuters)  John Stonehouse, the missing British Member of Parliament who turned up in Australia this week, was quoted today by a London newspaper as saying that he faked his death last month because I was being blackmailed by men who threatened to use my political career to squeeze me dry.

title: STOCKS CONTINUE MODERATE GAINS
Olympic Stamp Issued
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 26 (UPI)The Soviet Union has issued postage stamps showing sporting facilities in Moscow where the 1980 Olympic Games will be held.

title: Notes on People
description: Mao Tsetung turned 81 years old yesterday, but as usual his birthday passed without public celebrations in China or even mention in the Chinese press. The exact whereabouts of the Communist party chairman remained something of a mystery. Mr. Mao was last photographed in Peking at the end of May. Since September, he has been meeting state guests in various provincial centers, but the guests were always told not to divulge where.

title: A Model's Dying Screams Are Ignored At the Site of Kitty Genovese's Murder
description: While at least one neighbor heard her dying screams and did nothing, a 25yearold model was beaten to death early Christmas morning in her Kew Gardens, Queens, apartment, which virtually overlooks the scene of the murder of Catherine Genovese 10 years ago.

title: Lebanese Report Israelis Shelled Several Villages
description: SAIDA, Lebanon, Dec. 26 (Reuters)Israeli troops shelled (Reuters)Israeli troops shelled a number of southern Lebanese villages today, causing property damage but no casualties, residents of the area said.

title: William S. Dunn, 88, Dead; Assemblyman in Thirties
description: MIDDLEBURGH, N. Y., Dec. 26 (UPI)William S. Dunn, a former State Assemblyman, died yesterday at. Cobleskill Community Hospital. He was 88 years old and lived here.

title: Portuguese Leaves Somalia
description: MOGADISHU, Somalia, Dec. 26 (Reuters)Foreign Minister Mario Soares of Portugal left today for India after talks with the chairman of the Organization of African Unity, Gen. Mohammed Siad Barree, who is also President of Somalia.

title: Don Pasquale' Lacks Festive Spirit
description: There is nothing about Donizetti's Don Pasquale that ties in with Christmasexcept that both the opera and the holiday center on a funny old man with whiskers. Perhaps that was why the Metropolitan Opera revived the work Christmas night, with the added hope that its bubbly tunes might at least keep the audience in a festive mood.

title: New Head for Strike Force
description: The appointment of William I. Aronwald to succeed Edward M. Shaw as chief of the Joint Strike Force on Organized Crime here was formally announced yesterday by Assistant United States Attorney General Henry Petersen. Mr. Aronwald had been the top assistant to Mr. Shaw for more than two years.

title: France Spurring Exports to Oil Lands to Cut Deficits
description: PARIS, Dec. 26The essential thesis of French policy on the problem of oil prices is to seek the solution through massive, longterm industrial export programs, it has now emerged. This has become clear from the concluding reports on four recent French missions to oilproducing countries.

title: M. H. Fishman Set to File Bankruptcy Act Petitions
description: The M. H. Fishman Company, Inc., a variety chain with 54 branch stores said yesterday that the company and 20 of its subsidiary corporations would file petitions tomorrow in the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York under Chapter XI of the Federal Bankruptcy Act. The stores are in New York, New Jersey, New England and the Midwest.

title: Phosphoric Rock Deposits Found in Northwest Mexico
description: MEXICO CITY, Dec, 26 (AP) Extensive deposits of phosphoric rock, a basic element In the production of fertilizers, have been discovered in the Baja California peninsula, the Government said today.

title: Imprisoned Priest Begins Hunger Strike in Philippines
description: MANILA, Dec. 26 (UPI)An imprisoned Filipino priest went on a hunger strike yesterday to protest the alleged torture and indefinite detention of political prisoners by the martiallaw Government.

title: Exchange Clerks Get NotSoPerfect Gifts
description: There were many returns of the season, happy and otherwise, in the city's stores yesterday, as New Yorkers brought their unwanted Christmas gifts back for exchanges or refunds.

title: Jack Benny Has Cancer
description: Jack Benny has terminal cancer of the stomach, his manager, Irving Fein, said in Los Angeles. The 80yearold comedian was not hospitalized, and his family planned to be with him at home, Mr. Fein was quoted as saying by news agencies.

title: EXPORT PRICES UP IN NEW U. S. INDEX
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26A new export price index of the Labor Departmentstill covering only about onefifth of the nation's total exportsshowed today a price increase for exports of about 12 per cent from mid1973 to mid1974.

title: Women's Bank May Open Short of Its Capital Goal
description: The First Women's Bank of New York, unable to raise the full $4million in capital that it expected, will soon ask the Government to authorize it to begin operations with somewhat less than that amount, the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation disclosed yesterday.

title: Saigon Reports 5th Key Town Is Taken in Communist Drive
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Friday, Dec. 27The Saigon commend said this morning that besieged district capital, 50 miles north of here, fell to the Communists yesterday in a heavy shelling and infantry attack.

title: Anker Agrees to O'Hagan Plan to Correct Fire Violations in the City Schools
description: School Chandellor Irving An ker agreed yesterday to plan for the Fire Department to work closely with the Board of Education to Correct quickly 158 fire violations in more than 100 schools.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 33

title: News Summary and Index
description: FRIDAY, DECEMBER 27, 1974

title: Israel and Egypt Reported Far Apart on Sinai Stands
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26Israel and Egypt were reported today to be very far apart in their initial positions for the next round of negotiations over Sinai.

title: Wilson Unit Asks Halt in New Financing by U.D.C.
description: A study by a group appointed by Governor Wilson recommended yesterday that the Legislature halt the Urban Development Corporation's financing of $400million in projects not yet started, including the second stage of construction on Roosevelt Island.

title: A Monsanto Plant Will Lay Off 550
description: GREENWOOD, S.C., Dec. 26 (AP)About 550 employes, or roughly onefourth of the work force, of the Monsanto Company's textile plant here will be laid off beginning Jan. 6, the corn, said today.

title: Plan to End Fire Violations In Schools Here Is Drafted
description: School Chancellor Irving Anker agreed yesterday to a plan for the Fire Department to work closely with the Board of Education to correct quickly 158 fire violations in more than 100 schools.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: WASHINGTON. Dec. 26 (UPI)A new professional sports venture, World Team Boxing, will open competition Jan. 16 with four teams it was announced today. Sean Downey, promoter of the enterprise, said the first W.T.B. competition would match Montreal against Portland (Me.) at the Portland Exposition Hall. Downey said teams from Boston and Providence, R.I., also would begin a 22match schedule in January.

title: Business Briefs
description: The help wanted advertising index fell 8 points November to 86, the Conference Board said yesterday. The November reading was 34 points below the level of November, 1973. The base of 100 is for 1967.

title: Exchange Clerks Get NotSoPerfect Gifts
description: There were many returns of the season, happy and otherwise, in the citys stores yesterday, as New Yorkers brought their unwanted Christmas gifts back for exchanges or refunds.

title: Season's Biggest Ski Crowd Is Expected After New England Snowstorm
description: BETHEL, Me., Dec. 26The snowcloaked Sunday River ski area, pitched in the middle of the Longfellow Mountains' range, got off to a shaky start this morning. Les Otten, the resort's 25yearold manager, drove his car off the area's access road trying to avoid a sanding truck. At about the same time, Tom Walker, the director of Sunday River's ski school, which has 15 teachers, broke his glasses entering the base lodge. The goldrimmed spectacles fell from his hand while he was wiping them and clattered on the lodge floor.

title: Hanna Ferronickel Cost Up
description: The Hanna Mining Company said yesterday it was raising the price of ferronickel by 16 cents a pound to $1.97 a pound of nickel content following price increases announced earlier by the International Nickel Company of Canada, Ltd. Hanna produces about 26 million pounds of nickel annually, or about 6 per cent of current United States nickel consumption. Ferronickel is used mainly in producing stainleis and steels.

title: Rutgers, Fordham Advance at Garden
description: The 23d annual Holiday Festival basketball tournament got off to an exciting start at Madison Square Garden last night as Rutgers outran Seton Hall and beat the Pirates, 8981. Then Fordham, led by the secondhalf performance of Kevin Fallon, came charging from behind to defeat Manhattan, 8270.

title: PRICES ARE HIGHER ON AMEX AND OTC
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange and in the overthecounter market closed higher yesterday as trading stepped up slightly.

title: Penn State In Land Of Cotton
description: DALLAS, Dec. 26 (AP) Raw cold greeted Penn State's arrival on the Cotton Bowl scene today and inflation canceled the traditional gifts of fancy cowboy hats they would have received in other years. But Coach Joe Paterno was almost cheerful about the weather because there was no snow.

title: Metric System: Liters Are Coming
description: WASHINGTON (UPI)  In 1975 the sixpack of SevenUp on the grocery shelf will consist of six short, squat halfliter bottles.

title: PostChristmas Shopping Surges at Stores in the City
description: The day after Christmas was like the day before Christmas in many of the city's big storesjammed with customers in a buying mood.

title: Israel and Egypt Reported Far Apart on SinaiStands
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 26New and conspicuous diplomatic tension seems to be building between the United States and Israel in advance of the next round of negotiations with Egypt over the Sinai Peninsula.

title: A.F.C. Game a Sellout
description: OAKLAND, Dec. 26 (AP)The American Football Conference championship game between the Pittsburgh Steelers and Oakland Raiders became a sellout today and will be televised locally Sunday.

title: Germany's Jobless Rate Up
description: NUERNBERG, West Germany, Dec. 26 (UPI)West Germany's jobless rate averaged 2.6 per cent for the entire year, the highest proportion of unemployed in 15 years, the Federal employment office said today. The present number of 600,000 unemployed can be expected to rise to one million, or 4 per cent, this winter, Josef Stingl, employment director, said.

title: Wednesday's Fights.
description: Izegem, Belgium  JeanPierre Coopman, 203 pounds, Belgiu10. outpointed Vasco Faustino, 214, Brazil, 10 rounds.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: Plan Is Offered to Channel Oil Money to Poor Lands
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26A plan to transfer $3billion a year to the world's poorest countries at a cost to United States taxpayers of less than $200million a year has been developed by the Trilateral Commission, a group of nongovernmental leaders from North America, Western Europe and Japan.

title: Christmas Collection Gone
description: POUGHKEEPSIE, N.Y., Dec. 26 (AP)An estimated total of $10,000, most of it collected during Christmas masses, was reported missing today from a safe at St. Mary's Church here, the police said. The money was placed in the safe yesterday, and the police said they had no immediate indication of whether the safe had been forced.

title: I.A.'s Budget Is So Secret That Even Most Members of Congress Know Nothing About It
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26Evcry year, the Senate and House vote to allot money to the Central Intelligence Agency. But most members of Congress de not know how much money they are allocating, or what will be used for.

title: Boy, Missing for 6 Days, Found Near Naples, Fla.
description: NAPLES, Fla., Dec. 26 (UPI)Christopher Carrier, (UPI)Christopher Carrier, the 10yearold son of a prominent lawyer from Coral Gables who has been missing since last Friday, was found alive tonight by a hunter in Collier County, 125 miles from the spot where he disappeared.

title: Mild Reveals His Assets To the Japanese Public
description: TOKYO, Dec. 26In an effort to increase public confidence in his leadership, Premier Takeo Miki today made public a list of his persbnal assets, the first time a Japanese head of government has done so.

title: Law and Vengeance
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C.Another year, another Christmas, have passed and T. J. Reddy, James Grant and Charles Parker are still in prison near here. Another hearing has been held, a judge Sam J. Ervin 3d, son of the retiring Senator  is weighing the evidence again. So the drama of the Charlotte Three drags on, and as Mr. Reddy put it in one of the 400 poems he has Written in prison:

title: Baraka Drops Racism For Socialism of Marx
description: NEWARK, Dec. 26  Amiri Baraka, the prolific poet and playwright turned political activist, who has emerged during the last decade as a major intellectual force in the blacknationalist movement in this country, now says that movement must change its focus and direction because it has become ineffective and racist.

title: Howmet Shuts Down Plant
description: GREENWICH, Conn.; Dec. 26 (UPI)The Howmet Corporation has shut down its Eastern aluminum extrusion plant in Philadelphia because of poor orders. The company is continuing extrusion operations in Ithe Southern extrusions division at Magnolia, Ark., and Texas extrusions at Rockwall, lex. About 100 workers are affected by the Philadelphia shutdown.

title: NEW YORK SURTAX STARTS NEXT WEEK
description: New York State's onagain, offagain 2.5 per cent incometax surcharge is scheduled to go into effect again next week. If it lasts throughout the year, the tax will add about $15 to the average citizen's tax bill, but Senate Republicans are expected to work for its suspension.

title: About New York
description: This is when the action is off in the city, when things are in between. Christmas was here and left, and all over New York yesterday people woke up, sighed and thought: That's that, I have done it again, I have survived Christmas. It was not unpleasant, and it was even buoyant. All that New York has to worry about now is New Year's Eve.

title: Container Plant Planned
description: The International Paper Company announced yesterday plans for a $4.3million expansion at the container division's corrugated container plant at Statesville, N. C. It will provide additional capacity in the fast growing Southeastern markets where poultry, food processing and manmade fibers industries are concentrated. Completion is scheduled by January, 1976.

title: Paxton Blair, ExState Justice And Solicitor General, 82, Dies
description: Paxton Blair, a former New York State Supreme Court Justice and State Solicitor General, died Wednesday in Great Barrington, Mass. He was 82 years old and lived in Hillsdale, N.Y.

title: Bing's Shot 0:06 Left, Defeats Knicks, 8483
description: DETROIT, Dec. 26  The Detroit Pistons' walking wounded defeated the suffering Knicks, 8483, tonight on a basket by Dave Bing, one of those wounded, with six seconds remaining. Bing's 12foot baseline jump shot came 16 seconds after Earl Monroe had put New York ahead, 8382, in a hectic finish before a standingroom crowd of 11,265 at Cobo Arena.

title: People in Sports
description: For the first time in the 20year history of United Press International's award to the National Football League rookie of the year, recognition went yesterday to an interior lineman. John Hicks, the New York Giants' starting right guard, won by one vote over Wilbur Jackson, a running back with the San Francisco 49ers.

title: ANSWER TO PREVIOUS PUZZLE
Union Oil Is Facing Antitrust Charges In California Suit
description: MARTINEZ, Calif., Dec. 26 (UPI)  An antitrust suit brought by California's Attorney General, Evelle Younger, was filed in Contra Costa County Superior Court today against the Union Oil Company.

title: Market Place How to Please Some of the People
description: Shareholders with long memories are not fully convinced by some management's expression of pleasure over dividends lately. Take the Ronson Corporation as a case in point.

title: Blue Shield Rates Up
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Dec. 26 (UPI)About 2.8 million Pennsylvania Blue Shield subscribers will be paying $23.9million more in annual premiums under an increase announced today by the State Insurance Commissioner, William Sheppard. Mr. Sheppard said the increase would take effect Feb. 1.

title: Rooney Confident His Steelers Will Defeat Raiders
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 26 (AP) Art Rooney, who learned the value of objectivity as a dispassionate horseplayer, is Convinced his Pittsburgh Steelers can win the Super Bowl.

title: Steingut and Esposito Face Inquiry on Nursing Homes
description: A United States Senate subcommittee yesterday asked Stanley Steingut, who is scheduled to become Speaker of the new State Assembly, and Meade H. Esposito, the Brooklyn Democratic leader, to describe their involvement with the nursinghome industry in New York.

title: City Seeks to Settle Its Suit Against JGE Enterprises
description: Lawyers for Gerald (What's the story, Jerry?) Rosenberg and his brother and business partner, Charles, and for the City Department of Consumer Affairs negotiated for two and onehalf hours yesterday afternoon in an attempt to settle the department's $250,000 lawsuit charging violation of consumer protection laws.

title: Sadat Gets Brezhnev Note; Top Aides to Visit Soviet
description: CAIRO, Dec. 26  Foreign Minister Ismail Fahmy of Egypt will make an unexpected trip to Moscow on Saturday accompanied by Gen. Mohammed Abdel Ghany elGamasy, who was named Egypt's Commander in Chief and Defense Minister tonight, informed political sources said.

title: A Break Cuts Off Water To 30 Queens Families
description: A 12inch water main ruptured in a residential neigh borhood in Belle Harbor, Queens, shortly before sunrise yesterclay, cutting off water to about 30 families for 11 hours and flooding the basements of several homes.

title: Rockets Triumph
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 26 (UPI) Kevin Kunnert, pressed into service by the sudden retirement of Zaid AbdulAziz, scored 18 points and Calvin Murphy hit 21 tonight to lead the Houston Rockets to a 11486 victory over the Atlanta Hawks. into service by the sudden retirement of Zaid AbdulAziz, scored 18 points and Calvin Murphy hit 21 tonight to lead the Houston Rockets to a 11486 victory over the Atlanta Hawks.

title: New Books
description: GENERAL

title: HELMS WAS VAGUE IN 1973 ON SPY BID
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26  Richard Helms told the Senate Foreign Relations Committee in 1973 that he could not recall whether the White House had urged the Central Intelligence Agency to engage in domestic spying because of increasing antiwar activity in 1969 and 1970.

title: Mood of Portuguese: Hope Amid Troubles
description: LISBON, Dec. 20Economic depression, political conflict, social tension and a general sense of uncertainty about where the country is headed are all part of the Portuguese scene. But the future contains at least a promise of democracy and the start of economic reform after half a century in which it seemed that Portugal was frozen into a repressive political and economic system.

title: Bridge. A.C B.L. Steadily Improves Its Books on World Tourney
description: If there were an award for the best series of bridge books, the annual record of world team championships produced by the American contract Bridge League would be a standout choice. Since the first such effort in 1953, these books have shown a steady improvement every year in every respect except production time.

title: AIRLINES ACCUSED OF AIDING VI.P.'S
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 26The Civil Aeronautics Board's enforcement staff said today that 20 airlines, including virtually all of the nation's largest, illegally gave preferential treatment to Government officials and others whose influence could affect the airlines' future.

title: IRENE BOSE, AIDED VILLAGERS IN INDIA
description: Irene Mott Bose, a leader in village welfare services at Nagpur, India, died there Sunday at the age of 75.

title: People and Business
description: Chester Bowles, who served as price administrator and economic stabilization director from 1943 to 1946, said in an interview yesterday that a freeze on wages, prices and rent, similar to the freeze imposed during World War II, would almost certainly curb the runaway inflation that faces us today.

title: Woman and Her 4 Children Found Murdered in Virginia
description: MARTINSVILLE, Va., Dec. 26 (UPI)A 34yearold woman (UPI)A 34yearold woman and her four children, aged to 10, were found slain today in the hamlet of Preston in Henry County, a county sheriff's office spokesman said. (UPI)A 34yearold woman and her four children, aged to 10, were found slain today in the hamlet of Preston in Henry County, a county sheriff's office spokesman said.

title: Blues. Penguins Deadlock
description: PITTSBURGH, Dec. 26 (UPDThe St. Louis Blues rallied for two goals in the second period tonight and tied the Pittsburgh Penguins, 22.

title: Panel to Consider Easing Laws on Drunken Driving
description: TRENTON, Dec. 27 (AP)A special study commission concluded today that one of its principal concerns would be to decide if New Jersey was too tough on drunken drivers.

title: Harsh Penalties for Tot
description: Two years ago the National Commission on Marijuana and Drug Abuse reported that marijuana was a low priority risk compared with other drugs, including alcohol, and recommended the elimination of legal penalties for private possession and use while retaining stiff criminal penalties for marijuana traffickers.

title: JUDGE HERE CURBS LAW SECRETARIES
description: The presiding justice of the Appellate Division, Second Department of State Supreme Court, issued a directive yesterday barring law secretaries from holding office in political organizations and said he would enforce a court rule that bars them from practicing law except in rare cases.

title: Front Warns of Massacre
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Dec, 27 (UPI)The Eritrean Liberation Front said in a statement issued here today that is was stepping up its fight for independence from Ethiopia. It warned the world of an imminent Ethiopian massacre of the Eritrean people.

title: Crime Fighting
description: The street murder Christmas night of an Italian visitor trying to protect his wife from a mugger near their midtown hotel provides assurance that New Yorkers will enter 1975 with the same sets of anxieties and fears about crime that haunted them during 1974. Among the New Year's resolutions New Yorkers would most welcome from their Governorelect and from their Mayor would be one that promised a searching review of the criminal justice nonsystem in this city and some attempt to make it work better next year.

title: Stock Prices Decline on Bearish Reports
description: Adverse economic news yesterday sent stock prices slightly lower in moderate trading and ended the technical rally of the two previous sessions.

title: Now In New York Only in America!
description: Let's face it ... while the Yuletide season is a time for universal celebration, those of us in America celebrate it with a special panache Caught up in the generous American style, two of the Schrafft's restaurantsthe one at 57th St, and Third Ave. and the one at 68th St and Third  are expanding its marvelous Dinner in the American Tradition, from offering it only on Sundays, to offering it seven days a week! I'm all for thatwhy should the Schrafft's bargain be available only on Sundays? Tradition, a la?? Schrafft's (and the Schrafft's name is an American tradition in its own right!) means a complete dinner for a ridiculously low $6.95. And a complete dinner a la Schrafft's means (1) appetizer; (2) an entree of either Turkey with giblet gravy and candied yams OR elegant Sliced Steak simmered in a luscious sherrybased gravy; (3) either a potato or crisp green salad; (4) a rich dessert; (5) freshly brewed coffee. As if this, weren't enough, Schrafft's, in remembering its early days and early fans, is now offering a 50% discount on this already rock bottom price to all Senior Citizens. By simply showing Senior Citizen identification, all grandmas and grandpas can dine in a prince's style, at a pauper's price!

title: Rita Preisser Is Bride Of T. J. McGoldrick
description: Rita Howard Preisser of Eastchester, N.Y., widow of Walter J. Preisser, was married here yesterday to Thomas J. McGoldrick, director of retail sales at the Television Bureau of Advertising. The Rev. Patrick J. Howard, cousin of the bride, performed the ceremony in the Lady Chapel of St. Patrick's Cathedral, assisted by Msgr. Daniel P. Byrne, who also concelebrated the nuptial mass.

title: A New Year's GoingOut Guide To Dance, Drink and Party By
description: On Tuesday night, as they have for about 350 years, New Yorkers will welcome a New Year with spirits or spirituality, depending upon persuasion.

title: Yale, Harvard Bow in Hockey
description: DETROIT, Dec. 26The University of Michigan hockey team upset previously unbeaten Harvard, 32, tonight with three goals in the third period in the opening game of the Great Lakes invitation tournament at the Olympia. Although outshot, 4122, Michigan was saved time and again by the spectacular net minding of Robbie Moore.

title: Lawyers and Scholars Score Antipornography Group
description: THOUSAND OAKS, Calif.A national clearing house to promote pornography prosecutions, set up and financed by the Department of Justice on the campus of a small sectarian college here, has come under strong attack from legal and academic critics.

title: Morgan Stanley Is Sued By Occidental Petroleum
description: The Occidental Petroleum Corporation said here yesterday that it had sued Morgan Stanley & Co., the investment banking house, for breach of contract and fiduciary duty as an outgrowth of a proposed tender offer by the Standard Oil Company (Indiana) for Occidental stock.

title: Braves Triumph
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Dec. 27 (AP)The Buffalo front three of Jack Marin, Jim McMillian and Bob McAdoo combined for 68 points as the Braves defeated the Phoenix Suns, 108.92, in the N.B.A. tonight.

title: Chlorine Kills 2 in Malaga
description: MALAGA, Spain, Dec. 27 (Reuters)  Two longshoremen died and nearly 100 people were overcome when chlorine gas escaped from a burst tank at the port here today, hospital officials said, The sea breeze carried the fumes from the docks and people dropped unconscious on the street.

title: Finch to Oppose Tunney For California Senator
description: SAN MARINO, Cal., Dec. 27 (AP)  Robert H. Finch, formor Presidential counselor, announced his candidacy for the Senate today, declaring that the race would be a classic confrontation between myself and Senator John V. Tunney, a liberal Democrat. Mr. Tunney's term expires in 1976., Mr. Finch said he was entering the race early because of the pressure of the economy, to boost the Republican image and make a statement on the new campaign financing law.

title: MIGHTY CLOUDS SING SLICK GOSPEL STYLE
description: Roots and branches hang out at the Apollo, where the current showwhich runs until Wednesdayis headed by Harold Melvin and the Blue Notes. The roots are contained in the black gospel stylings of the opening act, the Mighty Clouds of Joy, a group full of say yeahs and Lord hairs mercies and about as slick as any that can be found in this increasingly professional aspect of music. But for all the brimstone, the Clouds are able to inject contemporary references into their music. All It Needs Is a Little More Time during Thursday's performance, for instance, is turned into a newscast broadcasting the troubles of the day, from Boston to the White House.

title: Getting Through
description: When two former Secretaries of Commerce, a dozen or so of the nation's leading industrialists and that peripatetic economist from Harvard, John Kenneth Galbraith, all manage to agree on something of national importance, it is probably worth noticing. We hope that their call for a strong and comprehensive energy policy will get through to the man in the WIN sweater on the ski slopes at Vail.

title: 4 Presidents Set Mediation In MaliUpper Volta Dispute
description: LOME, Togo, Dec. 27 (Reuters)Four African Presidents today agreed to form a mediation commission to help settle a border dispute between Mali and Upper Volta.

title: ANSWER TO PREVIOUS PUZZLE
Japan's Trade Surplus
description: TOKYO, Dec. 27Japan continued to have a sizable surplus in her trade balance in November because of strong export business, the Finance Ministry announced today.

title: Soviet ATest Reported
description: UPPSALA, Sweden, Dec. 27 (AP)  A tremor apparently caused by an underground nuclear test in the Semipalatinsk area of Soviet Kazakhstan was reported today at Uppsala University's seismologic institute.

title: JOHN A. FRICK
description: BETHLEHEM, Pa., Dec. 27 (AP)John A. Frick, former president of the AllentownBethlehemEaston Gas Company, died yesterday in St. Luke's Hospital. He was 94 years old.

title: Four Women: Their Lobby Is Washington
description: WASHINGTONThis city abounds in talented women holding demanding jobs, but there are four who think they have the best jobs in town.

title: China Charges Soviet Made High Profits in Mideast War
description: HONG KONG, Dec. 27 (Reuters)The Chinese press agency Hsinhua said today that the Soviet Union had made staggering profits by exchanging arms for oil during the Middle East war in October, 1973.

title: People in Sports
description: Zaid AbdulAziz, the starting center for the Houston Rockets of the National Basketball Association, has informed the team that he is retiring immediately. The 6foot10inch pivotman had announced earlier this year that the current season would be his final one. He said he wanted to devote more time to the Islamic faith.

title: STOCKS DECLINE AMEX TRADING
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange dropped yesterday after rising the day before in desultory trading. In the overthecounter market, prices were mixed on accelerated activity.

title: Laos Sends Coalition Panel To Try to Settle Dispute
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Dec. 27 (AP)  The coalition Government sent a delegation of Communists and rightists today to negotiate with rebel soldiers holding the border town of Ban Houayxay in northwest Laos.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: AHOSKIE, N. C., Dec. 27 (AP)An attorney for Jim (Catfish) Hunter said tonight the field had been narrowed to eight teams in the bidding for the services of the former Oakland A's righthander, who is now a free agent. He did not specify the eight games.

title: Dave Anderson
description: Nobody talks much about Vietnam anymore. Maybe nobody wants to remember how many lives it ruined. It almost ruined Rocky Bleier's life, too, but he wouldn't let it.

title: The Other News
description: International

title: People and Business A. & S. Names New President
description: Abraham & Straus, the largest department store division of Federated Department Stores, Inc., will have new president, effective Feb. 3. Edward Goodman, 52, who started as an A.&S. trainee in 1946, is leaving his post as president. He will be succeeded by Alan B. Gilman, 44, now chairman of SangerHarris, in Dallas, another Federated division.

title: United Airlines Seeks $5 Rate on Excess Bag
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27 (UPI)United Airlines proposed today a flat rate of $5 for each excess or oversize bag, eliminating the current practice of charging between $4 and $8 per bag depending on the cost of the ticket.

title: BUSING MEASURE VETOED BY SHAPP
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Dec. 27 Gov. Milton T. Shapp vetoed today a socalled antibusing bill that he said could have produced another Boston in Pennsylvania by stripping the Pennsylvania Human Relations Commission of its powers to lend racial desegregation.

title: St. John's Wins, 7856
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I., Dec. 27 St. John's used superior speed and height to win the final openinground game of the Eastern Collegiate Athletic Conference Ocean State tournament, 7856 tonight from the University of Rhode Island. The Redmen will now play South Carolina in a semifinal game tomorrow night. Mel Utley and Kevin Cluess each had 20 points to pace the winners.

title: Stars Turn Back Spirits
description: SALT LAKE CITY Dec, 27 (UPI) Jim Eakins scored 26 points to help the Utah Stars to a 9790 A.B.A. victory over St. Louis tonight.

title: U.S. Press Praised by Institute for Watergate Role
description: ZURICH, Switzerland, Dec. 27 (UPI)Through the part it played in unraveling the Watergate scandal this year, the American press showed the world a democracy conscious of its values and ready to defend them, Ernest Meyer, director of the International Press Institute, said in a report made public today.

title: SHERWIN RECEIVED THREATS IN PRISON
description: TRENTON, Dec. 27 (AP)A state official confirmed today that threats had been made against Paul Sherwin, former Secretary of State, while he was in Trenton State Prison during October.

title: Ballet: A Massive Stint
description: The whole idea of Nureyev and Friends, which opened a fiveweek engagement at the Uris Theater last night, is gloriously extravagant. There will be 34 performances, with the same four ballets at each performance, and ballet's superstar, Rudolf Nureyev, will dance not only at every performance but in every ballet at every performance. Anna Pavlova pushed herself hard, but never quite like this.

title: Exiled Thai Leader Seized On Unexpected Trip Home
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Dec. 27 Former Premier Thanom Kittikachorn was reported to be under arrest here today, following his unexpected return to Thailand after nearly 15 months of exile in Boston.

title: Article 1  No Title
Open Interest
CITY TO INCREASE FEES FOR METERS
description: The city plans to double parkingmeter fees along Madison and Lexington Avenues north of 60th Street next month to reduce congestion and raise money to help meet the budget deficit this year, the Traffic Department said yesterday.

title: Seven Utilities Seeking to Form a New Company
description: The state's seven major electric utilities asked the New York State Public Service Commission yesterday for authority to purchase stock in a company they have formed to raise nearly $20billion for construction and operation of powergeneration stations in the next decade.

title: International Exchange Ticket Popular Ski Item Along Border
description: MONT SUTTON, Quebec, Dec. 27  In this Eastern Townships region of the Province of Quebec, an international exchange lift ticket, valid on both sides of the border, continues to be a highly popular item. For $24, a skier can purchase a billet (a ticket) valid at five Canadian resorts as well as at one American area. Mont Sutton, Bromont, Orford, Echo and Owl's Head are cooperating with Jay Peak in Vermont in the promotion.

title: Judge Lectures Man Who Finds FrenchCuisine Odor Distasteful
description: To the lite of international society, government, and the arts, La Goulue, a Parisianstyle restaurant at 28 East 70th Street, has meant gleaming wood paneling, shiny brass guard rails, a bronz bar, elegant French dining and a tulip on each table.

title: GOLD PRICER $2 TO A $195.75 HIGH
description: LONDON, Dec. 27The price of gold rose to a record level again today in moderate trading on the European bullion markets in a further reaction to the approaching legalization of gold ownership by Americans.

title: Music: Arf and So On
description: If there are any music lovers in the nation today who are not aware of the music of P.D. Q. Bach (18071742?), it is not Peter Schickele's fault. For a decade, now, Mr. Shickele has been discovering (inventing?) and performing this music with extraordinary industry and not a little success. There are a halfdozen recordings of P. D. Q.'s incomparable compositions, and live concerts of them continue to multiply.

title: Miss Potter Has Nuptials
description: Brenda T. Potter, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Carl William Timpson of Cedarhurst, L. I., and Hobe Sound, Fla., was married here at noon yesterday to Andlre O. Koehn, a stockbroker with Wood Walker.

title: Treasury Bills Rose At the Weekly Auction
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27Yields rose on Treasury bills auctioned today in both the 91day and 180day maturities.

title: News Summary and Index
description: The Commerce Department reported that the United States balance of export and import trade slipped back into a modest deficit in November after a small surplus in October. The deficit, $113million, was the sixth in the last seven months, and brought the excess of imports over exports for the year to $2.4billion. The deficit was more than accounted for by one product, oil. [31:3.]

title: Disease Still a Threat
description: DARWIN, Dec. 27 (Reuters) Maj. Gen. Alan Stretton, the head of relief operations here, said today that the threat of an outbreak of disease was still major problem but that food supplies were sufficient.

title: NEWS INDEX
description: News Summary and Index, Page 25

title: JAPAN EXPECTING REVERSAL OF LAG
description: TOKYO, Dec. 27 (Reuters)The Japanese Government's economic planning agency predicted today that the current recession in Japan would bottom out by next March, when a slow recovery is expected to start.

title: CROSSWORD PUZZLE
description: ACROSS

title: Girl, 9, Burned by Heater
