description: NEWARK, Dec. 27 (AP) Mary Preziosi, 9 years old, was listed in fair condition at Martland Medical Center today after suffering seconddegree burns when her clothes caught fire from an electric heater in the living room of her Newark home. Her father, James Preziosi, 24, suffered burns on his hands in trying to beat out the flames. Mary Preziosi, 9 years old, was listed in fair condition at Martland Medical Center today after suffering seconddegree burns when her clothes caught fire from an electric heater in the living room of her Newark home. Her father, James Preziosi, 24, suffered burns on his hands in trying to beat out the flames.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: The amenities of a firstclass French restaurant are as important to civilized living as clean, unpolluted air and the hushed stillness of the night.Justice Edward J. Greenfield in refusing an injunction sought the ground that odors emanating from La Goulue Restaurant were objectionable. [16:1.]

title: Article 3  No Title
description: In another development the Inland Steel Company announced baseprice increases, averaging 1 per cent of its line of steel mill products, effective next Monday.

title: Louisville Wins Its Tourney
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Dec. 27 (AP)Allen Murphy scored 20 points to lead Louisville to a 7961 victory over Florida State tonight in Louisville's Holiday Classic.

title: Japan's Premier Plans PoliticalFund Reform
description: TOKYO, Dec. 27  Premier Takeo Miki made public today a program to reform his ruling LiberalDemocratic party's handling of political contributions to eliminate the distorted image of the party in its relation with business enterprises.

title: 3 Boston School Officials In Contempt Over Busing
description: BOSTON, Dec. 27Federa?? District Judge W. Arthur Gar?? rity Jr. held three Boston School Committeemen in civil contempt of court today for refusing to approve a citywide busing pla?? for school desegregation.

title: 3 SEIZE DRUGGIST TO GET METHADONE
description: Three armed men held a pharmacist captive in his home Thursday night while they used his keys to take thousands of methadone tablets from the safe at the Beth Israel Methadone Clinic at Harlem Hospital.

title: Pacers Ask League for Financial Aid
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Dec. 27 (AP)The Indiana Pacers, once one of the most solid franchises in the American Basketball Association but now in deep financial trouble, announced today they would remain in Indianapolis but had asked the league for temporary assistance.

title: Air Control Is Studied
description: STANFORD, Calif. (UPI) The possibility of controlling the ionization of the earth's atmosphere has been suggested by scientists at Stanford University who have had some success with a lowfrequency transmitter set up on the Antarctic continent.

title: EDWIN ROBITZEK
description: Edwin Robitzek, a past president of the Westchester County Golf Association and the Metropolitan Golf Association, died Wednesday, apparently of a heart attack, while on a visit in Redding, Conn. He was 65 years old and lived at 240 earth Road, Scarsdale, N.Y.

title: President Ford conferring w energy chief,
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Dec. 27  Judge Martin Ginsberg of Family Court was found guilty today of one count of perjury for having denied before a grand jury that he had received money from two businessmen in exchange for promises to use his influence in their behalf.

title: Art. Cultural Center Honors Bouguereau
description: There is weaponry in esthetics, as much as in anything else. Some words wound, others kill. The position of ultimate deterrent has been occupied for many years by the name of a oncefamous, onceloved French academic painter, WilliamAdolphe Bouguereau (18251905 To say of someone in print that he is the Bouguereau of our day is to finish him offin intention, at any rate. To say it to his face is to invite a shootout, verbal or physical, which will prompt the timid witness to duck behind the sofa. Bouguereau stands in everyday usage for everything that was false, stuffy, conventionbound and overblown in the academic art of the second the 19th century.

title: Business Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27 (AP)A record level of new claims for unemployment benefits drove the Government's indicator of future trends in the economy down for the fourth consecutive month in November, the Commerce Department said today.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Corruption at Grumman Charged

title: ExWestchester Supervisor Named to State Inquiry Unit
description: ALBANY, Dec. 27 (UPI) Governor Wilson today appointed Arnold D. Roseman of New Rochelle, a Democrat, to the State Commission of Investigation to succeed the late Judge Edward S. Silver of Brooklyn. Members of the commission are paid $32,465 a year.

title: In Memoriam
description: FRANKIda. You left us on this day, Mother darling. Your beautiful face is lovingly before me every day. NETTIE

title: Mrs. Court Gains at Aussie Net
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Dec. 27 (AP)  Margaret Court, seeking the 12th singles crown in the Australian open tennis championships, and Evonne Goolagong, the defender, led the advance today into the third round.

title: PROSECUTOR BIDS WATERGATE JURY CLOSE THE LEDGER
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27The prosecution wound up the final arguments at the Watergate coverup trial today by telling the jurors that it was now up to them to balance the accounts and close the ledgers on Watergate.

title: Ratelle Line Clicks for 5 Goals As Rangers Rout Sabres, 95
description: Now the injuryplagued Rangers know the exhilaration the Boston Bruins must have felt eight days ago when they punished New York, 113.

title: SEOUL REGIME'S FOE SEIZED BY VETERANS
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Dec. 27 South Korean riot policemen today freed Kim Young Sam, the opposition party leader from a 10hour captivity by 200 army veterans in the provincial, city of Taegu.

title: FORD AND 15 AIDES NARROW OPTIONS ON ENERGY POLICY
description: VAIL, Colo., Dec. 27Prestlent Ford met with 15 advisers today in an effort to formulate new policy proposals on energy that would increase the supply and restrict consumption.

title: Carey Names Group to Study State Funds for Local Police
description: A study group on law enforcement was appointed yesterday by Governorelect Hugh L. Carey to work out how to redeem a campaign pledge for greater state financial assistance to local police departmeats.

title: Argentine Cattle Industry Is in Crisis
description: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 27 The sweet smell of roasting beef drifted through the muggy summer air in the downtown area. Parkinglot attendants, construction workers and street repairmen have once again taken to cooking slabs of prime sirloin on crude charcoal grills on top of empty paint cans.

title: Close Survey of C.I.A. Opposed by Goldwater
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Dec. (AP) Congress will be making a big mistake if it undertakes too strong an investigation of the Central Intelligence Agency for alleged domestic spying, Senator Barry Goldwater, Republican of Arizona, said today.

title: Soviet Dissident Arrested in Inquiry On Secret Journal
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 27Sergei Kovalev, a dissident biologist who is active in the small Soviet human rights movement, was arrested today by Soviet authorities investigating an underground Lithuanian Roman Catholic journal, it was reported tonight.

title: Edith D. Cullen Is Wed to Robert Innis
description: Edith Dalton Cullen, daughter of Mr, and Mrs. Ronald Dennis Cullen of Canton, Ohio, was married there last evening to Robert Innis, son of Mrs. Robert Charles Innis of Kalamazoo, Mich., and the late Mr. Innis. The couple is from New York, where the bride is assistant to the curator of drawings at the Metropolitan Museum of Art and her husband is an assistant vice president of the Bancroft Convertible Fund.

title: WINE TALK
description: This is the season for Champagne. And, in a way, that is unfortunate. Most people drink Champagne at the wrong time, in the wrong way and for the wrong reasons, and this is particularly so at holiday time. Yes, and at weddings, too.

title: Charles Einfeld, Fox Executive Who Originated Junkets, Dies
description: Charles Einfeld, a leading promotional executive in motion pictures who retired in 1963 as vice president in charge of advertising and publicity for 20th CenturyFox, died yesterday in Ascona, Switzerland, where he lived. His age was 73.

title: U.C.L.A., Maryland In Final
description: COLLEGE PARK, Md., Dec. 27 (AP)  Steve Sheppard scored 26 points to lead Maryland past Georgia Tech, 10567, and the University of California. Los Angeles overcame the deliberate tactics of St. Bonaventure to win, 7862, tonight in the first round of the Maryland Invitation tournament.

title: Egyptians to Visit Moscow
description: MOSCOW, Dec, 27 (Reuters) Egyptian officials in Moscow confirmed, today that Foreign Minister Ismail Fahmy and the new War Minister, Mohammed Abdel Ghany elGamasy, were due tomorrow for talks with Soviet leaders.

title: EFTA COUNTRIES HIT BY RISE IN OIL PRICE
description: GENEVA, Dec. 27 (Reuters)The total trade deficit of the seven member countries of the European Free Trade Association almost doubled to about $10billion in 1974 because of higher oil prices, the association reported today.

title: Heroic Fireman Is Honored Here
description: Five hundred uniformed firemen, joined by Mayor Beame, gathered yesterday at the Holy Family Church in Westerleigh, S. I., for the funeral of one of the rescuers in the fire last Friday at 83d Street and Broadway.

title: Senate in Jersey Fails on Tax Plan
description: TRENTON, Dec. 27  The State Senate agreed today to meet in a special session on Jan. 6 after trying again but falling at the 11th hour to devise a tax program to meet the State Supreme Court's Dec. 31 deadline for a new system of financing New Jersey's public schools.

title: Police Seek ExBoyfriend Of Slain Woman in Queens
description: A 40yearold unemployed shoe salesman with a record of 11 arrests was identified yesterday by the police as the major suspect in the Christmas Day murder of a 25yearold woman in her apartment in Kew Gardens, Queens.

title: WHITE HOUSE CRASH RESULTS IN CHARGE
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27 (AP)  The man who crashed his automobile into the White House grounds Christmas morning was charged today with destruction of Federal property.

title: Pentagon Accused of 1958 Drive For Nuclear Plan Against China
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27 (UPI) The Pentagon tried to get President Eisenhower to approve the use of tactical nuclear weapons in 1958 during a confrontation between Nationalist and Communist China, the columnist Jack Anderson said today.

title: Family Court Judge Is Convicted on L.I. On Perjury Charge
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Dec. 27Judge Martin Ginsberg of Family Court was found guilty today of one count of perjury for having denied before a grand jury that he had received money from two businessmen in exchange for promises to use his influence in their behalf.

title: Amy Vanderbilt, 66, Falls to Death Here
description: Amy Vanderbilt, the syndicated columnist on etiquette, fell or jumped to her death last night from a secondstory window of her residence at 438 East 87th Street, the police said.

title: PROSECUTOR BIDS WATERGATE JURY CLOSE THE LEDGER
description: The prosecution wound up the final arguments at the Watergate coverup trial today by telling the jurors that it was now up to them to balance the accounts and close the ledgers on Watergate.

title: California Standard, Ethyl To Extend LIFO Accounting
description: The Standard Oil Company of California announced yesterday that it would extend the lastin, firstout (LIFO) inventory accounting method to foreign subsidiaries and chemical operations formerly on firstin, firstout (FIFO) basis. The change was expected to reduce 1974 net earnings by about $250million, the company said.

title: Indian Music and Oregon Complement Each Other
description: The program called Interweave on Thursday night at Town Hall actually wound up interweaving for only 10 minutes out of the three and a half hours between the scheduled starting time and the end.

title: Two Jersey Girls, Missing 2 Weeks, Are Found Slain
description: MANALAPAN TOWNSHIP, N, J., Dec. 27 (AP)The partly clad bodies of two Woodbridge girls, missing for two weeks, were found today in a wooded area of this Monmouth County community, the police said.

title: Notes on People
description: In Atlanta, Lieut. Gov. Lester G. Maddox called retiring Gov. Jimmy Carter a radical leftist and a Socialist rather than a Democrat and promised to travel to any part of America to stop the Governor's bid for the 1976 Democratic nomination for President.

title: Iran Would Favor the Arabs If New Mideast War Erupts
description: CAIRO, Dec. 27 (Reuters) Iran's feelings will be with the Arabs if another Middle East war breaks out, Shah Mohammed Riza Pahlevi of Iran said in an interview published today in the semiofficial Cairo newspaper AlAhram. But he said that his country would not join in the fighting, as had been inferred from another interview he gave, because of geographic and other obstacles.

title: Getting the Elderly Away From TV and Into Talk
description: WESTPORT, Conn.  The meeting of the Conversation Club of the Westport Manor Convalescent Home is scheduled for 2 P.M. sharp. The members, in their seventies, eighties and nineties, are brought to the lobby, some in wheel chairs, others walking carefully, clinging to nurses.

title: Amy Vanderbilt, 66, Falls to Death Here
description: Amy Vanderbilt, the syndicated columnist on etiquette, fell or jumped to her death last night from a secondstory window of her residence at 438 East 87th Street, the police said.

title: Rites Honor Victims of Battle of Bulge
description: SAINLEZ, Belgium, Dec. 26 On Christmas Day 30 years ago, 30 civilians huddled in a barn near the Sainlez church as an American relief column heading for nearby Bastogne was stalled by Nazi forces entrenched here.

title: LOTTERY NUMBERS
A New Year's GoingOut Guide To Dance, Drink and Party By
description: On Tuesday night, as they have for about 350 years, New Yorkers will welcome a New Year with spirits or spirituality, depending upon persuasion.

title: SENATE IN JERSEY FAILS ON TAX PLAN
description: TRENTON, Dec. 27  The State Senate agreed today to meet in a special session on Jan. 6 after trying again but failing at the 11th hour to devise a tax program to meet the State Supreme Court's Dec. 31 deadline for a new system of financing New Jersey's public schools.

title: Oil Slick in Gulf Dwindles
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 27 (UPI)An oil slick that once stood only three miles from the Louisiana coast retreated about eight miles more into the Gulf of Mexico, the Coast Guard said today. It said a helicopter flight last night showed the slick had dwindled.

title: Bridge: Declarer Not Always Clear On Trick Total He Will Take
description: It is a truth universally acknowledged, as that wellknown Bridge player Jane Austen might have said, that the number of tricks taken by the declarer and the tricks taken by the defense must total 13. However, it is not always clear to the declarer at the start of the play that this well  known conclusion will be reached. It appears to him not infrequently that he can take nine tricks, that.the defenders can take three and that one is in limbo.

title: Antiques: Finding Faults
description: NEW HAVENHow seldom we are treated to antiques exhibitions that spell out clearly not only the virtues but also the faults of period objects. Rarer still are shows that teach neophyte viewers how to spot repairs and outright forgeries in vintage designs.

title: ProAbortion Signs in Rome Deplored by Vatican Paper
description: ROME, Dec. 27 (UPI)The Vatican newspaper L'Osservatore Romano said today that proabortion signs and caricatures of Pope Paul VI on display in a Rome square were a shameful profanation of the Holy Year.

title: Senator Gravel's Mother
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass., Dec. 27 (AP)Maria Bourassa Gravel, mother of Senator Mike Gravel, Democrat of Alaska, died today at Springfield Municipal Hospital. She was 74 years old. Her survivors also include two other sons and two daughters.

title: Connecticut School Taxing Is Ruled Unconstitutional
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 27A Superior Court judge in Connecticut ruled today that the state's system of providing financial aid to public schools was unconstitutional.

title: TWO ARE SOUGHT IN WOMAN'S DEATH
description: UNION, Dec. 27A 23yearold robbery suspect and his girlfriend were being sought by the police today in connection with the murder of the man's mother, who was killed a few hours after she bailed her son out of jail.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A 40yearold shoe salesman, with a record of 11 arrests, was identified yesterday by police as the major suspect in the Christmas Day murder of a 25yearold woman in her Kew Gardens, Queens, apartment.

title: Kuwait: No Oil Cut Due
description: KUWAIT, Dec. 27 (AP)Kuwait's oil minister says this oilrich Persian Gulf sheikdom will never reduce oil production to the point of harming Britain or the United States, because that is where it keeps its money.

title: Inquiry on Nursing Homes Here Becomes a Political Issue in Israel
description: The investigation of the American nursinghome syndicate of Bernard Bergman has become a political issue in Israel.

title: Molucca Freedom Group Raids World Court Site at The Hague
description: THE HAGUE, Dec. 27 (Reuters)South Moluccans demanding independence from Indonesia today hurled fire bombs at the Hague Peace Palace, headquarters of the International Court of Justice, after scaling its closed gates, and smashing windows and doors.

title: State Bars 197% Rate Rise For Malpractice Insurance
description: The State Superintendent of Insurance yesterday suspended a 197 per cent rate increase sought by the Argonaut Insurance Company for malpractice insurance for physicians in the state, and ordered the company to continue covering the physicians until public hearings in January. The increase was to have taken effect on Jan. 10.

title: N.C. State Wins Easily
description: RALEIGH, N. C., Dec. 27 (AP) David Thompson scored 39 points tonight, and topranked North Carolina State rolled to an easy 9961 victory over Kent State.

title: Aide to Jailed Briton Says She Knows of Blackmail
description: LONDON, Dec. 27 (UPI)The secretary of John Stonehouse, the British Member of Parliament imprisoned in Australia after entering the country illegally, said today that she knows the names of the persons who the former Cabinet minister said were threatening to blackmail him, forcing him to flee to Australia.

title: The Other News
description: International

title: Scientists Urge 3Man Council To Improve Advice to President
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27Spokesmen for the Federation of American Scientists said today that the President was not receiving expert, timely and impartial scientific advice and urged the Administration to set up a threeperson White House council on science and technology to advise the President.

title: 18 More Strangled in Eritrean Wave of Terror
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopa, Dec, 27 (UPI)  Eighteen more persons have been found strangled by steel wire in a wave of political assassinations in the northern Ethiopian city of Asmara, Western diplomats said today.

title: Hudson Offers Drug Addicts Job and Dope
description: JERSEY CITY, Dec. 27This is the longest job I've had in the last 10 years, said Charles Collins as he plastered cracks in a wall at the prospective offices of the Police Department's internal affairs unit at the Jersey Medical Center complex.

title: Officials Named For Raiders' Game
description: OAKLAND, Dec. 27 (AP)Pete Rozelle, the commissioner of the National Football League, today announced the officials for Sunday's American Conference championship game between the Oakland Raiders and the Pittsburgh Steelers.

title: Jack Benny, 80, Dies of Cancer on Coast
description: Jack Benny, whose brilliant gift for selfdeprecating caricature brought laughter to the nation for 40 years, died late Thursday at his home in Beverly Hills, Calif. He was 80 years old.

title: Insurers, Raising Rates, Plan to Drop Some Lines
description: Consumers and businesses seeking fire and casualty insurance may soon find some forms of insurance unavailable or (from some companies) extremely expensive in parts of the nation.

title: H.E.W. Seeks to End Crisis Over Medical Malpractice Insurance
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27The Department of Health, Education and Welfare is working on emergency measures to make certain that the nation's physicians do not lose their malpractice insurance coverage, Secretary Casper W. Weinberger said today.

title: STATE TO LAY OFF 149 ROAD BUILDERS
description: TRENTON, Dec. 27 (AP)The Department of Transportation announced today that 149 employes were being laid off to save about $1.9million in annual salaries.

title: A Suit to Curb C.I.A. Activities Announced by Rep. Harrington
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27Representative Michael J. Harrington filed a suit today in Federal District Court here to force the Central Intelligence Agency to halt covert intervention in foreign countries and domestic surveillance activities.

title: Durkin Will Petition Senate for a Decision on New Hampshire Race
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27 (AP) John A. Durkin, a Democrat, notified the Senate today that he would be here Monday to contest the certification of Louis C. Wyman, a Republican, as the winner of New Hampshire's Senate race in last November's election.

title: 41 French Coal Miners Killed by Explosion and Fire
description: LIEVIN, France, Dec. 27 (AP)An explosion and fire tore through a 2,100foot deep shaft of a coal mine in this northern French town today, leaving 41 men dead and six badly burned.

title: GRAIN CONTRACTS ADVANCE SLIGHTLY
description: Prices of wheat and corn.futures moved up slightly on the Chicago Board of Trade yesterday, and analysts attributed the rise to a reaction to a price decline that bad gone too far, too quickly. Also, they noted a substantial amount of buying by shorts to even out positions.

title: Musick Resigns as Cornell Coach
description: ITHACA, N. Y., Dec. 27 (AP)Jack Musick resigned today as Head football coach at Cornell University. The school announced Musick's resignation effective immediately, and said it had been requested by Robert J. Kane, the dean of athletics, and Jon T. Anderson, the director of athletics.

title: Connecticut School Taxing Is Ruled Unconstitutional
description: HARTFORD, Dec. 27A Superior Court judge in Connecticut ruled today that the state's system of providing financial aid to public schools was unconstitutional.

title: MORE COMPANIES TO REDUCE WORK
description: The Black & Decker Manufacturing Company said yesterday it would shut down its domestic power tool operations for one week beginning Jan. 13. About 7,500 employes, from hourly workers to executives, will be involved at the company's offices and plants. The company said the continuing economic slowdown had prompted the move in order to bring production and costs closer to current sales rates and prevent a buildup of domestic powertool inventories.

title: PHYLLIS LANGSTAFF
description: Phyllis McVickar Langstaff, a former bacteriologist and chemist, wife of the Rev. John Brett Langstaff, retired rector of St. Edmond's Episcopal Church in the Bronx, died yesterday at her home in Morristown, N. J.

title: Judge Here Curbs Law Secretaries' Extracurricular Activities
description: The presiding justice of the Appellate Division, Second Department of State Supreme Court issued a directive yesterday barring law secretaries from holding office in political organizations and said he would enforce a court rule that bars them from practicing law except in rare cases.

title: Whitlam Arrives
description: DARWIN, Saturday, Dec. 28 (AP)  Prime Minister Gough Whitlam arrived today in Darwin. Mr. Whitlam, who interrupted a European tour, left an air force plane at Darwin airport and rove immediately to the city without talking to reporters.

title: House Unit Brands F.A.A. As Sluggish on Air. Safety
description: A House committee that conducted a ninemonth study of air hazards accused the Federal Aviation Administration yesterday of avoiding leadership and showing signs of sluggishness which at times approaches an attitude of indifference to public safety.

title: Thursday's Fight
description: Zurich, SwitzerlandEleno Ferreira, Brazil, stopped John McCluskey, Scotland, 8 rounds, bantamweights.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: HighRisk Fire Insurance Pool Gets More for Less Business
description: The State Insurance Department approved a 26.2 per cent rate increase yesterday for the New York Property Insurance Underwriting Association, the assignedrisk pool of fire insurance companies set up by the state in 1968 mainly to cover dwellings and businesses in slum areas.

title: Rome Paper Cites Slaying Here And Attacks City as a Jungle
description: ROME, Dec, 27The Rome newspaper with the largest circulation, II Messaggero, today called New York the metropolis of violence and a jungle in a long report on the killing of an Alitalia flight engineer by a mugger in midtown Manhattan on Christmas Day.

title: Post Victor in Ohio
description: ASHLAND, Ohio, Dec. 27 Bert Platt scored a gamehigh 28 points to lead C. W. Post College to a 7370 victory over Otterbein tonight in the opening round of the Ashland invitation tournament. Platt, a 6.2 senior guard shot 13 for 19 from the floor and Post had a 60 per cent shooting performance over all.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Dec. 27 (UPI)Kaiser Steel said today it would raise prices of some products and lower others with a net result of an average of 1.5 per cent.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: The amenities of a firstclass French restaurant are as important to civilized living as clean, unpolluted air and the hushed stillness of the night.Justice Edward J. Greenfield in refusing an injunction sought on the ground that odors emanating from La Goulue Restaurant were objectionable. [16:2.]

title: Uphill Task for Italy
description: The day before Premier Aldo Moro's new Government won its vote of confidence in the Italian Senate, fourteen million workers staged a general strike throughout Italy to demand job guarantees, higher social security payments and costofliving adjustments to cope with a 25 per cent inflation rate. It was only one of many indications of the outsized dimensions of the task facing Italy's 37th Government since the fall of Mussolini.

title: 14 Killed in Mexican Crash
description: Fourteen persons were killed and 15 injured when a tractortrailer truck collided headon with a bus today on a freeway at the edge of Mexico City.

title: A National Institution
description: Although he was successful on television, in nightclubs and even on the stage in oneman shows, Jack Benny was perhaps the most enduring and astonishingly shrewd creation of radio. For anyone growing up in the nineteenthirties and forties, Sunday night at 7 o'clock meant Jack Benny and the gang.

title: TRADE BALANCE BACK IN DEFICIT
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27The United States balance of export and import trade slipped back into a modest deficit in November after a small surplus in October, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: House Unit Brands F.A.A. As Sluggish on Air Safety
description: A House committee that conducted a ninemonth study of air hazards accused the Federal Aviation Administration yesterday of avoiding leadership and showing signs of sluggishness which at times approaches an attitude of indifference to public safety.

title: Pension for Wilson To Come to $52,130
description: ALBANY, Dec. 27 (UPI)The State Controller's office says that Governor Wilson's maximum pension benefits will be $52,130 a year once he leaves office.

title: Scientists Urge 3Man Council To Improve Advice to Presiden
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27Spokesmen for the Federation of American Scientists said today that the President was not receiving expert, timely and impartial scientific advice and urged the Administration to set up a threeperson White House council on science and technology to advise the President.

title: Ondine III of U.S. Takes Yacht Lead
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Dec. 27 (UPI)The 92foot American ketch, Ondine III, was leading the fleet of 63 ocearracing yachts for line honors late today in the SydneytoHobart race.

title: 16 MEDICAL SCHOOLS GRANTED V.A. FUNDS
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28 (AP)  The Veterans Administration has announced grants totaling $2.4million to 16 medical schools and other health professions and occupations.

title: PAYMENT SAVES M'INTIRE CENTER
description: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla., Dec. 27The Rev. Carl McIntire, Fundamentalist radio preacher and political archconservative, made a milliondollar payment tonight, just in time to ward off foreclosure on his Gateway to the Stars enterprises here.

title: Getty Reports on Results Of Alabama OilWell Tests
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 27 (AP)Initial tests on an 18,000foot Alabama well could indicate a significant discovery, according to a Getty Oil Company spokesman.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: Valery Panov and his wife, Galina Ragozina, the former stars of the Kirov Ballet who have emigrated from the Soviet Union, will now make their joint United States debut in Philadelphia on Feb. 4. The performance has been rescheduled from Jan. 7.

title: Lakers Down Bulls, 10593
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 27 (UPI) Lucius Allen scored 37 points and Gale Goodrich added 25 tonight to lead the Los Angeles Lakers to a 10593 N.B.A. triumph over the Chicago Bulls.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: State officials reminded employers in New Jersey that they must pay minimumwage workers an additional 20 cents an hour begining Wednesday, Jan. 1. The State Labor Commissioner, Joseph A. Hoffman, noted on Thursday that New Jersey's minimum wage had been raised to $2 on Aug. 3. He said the second raise in January, would put the state wage at $2.20 per hour, ahead of the Federal minimum wage of $2.

title: P.B.A. CHIEF EASES NAMETAG STAND
description: The president of the Patrol men's Benevolent Association, yesterday modified his position of defiance on the wearing of name tags by police officers.

title: GEORGIA KAY BLENDS MANY PIANO SOURCES
description: The last time Georgia Kay worked here, she was a Powers model, and her face adorned a CocaCola billboard on Times Square. That was during World War II. Shortly afterward, at the urging of Dave Garroway, she gave up modeling in favor of the piano and, for the last 25 years, has been playing in clubs and restaurants in Chicago.

title: Brokers Say Home Loans Have Eased in Last Year
description: PLAINFIELD, Dec. 26 (AP)Mortgage brokers say it is getting easier to buy a house in New Jersey.

title: Delay and Delay and ...
description: Describing auto pollution as a major health hazard for New Yorkers, Air Resources Commissioner Ethan Eldon declared at a Cleaner Air Week ceremony last October: There is no longer a question of debating technology, but of whether we have the political will to control auto pollution or whether we will continue to delay and delay and delay while citizens are exposed to these toxic substances.

title: Used Cars Costlier, but Sales Stay Strong
description: HATFIELD, Pa.  Murray Bilmes, vice president of Laurel Motors, a PlymouthChrysler dealership in Laurelton, Queens, bought five used cars at the weekly Hatfield Recon Center auction here recently and resold three of them within two weeks.

title: Car Kills Student in Israel
description: Janet D. Sandler of South Orange, a student at Hebrew University in Jerusalem, died in Hadassah Hospital there last Monday after being struck by an automobile near the Mount Scopus campus. Miss Sandler, who was 20 years old, had attended public schools in South Orange and was graduated from Columbia High School in Maplewood in 1972. She was the daughter of Florence and Lewis N. Sandler, Her father is president of the Sandler & Worth carpeting chain.

title: For Darwin, Long a BadLuck City, a New Chance
description: DARWIN, Australia, Dec. 27 The cyclone that shattered most of Darwin on Christmas Day struck at a time when this northern city was striving to shake off the rough frontier reputation that had clung to it since its founding in 1869.

title: FORD AND 15 AIDES NARROW OPTIONS ON ENERGY POLICY
description: VAIL, Colo., Dec. 27President Ford met with 15 advisers today in an effort to formulate new policy proposals on energy that would increase the supply and restrict consumption.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your editorial of Dec. 13 on the erosion of the United Nations by the irresponsible behavior in the General Assembly of an automatic majority of the new AfricanAsian states, assisted by the Communist bloc, suggests its survival is at stake.

title: Argentine Cattle Industry Is in Crisis
description: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 27 The sweet smell of roasting beef drifted through the muggy summer air in the downtown area. Parkinglot attendants, construction workers and street repairmen have once again taken to cooking slabs of prime sirloin on crude charcoal grills on top of empty paint cans.

title: Slowing in Beef Imports Urged to Avoid Quotas
description: WASHINGTON (AP)  Dec. 27The Government is trying to convince other countries they should hold down beef shipments to United States markets next year in an effort to avoid stiff mandatory quotas under a 1964 law de. signed to protect American cattlemen, Assistant Secretary of Agriculture Clayton Yeutter said today.

title: Books of The Times
description: GERALD FORD AND THE FUTURE OF THE PRESIDENCY, By J. F. terHorst, 245 pages, The Third Press, $9.95.

title: Regina Cotillion Held
description: The 17th annual Regina Cotillion, a benefit for the Bishop's Fund for Children, was held in the Grand Ballroom at the Plaza last night. The five debutantes presented to the Most Rev. Walter P. Kellenberg, Bishop of the Roman Catholic Diocese of Rockville Centre, L. I., were Danise. Anne Amoruso, Deborah Ann Bukunt, Mary Emilie Caldwell, Deidre Jacqueline Chapdelaine and Ann Michele Regan.

title: Pace to Buckeye Nick
description: FREEHOLD, N. J., Dec. 27 (AP)Buckeye Nick won the onemile pace feature by two lengths at Freehold Raceway today and returned $3.40, $2.60 and $2.20 for $2 across the board. Buckeye Nick covered the mile in 2:05. Tononki Jubilee was second and Royal Mark N. third.

title: SOCIALISTS FAIL TO BAR THE F.B.I.
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27Associate Justice Thurgood Marshall of the United States Supreme Court denied today an appeal by the Young Socialist Alliance co bar the Federa, Bureau of Investigation from attending and monitoring its convention in St. Louis.

title: DONALD R. STUART
description: Donald R. Stuart, former food photographer for The Ladies Home Journal, died Wednesday at his home, 16 West 16th Street. He was 69 years old.

title: Rent Rises Delayed in Westchester
description: WHITE PLAINS, Dec. 27Rent increases in eight Westchester County communities that have declared rent emergencies were delayed today, at least until midJanuary by a ruling in State Supreme Court.

title: DR. SAMUEL G. HOFFMAN
description: Dr. Samuel G. Hoffman, dentist in Hempstead, L.I., for 55 years and founding president of the 10th District Dental Society there, died yesterday in the Bayview Nursing Home in Island Park, L.I, He was 87 years old.

title: Frazier Worried by Slump
description: Walt Frazier's shooting slump has the highscoring Knick backcourt man concerned.

title: France Curbs Profit Margins
description: PARIS, Dec. 27 (Reuters)The Government set a new system controlling retail profit margins over the next nine months, whereby retailers can raise prices only if they can be justified by increases in supplier prices, the Finance Ministry said today.

title: Cougar Sale Completed
description: CHICAGO, Dec. 27 (UPI) Sale of the Chicago Cougars to a fourman group headed by PlayerCoach Pat Stapleton was completed today after nearly a month of negotiations. No purchase price was announced for the World Hockey Association franchise previously held by two brothers, Jordon and Walter Kaiser. However, it was believed the figure was around $2million.

title: Market Place Perplexity at Highland Capital
description: Shareholders of the Highland Capital Corporation, closedend investment company, are perplexed by a series of recent events.

title: Reporter's Notebook: Rutgers Boasts an Opportunistic Quintet
description: The basketball team that beats Rutgers will probably have to build a large lead to feel secure. The Scarlet players are opportunists, who pounce on the first opening a little letup they patiently wait for throughout the game.

title: Bodies of Two Girls, Apparently Slain, Are Found in Jersey
description: MANALAPAN TOWNSHIP, Dec. 27 (AP)The partially clad bodies ow two teenaged girls, apparently murder victims, were found today in a wooded area of this Monmouth County community, the state police said.

title: Sarah Porter Bartlett Married To H. B. Sheets 3d in Lewiston
description: St. Peter's Roman Catholic Church in Lewiston, N. Y., was the setting yesterday afternoon for the marriage of Sarah Porter Bartlett, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edwin Porter Bartlett of Lewiston, to Henry Bennett Sheets 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Sheets Jr. of Buffalo. The Rev. Edwin M. Cuddihy performed the ceremony, assisted by the Rev. Henry J. Gugino and the Rev. Dr. Warren W. Lane, cousin of the bridegroom.

title: Tokyo Prices Up 21.5%
description: TOKYO, Dec. 27 (UPI)Consumer prices in Tokyo rose 21.5 per cent in one yearthe secondhighest increase since the end of World War II, the Prime Minister's office announced today.

title: Mexican Multinational Is a OneMan Show
description: MEXICO CITYAt a time when multinational is a dirty word in Mexico, there is no biding the pride of Mexican businessmen and officials over the multinational operations of the country's largest construction company, I.C.A.

title: News Summary and Index
description: International

title: Cordero Is Banned, Ending Title Hopes
description: Angel Cordero's chances of winning the New York jockey championship all but vanished yesterday at Aqueduct when the Puerto Ricanborn rider received a sevenday suspension.

title: PHONE RATES RISE BY 13 TO 20 CENTS
description: NEWARK, Dec. 27The New Jersey Bell Telephone Company announced today that new intrastate rates approved yesterday by the State Board of Public Utilities Commissioners would increase individual residential service by 13 and 20 cents per month.

title: CRITIC OF THE C.I.A. IS OUSTED BY SAIGON
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Dec. 27  A Government spokesman said today that John D. Marks, coauthor of the controversial bestseller, The C.I.A. and the Cult of Intelligence, was expelled from South Vietnam this morning after his name had been discovered on a blacklist maintained by the Ministry of Interior.

title: Stram Dismissed by Chiefs
description: KANSAS CITY, Dec, 27 (AP)Hank Stram, the only coach the Kansas City Chiefs have had in their 15year existence, was dismissed today as coach and vice president of the National Football League team.

title: Bill to Give Nixon $200,000 in Costs Andn Pension Signed
description: VAIL, Colo., Dec. 27 (UPI)President Ford signed legislation today providing 5200.000 for former President Richard, M. Nixon's pension and office. expenses.

title: Jack Benny, 80, Dies of Cancer on Coast
description: Jack Benny, whose brilliant gift for selfdeprecating caricature brought laughter to the nation for 40 years, died late Thursday at his home in Beverly Hills, Calif. He was 80 years old.

title: SOVIET INDICATES CONCERN ON DRUGS
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 27Yuri Lipchuk was peddling packets of Central Asian hashish in a subway station in northeast Moscow when police descended on him and, after a struggle, took the youth to jail.

title: Botulism Suspected in Illness Of 13 Members of Bronx Family
description: Thirteen members of a Bronx family are hospitalized with food poisoning suspected as botulism after they ate homecanned foods prepared by another family member who died earlier this week.

title: Lawyers and Scholars Score Antipornography Group
description: THOUSAND OAKS, Calif.A national clearing house to promote pornography prosecutions, set up and financed by the Department of Justice on the campus of a small sectarian college here, has come under strong attack from legal and academic critics.

title: U.S. Steel Avoids Fine As 2,500 Are Laid Off
description: The United States Steel Corporation said yesterday it would close 10 openhearth furnaces Dec. 31 at Gary. Ind., laying off about 2,500 employes.

title: 3 Boston School Officials In Contempt Over Busing
description: BOSTON, Dec. 27Federal District Judge W. Arthur Garrity Jr. held three Boston School Committeemen in civil contempt of court today for refusing to approve a citywide busing plan for school desegregation.

title: A Caviar Eve Despite Recession
description: Maybe New Yorkers are celebrating this New Year's Eve because they're glad to shoo out the old year with its inflation, recession, unemployment and pennypinching. Or maybe they're celebrating because they see no reason not to sip champagne and nibble caviar in 1974 because they may be drinking beer and munching pretzels in 1975.

title: COOK INDUSTRIES SHOWS PROFIT DIP
description: Cook Industries, Inc., reported yesterday a decline of 80.5 per cent in earnings for the second fiscal quarter, ended Nov. 30, and a 77.8 per cent decline for the sixmonth period, despite higher revenues.

title: New Process Speeds Search for Cancer
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27A Massachusetts chemist has invented a process to enable specimens from living persons to be examined automatically for cancer at central testing laboratories. If further research, proves it practical, the method should considerably reduce the burdensome individual examinations made by technicians. Patent 3,857,033 was granted this week to Carolus M. Cobb and assigned to American Science and Engineering, Inc., a Cambridge company of which he is vice president.

title: Weather Reports and Forecast
City Lifts Its Embargo On Canned Tuna Fish
description: A fiveweek embargo on the distribution of Geisha brand canned tuna fish to supermarkets and grocery stores in New York City has been lifted after tests showed the product to be free of contamination, Dr. Lowell E. Bellin, the city's Health Commissioner, said yesterday.

title: JOSEPH H. EISENBERG
description: Joseph H. Eisenberg; who retired in 1967 as vice president of the Equitable Paper Bag Company, of which he had been a founder, died of a cerebral hemorrhage yesterday at Jackson Memorial Hospital in Miami, He was 68 years old and lived in Miami and Sands Point, L. I.

title: McCord Sues His Lawyers In First Watergate Trial
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 27 (AP) James W. McCord Jr., the convicted Watergate burglar, filed a $10million damage suit today against his original defense attorneys, including the trial lawyer, F. Lee Bailey.

title: A Korean Deputy Is Hopeful Despite Curbs
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Dec. 21On a rocky hillside high stove Seoul, lives a courtly, silverhaired 70yearold man who has served in South Korea's National Assembly longer than anyone else.

title: Moderate to Replace Rightist Buenos Aires Rector
description: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 27 The controversial rightwing rector of the University of Buenos Aires will be replaced by a moderate administrator after Jan. 1, the Argentine Government said yesterday.

title: Iran to Buy French Bonds
description: PARIS, Dec. 27 (Reuters)Iran intends to buy $80million worth of French Government bonds, probably in the form of a loan to the French Electricity Utility, an official at the Prime Minister's office said today.

title: Efate Bars 197% Rate Rise For Malpractice Jnsurance
description: The State Superintendent of Insurance yesterday suspended a 197 per cent rate increase sought by the Argonaut Insurance Company for malpractice insurance for physicians in the state, and ordered the company to continue covering the physicians until public hearings in January. The increase was to have taken effect on Jan. 10.

title: 18 KILLED AS TRAIN HITS BUS IN BRAZIL
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Dec. 27 (Reuters)A train and a bus collided at a railroad crossing on the outskirts of this Brazilian city early today, killing 18 and seriously injuring 18, railroad spokesman said.

title: Rams Likely To Subdue 2 Top Backs
description: Chuck Foreman and Lawrence McCutcheon, the two most productive running backs in the National Football Conference this season, will be two of the central characters in tomorrow's conference championship game between the Minnesota Vikings and the Los Angeles Rams. however, the Rams could prevent both from being as productive as they might like.

title: 1110 Choice Again Wins Irish Race
description: LEOPARDSTOWN, Ireland, Dec. 27 (AP)Comedy of Errors beat Lanzarote in a thrilling finish today in the Irish Sweeps Hurdle at Leopardstown and made nine lucky ticket holders richer by $116,500 each.

title: STOCK DEFRAUDER FINED AND JAILEDD
description: Cortes W. Randell, who founded the National Student Marketing Corporation, was sentenced yesterday to an 18, month prison term and fined $40,000 on stock fraud charges involving a scheme that cost investors many millions of dorlars.

title: BETHLEHEM TO GIVE DATA ON PRICE RISE
description: The Bethlehem Steel Corporation has agreed to provide the Government with information to back up its recent price increase, a spokesman for the Council on Wage and Price Stability said today.

title: Nets Fall To Spurs, 108103
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., Dec. 27 The travelweary San Antonio Spurs, playing in their seventh of nine straight road games, rallied from a 13point halftime deficit to defeat the New York Nets, 108103, before a crowd of 9,090 at the Nassau Coliseum tonight.

title: L.I. Woman Found Dead
description: A 49yearold Long Island woman with a history of mental problems was found dead in her locked car yesterday morning, the apparent victime of carbon monoxide poisoning. The Nassau County police said that the woman, Vincenza Sama of 13 Vine Street, Glen Cove, had been found by a passerby in the car, which was parked at Newbridge Road and Ball Park Lane In Hicksville. The source of the poison was charcoal burned in a metal cooking pot, the police said.

title: Maryland Beaten By U.C.L.A., 8175
description: COLLEGE PARK, Md., Dec. 28 (AP)  Marques Johnson scored 7 of his 13 points in the final three minutes, rallying the University of California, Los Angeles to an 8175 victory over Maryland tonight in the final of the Maryland invitation tournament. U.C.L.A. is ranked No. 3 and Maryland No. 5 in the Associated Press national basketball ranking.

title: LOTTERY NUMBER
Excess fuel costs would be shared
description: After weeks of discussion among top city officials, Mayor Beame has advanced a proposal to provide partial relief to owners of rentcontrolled apartments who have been hurt by soaring fueloil costs.

title: Analysts Pick Some Winners for '75
description: Wall Street market analysts are now busy picking their favorite stocks and industries for the New Year and hoping that the bad shocks of 196974 will finally fade in 1975.

title: Surrealism Exhibited In Depth At Hofstra
description: HEMPSTEADThe Bibliothque Nationale in Paris is one of the world's most distinguished institutions associated with art history and scholarship and the venerable keeper of some of the best miniatures, manuscripts and graphics.

title: Southern State Toll Facing Suit
description: MINEOLAA suit to prevent the Jones Beach State Parkway Authority from raising the toll on the Southern State Parkway to 25 cents from 10 cents will get its initial hearing here tomorrow in State Supreme Court.

title: Puns and twists
description: ACROSS

title: SUSPECT GIVES UP IN QUEENS SLAYING
description: The suspect in the bludgeon murder of Sandra Zahler on Christmas Day in Kew Gardens, Queens, surrendered yesterday to a newspaper reporter and was later booked on a charge of homicide.

title: White Plains Takes Team Title in Track
description: WHITE PLAINS, Dec. 28White Plains High School captured seven events last night to win the Class A team title in the Holiday Festival scholastic track games at the County Center. The Tigers scored 59 points to defeat Mount Vernon, which had 37. Woodlands won the Class B with 19.

title: For That Big Carey Family, Time to Move to a Mansion
description: The available bedrooms in the turreted Victorianera mansion in Albany have been countedalthough not yet assigned. Tom Regan is standing by to resume, if necessary, the homework stop that was unlisted but always scheduled during the CareyforGovernor campaign. And a bus is to be hired to carry the clan northward on New Year's Eve.

title: Samuel Comer, 81, Is Dead; Won Oscars for 4 Film Sets
description: LA JOLLA, Calif., Dec. 28 (AP)Samuel M. Comer, who won four Academy Awards for set decorations, died here yesterday after a long illness. He was 81 years old.

title: Indians Ask U.S. to Declare Sioux a Sovereign Tribe
description: LINCOLN, Neb., Dec. 24In a gesture of defiance, some 250 American Indians seized the historic Indian village of Wounded Knee, S.D., on Feb. 27, 1973, and held off Government Troops, United States marshals and agents of the Federal Bureau of Investigation for more than two months.

title: Pope Paul Is Fatigued, Afflicted by Arthritis
description: ROME, Dec. 28Pope Paul VI is fatigued, is suffering from a painful arthritic condition and needs rest, Vatican sources said today.

title: Sale of Blood for Cash Is Dwindling
description: NEW BRUNSWICKBlood sold by persons in need of quick cash is expected to become a thing of the past in North Jersey, hopefully by the end of 1975. At the same time, a major source of serum hepatitis will be dried up, according to Dr. August H. Groeschel, medical director of the New Jersey Blood Services.

title: Dave Anderson
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Dec. 28In the metallic zoo of exercising contraptions in the Oakland Raiders' locker room, George Blanda was saying, Back when I broke in with the Chicago Bears in 1949 . . . and a young teammate glanced at him.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: State Senator John R. Dunne, Republican of Garden City, L. I., urged legislation to outlaw job discrimination against exconvicts. The measure was part of a package he said he would submit tomorrow for consideration by lawmakers in the next session of the Legislature.

title: '35 MATERNITY BILL PAID WITH INTEREST
description: SANTA FE, N. M., Dec. 28A couple from Roswell, N. M., paid off a 39yearold bill amounting to $112 at the St. Vincent Hospital here this week and, to show appreciation for the institution's patience, added another $3,000 for interest. Sister Mary Joaquin: the hospital administrator, said that her records showed that a man and his wife were passing through Santa Fe in 1935 when the wife went into labor and was rushed to the deliveryroom where she gave birth to a boy.

title: Alvin AileyA Remarkable Year
description: With the end of its third winter season a week ago, Alvin Ailey's City Center Dance Theater has closed out a quietly remarkable year in its life. It has become, in a short time, a fixture of the dance year with regular seasons at City Center plus its first excursion to State Theater at Lincoln Center this past summer. It has emerged in fact, if not in name, as a moderndance repertory company.

title: Rowing a Link to Past in Nile Regatta
description: CAIRO, Dec. 28In the land where the boat began, on the Nile that nurtured Egypt, the Egyptian Rowing Federation this week staged the fourth annual International University Rowing Festival amid the pomp and magnificence of Egypt's historic heritage.

title: 61 SledDog Teams, nth No Snow, and Nary a Mush
description: There was no snow at Blydenburgh Park, but that didn't faze the sleddog enthusiasts who turned out from five states to compete recently at the Suffolk County site in News Smithtown. We have to take of what we get, [in Dogs weather] said Mrs. Elsa Marchesano, president of the Siberian Husky Club of Greater New York, under whose auspices the first races of the Middle Atlantic Sled Dog Racing Association were being held. They drew 61 teams.

title: Sarah Dunham Wed to J. A. Taylor
description: Sarah Williams Dunham, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William Putnam Dunham of Chappaqua, and St. Huberts, N.Y., was married in Chappaqua yesterday afternoon to Jeffrey Alan Taylor, son of Mr. and Mrs. Mervyn C. Taylor of Boca Raton, Fla., and Old Forge, N.Y. The Rev. Vernon A. Loescher performed the ceremony in the First Congregational Church.

title: Editors' Choice
description: General

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: UNITED STATES STEEL Corporation rescinded 20 per cent of a price increase announced on Dec. 17 that would have raised product prices by 8 to 10 per cent ... President Ford signed into law a bill to increase penalties for violation of antitrust laws ... The Department of Agriculture said farmers planted 55.5 million acres of winter wheat, up per cent ... Chrysler Corporation consolidated most of debt into a $400million line of credit with leading banks, due Jan. 31, 1978.

title: Kim Beckwith, John Walker 3d Plan Marriage
description: The engagement of Kim Ruth Beckwith to John Y. G. Walker 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Walker Jr. of Great Notch, N. J., has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. Frank Newell Beckwith of South Salem, N. Y., parents of the future bride.

title: Late TV Listings
description: The following information about today's television programs was not available in time to appear in Section 2:

title: 1975 Hydroplane Slate Is Worth Record $350,000 for 10 Events
description: Powerboat racing's most glamorous class, the unlimited hydroplanes, will compete for record purses of $350,000 next year in a 10event schedule. The 1975 season for the 180mileanhour thunderboats opens May 18 on Biscayne Bay in Miami and closes Sept. 14 on Lake Pleasant in. Phoenix, Ariz.

title: Caracas Seizure Approved
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, Dec. 28 (UPI)The Venezuelan Congress last night approved nationalization of the local operations of United States Steel and Bethlehem Steel.

title: Schary Will Head 1975 Conference On Jewish Culture
description: Dore Schary, a playwright and Jewish community leader, will serve as chairman of a conference on the Jewish cultural arts that will focus attention on both the Jewish maturel impact on America and America's impact on Judaism.

title: Islanders Bow, 31, To Leafs
description: TORONTO, Dec. 28 (AP)Norm Ullman scored two goals and assisted on a third tonight, leading the Toronto Maple Leafs to a 31 victory over the New York Islanders in the National Hockey League.

title: Mailbox. Rangers/Roberts vs. Ford
description: To the Editor.

title: 81 Shot Wins Stakes At Laurel
description: LAUREL, Md., Dec. 28Noble Of Course, the 81 outsider in a field of four Marylandbred 2yearolds, survived a long drive and won the $23,900 Senatorial Stakes at Laurel Race Course today as Chris McCarron added one winner to his world racewinning record for a total of 544.

title: LOTTERY NUMBER
2 ON SCHOOL BOARD IN BOSTON RISK JAIL
description: BOSTON, Dec. 28 (AP)Two of. the three Boston School Committee members cited for contempt of court by Federal District Court Judge W. Arthur Garrity Jr. say they are willing to go to jail before renouncing their opposition to school desegregation by busing.

title: State Group Honors A Farmer In Suffolk
description: ALBANY  For the first time since 1955, a Long Island farm family has been singled out for honors by the New York State Agricultural Society.

title: Ford Considering A Special Panel On C.I.A. Charges
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 28President Ford has under consideration a proposal to establish a public commission to investigate allegations of illegal domestic surveillance by the Central Intelligence Agency.

title: Mr. Helms, an Achiever In a World of Spooks
description: WASHINGTON  In 1936, Richard McGarrah Helms, then a young reporter for the United Press, managed to interview Adolf Hitler. Over lunch, Mr. Hitler talked for three hours. When asked how he had staged the Nazi party rally at Nuremberg, Mr. Hitler replied that the delegates had been brought in on special trains; this, he added, was perfect practice for the railroads in case of mobilization.

title: ART VIEW
description: The radical changes that overtook French painting in the sixth and seventh decades of the 19th century were among the most momentous to occur in the entire history of Western art. In them, a decisive shift took place in the way the greatest painters of the modern world conceived the very essentials of their task. Even today, exactly 100 years after the Impressionists handed together for the first of their group exhibitions in Paris, there is scarcely a single form of serious painting, from the most amorphous color abstractions to the most meticulous modes of representation, that is not directly or indirectly implicated in the innovations of that distant period.

title: Outdoors, Copte Win at Bid A
description: 'Twas the Saturday after Christmas, and a fivepiece combo played Latin rhythms for 30,701 patrons at Aqueduct yesterday while horses labored on a racing strip thawed by 35 tons of rock salt.

title: Martha Walker Married
description: In St. Paul's Episcopal Church in Chatham, N.J., yesterday morning, Martha Stettler Walker, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Alan Bareham Walker of Chatham, became the bride of John Mark Jones, of Bethlehem, Pa. The rector, the Rev. Walter A. Bell Jr., performed the ceremony and the Rev. Roy Ledbetter, minister of the Mount Bethel Moravian Church in Cana, Va., assisted.

title: William F. Deme, 61, Dies; Dean at McBurney School
description: William F. Deme, dean of students of the McBurney School, a college preparatory school of the Young Men's Christian Association of Greater New York, 15 West 63d Street, died here Friday of a heart attack. He was 61 years old and lived at 2 Stuyvesant Oval.

title: Criminals At Large
description: Part sea stories, part criminal investigation, the novels of Bill Knox about the Fisheries Protection Service off the coast of Scotland are always unusual, authentic and entertaining. WHITEWATER (Doubleday, $4.95) follows the pattern, and won't disappoint those acquainted with Knox's previous work. Those unacquainted with it can start with this book and make a new friend.

title: PRYOR IS RETIRING FROM L.I.R.R. UNION
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Dec. 28After more than two decades as chairman of the United Transportation Union of the Long Island Rail Road, during which time he was denounced by commuters for strikes and lauded by his membership for benefit gains, Harold J. Pryor will retire next Tuesday.

title: LEONARD HEHNER
description: Leonard Helmer, who retired in 1967 as advertising and sales promotion manager, of the Venus Pencil Company, died Friday on a visit to Oconomowoc, Wis. He was 70 years old and lived in Largo, Fla.

title: SHOP TALK
description: It used to be upstairs over the shoemaker, but now it is a walkup balcony, with darkbeamed white ceilings, a rather flashy geometrically patterned carpeted floor and shelves and cubbyholes holding what the owner of the shop says is the city's largest collection of under$3 wines.

title: All Aboard for the Montauk Valley (HOScale) Railroad!
description: WILLISTON PARK  The Montauk Valley Railroad begins and ends in the basement of a professional building at 174 Hillside Avenue in Williston Parkthe headquarters of the Nassau Model Railroad Club since 1958.

title: Good fences make bad neighbors
description: Our society is permeated by a consciousness of theft: triplelocked doors of city apartments, guard dogs prowling stores and warehouses at night, retail prices and insurance rates based on the assumption that large quantities of merchandise are simply going to disappear. But our consciousness of theft tends to be limited. It is easy to imagine the act itselfthe forced lock or smashed window in the dead of night, the hijacker ordering the driver out of his truck cab at pistol point. It harder to keep in mind that these acts aren't random or selfcontained but are usually practical ways of acquiring goods for an established buyer. As for the dealer in stolen goodsthe fencethere our imagination seldom goes beyond the owner of a seedy pawnshop or the character who sidles up on the street and mutters, Hey, buddy, wanna buy a watch?

title: Child to the Owen Nees Jr.
description: A daughter was born to Mr. and Mrs. Owen D. Nee Jr. of Hong Kong and Rye, N. Y., on Dec. 23 in Hong Kong. Mrs. Nee is the former Amber Wong of Hong Kong. The child, we Hong Kong law office of Couhose father is a lawyer in thdert Brothers, is named Claire Elizabeth.

title: Red Smith
description: Richard Anthony Allen, a racing man who appeared once as designated hitter last summer while moonlighting with the Chicago White Sox, owns a thoroughbred named Designated Runner. He also has a 2yearold colt named Briar Bend that he bought as a yearling for $61,000. Briar Bend, son of Never Bend and a daughter of Swaps named Give Or Take, is a halfbrother to Agitate, who raced 11 times this year, was never out of the money, finished third in the Kentucky Derby and earned $312,925. Considering that Dick Allen had to go to bat 462 times in 128 games to earn a paltry $250,000, it is easy to see why he prefers Aqueduct to Atlanta.

title: U.S. Olympic Squad Taking 5Game Tour
description: The United States Olympic soccer team will leave Thursday for a fivegame tour of Israel anti Greece to prepare for its two qualifying games against Bermuda early nextyear. After regional tryouts, a squad of 29 players was chosen to attend a final camp in Dallas, with 18 selected for the touring party.

title: Calendar Makers Turning New Page
description: KANSAS CITYThe calendar  mainstay of corporate giveaway and holiday greeting promotions, reminder of Aunt Mabel's birthday, without which any respectable desk looks naked is about to embark upon the year 1977.

title: Rudolph F. Puletz Dead, A French Horn Player, 66
description: Rudolph F. Puletz, a leading Frenchhorn solo player and teacher, died yesterday in Astoria General Hospital at the age of 66. He lived at 3507 147th Street, Flushing, Queens.

title: Banker Weds Mary Cunningham
description: Mary Elizabeth Cunningham and Howard Russell Gray Jr. were married at noon yesterday in St. Clement's Chapel of Aquinas House, at Dartmouth College. Msgr. William L. Nolan, a Roman Catholic priest and guardian of the bride, performed the ceremony.

title: The Eve of 1975: Quiet but Festive
description: PRINCETONThe glittering galas of New Year's Eves past in New Jersey appear to be giving way to smaller, more intimate celebrations.

title: Rio Slum Dwellers Resist Relocation
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Dec. 28Along the rim of the bay here, some 30,000 people live in vast shantytown on stilts that has been condemned by the authorities as a center of disease.

title: MUSIC VIEW
description: Two West German psychiatrists, after making a study of 208 orchestral musicians, reported that contemporary music sickens its performers. Musicians who constantly played contemporary music, they said, were relatively nervous, irritable and aggressivc, and suffered from ailments that included insomnia, earaches and impotence.

title: Big Hammer Takes Title
description: READINGTON, N.J., Dec. 28Harold Vogel, a 15yearold high school student from Scotch Plains, N.J., rode Big Hammer to the novice open jumper championship tonight at the Four Seasons Farm Horse Show.

title: Law Schools Chart Parttime Programs
description: CAMDEN  Rutgers University's Schools of Law here and in Newark have approved the resumption of part  time education programs that are similar in goal but different in format.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: Our American neighbors must be puzzled by current economic developments in Canada. Here we sit with proven tar sands oil reserves larger than those of the entire Arab world, with established technology to exploit them and make delivery at approximately current world prices. Yet we are telling ourselves that we will run out of the commodity in the early nineteeneighties and have, therefore, decided to reduce exports to oilthirsty customers south of our border. Of all the paradoxes in the current world oil puzzle, this must surely be the strangest.

title: British TV Doesn't Mind Stepping on Toes
description: LONDON This past fall season American viewers who timed into the British import nonsensically called Monty Python's Flying Circus on public TV may have got something of a shock along with a sense of the most unAmerican freedom from censorship that is enjoyed by the general run of British TV. And beginning Feb. 2, when the current episoaes of the more sedate Upstairs, Downstairs series will end, another Masterpiece Theater import, Country Matters, is likely to lift a few American eyebrows. This foursegment series, to be shown over public TV Sun days at 8:30 P.M., consists of dramatizations of short stories in rural English settings. Some of the tales are vividly and outspokenly sexual. They may cause viewers to recall the Britishmade adaptation of the Emile Zola classic Nana (aired by a limited number of public TV stations late last year and repeated this past spring) which graphically displayed such activities as bestiality, homose uality and sadomasochism.

title: Letters To the Editor
description: To the Editor: As a nongraduate of the United States Military Academy, presently assigned to the Staff and Faculty, it is my impression that Robert Sherrill presents a most biased review of School for Soldiers (Oct. 27) based largely on his personal distaste and dislike for this institutiona distaste and dislike founded long before he reviewed the Ellis and Moore book. By his own admission: . . . it is no more possible to give a balanced account of the training at West Point than it is to give a balanced account of hunger in Biafra.

title: A Federal Experiment Is Soon to Be Conducted: The Free Ride
description: Within the $11.8billion masstransit bill signed last month by President Ford is an obscure but tantalizing provision that anticipates a far different future for the dogged commuter: a free ride.

title: A half nelson
description: Very soon now the unhappiness of Nelson Rockefeller will begin.

title: New Year's Eve With the Guru of Warwick Grotto
description: DEC. 31, 6 P.M. Dr. Frederick Franck stacks 52 back issues of the Sunday New York Times on a homemade raft. The vessel, tied to the bank of the Wawayanda River, groans under the weight of its heavy cargo and settles lower in the frigid water. Sleet slices through the night air and hurricane lamps, dangling from the trees, cast an eerie glow on an iceglazed path near the Wawayanda, where 100 or more men, women and children watch in silence. Dr. Franck works quickly, soaking the fivefoothigh piles of papers with kerosene. Crouching, he flings a match. Suddenly, a brilliant shaft of fire flares 30 feet into the air, its orange glow illuminating everything within a halfimile radius of the meek.

title: John E. Dunphy Jr. Weds Miss Fisk
description: Virginia Lee Fisk and John Englebert Dunphy Jr., both of San Francisco, were married yesterday afternoon in the First Congregational Church in Old Greenwich, Conn. The Rev. Vincent O'Connor, a Roman Catholic priest, and the Rev. Dr. Paul W. Yinger, minister of the church, performed the ceremony.

title: Ballot Positioning Faces a Challenge
description: TRENTON  Under state law, County Clerks in New Jersey are empowered to hold drawings to determine ballot positions in general and primary elections.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In attempting to deal with its acute internal economic crises and to develop effective and creative international economic initiatives, the United States is severely hampered by the precipitous oil price increase and the threat of embargo. We also are hampered by its own huge defense budget. But it seems to have escaped general notice that some of the prime beneficiaries of our defense establishment are many of those same oil producing Arab nations who are making life so hard for us.

title: Man, 115, Dies in Greece
description: VEROIA, Greece, Dec. 28 (UPI)Alexander Amyradis, oldest inhabitant of the village of Ano Zervochori in northern Greece, died yesterday at the age of 115, his family said today.

title: Educated guesses
description: Despite the authoritative prediction of sunny shies the chief of the U.S. Weather Bureau for President Taft's inauguration in 1909, the ceremonies were ruined by a howling snowstorm. Since then, shortrange predictions have become more reliable and advanced: On Nov. 27, the National Weather Service audaciously offered its first 90day forecast. At the same time, climatologists are willing to make a few guesses, on the basis of historical cycles, about the more distant future.A.A.

title: FollowUp on The News
description: Every year at Christmas, the big Texas department stores manage to corral a few reams of publicity when they issue catalogues containing such madcap gift suggestions as hisandhers airplanes, a Noah's Ark ($588,247) and a pair of ancient Greek kraters.

title: PHOTOGRAPHY VIEW
description: Photographically illustrated books, magazines and newspapers pour off the presses in such numbers today that few people realize how new they really are. Photography itself is less than 150 years old, and the modern photographically illustrated publication, with halftone reproductions on the same pages as the text, is even younger. The halftone plate that makes it possible was not invented till the 1880's and was not widely used before the turn of the century. The modern mass market, without which such publications would be economically unfeasible, is also a development of the late 19th and early 20th centuries.

title: BARRY MANILOW ACT LIKABLE BUT HOLLOW
description: Barry Manilow, who is at the Bottom Line through New Year's Eve, first came to prominence as a performer at the Continental Baths, and then as music director for Bette Midler. During Miss Midler's shows Mr. Manilow would take a short solo turn, and for all the latent talent the result was mostly gawky and selfconscious.

title: The Economic Threat ...
description: The year is ending with much of the nation in a state of deep anxiety over the course of the economy. There has been nothing like the present degree of apprehensivenessor confusionabout the business outlook since 1930. And the question on everybody's mind whether years like 1931 and 1932 lie ahead.

title: Elizabeth B. Blanchard Is Bride Of Kenneth Ralph Oppenheimer
description: The marriage of Elizabeth Brooks Blanchard to Kenneth Ralph Oppenheimer, son of Mr. and Mrs. Alfred S. Oppenheimer of Baltimore, took place yesterday afternoon in Convent Station, N. J.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor: Among the many cures for simultaneous inflation and depression is one that has received no attention. It is possible to use the Federal tax on corporate income to provide an incentive to act in a desirable direction, in contrast to an excessprofits tax, which is only punishment for an undesirable action.

title: Red Sox Official Quits
description: BOSTON, Dec. 28 (AP)John P. Alevizos, who reportedly heads a group attempting to purchase control of the Cleveland Indians, announced today his resignation as vicepresident in charge of administration of the Boston Red Six. He said he planned to pursue several offers and opportunities both in and outside baseball.

title: The City That Epitomizes the Genius of Japan
description: The Manyoshu (A.D. 760) IT was a clear, crisp autumn day with a bright sun breaking through the red and brown leaves and the swaying evergreens, dappling the thick moss of the park. I was strolling, lost in my own thoughts, glad to be in this tranquil place away from the assaults on the mind and ear and nose in Tokyo. But I was drawn out of my reverie by shouts and laughter from an arena down in the woods. I wandered over, paid the nominal fee to get in, and clambered up into the rough wooden stands to watch what I later learned was the annual rite of cutting the horns of Nara's tame deer.

title: SPOTLIGHT
description: GARDEN CITY, Mich.Dennis Dolan has been lucky during the last 60 days. He has had work, and that makes him much luckier at least, than thousands of his brother construction workers here in the Detroit area and across the country.

title: Sara Colbert Married to Gerrit Crosby
description: Sara Becket Colbert, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Roger Colbert of Rye, N. H., was married last evening to Gerrit Lansing Crosby, son of Prof. and Mrs. Sumner Crosby of Woodbridge, Conn. The Rev. Donald Vedeler, a Congregational minister performed the ceremony at the Colbert home.

title: NIGERIA TO INCREASE CIVIL SERVANTS' PAY
description: LAGOS, Dec. 28 Reuters) Wage increases of up to 133 per cent for Nigerian civil servants were announced today by the federal government.

title: HARRY COLWELL JR.
description: Harry E. Colwell Jr., who retired in 1968 as head of H. E. Colwell & Sons, Inc., real estate and insurance, New Rochelle, N. Y., died in New Rochelle on Friday. He was 77 years old and lived at 32 Woodlawn Avenue, New Rochelle.

title: New Orleans Seeks to Mute the Sound of Street Music
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 28Playing music in the street has become an obstruction to commerce here. It will be licensed and regulated early next year.

title: The Problem With Banks and Bankers
description: All large banks today expect to fund their new loans by borrowing somewhere. If the Federal Reserve System were really able to close down all the sources of funds, the banks would have some municipal bonds and Federal agency bonds to sell off at big losses, but nowhere near enoughand the market could not absorb them anyway.

title: How to Help Your Golf With a Light Grip
description: The story of the professional golf tour in 1974 was, with apologies to Chaucer, a Miller's Tale. Johnny Miller played almost poetically to win eight tournaments and set a money record of $353,021.

title: Slalom Is Taken
description: WATERVILLE VALLEY, N. H., Dec. 28 (UPI)Ron Biedermann of Stowe, Vt., won the sendoff Slalom today and earned a berth on the touring United States Alpine ski team, scheduled to leave tomorrow for World Cup competition.

title: Travel Notes: A Club For Globetrotters
description: The Travelers' Century Club, a Los Angelesbased nonprofit organization that describes itself as the world's most exclusive travel club, is celebrating its 20th anniversary, this year with a drive for new members. But even in today's jet age the club has had trouble soaring over the 300member mark. The reason: To become a member you have to have visited at least 100 countries.

title: French Open Disaster Inquiry As Mine Deaths Spur Outcry
description: PARIS, Dec. 28A judicial investigation was opened today into the mine disaster at Livin that left 42 dead, 5 injured and 120 orphaned yesterday. The accident has provoked a widespread outcry.

title: India Weighs Early Voting To Bolster Mrs. Gandhi
description: NEW DELHI, Dec. 28  A wave of speculation has stirred New Delhi that Prime Minister Indira Gandhi may call national elections a year ahead of schedule.

title: Social Announcements
description: Births

title: Nassau Gets Pratt Estate In Glen Cove
description: MINEOLA  Welwyn, the 212acre Pratt estate in Glen Cove, will become a countyowned park under an agreement announced last week by that community's MayorSupervisor and Nassau County Executive Ralph G. Caso.

title: Princeton Weighing Law School Plan
description: PRINCETON  F. Sheldon Hackney, provost of Princeton University, spends most of his time these days scrutinizing the school's budget in order to minimize the deficits and, hopefully, prevent unusually large increases in tuition.

title: Solutions to Last Week's Puzzles
description: (PAUL) HEMPHILL THE GOOD OLD BOYSCountry music has . . . been a mixed bag of basic themes coveting Mother, Home and Flag; and lately, as the Silent Majority has begun to be heard, it has become even more fashionable in Nashville to be conservative, patriotic and ... American.

title: Campaign Unit Closes Books On Two in Massachusetts
description: BOSTON, Dec. 28 (AP)The Office of Campaign and Political Finance has closed the books on two cases in which candidates apparently received exclusive loans during the last campaign.

title: The Human Priority
description: Msgr. James J. Murray wrote movingly the other day for all of the voluntary social service agencies that share in The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund when he declared: We have still many miles to cover and many promises to keep before reaching our goal of establishing the human priority in all areas of our community life.

title: Kentucky Tops Irish By 11396
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Dec. 28 (AP)The Kentucky Wildcats, led by Kevin Grevey's 28 points, defeated Notre Dame, 11396 tonight.

title: Keeping Atom Power Fully French
description: PARISA bitter struggle has broken out for control of the key company in the French nuclear reactor program on which the Government is counting to lessen its dependence on Middle Eastern oil.

title: The End of Intelligent Writing
description: The End of Intelligent Writing isn't about that, and isn't itself as intelligently written as it could and should have been. Many will say the title should have been Richard Kostelanetz, His Enemies and Friends, and while they would be wrong, Kostelanetz has let himself in for it. He spends the first half of the book on his enemieshe takes Jason Epstein and The New York Review of Books to be the centers of power in literarypolitical America, and he works from there, identifying establishments here and ingroups there. He offers his list of those who count, one that is accurate enough, one supposes, but boringly rude, and not as much news as Kostelanetz himself thinks. The secand half is about his friends, the young writers who have been excluded, and he offers a list of these too, to which he attaches this caveat: Any critic of tontemporaty writing who cannot identify works by fifteen per cent of these should, perforce, retire into the Academy to lecture on people and periods already past.

title: The Dangers of Overemphasis
description: When something is so very important to you that you work for it, and sweat for it, and cry for it, then every success, no matter how small, is welcomed and very much appreciated.

title: U.S.C., Fordham Gain Final
